Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job ID 577292BR Location Burbank, California, United States Business The Walt Disney Studios Date posted Aug. 01, 2018  Job Summary: We have created one of the most powerful brands by bringing memorable, life-changing storytelling to the world. The foundation of this creativity starts with The Walt Disney Studios where we produce, acquire, and distribute live-action and animated motion pictures, video experiences, music, and live performances. Our brands include Marvel, LucasFilm, Pixar, Disney Animation, Disney Nature and Hollywood Records. No other Media & Entertainment company can rival the brands we have the honor of bringing to the world.As part of the Studio’s Technology team you’ll be joining a group of seasoned, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting and dynamic industry.We are looking for a self-starting software professional who is dedicated to shaping the future of movie distribution. We’re a casual shop that values passion, community involvement and exceptional software. If this is you, we want you to join our team. Responsibilities:You will be part of the team creating the next-generation internal systems for movie distribution. You should be comfortable being part of a cross-functional team and working with a diverse group of business stakeholders and technologists. We expect you to have a deep understanding of Business Analysis, to be passionate about technology and the business, to keep up with the latest trends, and to have ownership in your project deliverables. As part of Studio Technology, you will conceive, deliver, enhance, and influence products across the entire distribution value chain including sales, marketing, planning, operations, and finance. You will work in service of an overall company initative to reimagine the studio business as an integrated, automated, efficient and effective machine that can scale and flex in line with rapid, technology-driven business dynamics.Your key responsibilities will be:Write user stories by conducting interviews, workflow analysis, process analysis, and observation sessionsWrite concise and effective User StoriesProduce clear and concise workflow documents to drive balanced solutions that consider people, process and technology componentsEvaluate information from multiple sources and help distinguish user requests from user needsFacilitate and clarify customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirementsAssist in the business case development using modeling techniques and methods as neededDefine precise and accurate User Story acceptance criteria that will be used by developers, automation test frameworks and by product owners to ensure that product owner intent is effectively capturedArrange client reviews of software under development, ensuring client satisfactionCollaborate to develop user acceptance testing (UAT) specificationsInterface with all levels of internal clients and analyze current business and software development processesFoster Agile principles and methods for requirements gatheringAdhere to Agile development methodology best practiceFacilitate Agile rapid and meaningful releasesAssist in the creation of project approval request documentationWork with the Project Manager to help facilitate and ensure successful user acceptance testingWork with the business to ensure business adoptionMeasure impact of solutions on the business Basic Qualifications:Your passion for good software is visible to your team members, stakeholders and in every product you and the team delivers. You take business automation seriously, and that will help you make decisions that drive value every day. You are:A problem solver. You take deep pride in your work and view each new problem as an opportunity for success; you approach challenges creatively, but methodically, and are biased toward delivering requirements fit quickly and within budget constraints.Inquisitive. You are curious and ask questions often. You’re hungry to learn new things and understand complex problems. You have a desire to learn how things are done and that drives you to look for ways to improve and streamline existing processes.Comfortable with ambiguity. You face change with a cool head and persevere even if you don’t have all the details; you’re comfortable moving between projects and facing the uncertain because risk and change motivates you to evolve and innovate.Technically astute. You rapidly learn new skills, grasping complicated technical information that often leaves others lost whether it’s product, industry, or hard tech knowledge, you absorb it quickly and are ready for more.Goal oriented. You are focused on your goals and drive to get to the desired outcome; you connect business and technology strategies to the software you deliver and can easily articulate the value created.Business analyst Level 3 career practitioner including practical application of the techniques outlined in BABOK v3.3+ yrs of experience performing business analysis within a large enterprise covering both business and information technology domainsWork experience in data analysis a plus2+ yrs of experience using Agile SCRUM methodologyStrong problem-solving skillsStrong written and verbal skills and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiencesAbility to communicate effectively with business stakeholders and to translate business requirements for technical developersStrong partnering skills and ability to work within a collaborative team environmentProficient use of UML including one or more modeling tools in the business and information technology domains e.g. Sparx Enterprise Architect, Modelio, and/or IBM RationalStrong business process definition capabilities, including the ability to capture process flows visually according to standard methodologiesResponsive to business needs and highly motivated to improve the skills and capabilities of his/her organizationA sense of ownership and responsibility for deliveryAbility to learn, understand and apply new technologiesMust be able to work independently, support several projects simultaneously and prioritize effectively Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge and experience with the Entertainment Distribution Value Chain including EIDR, rights and availability, servicing and financing preferred Required EducationBachelor's degree with technical emphasis such as Computer Science About The Walt Disney Studios:For over 90 years, The Walt Disney Studios has been the foundation on which The Walt Disney Company was built. Today the Studio brings quality movies, music and stage plays to consumers throughout the world. Feature films are released under the following banners: Disney, including Walt Disney Animation Studios and Pixar Animation Studios, Disneynature, Marvel Studios and Lucasfilm. The Disney Music Group encompasses the Walt Disney Records and Hollywood Records labels, as well as Disney Music Publishing. The Disney Theatrical Group produces and licenses live events, including Disney on Broadway, Disney On Ice and Disney Live!. Ours is a culture of innovation, inspiration and collaboration that brings together visionary artists, gifted technologists and savvy business minds to conjure up magical entertainment experiences for a global audience. About The Walt Disney Company: The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.  This position is with Walt Disney Pictures, which is part of a business segment we call The Walt Disney Studios.Walt Disney Pictures is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

Name: Analyst
Description: Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played PC game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and it's for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience.  We're looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; you're passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, aren't afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.  That's where you come in.  As an Analyst, you'll join the Insights discipline the group of researchers, analysts, data scientists and strategists responsible for solving problems and executing analyses that enable Rioters to make difficult decisions with confidence. You'll provide a unique voice to players by using top-notch analytic skills to translate data from a variety of sources into narratives that describe their experiences and suggest the right way forward. Armed with these narratives, you'll inform decisions across Riot and ensure that we make good on our mission to become the most player-focused game company in the world.  This posting covers a range of levels, including senior and principal analysts. Having a variety of experiences and skills to draw on is a plus, especially if you have both analytics and research experience.YOU ARE:Player-focused: you're a core gamer and an analyst, probably in that order, and you use your gaming experience to both help interpret the data you're seeing and generate empathy for the players involved. Bonus points for ranked LoL play take play seriouslyExperienced: you'll bring at least 3 years of professional work experience analyzing large data sets, visualizing information, and working closely with stakeholders to inform company strategyEducated: you have at least a bachelor's degree in Economics, Computer Science, Applied Math, Management Information Systems or a related discipline; graduate degrees are preferred, but can be replaced by relevant work experience in consulting, consumer insights, or product strategy groupsStrategic and business-savvy: you're well aware that there's no point to analyzing every aspect of a problem if the decision hinges on one critical insight; you're sharp about what makes a company like Riot tick and can find the critical path to how Riot can deliver meaningful experiences to players. Professional XP developing KPIs to inform business decisions will earn you some bonus pointsTechnically adept: You're very comfortable with statistics, probability, and quantitative analysis methods that help you find insights that matter. Additionally, you already know or are down to learn SQL, Python, or any other language that makes getting to the data more efficient; bonus points for front-end languages like Java or PHP.Social: you can make friends anywhere you go, but that's the easy part you're ready and able to build relationships and become a trusted advisor to decision-makers across RiotAdaptable: you recognize that situations change, complications arise, and you're ok with that; you're adept at making plans and prioritizing under pressure, but coolly flexible and able to handle whatever comes your wayAn equipped communicator: you're comfortable using Excel, Powerpoint, and/or Tableau; you're capable of translating raw data into reports and presentations that are clear and concise, and delivering them to a variety of audiencesYOU WILL:Work in teams and solo to accurately aggregate and analyze petabytes of game data and information from various sources in preparation for deeper analysis and/or reportingOrganize the data you've collected into reliable intel that informs Rioters about areas where we can improve the player experienceWork with decision-makers to understand their goals, identify opportunities, and inform decisions about products and features across the companyCreate awesome Don't forget to include a resume and cover letter. We receive a lot of applications, but we'll notice a fun, well-written intro that shows us you take play seriously.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionTITLE: Business AnalystLOCATION: Compton, CADEPARTMENT: Information TechnologyREPORTS TO: Applications DirectorJOB SUMMARY:The Business Analyst will work with the ERP Project Team members and users from business departments with the purpose of gathering and documenting requirements. This includes observing the current process, documenting and flow-charting the process flow. Identify areas where a process has conflicts or could use some attention. Perform testing on the new software platform for their functional area and assist in UAT and training.The Business Analyst will be part of the IT Applications team within Transamerican Auto Parts with focus on upcoming ERP project as well as further growth and advancement of our business.ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:Acts as functional lead and subject matter expert in a functional area as part of MS Dynamics ERP implementation project.Gathers business requirements through a variety of techniques (e.g. work sessions and interviews).Assists with the development of conceptual business model views and high-level and detailed business process designs.Develops the required work products for the business process and application domains of change.Assists in prototyping business applications to ensure accuracy in design and applicability to user requirements.Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel.Trains users on new software and procedures.Communicates in formal presentation settings including proposal orals and client workshops; develops proposal sections, methodology work products and formal written deliverables covering area(s) of expertise.Works with PMO to keep project timeline and reporting.Be a hands-on, active team member of the IT Applications team.SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:B.S. degree or equivalent experience.Experienced in Information Technology as Business Analyst type roles.Experience with ERP type business systems in business analyst role.Strong exposure to ERP implementations (preferably Microsoft Dynamics AX/D365) in design, planning, development, and execution phases is a plus.Ability to work with Technical and Non-Technical staff.Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to quickly synthesize information and develop recommendations.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required.Capable of managing multiple objectives simultaneously.Self-motivated, requiring minimal direct supervision.Experience in automotive industry is a plus.WORKING CONDITIONS:Working conditions are standard office environmentCompany DescriptionAPPLY and complete the application for this opportunity at http://4wheelparts.com/jobs ABOUT TRANSAMERICAN AUTO PARTSTAP OVERVIEW: For more than 50 years, Transamerican Auto Parts (“TAP”) has been an industry leader in the manufacture, distribution, and sale of off-road parts for Jeeps and light trucks. TAP has numerous entities serving various niches in the automotive aftermarket under its corporate umbrella. From 4 Wheel Parts to Transamerican Wholesale, TAP subsidiaries provide the best parts and services for the customer at the most competitive prices.  Since 1961, TAP has grown with the popularity of off-roading. The company began by supplying Jeep parts to local dealers and independent service centers that catered to 4×4 enthusiasts. The original company did not deal directly with the consumer at first, but as the company grew, so did its focus. In the ensuing decades, TAP established and acquired industry leading brands, including Pro Comp, Smittybilt, Rubicon Express, and G2 Axle & Gear. The company also launched Off-Road Adventures, a magazine for off-road enthusiasts.  TAP conducts business through a three-pronged sales, service, and manufacturing paradigm. The company supplements a robust mail-order system with 80 plus brick-and-mortar retail centers, staffed with experienced product and installation specialists. In addition to the retail initiative, TAP has accelerated its business with the e-commerce marketplace. Led by its flagship Websites 4WheelParts.com and 4WD.com, TAP’s 22 consumer-oriented sites have collectively grown beyond 2.6 million visitors each month. The TAP e-commerce network facilitates consumer sales, service, and support. TAP’s manufacturing system features a 100,000 square foot research and production facility that incorporates an in-house conceptualization, design, and implementation process. From the beginning, TAP has dedicated its resources to serving its customers, and to establishing itself as the premier supplier and distributor of high quality automotive parts.  To learn more about us, visit: http://transamericanautoparts.com/

Lowe is owned by a group of employees and retired employee shareholders, 30 of which are active in the firm. Over the past 45 years, Lowe has developed, acquired or managed more than $28 billion of real estate assets. Lowe's mission is to build value in real estate for those it serves by creating innovative, lasting environments and meaningful experiences that connect people and place. Lowe is headquartered in Los Angeles, with regional offices in Denver, Washington, DC, San Diego, Seattle and Irvine and projects throughout the US. Lowe is active in investment, development and management of commercial, residential and hospitality properties. State California Type of Position Entry Level Management

Name: Business Analyst, Client Services
Description: We believe in the power of data to transform how people make decisions. Our data and products help our broad array clients - leaders of progressive political campaigns and Fortune 100 companies - to make better decisions around buying TV advertising.  We're looking for someone with a strong predisposition to analysis who wants to take the next step in their career. We'll teach and explain concepts to you, and you'll in turn be able to explain these ideas to our clients. The core responsibilities of this role are to make and deliver clear and informative reports and presentations to our broad range of clients. You're the kind of person who:Loves to learn - you can't stop taking online courses or reading about new disciplinesConstantly consumes information (breaking news, technology developments, the works)May have built a spreadsheet to evaluate an important life decisionABOUT 605 At 605 we are engineers, analysts, data scientists, media experts, marketing strategists and political operatives. Our team of data scientists pioneered the field of TV data analytics. We offer unique, independent audience measurement and analytics to build better marketing and programming initiatives within the media and entertainment industries.  We are a tech and media analytics startup that grew out of the 2012 Obama Campaign where we used individual-level data to change the way the campaign spent their $500M media budget. Though we were outspent, our ability to target our audience in a sophisticated way meant our dollars were better spent than the opposition.  We're bringing this methodology (and scrappiness!) to a broad array of clients who range from Fortune 500 consumer companies to political candidates and interest groups. RequirementsExcel (for data analysis and building clean tables for presentations)Familiarity with fundamentals of statistics and analysisSuccinct writingPowerPoint (not just familiar, but strong)Word (not just familiar, but strong)Things that will make us really excitedUndergraduate degree in Business/ Economics/ StatisticsInternship in marketing or consultingFamiliarity with basic tools for statistics and analysis (SQL, Python, R)Data visualization (Tableau, R)BenefitsJoin a mission-aligned team dedicated to delivering outstanding work to clients and growing individuallyComprehensive health and dental insurance for employees and their familiesLife insurance401k with match, eligible for match after one yearPre-tax flexible compensation plan for medical, transit, parking or dependent care expenses10 paid vacation days to start2 flexible personal holidaysSick days—if you’re sick, you stay homeWork-from-home FridaysA tight-knit startup community who likes to eat! We celebrate everyone’s birthdays, have frequent team lunches, and do events in and out of the officeEEO STATEMENT At 605, we’re just as passionate about diversity as we are about pioneering the field of TV data analytics. We are committed to cultivating an environment of mutual respect and equal opportunity. All hiring and advancement decisions are made on the basis of qualification, merit, and business need.

Name: Technology Consultant - Healthcare
Description: Job DescriptionOur Healthcare sector has a track record of success in transforming the performance of client organizations by helping them navigate changes in the marketplace while reaching their unique growth and performance goals. As a consultant on our team, you will work alongside the leaders of a diverse group of healthcare organizations to provide solutions to industry and regulatory challenges and drive toward meaningful results. Your contribution will be key as we continue building our winning track record of defining, designing and delivering the outstanding outcomes that optimize an organization’s performance.  Role Responsibilities  As a technology consultant, you will work both independently and with small to mid-sized agile teams to: Interface directly with local/national clients to design, develop and deploy customized solutionsPerform quantitative and qualitative analysisParticipate in business development activities including proposals, marketing, thought leadership, and moreAttend training courses and industry events (when available) to sharpen your consulting skills and build your industry knowledgeTake on responsibilities and assignments of increasing complexity as skills and experience developJob Requirements• Undergraduate or Graduate degree indicating a track record of academic achievementPrevious experience/exposure to working within the Healthcare industry a plus, but not necessaryStrong analytical and quantitative skillsAbility to develop strong relationships with client and internal teamsExemplary communication skills, including written, verbal and presentationBig picture thinking with the discipline, energy, and confidence to get things doneAmbition and self-motivation with the desire to contribute to a positive team environment and the long-term performance of PA and our clientsWillingness to travel locally/nationally as neededAdditional Expertise:Knowledge and/or experience in one or more of the following areas: o System Integration – complex system integration, codified SI methodologies  o Technical Architecture – detailed technical architecture, data architecture, solution development  o Delivery Assurance – technical project management, stakeholder management  o System Development Life Cycle – managing and operating SDLC methodologies (agile, etc.)  Locations - This position will be located in Los Angeles, CA.About PA Consulting GroupWe are the consulting, technology and innovation firm that uses constant curiosity and ever-evolving expertise to make a lasting impact on the world. We are PA Consulting Group. Specializing in technology and innovation, management and IT consulting, our employees operate globally across a wide range of sectors, delivering practical solutions that make the difference for our clients.  Getting exceptional results that have a lasting impact on businesses, communities and individuals is what we do. And finding fresh angles, exploring new avenues and following the unconventional path is how we do it. We are solving some of the world’s most complex problems. But where others settle for off-the-shelf solutions, we approach each challenge with fresh eyes, unconstrained thinking and a perfectly balanced team of experts handpicked for the task.  Join us and make the difference with your career.  VEVRAA Federal Contractor  We are committed to recruiting, promoting and rewarding our people solely on the basis of their ability to contribute to PA’s success. Name: Business Analyst
Description: POSITION TITLE: Business Analyst GENERAL SUMMARY The Business Analyst will be responsible for managing the reporting suite insuring timely & accurate delivery, providing thoughtful analysis and business insights, and will play a key role in the evolution of reporting for the Customer Service Management Team. The role requires heavy Excel use and expertise, the ability to understand data and systems, and the ability to produce a polished and professional presentation. Role further requires working knowledge of SQL scripting and building of toad queries.  This is a highly visible position, working with the Customer Service Management Team and Call Center. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Manage reports, analyses & dashboards (all aspects from content, configuration, delivery, insights, and recommendations).Analyze data from the different functions within the Customer Service department, from orders being filled to payments received, in order to provide recommendations to the business.Prepare reports, charts, graphs and/or Power Point Presentations based on data analytics.Work in collabortation with Customer Servicee and Call Center Leadership Team.Manage data QC, cross referencing, and cleansing.Pro-actively seek to improve what is in your sphere of influence.AccountabilityEXPERIENCE/TRAINING/EDUCATION: A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four year college or university in a business related field. 3 to 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst COMMUNICATION SKILLS: This position requires the ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. This role also requires the ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. This position further requires the ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS: This role requires the ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference. This position also requires the ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. REASONING ABILITY: This position requires the ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. This role further requires the ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. SKILLS/ABILITIES: Proficient in SQL and Oracle environments.  Proficient in Windows environment and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, etc.) environment.  Must have advanced to expert Excel skills/knowledge.  Ability to write Macros, import and export data to Excel and other outside data sources, experienced in Pivot Tables.  Ability to work and communicate with management, colleagues and customers throughout the business and industry at every level.  Knowledge of and ability to utilize customer profile and information.  An innovative thinker with a focus on execution.  EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: STRIVR is using immersive technologies like Virtual Reality (VR) to redefine the way people learn and train for everyday moments in their jobs. Our vision is to empower people to perform at their best by combining real-world experience with cutting-edge technology. With STRIVR spearheading the future of human performance and training, it’s an exciting time to make a big impact!  Born out of Stanford University and its world renowned Virtual Human Interaction Lab, STRIVR aims to improve human performance and is used by Fortune 500 companies and elite sports teams worldwide. We have empowered over 200,000 individuals (and counting) to improve with VR since our launch in 2015. The STRIVR team includes industry leaders that have been studying and building VR for 20+ years, data scientists, instructional designers, and former pro athletes. As a culture, we are scrappy, smart and fearless.  STRIVR is looking to fill a position in the Analytics & Insights team. As a BI Analyst, you will interface with Analytics & Insights, Account Managers and Data Engineering teams at STRIVR. This role will be primarily focused on access, exploration, and visualization of user generated data. In addition to administering and developing Tableau solutions, this role will require familiarity with many parts of the data pipeline as well as front end visualizations for reporting deliverables. The ideal candidate will possess at least minimal engineering and SQL skills as well as an emphasis on data visualization skills (e.g., D3, ggplot, Tableau) along with basic analytics knowledge. Your Responsibilities:Develop and implement new information solutions for internal and external customer via dashboards (primarily Tableau)Create and maintain relevant, high quality, and scalable data visualizations for internal and customer-facing reportsMaintain, debug, and test Tableau applicationsInterface with data engineering to help maintain and develop cloud-based ETL processesUtilize issue tracking software for bug and feature managementLiaise between Analytics + Insight team and customer-facing parts of the organization to explore gaps, opportunities, and bring relevant data sets onlineIngest, clean up, and parse data from various data file formats (e.g., JSON, csv, etc).Work with account managers and operations team to ensure data is successfully being captured from all devices in the field Your Skills:Experience building dashboards and prototypes with BI tools such as Tableau, Qlik View, etcSQL development and experience writing advanced queriesStrong data manipulation and scripting skillsStrong data visualization and presentation skills for professional reportingOrganizational, problem solving, unit testing, and debugging skillsComfortable with data modeling and strategizing to bring online new data sources used in downstream processing.Knowledge of UX and visualization best practices as it relates to dashboardsCross-functional team collaboration (engineering, account managers)Practical experience with cloud computing services Preferred Skills:Experience with statistical tools is a plusFamiliarity with Google Cloud PlatformExperience with Git or version control softwareExperience in the L&D and Training industryBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Finance, Behavioral Science, Accounting or related field preferred

Since then, the firm has grown and broadly diversified to provide engineering, environmental consulting, oil and gas pipeline, infrastructure operations, and remediation-related services. E2 Consulting Engineers, Inc. offers an excellent benefits package including health, dental, vision, and life insurance, 401(k) with employer match, paid time off. Qualified candidates only please submit your resume. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.  LOCAL CANDIDATES PREFERRED. NO PER DIEM OR RELOCATION OFFERED AT THIS TIME. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Title: Business AnalystAbout City of Hope City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 5,000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.  Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nation's 20 leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment. Position Summary: Works alongside the Senior Business Analyst. Responsible for business process management which includes developing and maintaining a repository of organizational and tactical objectives, process documentation, department/unit metrics and key performance indicators. Routinely reviews and analyzes business process, workflow procedures, and job functions to provide insight and suggestions for improvements. Participates in medium to large system related projects to develop business case during project initiation, identify business needs and develop functional requirements and prototypes for system design, develop testing validation requirements for system testing, and assist in change management strategies for adoption of new systems or system changes throughout the project life cycle. Essential Functions:Maintain repository of organizational and tactical objectives, process documentation, department/unit metrics and key performance indicators.Participate as core team member of medium to large system related projects under the direction of a project manager.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, compile high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.Proactively communicate and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Project Feasibility Studies/Business Case Analysis; Business Process Documentation/Work Flow Diagrams; Functional Requirements/Business Requirements Documentation; Functional Specifications; Use Cases, mock-up of GUI Screen and Interface designs.Understand the solution options that are available, and help project stakeholders prioritize those options based on their merits, and eventually select the best option.Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plansCollaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.Distinguish a business problem's symptoms from its root cause, and help discover the true root cause.Identify all the systems, processes and users that are impacted by the business problem, and/or the solution.Ensure that the system/process users' interests are known and communicated to other project stakeholders.Application troubleshooting as a result of a reported helpdesk incidentUser Training on Development applicationsConfigure application user interface according to functional specificationsDevelop low complexity reports using integrated application tools. Follows established City of Hope and department policies, procedures, objectives, performance improvement, attendance, safety, environmental, and infection control guidelines, includingadherence to theworkplaceCode of Conduct and Compliance Plan. Practices a high level of integrity and honesty in maintaining confidentiality.  Performs other related duties as assigned or requested. Position Qualifications:Minimum Education:Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems, Business or Healthcare Administration, Computer Science, or related discipline.Experience may substitute for minimum education requirements.Minimum Experience:2-5 years of healthcare business analysis or consulting experience with Non-Profit organizations.3+ yrs of experience in Use Case diagramming, Business Process Mapping, Sequence and Activity diagramming required.Project lead responsibilities for at least two (2) large multi-user system implementation.Project management experience a plus.Required Courses/Training:Req. Certification/Licensure:Preferred Education:Preferred Courses/Training:Pref. Certification/Licensure:Preferred Experience:Healthcare experience in Hospital ERP systems preferred.Skills/Abilities:Excellent oral/written communication and organizational skills.Foster/promote a professional image.Strong English communication skills, both written and oral.Strong organizational, planning and time management skills.Strong problem solving, critical thinking and conflict resolution skills.Ability to work efficiently with peers, end users, and outside vendors.Software:Microsoft Office Tools, Requirements management tools, MSSharepoint, Working knowledge of BI tools & Databases like Business Objects, MS SQLServer & Oracle.Machines/Equipment:Personal Computer and Peripherals, Mobile Devices, Phone and Voicemail SystemWorking / Environmental Conditions:Occasionally subjected to irregular hoursOccasional pressure due to competing priorities and deadlinesOccasional pressure due to multiple callsOccasionally covers varied shifts, weekends and holidaysOccasional travel requiredAtmosphere and environment associated with an office settingPhysical Demands:Light physical effort (lift/carry up to 10 lbs.)Mostly sedentary workOccasional standing/walking City of Hope is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Name: Business Analyst
Description: At Panda, we all share a common mission: "Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives." We invest in our people because great people run great operations that will exceed our guests' expectations. Talk to any of our associates and you will experience a culture dedicated to its mission and our five fundamental values- Proactive, Respect/Win-Win, Growth, Great Operations, and Giving.  Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn fine dining restaurants, Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food concept served in a fast casual environment, and Hibachi San, our Japanese grill concept. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng.  Panda offers competitive benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have restaurant positions available nationwide and support center positions in Rosemead, CA. Come join the nation's largest and fastest growing Asian restaurant company. ResponsibilitiesResponsible for requirements gathering, design, feature review, coordination, testing and support of software development and hardware deployment.Liaison between business users, stakeholders, Operations and Development and QA teamsCollaborate with Operations and Department management, subject matter experts and business users to gather and document detailed requirements for new and/or enhancements to software, systems and platforms.Gather business requirements and transfer into functional specification documentsCreate diagrams that are easily understood by both business user and technical team to support requirements documentation.Take part in QAQC testing, User Acceptance testing and technical trainingProvide system support and training to IS team. Must be able to analyze issues and provide solutions, recommendations, root causes.Research and analyze solutions and possible vendors for projects.Support and consult in build vs. buy analysis on software, including creating Request for Proposal (RFP) documentation to prospective vendorsRequirementsEducation: Bachelor’s Degree (BS/BA) in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related areaExperience: 2+ years of business experience working with system solutions such as an ERP system and/or 2+ years of Information Systems experienceKnowledge of SQL would be helpfullRestaurant or retail experience preferredAbilities:Exceptional verbal and written communication skillsExcellent documentation skills including requirements, diagrams, system interfaces and use casesStrong presentation and facilitation skillsAbility to multi-task and manage multiple priorities effectively while being able to deal with frequent interruptions and a high-pressure environment.Ability to work independently and in a team environment with minimal supervisionHighly organized and must possess a strong attention to detailMust be a result-oriented individual – take initiative to ensure that schedules and milestones are met Panda Restaurant Group’s culture is strongly guided by our Mission and Values, highlighted on the Panda websites. We recommend all interested candidates become familiar with our Mission and Values, as well as the principles of The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People, by Stephen Covey.  Panda Restaurant Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: PeerStreet is an award-winning, Andreessen-Horowitz backed, platform focused on democratizing access to real estate debt. What we're working on at PeerStreet will ultimately change mortgage finance! PeerStreet is a leading online platform for investing in real estate backed loans (www.PeerStreet.com).  We are seeking a highly motivated Business Analyst to join our team in El Segundo, CA. The Business Analyst will report to the Director of Strategy and will support many areas of the company -- from creating reports and Excel models to conducting market research and driving special projects. The role is highly visible and will be very demanding. You will be collaborating closely with cross-functional leadership from Real Estate, Legal, Finance, Operations, Product, Technology and Data departments. Our teams are made up of experts who are passionate, collaborative and entrepreneurial, fostering a culture of innovation, learning and fast-paced growth. Name: Technical Business Analyst- L.A
Description: About the Position The Technical Business Analyst role is a highly collaborative position with insight into and collaboration with all roles within the organization. This position serves as a primary facilitator for cross-team communication and collaboration. The Technical Business Analyst must familiarize him/herself with scope, objectives and architecture of each project to gain a cohesive, detailed and accurate understanding. Technical Business Analysts must have focused attention to detail and must work well in teams or on solo tasks.  The Technical Business Analysts primary responsibility is gathering and analyzing detailed functional requirements. As a result the Technical Business Analyst will produce functional specifications for client approval that clearly denote scope and requirements to aid user interface, engineering, and quality analysis teams in project development. The Technical Business Analyst owns/organizes all project-related documentation. The Technical Business Analyst is responsible for answering scope and functionality related questions, as well as to provide oversight to the successful completion of the project.  Approximately less than 20% travel required per year. ResponsibilitiesDocumentationResponsible for drafting and updating all functional specification documentation including use cases, process and data workflows, as well as relationships between content structures for a siteWork closely with the Technical Architects and to obtain the technical details for the necessary planning deliverables before the implementation phase.Ability to identify gaps, overlaps, and conflicting information in scope and requirements. Work closely with the team to resolve project issues.Ability to outline basic test scenarios, provide functional and technical recommendations as necessary.Communication/CollaborationFacilitating cross-department communication is key to this role.The Technical Business Analyst leads project handoff and retrospective meetings with members of the Engineering, Quality Analysis, Project Management and Creative teams. Will be responsible for capturing & following-up on any action/blocking items.The Technical Business Analyst will be the main information resource for project functionality and scope specific questions.Must be able to effectively communicate and document complex user interaction scenarios.The Technical Business Analyst is client facing role. Frequent communication with the client is necessary for gathering requirements and making recommendations. They will also be responsible for explaining gaps and technical concepts for an often nontechnical audience.QualificationsBachelors Degree in related field, specialized training, or 3-6 years of equivalent work experience in IT/software industry.Exceptional organizational and communication skills, with the ability to cultivate relationships with internal departments.Excellent attention to detail.Ability to gather, analyze and document information clearly and efficiently.Proactive nature to actively seek gaps and issues, and make recommendations to functionality.Candidate should possess a solid understanding of front-end development (XHTML, CSS, JS) and have experience with middle tier and back end development (ASP.NET, C#, SQL). Although development knowledge is desirable, development will not be a focus of this role.Experience with Content Management Systems and integrations (Sitecore, Episerver or Ektron) is not essential but is a big plus.Familiarity with both agile and waterfall development methodologies is a plus.Experience with project life-cycle management tools such as JIRA and Confluence would be a plus.Must be an innovative, self-motivated, and hands-on professional who excels with new and changing technologies in a rapidly growing and fast moving company.Multi-day domestic, and sometimes international, travel will be a requirement for some projects.Ten great reasons to work for VerndaleRapid growth company of 19 years maintaining start-up company feelWork that demands team building and quality results by challenging the solution, experience and technology.Monthly outings and social events including a summer fiesta and winter bash.Tight-knit and collaborate work environment with no formal dress codeWestside LA location next to downtown Culver City and the beach; covered parking garage sponsored for by VerndaleOpportunities to hone your inner-self through events, speaking opportunities, trainings and more.Friday VernDiner breakfasts, free lunch and happy-hour at 3:00pm sharp!Community athletic leagues that vary based on season and interestFlexible schedule options to support work/life integration (we know all about LA traffic)Paid holidays, 3 weeks paid vacation at time of hire, fantastic 401k matching and stellar insurance for you and your familyAbout Verndale Verndale is a customer experience agency, purpose-built to help marketing and technology leaders connect the dots of the consumer journey. From our offices in Boston, Los Angeles and Quito, we design and build digital experiences, and enable marketing technologies that bring brands and their customers closer together.  We know that in order to do great work, you have to make work great. Verndale is committed to always being a company that celebrates diversity, equality and inclusion. We strive to recruit and retain people who are committed to creating the climate of respect that is essential for individual and company success.  Verndales services are built around a core methodology that encompasses Growth Strategy, Experience Design, Technology Enablement, and Experience Optimization.  Lean more about Verndale at www.verndale.com Compensation & Benefits Verndale is proud of the fun, diverse, and respectful company environment we enjoy on a daily basis. Competitive compensation and comprehensive coverage for medical, dental, life, disability and a 401(k) savings plan with company match are offered to all full-time employees. Ample company paid holidays and personal time off make having a work-life balance possible. For some roles working from home on an as-needed basis is a definite possibility; we believe in hiring the best and keeping our own happy and motivated.

Name: Analyst
Description: The Analysts acts as a Trusted Advisor to our partners, ultimately responsible for ensuring their success. You will align at the stakeholder level, building and maintaining strong relationships. In these roles, you will be responsible for helping customers achieve business value and ROI from their investment with Xsolla. The end result is increased value, retention, partner satisfaction and ultimately expansion of the Xsolla footprint.  An Analyst leverages deep business and industry knowledge to partner with customers to help them accelerate business value and ROI from their investment with Xsolla. You will align with Business Development, Integrations, Product Owners and Marketing to, build and maintain strong relationships to help partners launch, monetize and scale their games and businesses. RequirementsEnsure that partners derive maximum value from their investment in XsollaBuild and nurture relationships across accounts to solidify our partnership and commitment to the customer while penetrating the account deeperWorking collaboratively with the business development and integrations teams to effectively network within accounts in order to help customers achieve their objectivesMonitor customer usage data, health indicators, renewal dates and growth opportunities, and translate into strategies for successEvangelize the capabilities of XsollaDevelop an understanding of typical business challenges faced by developers and publishers and common objectives to appropriately map Xsolla’s tools and services and associated business benefits to address their needsIdentify risks to the customer achieving their stated business goals and work with the business development and integrations teams to build a risk mitigation plan or escalate as neededWhen appropriate, recommend additional Xsolla tools and services needed to drive partner successProactively understand the partner's roadmap (release schedule, etc.). Work as an extension of the partner's team. Anticipates potential problems and involve appropriate internal team members to devise solutionsBenefitsPay depends on experience and availabilityHealth, life, dental, and vision insuranceRetirement fund matchingGenerous PTO policyPersonal advancement opportunities - as a global company growing every year, there are often opportunities for internal advancement and trainingRelaxed work environment with table tennis, foosball, office parties, and a full kitchen.

Name: Product Analyst
Description: Honey is a fast-growing startup based in Los Angeles. Our online shopping platform offers users a smarter way to shop. Through a simple browser extension, we open up instant access to exclusive savings, deals, rewards and discovery, all powered by the collective knowledge of Honey's community of online shoppers. We are helping millions save when they shop online, and we're hiring! We are actively seeking a Product Analyst to help us discover, interpret, and communicate new insights from our data. About the Analytics team: We work closely with the Product and Engineering teams to dig into data and try to predict and quantify user behavior, map out certain consumer journeys, and decide on what features to push to production. We work closely with one another but also have autonomy in getting to work on projects that interest us as it relates to business needs. About the Role:Create, measure, and analyze various KPIs to inform decisions and support recommendations across the companyInnovate! Implement innovative quantitative analyses, try new data wrangling techniques, and experiment with new visualization toolsWork with other analysts to build tools and set processes to automate data analysesWork closely with all engineering, product, finance, and marketing departments to understand, solve, and anticipate their analytics needsFoster a culture of transparency: act as the main liaison between other departments to ensure data accuracy and uniform understanding of key metricsPossess excellent communication and presentation skillsMust-Have Qualifications:At least 2 years of experience with dashboarding tools like Tableau or similar (Periscope Data is a plus)At least 2 years of experience with SQL (BigQuery and MySQL is a plus)Ability to take vague requirements and transform them into concise deliverablesAbility to manage multiple priorities and a fast-paced environmentStrong working knowledge of Python, R, and/or D3 is a plusBachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics or similarProficiency in ExcelPrior experience at a tech company is a plus Honey is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: We look for the risk-takers, the collaborators, the inspired and the inspirational. We want the people who are brave enough to work at the cutting edge and create solutions that will enrich and improve the lives of people across the globe. So, if you want to make the world say wow, let's talk.  The conversation starts here. If this role matches your ambitions and skillset, let's get started with your application. Take a look at our other open positions too. Our many opportunities can lead to infinite possibilities. Sony New Media Solutions (NMS), a subsidiary of Sony Electronics, Inc. provides complete digital supply chain solutions to power a new era of media consumption. Major film studios, broadcasters, music labels, game companies, software providers, and other content providers rely on our Media as a Service (MaaS) Ven.ue for innovative technology to keep pace with rapidly evolving consumer demand and emerging multi-channel distribution models. Our market insight, proven expertise across both physical and digital media, and strategic partnerships throughout the industry enable us to provide unmatched end-to-end services that deliver the speed, efficiency, and quality required by today’s digital media businesses and the audiences they serve. Built on our foundation as the world’s leading digital supply chain and logistics provider, Ven.ue offers an immersive interface and a flexible MaaS model. Everything from rights management, content preparation & ingest through to authoring, global distribution, broadcast playout and OTT with fully integrated merchandising and commerce. Ven.ue provides a single solution to distribute your content to thousands of destinations around the world while creating a unique personalized experience for your consumer. Sony is seeking an agile, entrepreneurial, and team-oriented Business Analyst to join our Software Development team in our Marina Del Rey office! Key ResponsibilitiesDefine business requirements for application features, supported by internal and external analysisDefine, maintain, and shepherd project plans and development schedules based on overall team strategy and visionCreate documentationCommunicate effectively in all directions with all teamsProactively identify and resolve strategic issues that impair the team’s ability to execute on project plansProvide QA support as neededQualificationsBA/BS in any discipline, Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or technical related field preferred3+ years of experience in a product/project manager roleWell versed at managing relationships in design and developmentStrong project management skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skills Sony Electronics is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values employees with a broad cross-cultural perspective. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. All applicants will receive fair and impartial treatment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, status in the U.S. uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information or on any other basis which is protected under applicable federal, state or local law.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Who we are: Outlook Amusements is not your average company in a ‘ho-hum’ industry. We are a technology-based e-commerce business connecting customers to psychic advisors for the advice and direction they need, when they need it, and how they want it across our three brands: California Psychics, Psychic Encounters, and the in-culture Spanish language brand, Conexiones Psiquicas. Our Mission is to be a positive force in people’s lives, and we live it every day. We touch 1000’s of customers each month who seek guidance, insights, direction and reassurance in their lives. Our 20-year old Company’s corporate headquarters is based in Burbank, California. This position will be based in our Burbank, CA office. What we are looking for: The Business Analyst will support the Financial Planning & Analytics (FP&A) team in performance analysis as well as the Marketing team in measuring the effectiveness of Customer Relationship Marketing (CRM) strategies. In this role, you will play an important part in accessing data stored in multiple sources by utilizing available business intelligence tools and processes; advanced spreadsheet skills including macros and solid experience with CRM tools is required.  This is a fantastic opportunity to apply an analytics background in helping to guide our company to smart long term decisions. To be successful in this role and to grow within the company, the ideal candidate for this position should be a passionate, driven, results-oriented individual. As this is a high visibility and high impact position, you will have regular exposure to top management. Some of which you will be accountable for:Provide company-wide reporting and analysis support including: business KPIs, customer behavior, value and engagement, marketing campaign effectiveness and customer segmentation.Ability to effectively turn complex data into clear and actionable insights.Using CRM software tools, analyze effectiveness of marketing promotions and presenting findings to the leadership team.Develop, maintain, and distribute ad-hoc reports and marketing mix models as needed.Identify business trends, marketing shifts, and provide insight to company performance.Monitor and assess business operating performance metrics.Establish email performance benchmarks, summarize key insights, and recommend actions to improve email performance.All other projects as assigned.We are looking for you if… You’re passionate about all things marketing and analytics. Good vibes, good energy is a must. Our ideal candidate is a problem-solver who is able to communicate clearly with the entire staff. Provide company-wide reporting and analysis support including: business KPIs, customer behavior, value and engagement, marketing campaign effectiveness and customer segmentation.Ability to effectively turn complex data into clear and actionable insights.Using CRM software tools, analyze effectiveness of marketing promotions and presenting findings to the leadership team.Develop, maintain, and distribute ad-hoc reports and marketing mix models as needed.Identify business trends, marketing shifts, and provide insight to company performance.Monitor and assess business operating performance metrics.Establish email performance benchmarks, summarize key insights, and recommend actions to improve email performance.All other projects as assigned.Qualifications and Experience:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Finance or a related field.3-5+ years’ experience and demonstrated success in a corporate setting.Advanced knowledge of CRM tools and marketing analysis.Some additional factors you need to be successful in the role:Experience with Microsoft Excel, Power Point skills, and Microsoft SQL server.Advanced Excel skills a must (e.g. macros, v-lookup, pivot tables, and other advanced formulas).Experience with PowerPivot highly preferred.Familiarity with Optimove marketing software a plus.What do you get: When you join Outlook Amusements, you will get a warm and welcoming environment in which each person you meet is interested in your success! You’ll be part of a team that is serious about business, focused on our customers, and knows how to have fun too! Our comprehensive employee benefits package has been carefully designed to meet your health, financial and retirement well-being objectives which include medical, dental, vision, a 401k with a company match, additional add-on insurance plans, and paid time off.  Outlook Amusements is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable state or federal civil rights laws.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: At Panda, we all share a common mission: "Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives." We invest in our people because great people run great operations that will exceed our guests' expectations. Talk to any of our associates and you will experience a culture dedicated to its mission and our five fundamental values- Proactive, Respect/Win-Win, Growth, Great Operations, and Giving.  Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn fine dining restaurants, Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food concept served in a fast casual environment, and Hibachi San, our Japanese grill concept. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng.  Panda offers competitive benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have restaurant positions available nationwide and support center positions in Rosemead, CA. Come join the nation's largest and fastest growing Asian restaurant company. ResponsibilitiesResponsible for requirements gathering, design, feature review, coordination, testing and support of software development and hardware deployment.Liaison between business users, stakeholders, Operations and Development and QA teamsCollaborate with Operations and Department management, subject matter experts and business users to gather and document detailed requirements for new and/or enhancements to software, systems and platforms.Gather business requirements and transfer into functional specification documentsCreate diagrams that are easily understood by both business user and technical team to support requirements documentation.Take part in QAQC testing, User Acceptance testing and technical trainingProvide system support and training to IS team. Must be able to analyze issues and provide solutions, recommendations, root causes.Research and analyze solutions and possible vendors for projects.Support and consult in build vs. buy analysis on software, including creating Request for Proposal (RFP) documentation to prospective vendorsRequirementsEducation: Bachelor’s Degree (BS/BA) in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related areaExperience: 2+ years of business experience working with system solutions such as an ERP system and/or 2+ years of Information Systems experienceKnowledge of SQL would be helpfullRestaurant or retail experience preferredAbilities:Exceptional verbal and written communication skillsExcellent documentation skills including requirements, diagrams, system interfaces and use casesStrong presentation and facilitation skillsAbility to multi-task and manage multiple priorities effectively while being able to deal with frequent interruptions and a high-pressure environment.Ability to work independently and in a team environment with minimal supervisionHighly organized and must possess a strong attention to detailMust be a result-oriented individual – take initiative to ensure that schedules and milestones are met Panda Restaurant Group’s culture is strongly guided by our Mission and Values, highlighted on the Panda websites. Name: Analyst Intern - Summer
Description: Duration: Ten- Twelve weeks over the course of Summer 2019Location: Opportunities in Boston, Chicago, Stamford, New York City, Washington D.C., Philadelphia, Atlanta, Houston, Seattle, San Francisco and Los AngelesStart Date: Flexible Hours: 40 hours per week Application Deadline: January 21, 2019Organization ProfileSpencer Stuart is the leading privately held, global executive search consultancy. We are the advisor of choice among top companies seeking guidance and counsel on senior leadership needs, including executive recruiting, succession planning, organizational design and corporate governance. Our clients range across industries, from the world's largest companies to medium-sized businesses, not-for-profits and entrepreneurial start-ups. We operate out of 57 offices in 30 countries. Last year alone, Spencer Stuart conducted over 4,000 assignments around the world placing top corporate executives and board members of leading Fortune 500 companies. The Spencer Stuart InternshipSpencer Stuart offers analyst interns a fast-paced, intellectually engaging, entrepreneurial environment working with a diverse group of energetic professionals who are former business leaders and management consultants. Interns have a unique opportunity to gain broad exposure to a variety of industries and functions and to learn about the careers of leading executives around the world. Interns also participate in trainings designed to broaden their skill set and familiarity with executive search.Position DescriptionAnalyst interns will work on strategic projects in teams with associates and consultants. Responsibilities include: Coordinating and completing business analysis on multi-faceted business development projects;Bringing creative solutions to search assignments and new business issues.Providing research and analysis support to management and participating in special projects.Analyst interns will work simultaneously on a variety of projects that vary greatly in size and complexity. Some projects target a narrowly defined business problem, while other projects address much larger strategic needs which may result in the creation of a presentation, report, or intellectual capital piece (i.e. article). Interns will be asked to present an overview of their work to their office at the conclusion of their internship.Qualification ProfileRising seniors only. A solid academic record is required (all majors welcome)Broad extracurricular involvement and leadership experience. Strong analytical, communication and writing skills.Proficiency with MS Office applications such as Excel, PowerPoint, and Word is required.Previous experience in a research capacity (either through coursework or previous internships) is a plus. Spencer Stuart is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer F/M/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business AnalystLocation: Los Angeles, CADuration: 6 Months Contract (potential to go over 12 months) This role will require SOMEONE TO HAVE EXCEPTIONAL VERBAL COMMUNICATON AND INTERPERSONAL COMMUNICATION SKILLS. This role will require interfacing with people, interviewing, etc. A marketing background will be helpful. Requirements Documentation – Responsible for defining and documenting project and user requirements. Analysis and documentation of the requirements must be thorough, inclusive of both the operational requirements and detailed explanation of how the system should work. Documentation must be written so that it can be understood by any perspective reader. Documentation must be maintained and updated. Support/Problem Solving – Ability to define, find root cause and resolve system issues and/or business process issues. Upon identification, produce the appropriate documentation defining the issue, root cause, priority and requirements for resolution. Manage issue through resolution. Analytical Skills – Ability to analyze and clearly articulate aspects of process improvements. Review environment with a clear understanding of both operations and systems to identify areas of improvement. Must understand the technologies, solutions and development options available for the solution. Communication – Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must. Key aspect of the position is the ability to document accurately and holistically. Communications must be clear to all audience members and provide opportunity for feedback concerning the content. Technology – Understanding of Project Management tools (Jira, MS Project) and productivity software (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio etc).

Name: Business Analyst
Description: A SaaS and IoT software company is looking to add a business analyst to a new team they're creating around their largest software product. Theyre a technology subsidiary supported by their large parent corporation with offices in Long Beach.
