Name: Business Analyst
Description: Overview  The Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the senior members on the team in managing projects across functions and departments. This includes supporting the process of gathering needs, analyzing business processes, and evaluating and recommending solutions. The incumbent will manage user expectations, engage in multiple initiatives, perform issue tracking and resolution, and ensure that projects are delivered on time. This role also serves as a liaison between the business units and the software development teams by assisting in the requirements definition process and testing software to ensure quality standards are met.  Some projects require being embedded in the department most impacted or concerned with specific work flow and systems changes for an indefinite period. This will normally occur only on the largest and most high risk/reward projects. In those situations, the incumbent will have a dotted line reporting relationship to the senior manager of the business unit to which he/she is embedded.  Stakeholder feedback is considered in both project and annual performance reviews. ResponsibilitiesParticipate in cross-departmental projects and provide assistance to the project team assigned.Provide support in all phases of the project cycle, which includes analyzing business needs, participating in solution design, and developing functional specifications (may include stakeholder interviews, business process analysis, and review of existing documentation).Assist in the development projects through all phases of the software development life cycle.Perform thorough quality assurance testing on new and enhanced features as assigned.Assist in developing executive project summary reports for discussion of project progress to senior stakeholders.Provide production support & troubleshooting to the business unit assigned as needed.Minimum QualificationsBachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, or related disciplines2+ years of successful project management and business analysis experienceKnowledge or prior experience in the finance industryExcellent verbal and written communication as well as analytical skillsBasic Business Intelligence, Report Development, and / or Relational Database ExperienceStrong MS Excel skillsDesired QualificationsExperience working in buy-side asset management firmsProject Management certificationSDL2017

Name: Business Analyst
Description: THE COMPANY: BRAINJOLT (brainjoltmedia.com) Brainjolt is a leading digital media company with two sites in Quantcast’s top 35 mobile sites in the U.S. We are a team of constant learners who value scrappy cleverness as much as best practices.  And it’s working. Despite a lean team, we reach 36 million users a month across our properties and social media channels with engaging, smile-inducing viral stories, quizzes, and more. Highlights…Our flagship viral site, 22 Words, is ranked in the top 25 mobile sites in the country with 20M unique visitors a month.MagiQuiz is ranked in the top 35 mobiles sites, boasting 3-minutes on site per visitor and whopping 60% completion rate.Our social following is at 26 million and is growing fast. Brainjolt is a culture of constant and continuous learners, who strive to better themselves every day. THE OPPORTUNITY: BUSINESS ANALYST Brainjolt is looking for a Business Analyst responsible for supporting the strategic planning and optimization of the Brainjolt Digital Media Ad Stack. You will have a strong foundational understanding of the programmatic ecosystem to help develop, grow and support Brainjolt’s Ad Operations strategy. As the Business Analyst, you will provide insights related to ad revenue KPIs and discover ways to automate the revenue reporting and data analysis process. Specifically…Working with the AdOp’s Director on how to best manage the day-to-day requirements related to Ad Operations, Reporting and Yield Optimization efforts.Oversee the daily revenue reporting requirements as it relates to Brainjolt’s revenue and performance requirements.Supporting existing/new relationships and engaging demand-side vendors to expand revenue streams.Helping manage relationships with revenue partners and implementing direct campaigns while addressing day to day needs of our audience targeting operation.Assist in optimizing and increasing programmatic opportunities and improve revenue performance.Developing and nurturing relationships with demand-side partners.Identifying and evaluating the right partners to help activate data assets in the display, video and mobile exchanges via a deep understanding of our data.Analyzing valuable opportunities with DSPs, agency trading desks, etc.Maximizing onsite yield management through various monetization opportunities.Manage channel conflict and optimize performance for best risk/reward scenarios.On-going analysis of new digital advertising technologies and evolution of the programmatic platform, making recommendations for improvements as appropriate.Trafficking and reporting of campaigns (scheduling & delivery, fill, revenue and analysis).Support all revenue reporting across revenue stack.RequirementsEDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.EXPERIENCE: 2+ years of Programmatic or Ad Operations experience building/evolving the programmatic platform and managing monetization across multiple programmatic channels. (Open to training the right candidate, as applicable.)Measurable success developing programmatic strategies and managing strategic partnerships.Knowledge of data management technologies and third party data sources and platforms.Familiar with DSPs, SSPs, Exchanges, Ad Networks, Ad-Server (specifically DFP).Strong foundation in Excel/data modeling with experience in aggregating 1st and 3rd party dataProven track record of meeting revenue goals and supporting new business with third party vendors, trading desks, and DSPs.Foundational experience with Header Bidding strategies and ad stack technologies.Desire to continually develop and discover new opportunities in the ever-changing programmatic ecosystem.A love of working in a fast paced environment.A self-starter with a results + growth driven mindset.EXPECTATIONSREPORTING: Primary responsibility around revenue and performance reporting to ensure accurate data is provided daily either through automation or manual pulling of data.TROUBLESHOOTING: This position will require on-call availability on weekends (when needed) to deliver revenue reporting, troubleshoot issues and Ad Stack needs, communicate with revenue partners and coordinate with appropriate internal stakeholders on revenue and/or UX initiatives.MITIGATE RISKS: Constantly monitor performance to eliminate any/all issues that negatively impact Brainjolt’s revenue and overall performance.DATA INTEGRITY & KNOWLEDGE: Expert attention to detail and knowledge as it relates to Brainjolt’s revenue and performance data with a keen ability to deliver key insights and recommendations to ensure trust is constantly maintained with all internal stakeholders.THOUGHT LEADERSHIP: Deliver key insights to the entire Brainjolt team in an effort to educate and enhance the entire company on opportunities for optimization and overall improvement.Benefits Brainjolt is a fun, fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment that empowers its employees to work independently and drive results that greatly impact the business. Since early on, one of our go-to values has been Fight boredom, spread happiness. We strive to do this not just for our audience, but for our team, too. In addition to basic benefits, here are some additional ways we support your continued success and happiness: Unlimited PTOHome internet & mobile phone assistanceGym membership assistance2 tickets to a concert of your choice per yearSpotify, Netflix, & Audible subscriptions.Monthly Personal & business-related book budgetAnd more…

Name: Business Analyst, Marketing
Description: As Procore's Business Analyst, you'll work on Procore's Revenue Operations team to help drive smarter business decisions. You're passionate about using technology to problem-solve and data-driven insights to create and direct strategy. Your work will help scale our efforts through both technical execution and thoughtful data analysis, which will enable the team to make impactful decisions. As our Marketing Business Analyst, you're knowledgeable in the processes of marketing and can create inventive solutions to make decisions with confidence. What you'll do:Understand the Procore marketing business - communicate with stakeholders, gather requirements, and make sense of these requirements to ensure that the end products will solve the problems at hand.Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies.Manage projects, develop project plans, and monitor performance.Monitor deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements.Serve as a liaison between stakeholders, users, system analysts, and engineers.Participate in the creation and management of Salesforce reports and dashboards which help run the heart of revenue operations.Track ROI and efficiencies of marketing programs and larger initiatives.Maintain consistent reporting cadences across a large marketing organization and use our data to communicate performance, areas for improvement, and shared success or failures.Monitor performance at channel and product levels across our Marketing organization.Present results monthly, quarterly, and annually to key stakeholders within the company on departmental performance.What we're looking for:2+ years of previous Business Analyst or Project Management experience.2+ years of experience working marketing or sales, or market-to-order experience2+ years of experience using a marketing software (Marketo, Hubspot, Pardot, Eloqua, etc.).Bachelor's Degree in area(s) related to Business and/or Technology.Strong project management and organizational skills to manage schedules and deadlines within ongoing and new campaign.Salesforce reporting and dashboarding experience.Business Intelligence software experience (Looker, Tableau, or Domo) is preferred.About Us Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore. Our headquarters is located on the bluffs above the Pacific Ocean in Carpinteria, CA, with growing offices worldwide. To learn more about our team, click here.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Perks & Benefits You are a person with dreams, goals, and ambitionsboth personally and professionally. That's why we believe in providing benefits that not only match our Procore values (Openness, Optimism, and Ownership) but enhance the lives of our team members. Here are just a few of our benefit offerings: competitive health care plans, unlimited paid vacation, stock options, employee enrichment and development programs, and friends & family events.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst (Bilingual - Mandarin & English)  Start Date: February 2018  Location: Culver City (must be able to come in for face-to-face interview)  Essential Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to (other duties may be assigned): Performs qualitative research and quantitative analysis to support investment and business development opportunities;Contributes to the formulation of business and marketing plans for new or existing products;Assists with the implementation processes and timelines for new businesses across multiple departments;Produces monthly reports on e.g. investment opportunities, sales performance, media coverage, user reviews;Supports Marketing, PR, and Localization departments on special projects such as key product launches and tradeshows; Education/Experience: Bachelors degree, preferably in Business or ManagementTwo to three years related experiences and/or trainingBilingual in English and Mandarin is a MUSTStrong knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPointSelf-motivated and detailed orientedExcellent communication and problem-solving skillsFlexible to work overtime outside of the typical work hours as neededWilling to travel for business as neededTeam player, enjoys working in diverse office environment and excited to help build our internal culturePassion for games is a plus About the Company  Snail Games has been a pioneer in the digital technology and entertainment industry since its founding in 2000. The company has developed and published over 50 digital products, providing entertainment to 85 million users in over 100 countries and regions. As the mobile era continues to accelerate, Snail Games aims to expand the scope of gaming through innovations in software, hardware, and telecommunications.

Name: Technical Business Analyst

You will work as an integral member of our Engineering team, gathering requirements and being the liaison between business and the IT team, ensuring that mission critical systems are functioning effectively and consistently. Name: Business Analyst
Description: ForwardLine is a fast-growing fintech company dedicated to providing simple, fast, and affordable financing to Americas Main Street businesses. An innovator in the industry since 2003, we are currently implementing an aggressive national growth strategy.  Want to be part of a team where your work has a direct impact on the economic decisions of the company? Are you interested in working in an environment that promotes data-driven decisions, creativity, and innovation? The Product Analyst works directly on several aspects of the core lending business sales and marketing strategy analysis, determining underwriting criteria at Originations and later in the customers lifecycle, measuring policy and execution effectiveness, and much more. It is a dynamic role that can touch all parts of the business, with high visibility and interaction with the executive team. If you are a go-getter who wants to blend analytical chops with real-world execution, apply today. Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: In February 2018, the Student Services Initiative Assessment was completed with the goal of reviewing the state of current student and faculty-facing services for six applications that have been prioritized by sponsors:Grading and Roster System (GRS)Financial Aid data (FAO Data) in a centralized data sourceFinancial Aid Office Online Forms (OLF)OASISWeb Registration (Web Reg)Financial Aid Summary and Tasks (FAST)There are three main objectives for the program:Modernize the applications: GRS, OLF, OASIS, Web Reg, and FASTEnsure all required data exists in a centralized data source and build new services (i.e., applications and reporting) to leverage this centralized data sourceReduce dependency and impact of external systems to the Student Information System (SIS)We are currently seeking two Senior Business Analysts to join the Student Services Initiative optimization program team within the Information Technology Services (ITS) department here at the University of Southern California. The Senior Business Analysts will serve as members of the program team, partnering with other resources working on the projects above. Responsibilities include requirements gathering, solution design, solution build, testing, and deployment. This will include balancing the needs of the business with the objective of optimizing the business process. There are 2 vacancies for this role. These are fixed-term position with an anticipated end date of 1.5 years after the Hire Date. Please note that these are full-time roles eligible for benefits, including medical, dental, and vision plans.What You’ll Do:Gather and document within USC’s tracking software the user stories from our business ownersTranslate user stories into detailed requirements and use casesWork with the project leadership and business owners to help build and manage a backlog of user stories for consideration to deploy during the projectWork with project team members to design solutions to the prioritized back log items in an iterative ‘agile’ style processHelp manage the execution of a focused testing strategyAssist project team members in the design of new (or redesign of existing) integrationsDraft documentation (e.g., white paper, policy challenges) supporting the escalation of business decisionsWork closely with business owners in the overall design of the requirement solutionsChallenge the existing business process looking for opportunities for improvementMeet with customer groups to determine IT business requirementsElicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysisProvide and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilitiesProvide project level analysis – producing required project analysis documentation (business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, UAT plan)Serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development or business process re-engineering team through which requirements flowDevelop requirements specifications according to standard templatesCollaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needsParticipate in project meetings to review project deliverables and timelinesWork with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of projectParticipate in testing developed software or new process flowProvide guidance to other members of the development/analysis team, as requiredStay informed of new developments and technologiesPerform other duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any timeThe Must Haves:3 years of business analyst experience working on large scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from the businessStrong project management, ability to successfully manage multiple tasks at any given point, strong relationship building skills & communication skillsThe Nice to Haves:5 years of business analyst experience focused on demonstrated success in system improvementExperience working within a higher education settingMinimum Education: Bachelor's degree, Combined experience/education as substitute for minimum educationMinimum Experience: 3 years, Combined education/experience as substitute for minimum experienceMinimum Field of Expertise: Sound knowledge of requirements gathering, documentation procedures, project management methodologies, process flow charting and testing processes. Competent to work independently on complex business process and system changes and issues.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: 2141 Rosecrans Ave. Suite 2050· El Segundo, California 90245 · Phone (310) 416-9898 · Fax (310) 416-9897  Business Analyst  El Segundo, CA Company Overview: Integrated Data Services (IDS) is a leading provider of custom software products and Government financial management services. IDS was founded in 1997 in El Segundo, CA, and since that time has seen tremendous growth and success. Currently IDS has offices supporting customers nationwide. By providing customers with fast, efficient and reliable information systems and support services, IDS has become a preferred provider of financial and programmatic systems, services, and solutions across a wide variety of government agencies. Position Description: IDS is currently searching for a Business Analyst with experience in DoD or government financial management processes, government financial and accounting systems, and reconciliation processes to provide support to a government customer.  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:  Act as a member of a financial reconciliation team supporting a Department of Defense program office and will perform reconciliation between government contracts and funding documents.  Analyze financial data between various government accounting systems to determine errors.  Submit correction packages to the Defense Finance and Accounting Service for input.  Verify funding documents for validly prior to submission for budgetary adjustments.  Prepare reports on status of funds.  Submit financial reports summarizing all reconciliation efforts and unresolved discrepancies.  Otherwise support a government office. Physical Qualifications: Must be able to lift/carry at least 15 lbs.  Must be able to remain in a stationary position 80% of the time.  Must consistently work and type on a computer and may be required to move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office supplies, etc. Knowledge and Skills: Minimum of four (4) years of finance or financial management, federally funded research and development center, and/or government support/development or related experience within a Government or DoD organization with a minimum of three (3) years of experience directly supporting a financial management acquisition program.  Financial Management Suite (FM Suite), MAR Reporting Software (SMART), Comprehensive cost and Requirement System (CCaR), and Commanders Resource Integration System (CRIS) experience is required. Education and Work Experience: This position requires a minimum of a 4-year degree from an accredited college or university in business management, engineering, computer science, mathematics, economics or other related discipline. Certificates and Licenses: Applicants selected for employment will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet additional eligibility requirements for access to classified information or materials. Travel: Some travel may be required. Hours: Normal work schedule will be 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M., Monday through Friday. May be required to work additional hours and/or weekends, as needed, to meet deadlines or to fulfill travel obligations. Salary Range: Commensurate with experience.  Company offers full-benefits package including health, dental, vision and 401K plans. IDS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, creed, age, sex, gender, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, ancestry, pregnancy perceived pregnancy, medical condition, marital status, familial status, color, religion, uniformed services, veteran status, national origin, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected under local, state or Federal law. A submission of a resume is an expression of interest and not considered an application.  For more information, visit www.get-integrated.com. To apply, please send a resume and cover letter to jobs@get-integrated.com and reference code: IDS-RCBA-CA. ***U.S. citizenship and/or green card is required; H1-B visas and other visas are not being sponsored. Relocation expenses are NOT compensated. All jobs are employer paid; no fees to candidates. Third parties or agencies inquiries are not being accepted.**

Name: Jr. Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary:Looking for high powered and quantitatively oriented IT Business Analyst to support the Projects in IT Domain. Analyst will be required to analyze specific business problems and drive value in strategic areas of business. What you will get to do:Typically the customers would be Senior Managers / Directors from different Domains located in US, Latin America, and Asia Pacific.The analyst would typically handle a high impact project at any time which should result in bottom line impact.Most of the work would be around business understanding, data understanding, guiding junior analysts in data preparation, working with the statistical team to create models if required and result presentation. The analyst would be required to understand the business model, business brief, and the information available for analysis.Adhoc requirements would need to be fulfilled from time to time as well.High Level of Business analysis skills is necessary.Graduate or Post Graduate from Tier 1 with 0-2 years of experienceIdeal candidate would have strong analytical skills, ability to understand business situations and provide data backed analysis.Basic Requirement:Graduate degree in Computer Science. Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science.Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.

Name: Business Systems Analyst, Finance
Description: The Business Systems Analyst, Finance (Order to Cash) is responsible for implementation and ongoing maintenance of Procore Order to Cash business systems, which includes design, configuration, training, reporting, and support. You will work with Business Analysts as well as Sales and Finance team leaders and cross-functionally across other Procore business units to ensure the systems are functioning as expected and implement functional improvements. You will be responsible for security, facilitating system upgrades, communication about system stability and improvements, and maintaining updated documentation on the business systems. You will also manage and monitor some integrations between financial systems and be part of larger integration initiatives. What you'll do:Manage and support the Order to Cash processes via systemDesign and implement process improvements to increase efficiencies and ensure reliabilityImplement feature enhancements to systems according to Procore business needsEnsure integrations between systems are working as expected and resolve any errorsCommunicate and resolve planned or unplanned system downtimeProvide day-to-day end user support and deliver end user training where neededMaintain accurate and consistent metadata across all business systemsWork with IT to administer licensing & permissions and maintain security matrix of roles & permissionsMaintain updated documentation of process & system configurationsWork with data team to provide relevant requested data for data warehouse with the business relevance & functionDevelop and provide reporting from systems when requested, train others on building reportingEstablish and implement best practices with regards to system maintenance, security, release management, improvements, data integrity, duplicates, backups, etc. What we're looking for:At least 1 year of experience managing business systems such as Zuora, Salesforce, Obero or Xactly, Cybersource, Avalara; familiarity with Intacct or Netsuite is a plusAbility to reasonably estimate the time for tasks and meet deadlines set by those estimates; ability to quickly and effectively prioritize multiple requests, keeping the company's strategic goals in mindExperience with data management, transformation, cleaning, and de-duplicationExperience with 3rd party SaaS application integration, ongoing maintenance, & supportAbility to triage issues as they come in and escalate where necessaryAbility to consider the end-to-end process and advise on downstream effects of changesAbility to interact with individuals across a wide variety of operational, functional, and technical disciplines and work well with all levels of management but also able to work independently to resolve issuesExcellent written and verbal communication skills with a pleasant, supportive, and customer-focused personality and the ability to work across all levels in an organizationExperience with a ticket/task tracking system (JIRA) a plusAbout Us Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore. Our headquarters is located on the bluffs above the Pacific Ocean in Carpinteria, CA, with growing offices worldwide. To learn more about our team, click here.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Perks & Benefits You are a person with dreams, goals, and ambitionsboth personally and professionally. That's why we believe in providing benefits that not only match our Procore values (Openness, Optimism, and Ownership) but enhance the lives of our team members. Here are just a few of our benefit offerings: competitive health care plans, unlimited paid vacation, stock options, employee enrichment and development programs, and friends & family events.

Name: Senior Analyst, Corporate Business Development & Strategy
Description: What part will you play? We are currently seeking a Senior Analyst for the Corporate Business Development & Strategy Department. The Senior Analyst is a pre-MBA position and will support Warner Bros. in the execution of M&A and corporate transactions as well as the development of strategic growth opportunities. The team collaborates with partners across all Warner Bros. divisions – including Theatrical, Television, Home Entertainment, Games, DC Entertainment and Consumer Products – to develop strategic analyses and recommendations for Warner Bros. senior management on high profile projects and in a fast-paced environment.  This is an ideal position for someone who is passionate about entertainment and who wants to gain a broad understanding of and deep experience within the media industry. Specific responsibilities include: Providing financial and strategic support in evaluating and executing mergers & acquisitions, joint venture partnerships and cross-divisional business development initiatives.Developing comprehensive financial models and valuation analyses, including returns analysis and sensitivities.Assisting with commercial and financial due diligence.Preparing internal presentations highlighting strategic rationale, key considerations, upside opportunities, potential risks, etc.Assisting teammates and divisional counterparts in the development of long-term global strategy for WB.Conducting research to help inform WB strategic priorities.Preparing comprehensive business plans for new growth initiatives, including expansion internationally and into new businesses.Performing financial analyses to evaluate strategic alternatives and new investment opportunities.Closely monitoring industry trends and competitive dynamics, and prepare presentations summarizing industry segments and individual companies.What do we require from you?Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or business from a top university.2-3 years’ experience at a leading investment bank, strategy consulting firm, or related industry (media and entertainment, digital, tech) company.Advanced financial modeling skills; high proficiency in MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint.Strong quantitative and analytical skills and be able to think strategically.Strong communication & interpersonal skills.Passion for media and entertainment.Requisition #166626BRPosition Type Full Time Area of Interest Business Development, Finance/Accounting, Strategic Planning/Analysis WB Business Unit Corporate Business Development & Strategy Industry Film Production and Distribution Company Overview Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team. * The Warner Bros. Entertainment Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer and considers all candidates for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, marital status, military or veteran's status (including protected veterans, as may be required by federal law), sexual orientation, gender identity or any other category protected by law. Business Unit Overview Warner Bros. corporate functions provide specialized knowledge and expertise to support our vast portfolio of businesses like DC Comics, Warner Bros. Pictures, Warner Bros. Television Group and Warner Bros. Consumer Products.

assigned deadlines.Strong verbal and written communication skills, and be customer focused, to understand and appropriately respond to clients’ business needs.Experience interfacing effectively and collaborating with others, such as internal/external clients, peers, management, and other work units.Ability to motivate self and others to overcome obstacles and achieve goals.Ability to accurately analyze information to draw conclusions, make sound decisions and modify and/or recommend new processes to improve outcome.Takes initiative and accountability for the accuracy of information and for achieving results.Integrates work across relevant areas, develop the business and services to enhance customer satisfaction and productivity, manage risks appropriately, develop and execute business plans, manage information, and provide exceptional service to internal and external customers.Effective resource and project planning, decision making, results delivery, team building, and the ability to stay current with relevant technology and innovation.Strong ethics, influence and negotiation, leadership, interpersonal skills, communication, and the ability to effectively manage stress and Coastal and Southern California. Name: Business Data Analyst
Description: Why Work at Grindr? Since 2009, Grindr has built the world's largest social network for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. Now more than just an app, we're a family of lifestyle brands with the shared mission to connect LGBTQ people with the world around them:  Grindr The location-based social app that started it all. Over 3 million people use Grindr daily, from every country on the planet.  INTO A digital magazine dedicated to queer perspectives: news, culture, commentary, video, and more.  Grindr for Equality (G4E) Our social mission to promote justice, health, and safety for LGBTQ individuals around the globe.  Gaymoji A one-of-a-kind collection of over 500+ stickers available on iOS, Android, and in the Grindr app.  Slumbr An event series for the high-minded partygoer, combining fashion, music, and art.  Behind the brands, Grindr is an inclusive and passionate family of thinkers, innovators, leaders, and most importantly, doers. We're fueled by endless curiosity, constant collaboration, and a knack for crossing every finish line all within an agile growth environment. We also enjoy tons of perks, great social events, and stunning views from our HQ in West Hollywood. Summary Our team is growing, and we're looking to add a Business Data Analyst who will bring their passion for data and help us build products that drive business insight to connect people and experiences, including creating innovative solutions for our users.  In the role, you will have the opportunity to be one of the founding members of the Finance data team, while working closely with other data specialists across the organization, as well as C-suite executives.  The Business Data Analyst will provide insights into our app, allowing us to understand how our users interact with app features, provide actionable insights that drive engagement, and identify opportunities that lead to paid subscriptions. ResponsibilitiesSupport the Finance team in understanding the drivers of each of Grindr's businesses by collecting, cleaning, and maintaining data pipelines from numerous sources.Create dashboards that will allow the Finance team to visualize financial information, as well as key operational metrics, currently housed in our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system and other third-party data providers.Perform in-depth data analyses to identify user behavior and interpret findings within the subscription and advertising businesses.Drive insights into company's subscription products and subscriber behavior, including funnel analyses, user segmentation, user profitability, retention by cohort, and more.Assist in analytical ad-hoc projects targeted at identifying usage trends across the app and determine causation.Support revenue and lifetime value forecasting of subscribers across different offerings.Work closely with the subscriptions and advertising data teams, product, marketing, and engineering.Skills and QualificationsB.S. in economics, decision science, statistics, engineering, applied math, operations research, or a related quantitative fieldAt least 2+ years of post-collegiate in a quantitative field in finance, subscription services or mobile companyExperience working with relational databases and SQL query languagesProficient with statistical packages in R, Python, and/or SASExperience working with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environmentQuantitative forecasting experienceSignificant experience with ExcelAbility to communicate the results of your analyses clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Nice to have: Mandarin language proficiency a plus.Benefits & Perks 100% covered medical, dental and vision insurance  Generous Parental Leave  Unlimited sick policy  Competitive Salaries  401(k)  Catered daily lunch  Stocked kitchen  Free on-site parking  Casual dress environment  Grindr is an equal opportunity employer  *Recruiting firms that submit resumes to Grindr without first entering into a written contract will not be entitled to any compensation on candidates referred by that firm.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: TITLE: Business Analyst  LOCATION: Compton, CA  DEPARTMENT: Information Technology  REPORTS TO: Applications Director JOB SUMMARY: The Business Analyst will work with the ERP Project Team members and users from business departments with the purpose of gathering and documenting requirements. This includes observing the current process, documenting and flow-charting the process flow. Identify areas where a process has conflicts or could use some attention. Perform testing on the new software platform for their functional area and assist in UAT and training.  The Business Analyst will be part of the IT Applications team within Transamerican Auto Parts with focus on upcoming ERP project as well as further growth and advancement of our business. ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: + Acts as functional lead and subject matter expert in a functional area as part of MS Dynamics ERP implementation project.  + Gathers business requirements through a variety of techniques (e.g. work sessions and interviews).  + Assists with the development of conceptual business model views and high-level and detailed business process designs.  + Develops the required work products for the business process and application domains of change.  + Assists in prototyping business applications to ensure accuracy in design and applicability to user requirements.  + Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel.  + Trains users on new software and procedures.  + Communicates in formal presentation settings including proposal orals and client workshops; develops proposal sections, methodology work products and formal written deliverables covering area(s) of expertise.  + Works with PMO to keep project timeline and reporting.  + Be a hands-on, active team member of the IT Applications team. SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE: + B.S. degree or equivalent experience.  + Experienced in Information Technology as Business Analyst type roles.  + Experience with ERP type business systems in business analyst role.  + Strong exposure to ERP implementations (preferably Microsoft Dynamics AX/D365) in design, planning, development, and execution phases is a plus.  + Ability to work with Technical and Non-Technical staff.  + Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to quickly synthesize information and develop recommendations.  + Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required.  + Capable of managing multiple objectives simultaneously.  + Self-motivated, requiring minimal direct supervision.  + Experience in automotive industry is a plus. WORKING CONDITIONS: + Working conditions are standard office environment  EOE Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabled

Name: Marketing Data Analyst
Description: This is a really exciting time to join Verve’s performance marketing team. This is a new role for Verve and an opportunity to shape the Marketing strategy and develop our Los Angeles office to achieve a high, fast and sustainable growth.  In the next 12 months you will: Be leading the data driven mindset within the acquisition team for Verve: You will become an expert in Data analysis and insights for advocate and customer acquisition, always focussing on the company ROAS, revenue growth and scalability.Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and qualityAcquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systemsAs Marketing Analyst Leader, you will Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports including actionable insights to the marketing team in order to improve the campaign resultsUsing your mathematical skills, you will be creating a bidding algorithm to shape our digital advertising bidding strategyYou will combine your communication skills with the insights gathered to report actionable insights and strategy to other department of the business.You will be ruthlessly data-driven, ensuring the development and implementation of best practice in the tracking and storage of customer data, and support the use of this data in providing training to the teams memberRequirements You are: An experienced analyst, with 3+ years of paid advertising data management, ideally in either marketplace, retail or travelA start-up enthusiast, with demonstrable experience in a high growth start-up environmentHighly analytical, data-driven and with a ROAS solution-oriented mindset.Proficient in SQL & excel and willing to teach othersBenefits Verve is building a platform which enables our global network of advocates to sell products and services they love to their friends in exchange for unique experiences and rewards. We‘ve established a beachhead in live entertainment and work with some of the biggest events in the world, and are rapidly expanding our festival and event portfolio across the U.S., UK, Europe, and Australasia. As we continue to expand rapidly within this market, we’re also developing and launching exciting new technology for events to connect directly with their biggest fans. At Verve we believe in a culture of freedom and ownership.  We empower you to own the value you create and impact on our future success. And we believe that to act as an owner you should be empowered to work in the way that enables you to deliver the best results – how and when you do is up to you. You choose your hours, where you work, the meetings you attend and the amount of holiday to take in order to create the most value and be at your best.

Name: Operations Business Analyst

This includes, but is not limited to, business systems, policies, and procedures, reporting metrics, and monitoring internal controls. Self-initiated implantation of best business practices, originating process design, and recommendation of systemic process solutions is required. Since its establishment in 1968, Emser Tile has become the leading supplier of the world's finest tile and natural stone. Through our international production network and product development expertise, we offer myriad of possibilities that help retailers, contractors, homebuilders, commercial builders, architects & designers bring their ideas to life. Although Emser has grown rapidly, our on-going dedication to outstanding quality and service remains the hallmark of our success.  Emser is always seeking knowledgeable, career-minded professionals to become a part of our team and help drive our growth and expansion into new and existing markets. When it comes to challenging and rewarding career opportunities, Emser is the place to be!  As an Emser employee, you will enjoy healthcare coverage including medical, prescription drug, vision and dental care. Your financial well-being will be supported through our 401(k) plan. Moreover, we offer a challenging & rewarding professional work environment. Name: Analyst, CRE
Description: RealtyMogul launched in 2013 with one mission: simplify real estate investment by connecting real estate entrepreneurs and investors through cutting-edge technology. We have built a disruptive new business by creating a leading online, crowdfunding, capital markets platform within the traditional real estate industry. Today we are a leading online real estate capital marketplace, offering commercial equity and commercial debt products nationwide, educating our investors, and building a company that will change real estate investing and financing forever. Analyst, CRE We are looking for an intelligent, motivated, detail-oriented individual to work full-time in our West Los Angeles office. The ideal candidate will be a team player, good with numbers, and extremely detail oriented. Most importantly, they will have a strong desire to learn everything they can about real estate. What You'll Do:Pre-screening of potential real estate investments including the analysis of real estate companies, physical property characteristics, business plan, market fundamentals, deal structure, and financial metrics. You will be a key piece in helping the team identify strengths and weaknesses as well as the feasibility of potential transactionsMarket research & competitive property analysisFinancial modeling for a variety of property types including multifamily, office, industrial, mixed-use and retail properties. You will also learn how to analyze and model cash flows for various deal structures including joint-venture equity, debt, & subordinated transactions. You will also perform various scenario analysis to account for potential changes in a number of variables including tenant financial status and market conditionsAssist the underwriting team with collecting and reviewing due diligence materialsCompilation and presentation of investment committee deliverablesInteract with real estate companies including Sponsors, brokers, and third-party agenciesInteract with senior management on a daily basis and work with the management team on additional ad hoc projects as neededWho You Are:0-2+ years of experience in real estate. If no prior work experience, the ideal candidate has taken real estate courses and/or interned previously.Enthusiastic with a hunger and desire to learnSolid understanding of real estate investment concepts, structures, and financial analysisExperience with multiple product types (i.e. office, retail, industrial, multi-family, etc.) a plusProficient in ExcelExcellent communication and writing skillsExtreme attention to detail and highly reliableMust be fast paced, not easily shaken and work in a highly demanding environmentAbility to stay organized with a wide variety of tasksAbility to prioritize, multi-task and meet tight timelinesExcellent computer skills with MS Office including Word, Excel and PowerPointExperience with Argus is a plus

Name: Business Analyst II
Description: Our direct and current client is seeking an BA II to join their Product Management ERP Team. In this role you will be tasked with working with Business users to support the transactional daily business flow, assist with medium to complex system and process trouble-shooting. You may also get involved in such projects as operational process efficiency research, as well as supporting business critical functions such as ERP implementations to/from other ERP systems. Background in support for example the interaction between PO and AP as well as Customer Orders vs. Vendor Orders and knowing the difference between the functions is a key aspect of this role. Being able to spot anomalies in data or data source while researching is also a key attribute for this person. We are working directly with this client and hiring manager. Please forward resume in word format. Role is not open to 3rd parties. Salary plus potential bonus in the range of 5-8% Essential Functions: Requirements Elicitation - Ability to identify a desired future state that addresses a business problem.  Requirements Management and Analysis - Ability to define, document and manage business requirements to the smallest set that will provide the biggest impact in advancing business objectives.  Creating Compelling Business Case - Ability to measure and communicate proposed project benefits.  Providing Accurate Project Effort Estimates - Ability to quantify and meet individual and project phase level efforts.  Design for Usability - Ability to translate business requirements into business solutions for end-user adoption and productivity improvement.  Functional Design - Ability to translate business requirements to functional designs using analysis and design techniques.  Adherence to Standards - Ability to create solutions that adhere to and incorporate client standards.  Business Requirements Testing and Validation - Managing traceability of business requirements through testing and validation process.  User Acceptance Testing - Collaborates with stakeholder in testing for acceptance of end user business solution.  Business Relationship Management - Ability to engage business sponsors and contribute to their targeted business outcomes. Required and Preferred Qualifications: Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience in a related field required  5+ years of Business Systems Analysis experience required  5+ years ERP systems experience required  Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing, at all levels including customers, vendors, peers, business stakeholders and management required.  Proficiency with Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Office products required  Proficiency with some collaboration tools like SharePoint and Box  Capable of learning new systems and creating/implementing new system functionality  Possesses intermediate knowledge of HTML and XML  Understands intermediate Internet and client/server architectures  Possesses intermediate knowledge of SQL and databases  Must be self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team  Detail oriented with excellent interpersonal communication skills  Excellent customer service skills Other duties as requested including but not limited to: After-hours 2nd tier application support, operational Physical Inventory support, SME support for peripheral projects affecting supported companies For immediate consideration please submit your resume in Word format, along with daytime contact information. LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY PLEASE unless you are willing to relocate yourself at your own expense. Client is unable to provide H-1B Visa sponsorship at this time. All submittals will be treated confidentially. Selected candidate may be asked to pass a comprehensive background, credit and/or drug screening. Principals only, no third parties please.  Established in 2000, Atrilogy Solutions Group, Inc. provides organizations of all sizes with high-quality, cost effective information technology (IT) and business process consulting & staffing services. Our industry-leading service model combines experienced project managers with seasoned technical and functional consultants to eliminate client uncertainty and deliver superior value and results.  Clients turn to Atrilogy for expertise in: IT staffing and placement (Project Managers, Agile/Scrum Masters, Business Analysts, DBAs, Software Engineers, Mobile Developers (iOS, Android), DevOps, Automation, QA, Systems & Network Engineers, Cyber Security / Information Security Specialists)All major ERP & CRM packages (including Oracle, Workday, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, Lawson, SAP, Dynamics AX, Salesforce, Microsoft CRM, NetSuite)Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, and Big Data IntegrationCreative (Interactive Project Manager/Art Director, Information Architect, UI/UX Designer, Web/Graphic Design) Atrilogy has been recognized by Inc. magazine as one of the nations fastest-growing, privately-held companies. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Atrilogy also has offices in Denver, Phoenix, Atlanta, and Dallas with satellite offices in Boston, Jersey City, Las Vegas, Seattle, and Delhi, India. Name: Senior Business Strategy Analyst
Description: Req ID: 24881 Experience Level: Professional Other Location(s): Los Angeles (CA) Relocation offered: No Travel required: e. No Selection Come grow with us At Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.  Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous.  Capital Group Private Client Services (PCS), a division of Capital Bank and Trust Company (CB&T) manages over $20 billion for high-net-worth (HNW) individuals, trusts, foundations, and endowments nationwide. We provide highly personalized portfolio management, wealth advisory, and trust services to clients throughout the country. We typically work with individuals or families with at least $10 million in investable assets, and have strategic relationships with consulting firms or multi-family offices with over $100 million in assets.  Capital Group has embarked on a major strategic initiative to expand its presence in the $12+ trillion HNW market. As part of this, PCS has launched a growth plan to significantly grow the business and be more competitive in the marketplace. The Senior Business Strategy Analyst role will align with our business leaders to successfully deliver important strategic business results within PCS.  As a Senior Business Strategy Analyst, you will manage and deliver business analytics, insights, and guidance to support business decision making by working closely with business owners and stakeholders to identify and analyze key business trends, provide competitive intelligence, develop business cases and make recommendations. Responsibilities:Help to drive important strategic and tactical business initiatives, develop structure around business intelligence for PCS, which includes working with other business areas to expand the metrics, competitive analytics, and general reporting to facilitate and inform decision making.Provide project management support and drive process changes for initiatives of varying size and scope (including significant involvement in the PCS Growth Plan initiatives), often with significant complexity and ambiguity.Maintain relationships with business stakeholders to understand information needs and goals, and support the definition and implementation of KPIs and metrics.Collect and leverage data from appropriate sources and to solve strategic, tactical, structured, and unstructured business problems.Provide competitive intelligence including but not limited to: profiling competitive landscape, developing insights, and identifying best practices, and establishing routine updates providing in depth analysis of key trends, competitors and relevant topics.Develop and implement strategies and solutions by understanding the long term goals and objectives of the organization and develop strategies and business capabilities to achieve these goals, developing solutions to complex business issues through the exploration, design, development, and delivery of creative solutions, proactively identifying opportunities for improvement based on overall business needs and strategic direction; driving process to make changes, and facilitating the creation of well-defined business cases and provides recommendations to senior management to assist in making informed decisions on business strategy, gaps or improvement opportunities.Provide information on business strategies, processes and system functionality. Serves as a knowledge resource to the business and technology areas.Produce business updates and initiative summaries for PCS management that are also used more broadly with various Capital Group committees.Identify industry best practices and introduces them to the department.Qualifications:4+ years of experience in financial services, ideally wealth or asset management.Knowledge of wealth management and/or trust business, ideally in the high-net-worth space (private bank, RIA, trust company, etc.) preferred.Strong analytical skills with an ability to leverage analytics to drive significant business impact.Proficient with data analysis tools (Microsoft Excel) for data manipulation, analysis and summarizing results in digestible formats. Knowledge & experience with additional business intelligence and data visualization tools a plus.Experience obtaining competitive insights.Aptitude for problem solving; displays initiative to identify issues and recommend solutions.Ability to translate the goals and objectives of the organization into an actionable business strategy that addresses both immediate and long term needs.Sound judgment, intellectual curiosity and analytical skills in areas of high complexity.High level of quantitative skills and business acumen.Highly effective written and oral communication skills with a diverse group of associates and senior business leaders.Effectiveness in leading/facilitating with senior business leaders on broad/controversial topics inside and outside the organization.4 year degree required, advanced degree (MBA or other) a plus.Company Overview: Founded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.39 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers. We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Name: Temp Business Analyst
Description: Client in Los Angeles has an immediate need for a Temp Business Analyst /Senior Analyst.  Temp Business Analyst responsibilities will include, but not be limited to, the following: Create Business Requirements Documents (BRD), Functional Specifications Documents (FSD), Nonfunctional Requirement Documents and Use Cases Specifications;Interpret, analyze and document business requirements with the appropriate business leaders/stakeholders and work with developers and team leads to translate user needs into functional specifications;Participate in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) by creating epics and user stories using Atlassian tools;In conjunction with Quality Assurance, develop and direct software system testing and validation procedures, review and approve test scripts, user and quality assurance acceptance testing;Review and approve test scripts, project expected results and verify functional integrity of the system design;Participate in the identification and resolution of complex production support issues, detecting root issues and identifying requirements gaps;Serve as a training resource for junior analysts and assisting management in ensuring quality team work product.Work overtime as required, in particular at month end and year end; andHandle additional related projects as assigned. Qualifications: BA degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalent field;At least 7 years’ of business experience as a Business Analyst (legal industry preferred);Advanced knowledge of technologies including business process tools such as MS Project, Excel, Access and Visio;Advanced knowledge of Atlassian tools such as Confluence, Jira, Portfolio and Service Desk;Advanced abilities in analysis and problem solving, as well as multi-tasking;Strong analytical skills with Microsoft and Atlassian applications required;Strong verbal and written skills required; andAbility to handle fast paced environment.

Name: CSC Business Analyst III
Description: CSC Business Analyst III Job Category:  Administrative, HR, Business Professionals Department:  Office of CSC Excellence Location:Los Angeles, CA, US, 90017#job-location.job-location-inline {  display: inline;  } Position Type:  Full Time Requisition ID:  2641Established in 1997, L.A. Care Health Plan is an independent public agency created by the state of California to provide health coverage to low-income Los Angeles County residents. We are the nation’s largest publicly operated health plan. Serving more than 2 million members in five health plans, we make sure our members get the right care at the right place at the right time.  Mission: L.A. Care’s mission is to provide access to quality health care for Los Angeles County's vulnerable and low-income communities and residents and to support the safety net required to achieve that purpose.Job Summary  The Business Analyst III facilitates business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of functional business specifications. This position manages the requirements development process through the elicitation, analysis, specification and verification of multiple levels of requirements from an end-to-end perspective and supports the ongoing management of the requirements. This position will develop report and analysis for the department. It is responsible in communicating and coordinating with IT on a day-to-day department related efforts. The Business Analyst III will manage and coordinate the implementation and/or integration of products or new features for clients including client training and provides subject matter expertise (SME) and support of the department's inbound and outbound functions. This position will act as mentor to Business Analysts I/ II.  Duties Develop functional and user acceptance test plans and scenarios. Coordinate functional and user acceptance testing by executing the testing strategy, scheduling resources and tracking test performance. Perform data analysis to support evaluation of system defects or to develop requirements for new functionality; assist in various system trouble shooting and balancing and correction efforts including analysis, verification and validation of issues and fixes. Coordinate activities including on-time delivery, testing and production moves.Collaborate with IT on all department related efforts, including submission of Service Requests and writing BRD's. Coordinate related data requests from internal departments, and/or assist IT with definition of criteria. Delegate data and reporting requests to business analysts. Facilitate collaborative system and data design sessions with the user community, technical architecture resources and development resources. Preparation of status updates to enterprise for distribution and communication.Work as a technical support and liaison to designated IT personnel to provide testing, support and feedback on enhancement requests and regular updates/releases; adhere to release schedules. Provide analytical support for critical corporate initiatives including business function support for system migrations and consolidations, significant business area process improvement projects and complex product installations.Demonstrate a high level of subject matter expertise in functional area to bridge business requirements and IT solutions; provide technical direction and ensure compliance with best practice solutions. Practice knowledge transfer and foster change management as the organization changes and new skills are required, focusing on team/individual development to be a valued contributor.Participate and contribute on the development/ creation of data models and interface design specifications. Support internal/ external stakeholder's roadmap and audits as needed.Oversee the business process support across multiple client engagements. Communication with internal/ external stakeholders for department's submission requirements. Review submission of data against established benchmarks and coordinate correction and improvement efforts. Monitor timely and accurate outbound data submission to state and federal recipients.Perform other duties as assigned. Education  High School Diploma/GED  Associate's Degree or Bachelor's Degree  Experience Required:With High School Diploma: Proven analytical/technical aptitude evidenced by 10 years of successful experience in a quantitative role as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Programming Analyst, Claims processing, encounter processing.Preferred:With Associate's Degree: Proven analytical/technical aptitude evidenced by at least 7 years of successful experience in a quantitative role as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Programming Analyst, Claims processing, encounter processing.With Bachelor's Degree: Proven analytical/technical aptitude evidenced by at least 5 years of successful experience in a quantitative role as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Programming Analyst, Claims processing, encounter processing.With Master's Degree: Proven analytical/technical aptitude evidenced by 3 years of successful experience in a quantitative role as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Programming Analyst, Claims processing, encounter processing. Professional Licenses  Professional Certifications  Required Training  Additional InformationL.A. Care offers a wide range of benefits includingPaid Time Off (PTO)Tuition ReimbursementRetirement PlansMedical, Dental and VisionWellness ProgramVolunteer Time Off (VTO)Nearest Major Market: Los Angeles Job Segment: Business Analyst, Medical, Claims, Finance, Healthcare, Insurance

Name: Senior Business Technology Analyst
Description: ZS is the world’s largest consulting firm focused exclusively on improving business performance through sales and marketing consulting solutions, from customer insights and strategy to analytics, operations and technology. Together, we design and implement strategies that lead to greater market share, more competitive operations and increased use of today’s latest technologies. From our worldwide offices, ZS professionals draw on deep industry and domain expertise to deliver impact where it matters for clients. We are particularly known for our expertise in the pharmaceutical and health care sectors, yet work across a range of industries. ZS's Business Technology group helps companies define and execute their technology strategy by designing, building and operating the business intelligence (BI), cloud, data management, dashboard and analytics capabilities that are at the core of sales and marketing operations. The Solution Delivery team implements technology based solutions in the areas of business intelligence, analytics, information management, reporting and mobility. In addition, this team configures ZS' proprietary software used to streamline business processes for commercial groups at client organizations. This team takes overall ownership of the delivery of the technical solution leading the design and development phases and collaborating with other teams for business requirements and system testing. SENIOR BUSINESS TECHNOLOGY ANALYSTResponsibilities:Partner with solution delivery lead to build comprehensive implementation project plans with well-defined tasks and owners;Implement design and development phases innovative big data solutions to solve business problems across multiple client engagements;Leverage information from requirements-gathering phase and utilize past experience to design a flexible and scalable solution;Coordinate on-shore/off-shore teams;Collaborate with other team members (involved in the requirements gathering, testing, roll-out and operations phases) to ensure seamless transitions;Articulate the advantages or disadvantages of various big data technologies across a variety of client use cases.Qualifications:A bachelor’s/master’s degree in Computer Science or related field from a top university; MBA is desirable;4-6 years of professional experience in IT, IT services or consulting work;1-2 years of experience in the development of open source big data platforms, including: Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Pig, Spark, Sqoop, Flume, Kafka;Programming experience in SQL, Java, Python, R, Scala;Experience developing 2-3 end-to-end big data/cloud based solutions across multiple technologies;Proven ability to lead both on-shore and off-shore teams in the development of big data solutions;Deep expertise in the principals and architecture of various technologies within the big data stack is required;Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in interpersonal and written formats;Familiarity with agile development and DevOps best practices preferred.Additional skills:Strong leadership, verbal and written communication skills with ability to articulate results and issues to internal and client teamsProven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environmentAbility to work within a virtual global team environment and contribute to the overall timely delivery of multiple projectsKnowledge of current issues, practices, methodologies, and trends in the Business Intelligence domainWillingness to travel to other global offices as needed to work with client or other internal project teams ZS is a global consulting firm; fluency in English is required, additional fluency in at least one European or Asian language is desirable.  Candidates must possess work authorization for their intended country of employment. An on-line application, including a cover letter expressing interest and a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered.  ZS offers a competitive compensation package with salary and bonus incentives, complete medical/dental/life insurance programs and retirement savings benefits. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.Connect with ZS on social media:Like ZS Careers on FacebookFollow ZS Careers on Twitter and InstagramFollow ZS on LinkedIn for more job opportunitiesSubscribe to the ZS YouTube channelExplore the Life at ZS blog ZS has been recognized globally for its expertise in consulting and its flexible work environment. View ZS’s accolades.
