Name: IT Business Analyst
Company: Motion Picture Industry Pension & Health Plans
Description: Job Description:IT Business AnalystThe Position The position of Business Analyst reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Documents requirements, defines scope and objectives, and formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. For consideration, qualified candidates only, submit letter of interest with resume and salary requirements. Local Los Angeles candidates only. Relocation Assistance is not provided for this role. MPI does not file visa petitions or sponsor applicants for work visas in this job classification.The Ideal CandidateThe ideal candidate will have the following skills, abilities and experiences, which includes but is not limited to:3-5+ years of experience eliciting, documenting and maintaining business requirementsExperience in Health Insurance Claims processing (i.e. QNXT)Experience developing and maintaining User Cases, Requirements Traceability Matrix, & User StoriesExcellent understanding of SDLC processes and requirementsExcellent communications (verbal and written), problem solving and analytical skillsExperience identifying testing scenarios and documenting test cases, executing tests, and leading UATExperience with business process improvement techniquesExperience developing business and system context diagramsResponsibilitiesThe primary job responsibilities of this role are to document business and technical requirements for maintenance, new or changing applications. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:· Works directly with the business to provide technical expertise, and produce specifications for any new or changed technology applications· Identifies, assesses, and documents business and technical requirements, recommending business priorities and advising business on options, risks and costs versus benefits of various solutions· Runs and manages requirements gathering sessions; obtains appropriate IT and business signoff· Conducts research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible· Accountable for the delivery of business and technical requirements documentation· Works closely with Application Designers and Developers to ensure understanding of requirements that will be used for creating application architecture and design specifications· Communicates technical integration decisions, issues and plans with project team· Develop use cases, flow charts, functional diagrams and descriptions to communicate application design specifications· Work with the development team to ensure that specifications are understood· Assists QA team to ensure that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans· Creates and manages traceability matrix and ensure that the proper testing plans have been completed and can be mapped back to requirements· Participates in test results meetings and executes traceability activities to determine cause of bugs, system errors and failures during testing· Assists with the documentation, coordination, and organization of production readiness· Supports projects through all production and post production milestones (as needed)Qualifications· Bachelors or Master’s degree in one of the following subject areas: Business Administration, Information Systems/Technology or related field preferred; or four to six years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.· 5+ years of experience eliciting, documenting and maintaining business requirements· Experience developing and maintaining User Cases, Requirements Traceability Matrix, & User Stories· Excellent communication skills, including the ability to write concise and accurate technical documentation, to communicate technical· Experience with SDLC MethodologiesSubmissions will be reviewed; only candidates most closely matching the requirements of the position will be contacted. About MPILocated in Studio City, CA, the Motion Picture Industry Pension and Health Plans (MPI) are multi-employer trust funds established by collective bargaining agreements between various employers and over 40 Unions and Guilds representing employees in the motion picture industry. Recognized as an Employer of Choice for its employee-focused work environment, competitive compensation and benefits, MPI is a recipient of the World at Work Seal of Distinction. MPI offers free employee health, dental, vision and life insurance ($50/month for family coverage), retirement and pension, and generous paid time off.Visit us atwww.mpiphp.orgEqual Opportunity Employer

Name: IT Business Systems Analyst
Description: Your passion for technology, exceptional critical-thinking skills and ability to creatively think-on-your feet will fit perfectly in our IT Business Systems Analyst position at AssetMark. This is an ideal time to join our organization and you will be a key player as you analyze, design and QA on our internal systems. We are in an exciting phase and you will enjoy working on a wide array of projects and will be recognized and rewarded for delivering world-class, excellent results. Fully utilize your creative talents and true desire to enhance clients' business needs; take the next step and apply today!  As an IT Business Systems Analyst, based in Encino, CA you will participate in the full project lifecycle from conception through post-deployment. In this IT Business Systems Analyst role, you'll present information regarding proposed solutions as you detail business and functional requirements, assess project progress and monitor the effectiveness of deployed initiatives. Key to this role is expertise in process mapping, process engineering and process modeling. Your high energy and natural sense for creativity will lend itself well to tackling any variety of issue and position you to be an expert at recommending streamlined process that implement increased efficiency in these processes. Additionally, your ability to be adaptive in an environment of changing priorities will give you a head start to success in this position.  You’ll also use your highly organized abilities in conducting customer and process analysis to develop plans, requirements, and solutions. Your demonstrated success eliciting business requirements using appropriate tools and techniques including, but not limited to, interviews, document analysis, surveys, site visits, use cases, scenarios, business process, task, and workflow analysis will all be key. Being able to write business requirement documents and functional requirements are a must as well. We are seeking those individuals who want to help us grow as well as enhance their own professional growth along the way. If you’re ready for the next step in your career, join us today! ResponsibilitiesActs as the liaison between IT and business stakeholders during analysis, requirements definition and design activities for new solutions and/or integration projectsCollaborates with business stakeholders to facilitate and document business requirements, use cases and functional specifications. Provides strategic advice for business processes and solutions.Gains a holistic understanding of a broad range of business processes and related systems.Interacts with and directs technical partners to develop solution alternatives.Has a good understanding of technical terminologies around UI, API and DatabasesCommunicate effectively both orally and in writing to management, team members, and business partners.Analyze and solve complex business problems and determine suitable IT solutions.Apply broad business knowledge and practical experience to the analysis / solution generation processEstablish and maintain productive working relationships with departmental staff, and internal business partners.Generate use cases and participate in user acceptance testing.Communicate complex information clearly and concisely both orally and in writing to technical and non-technical audiences.Qualifications5+ years’ experience working as a Business Systems Analyst on small to medium sized projectsExceptional written / oral communication and interpersonal skillsDegree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Finance related field.Proven experience creating business functional requirement documents and other BSA artifactsAble to mine and analyze large amounts of data; strong analysis and problem solving skills.Must be highly detail oriented, meticulous, and self-directed.Proficient in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, and Outlook).Experience in the wealth management or financial services industry a plus.Experience with Microsoft Access a plus AssetMark, Inc. is a leading strategic provider of groundbreaking investment and consulting solutions created to serve independent financial advisors and help them create great outcomes for their clients. Through a consistent program of engagement, education and community-building, AssetMark brings like-minded advisors together to share their ideas, experiences and solutions. This collaboration guides our development of investment, client relationship and practice management tools that advisors can tap to help clients achieve their investment objectives and life goals.  We are always seeking bright, creative, energetic individuals who want to learn and grow with the company. AssetMark is an innovative organization, delivering the best services in the industry. We offer a rewarding work environment, competitive salaries, full benefits, and excellent opportunities for career growth. We are headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area. We also have regional offices in Chicago, IL, Phoenix, AZ, Encino, CA, and State College, PA. Become a part of our growing team today!

Name: Product Data Analyst
Description: About us: A Santa Monica-based tech company, EZ Texting's voice and text marketing platform is revolutionizing how businesses communicate. We are passionate dreamers who believe that technology can make a meaningful difference to any organization's success. Located in the heart of Santa Monica, we've created a unique work-space that the Los Angeles Business Journal has named one of the Top 100 places to work in LA - for the last four years running. Come find out why.  EZ Texting is looking for a talented and passionate Product Data Analyst to join our Business Intelligence Team.  The Analyst will be responsible for providing multiple types of analyses in support of product development activity. The Analyst will focus on user behavior and partner with the Product Team, UI Designers and Data Scientists/Engineers to analyze our users (behavioral, quantitative, qualitative, demographics, use case, etc.) to measure results, identify problems, surface opportunities, provide insights, inform decisions and support recommendations. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, highly versatile work environment that values team-based product development to solve business problems and scale for growth. Required Skills:Analyze data to drive product decisions (creation, measurement and analysis of product KPIs)Create KPIs & dashboards to measure performance and efficacy of existing product features and effectiveness of changesAnalyze A/B tests and test user hypothesis (including statistical significance)Attention to detail with ability to manage multiple tasks/priorities while working in a fast-paced environment with limited supervisionHighly proficient with SQL, advanced Excel and analytical skills requiredQuantitative analysis and critical thinking skillsExcellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills (with a focus on quality)Experience with A/B testing tools is a plus (Google Analytics, VWO, Fullstory, Pendo)Qualifications:BS/MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or related field from an accredited college or university, or the equivalent combination of education and experienceMinimum of 3 years of relevant Data Analysis or Product experienceKnowledge of Google Analytics and A/B testing frameworksExperience with Pendo & Domo is a plusExperience working in an Agile environmentBenefits:Fully paid medical (medical, dental, vision) benefits, 50% for families401 (k) planUnlimited sick leaveStock optionsPaid vacationDog friendly officeGeneral awesomeness

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job Description JOB DESCRIPTION The Amazon Studios team is shaping the future of digital video entertainment. The Amazon Studios finance team is seeking an experienced Financial Analyst to drive improvements that span across financial planning & analysis, analytics, and evaluating new business development opportunities. This position involves many ad hoc projects, and therefore a successful candidate will have the ability to tackle multiple projects and efficiently execute deliverables. The right individual will have exceptional finance skills and strong understanding of Finance & Accounting principles, solid analytical skills, and firm business judgment capable of driving an organization to the right results.  He or she will have operated successfully in a fast-paced, global, results-oriented environment and have the ability to influence the decisions of senior business leaders through effective verbal and written communication, logical reasoning, and the presentation of analyses. The successful candidate must be able to think and act both strategically and tactically. Strong oral and written communication skills are crucial, as well as ability to think clearly, analyze quantitatively, problem-solve, and prioritize.  The team needs a self-starter, who is able to work autonomously and drive cross-functional projects involving teams such as FP&A, Content Production & Operations, Marketing, Research/Analytics, Accounting, and Business Development. The candidate will need to able to collaborate with business partners both domestically as well as abroad and must display strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level executives. This position will be based in Culver City, CA. Key responsibilities include:  - Creating complex financial models to analyze the performance of Amazon Original movies. This will require developing robust analytical frameworks and also the ability to effectively collaborate with various teams throughout the organization to gather inputs and build reporting processes. - Partnering with Digital Video finance, Original movies business teams, and accounting team members across the globe to construct and implement improvements relating to the financial forecasting/planning process.  -Work on monthly FP&A duties including forecasts, month-end close, annual budgets - Create new tools/systems/dashboards that enable teams throughout Digital Video to analyze the various costs and value-drivers for Amazon Original movies. - Working closely with business and finance partners to support and influence new and existing content strategies.Basic Qualifications REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS - BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business and/or similar field -4-7 years of industry experience of increasing responsibility in finance-Previous FP&A experience  Preferred Qualifications PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS - Prior experience in media and entertainment is a plus - Experience working on the launch of a new business - Proficiency in Cognos TM1, SQL, Oracle, and database management - Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally, manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously, and drive projects to completion - Strong Excel skills. Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, and Cognos TM1 are a plus.- Ability to build and manage complex financial models for business forecasting and analysis- Experience working with large data and developing scalable solutions for financial reporting and forecasting.- Excellent written and verbal communication/presentation skills. Highly detail-oriented.- Must be able to work independently, be a self-starter and be prepared to have a hands on approach.Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual OrientationApply Now at Amazon

Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: Summary of Essential Job Duties:Reporting to the VP, Business Development, the Business Development Analyst position is responsible for collecting, analyzing, testing and providing data and information to the department of Business Development. In addition, this position will (as needed) support the data and information needs for Marketing and Strategic Planning.  General responsibilities include capturing and analyzing data pertaining to the operational, financial and clinical aspects of the CSMC and CSMDN. This position will also develop information from external data sources pertaining to conditions and trends in the local, regional and national Healthcare MarketplacePrimary Job Responsibilities:Internal Data Analyses: 1) Work with Business Development team members and operations staffs across the Health System to define information required for strategic and operational decision making; 2) Develop data from internal hospital systems to respond to key business decisions regarding the size, scope and potential risks and/or opportunities associated with new ventures; 3) Work with Finance and Resource Management staffs to develop information from hospital systems which analyze clinical and financial trends; 4) Work with operations staff across the entire Health System to define the data required to address issues pertaining to the operation of existing programs and services.External Data Analyses: 1) Identify external data sources which can be used to evaluate market conditions; 2) Develop and analyze data sets which are used to project market demand and opportunity to develop new or expand existing services throughout the Health System; 3) Develop maps, graphs, and other materials which can be used to examine, evaluate and describe information which has been prepared; 4) Monitor global trends in technology, new legislation, and reimbursement which can impact the management and/or future development of existing and/or new programs, services and general hospital operations.System Development – Information Development: 1) Develop new databases to support the activities of Business Development, Marketing and Strategic Planning; In particular, market planning data bases incorporating state and other incident rate data. 2) Design and implement standard reports for senior management which describe and analyze key financial and operations trends; 3) Assist in the design and implementation of an information strategic plan to support the activities of Business Development 4) Assist Business Development FDirector and consultants with the development of spreadsheets, relational databases (using MS Access) and Power Point presentations designed to analyze information which has been developed.· BA degree required with preference for an MBA, MPH. Some coursework in Health Services Management, Marketing, Finance, Accounting and Business Strategy is required;· Previous Health Care managerial background and experience in a clinical setting is strongly desired;· Extensive knowledge and skill of PC/Macintosh applications. The individual should be an expert user of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access), Visio, and other relational databases.· Strong research skills including conducting research using Internet and other online library services;· High-level communications skills are critical along with team work ability;· Experience working with complex data systems;Ability to think through challenging analytical problems and ask hard questions.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: ScopeThe Business Analyst /CRM Administrator will be responsible for supporting tactical day-to-day administration and operation of the Salesforce.com platform and related processes and workflow. The successful candidate will work with the user community on an ongoing basis to improve and enhance the CRM platform to support the investment banking business globally. The analyst will be part of an initial implementation effort as well as post go-live support and future enhancement phases of the CRM system and platform. The analyst needs to have firm grasp of CRM best practices to drive and foster greater CRM adoption and to improve internal customer experience on an ongoing basis.Responsibilities:Perform system administrator function of the Salesforce.com CRM application. Responsible for maintaining functional areas of contacts / relationship, accounts, opportunities, dashboards and reports. Create and execute queries and reports, maintain user roles, security and profiles.Work in a cross-functional environment with various business groups, IT and end users to identify, document, and communicate business processes.Maintain and enhance visual layout, workflow rules and business logic layer to streamline and enhance business processes and improve user experience. Implement and integrate third-party products / applications on the force.com platform.Work with IT and Salesforce.com and other 3rd party vendors to maintain smooth operation and performance of the platform.Coordinate and lead user acceptance tests with the business units and end users against business requirements.Maintain key system metrics to track trends in usage / adoption and data integrity. Train end users, prepare related documentation (requirements, training materials, process and data flows, use cases, functional design, etc), participate in cross-functional teams, communicate key messages or address critical questions from the user base involving the CRM.Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in business or information systems preferred2-5 years of business analysis and/or data analysis experience required2+ years of strong operational experience with SalesForce.com requiredExcellent verbal and written communication skills requiredExcellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work in a cross-functional team environment requiredStrong customer focus, ability to probe customer needs and translate customer requirements into system specifications requiredStrong business acumen, superb knowledge of business processes and CRM best practice requiredSalesforce.com administrator certification a strong plusPlease submit cover letter along with resume.Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V

Name: Sr. AEM Business Analyst
Description: As a Sr. AEM Business Analyst, candidate will work with a multidisciplinary team to implement Cedars-Sinai’s vision of a patient-centric digital platform. Candidate will work closely with web and mobile developers, product and content managers to show case Cedars-Sinai programs and services. Candidate will facilitate the requirements and development of Adobe Experience Manager web solutions. This position is ideal for a collaborative and creative individual who facilitates the design of web solutions. The Business Analyst is an integral part of the IT team and acts as a bridge between the Digital Strategy and the Software Development team.Job Responsibilities• Provides leadership and promotes effective collaboration and teamwork among individuals from multiple disciplines, and across the organization.• Conducts user groups, advisory committees and/or feedback sessions with appropriate participants to generate useful input and ongoing support as needed. Interdisciplinary participation will be sought at appropriate phases of development and implementation. • Coordinates and participates in system/UAT testing in conjunction with involved parties. • Helps deliver presentations to customers and management teams.• Translate client’s business needs into detailed business requirements documents, use cases and systems interaction diagrams.• Works with customers to establish approved wireframes and mock-ups for solutions.• Coordinates communications and collaborates with the functional department stake holders to establish project timelines and implementation milestones to achieve maximum utilization of available systems. Demonstrates ability to follow up to implement, coordinate and complete these responsibilities accurately within established time frame.• Provides leadership throughout the lifecycles of a project, guiding the understanding the project team has through design and development to ensure project requirements are met• Helps establish project test strategy, methodologies, test plans as well as assist with test execution.• Instills team commitment to company delivery methodologies and practices.• Documents and assists with change management process for technical and functional changes to systems/software/applications.Educational Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent work experienceLicense/Certification/Registration Requirements:AEM 6 Business Practitioner Certification (If no certification, then 3 - 5 AEM projects and a deep understanding of AEM 6.x).Experience:• Ability to conceptualize a solution from inception to implementation• Minimum of 5 years of experience facilitating functional requirements and Business Process Re-Design (BPR) or equivalent as an IT systems analyst, or operational end-user in a large and complex environment, preferably in healthcare.• Experience as a Business Analyst on at least 2 major AEM projects• Experience in product development, product lifecycle management, functional and process analysis• Experience with Test Driven Development• Experience with the creation and maintenance of detailed requirement and specification documentation.• Experience with a blend of software development methods (i.e. Waterfall, Agile, XP, RUP, etc.)• Facilitate customer meetings, resolving requirements issues, and gaining buy-in for solutions• Ability to identify critical issues within product specifications, design, and development and establish resolutions quickly and efficientlyPhysical Demands:Nothing extraordinary

Name: Product Analyst - Software
Description: Vista Entertainment Solutions – Los Angeles  Vista Entertainment Solutions is a global leader in film industry software solutions. We are one of the leading producers of software for the cinema market worldwide. Vista software is used to operate cinemas in over 65 countries around the world including the USA, Canada, Mexico, UK, India, China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Australia, New Zealand and many more.  Vista’s Los Angeles office is responsible for implementation projects, sales, customer support, and development for Vista’s client base in North America.  For more information about Vista please visit our web site, www.vista.co  Summary  Reporting to the Vice President of Product, the Product Analyst position is an exciting opportunity to join and contribute to the development of new features of the US customer base of Vista. The ideal candidate is someone who has demonstrated experience translating customer requests into business solutions in the software and / or technology space. ResponsibilitiesAs part of an Agile team, drive new product feature development from start to finish - with help along the way!Participate and contribute in the scrum, sprint review, backlog grooming, sprint planning, and other team meetingsPerform requirements gathering with existing and prospective clients to understand the essential and ideal needs for new product functionalityDocument requirements in a clear and concise manner, adjusting the communication to cater to the intended audienceWork with the Product Directors and other Product Analysts to analyze the requirements and translate them into elegant software solutions that meet (and often exceed!) the requirementsGenerate early mockups and consult with Product Directors and Developers for technical impacts and considerationsCommunicate the requirements and the final solution designs, generally via PowerPoint storyboard, to the Product Directors for approval, to the customers to ensure accuracy, and to the Developers (and in some cases the Test Analysts)Produce cost estimates for design and development for customer approval prior to completing workPerform thorough reviews of the new functionality to ensure that it was completed as expected (may also include writing reusable test cases)Provide powerful analytical thought and leadershipRequirementsRequirements1-2 years of Product Analyst / Product Manager / Solutions AnalystDetail oriented a mustEffective communication skills a mustExperience in the cinema exhibition, distribution, or related industries highly beneficialExperience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) – required, Microsoft Team Foundation Server – highly beneficial, Microsoft SQL Server and Azure a plusBenefitsPerks Gorgeous lunch room with epic view of West Hollywood  Vibrant office culture with organized social outings and activities (winter ski trip, Palm Springs summer retreat etc.)  Work with the best in the business – we are very careful with who we hire, and have assembled an extraordinary team of bright, hardworking and friendly people  Our benefits package is above and beyond the standard offering: medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with company match, pet insurance, generous paid time off

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: How To Apply: Click "Apply for this Job" below to submit your application. After doing so, please take our 4-minute web analytics assessment followed by a 15-minute aptitude test by clicking the following link: Start AssessmentThe Role: As a Business Intelligence Associate, you will create tangible value by helping to implement, test, and report on web analytics and marking performance trends for current and future clients. The work you do directly contributes to our ability to measure and improve marketing strategies and initiatives to meet and exceed client expectations.  You will have the opportunity to work on leading-edge digital measurement and predictive capabilities, with opportunities to work on marketing forecasting, data-driven attribution, propensity modeling, and much more. The position requires fostering close working relationships with internal marketing teams as well as clients. Must be self-motivated and able to take the initiative to get the job doneDigital Marketing experience is preferred but definitely not requiredWhat Youll Get:Competitive compensation and comprehensive health benefitsFast tracked growth with quarterly reviewsLearning & Development opportunitiesTeam Building, Wellness, and Community Engagement activitiesFlexible work schedule and supportive maternity policyUnlimited snacks, catered lunches, happy hours & other celebrationsAccess to OneMedical, Health Advocate, Gym Membership Subsidies, and More!Who We Are: Named one of Crain's 100 Best Places to Work, Direct Agents is a data-driven digital marketing agency with offices in NY and LA.  Our award-winning cross-channel customer acquisition solutions allow us to help build and transform brands with Media, Strategy, Analytics and Creative.  Our teams are made up of experts who are passionate, collaborative and entrepreneurial, fostering a culture of innovation, learning and fast-paced growth. Who We Work With: Some of the brands we work with include Time Inc, NBC Universal, Sony, BBC, IMG, Rolling Stone and more.

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: We are currently seeking an IT Business Analyst to join our Business Strategy and Applications department. The IT Business Analyst will work with Senior Business Analysts to support the existing production Kuali Financial and Research Administration systems. The successful candidate will be responsible for determining IT Business requirements for a variety of special system processes and applications, documenting and updating systems specifications, and serving as a liaison between the customer community and the software development team to implement technology solutions. The IT Business Analyst position would be on a career path to grow and become a senior member of our team and subject matter expert on modules/feature sets of our systems.  The ideal candidate should possess academic or working experience in some of the following areas: Accounting, Finance, Business, or Information Systems. Responsibilities include being able to facilitate meetings with the implementation teams to define solutions and create, analyze and validate detailed functional specifications. Excellent verbal and communication skills are required. Experience with Higher Education Administration, Kuali, Workday Financials, or an accounting background is preferred.  Information Technology Services (ITS) is committed to providing information technology (IT) services and support to the university. ITS provides essential, university-wide services such as: Enterprise information systemsUniversity wired and wireless networksEducational TechnologyResearch ComputingIT SecurityAcademic Software IntegrationsQualifications:Must have completed at least 4 years of college educationMust be able to collaborate or work independently as necessaryMust possess excellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to coordinate multiple assignments and adjust to changing priorities in a fast paced environment.Demonstrated strong personal mastery, including ethics, interpersonal skills, and engage in continuous learning.Job Accountabilities:Serves as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development or business process re-engineering team through which requirements flowMeets with customer groups to determine IT business requirements.Elicits requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.Provides information to developers and subject matter experts for the establishment of the technical vision and performance needs.Develops requirements specifications according to standard templates.Participates in project meetings to review project deliverables and timelines.Works with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of project.Participates in testing developed software or new process flow.Performs other duties as assigned or requested. Competent to work on moderately complex programming activities under supervision of senior IT Business Analyst. USC is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law or USC policy.USC will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of theLos Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring ordinance. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: ResponsibilitiesThe Finance organization at Oaktree is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to manage the Workday platform for Corporate Accounting, Corporate Finance and Accounts Payable. This role is expected to evolve from an initial position within the project team tasked with implementing Workday Expenses and Procurement to an administrator role focused on maximizing the use of the Workday platform within Oaktree.  Responsibilities include: Playing a key role in the implementation of Workday alongside our consulting partners which include, leading discovery sessions, data validation and creating customized and detailed test scripts;Working with internal business leaders to understand current processes; ensuring that the new system will address pain points, maximize efficiency and fully utilize Workday platform capabilities;Using expertise and prior knowledge to recommend best practice resolutions for the organization’s needs;Finding alternative solutions for challenges unique to Oaktree where necessary, using resources such as Workday Community;Coordinating with the HR team to minimize impacts to Workday processes and security settings;Partnering with IT and implementation partners to build or modify integrations to internal systems;Being a subject matter expert and point of contact for both internal and external partners;Ensuring data integrity;Developing and generating analytics for business users;Providing customer service, instruction, and support to system users;Managing the semiannual Workday update cycle for the Finance organizationWorking with the project team & IT to assure smooth transition to production support. Qualifications3-5 years of Business Analyst experienceExperience implementing a large scale projectKnowledge of Workday Financials preferred, but not requiredDemonstrated skills in understanding and adhering to policies, procedures and operating controls to ensure consistency and timeliness of execution;Proven ability to manage tasks with competing priorities and deadlines, independently determining order of priority and self-initiating other value-added tasks;Knowledge of Project Management tools, tactics, and methodologies a plus.Asset Management/Financial Services experience a plusExperience with MS Office tools XLS, Project, Access, PPT, and Visio required Personal AttributesThe successful candidate should demonstrate strengths in: Relationship Building; works effectively with strong, diverse teams of people with multiple perspectives, talents, and backgrounds. He or she is known for doing what is best irrespective of politics and is comfortable with consensus building (at multiple levels) and soliciting constructive feedback; ability to elicit cooperation from a wide variety of participants including upper management, other departments, and 3rd party service providers.Communication; strong interpersonal and verbal/written communication skills; ability to present complex material.Independence & Collaboration; experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment; must be able to drive work effectively with limited supervision (at times) while representing department and executive management interests and concerns.Work Ethic; focus on continual development, performance, accountability and self-motivation.Flexibility & Organization; adapt to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities; proven ability to multi-task and efficiently manage time across competing activities/resources; able to effectively prioritize, execute tasks, and thrive in a high-pressure fast paced environment.Intellectual Curiosity; energized by learning new things and engaging across a wide range of issues; must have strong problem solving skills; adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products.Driving Results; sets aggressive timelines and objectives to drive results, conveys a sense of urgency, and drives issues to closure; is a self-starter committed to achieving results and has a strong sense of ownership and follow-through.Judgment; makes recommendations and decisions that balance a variety of factors (e.g. cost, risk, short-term vs. long-term impact) and are supported by a sound fact base to achieve an optimal outcome. Goes back to core values and key objectives when making decisions/recommendations. EducationA Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or Technology is preferred.

Name: Business Systems Analyst II
Company: Superior Court of California County of Los Angeles
Description: Position Description Updated to include closing datePOSITION TITLE: BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST II SALARY: $5,629.55 - $6,993.82 Monthly OPENING DATE: 10/30/2018 CLOSING DATE: 11/28/2018 at 5:00 pm (PST) EXAM NUMBER: R9868C TYPE OF RECRUITMENT: Open Competitive Job Opportunity  This position may close at any time based on the needs of the Court.  Applicants are encouraged to apply promptly.  Los Angeles Superior Court is seeking dynamic, well-qualified, and highly-motivated individuals to fill the position of Business Systems Analyst II within its Court Technology Services department based in Los Angeles, California.  Business Systems Analyst II is the journey-level class in the business systems analyst class series. Incumbents provide support for court case management and other applications, including performing business process documentation and reengineering, working with users to identify needs for systems modifications and enhancements of moderate complexity, developing functional and programming specifications, testing new and revised programs to ensure accuracy and efficiency; providing training and troubleshooting and resolving applications and related hardware problems. Incumbents are responsible for analyzing requests for new programs and modifications to existing programs and determining feasibility based on current system functions and capabilities. Incumbents are also responsible for coordinating with programmers to ensure customer requirements are met.  For a detailed job description, please click here. Please note the requirements in the job description may vary from the requirements in the bulletin. Applicants must meet the requirements stated in this bulletin. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: To qualify, you must meet one of the following options upon the final filing date of this bulletin:  OPTION I: Two years of experience in performing business process analyses at the level of Business Systems Analyst I* working for the Los Angeles Superior Court. *Experience at the level of Business Systems Analyst I is defined as performing work in a comparable class with the same level of responsibility, and requiring the same knowledge, skills, and abilities. Duties include performing business processes documentation and reengineering, work with users to identify needs for systems modifications and enhancements of limited complexity, develop functional specifications, test modifications and troubleshoot system and software problems or equipment failures.  OPTION II: Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university -AND- four years of experience in performing user support, testing and related functions for Court case management systems and other business applications, at least two years of which were at the level of Business Systems Analyst I*. *Experience at the level of Business Systems Analyst I is defined as performing work in a comparable class with the same level of responsibility, and requiring the same knowledge, skills, and abilities. Duties include performing business processes documentation and reengineering, work with users to identify needs for systems modifications and enhancements of limited complexity, develop functional specifications, test modifications and troubleshoot system and software problems or equipment failures.  Note: Credit for experience is given based on a 40-hour workweek. Part-time experience is credited on a part-time ratio, i.e., working 20 hours per week for two months equals one month of experience. No additional credit is given for overtime.  No out-of-class experience will be accepted. Licenses; Certificates; Special Requirements: A valid California Class C driver's license or the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions.  Education Verification for option II: A legible copy of your college diploma -OR - transcript(s) (unofficial are acceptable) with the degree posted from the college or university must be submitted within 10 business days from application submission. Documentation may be submitted as follows:As an attachment to your on-line application. Attachment(s) must be in Microsoft Word or PDF format and should not exceed 10 MB; or,As an email attachment to Max Penate at mpenate@lacourt.org. Please indicate in the subject line "Business Systems Analyst II - Degree Verification." Please include your first and last name and the examination title on the documentation. For a list of acceptable accredited institutions or international universities, please visit http://ope.ed.gov/accreditation, www.chea.org/search, or http://whed.net/home.php.  Foreign studies must be evaluated by an academic credential evaluation agency and deemed to be equivalent to degrees from the United States. For a list of acceptable evaluation agencies, please visit www.naces.org or http://aice-eval.org/. Foreign studies submitted without acceptable evaluation will be rejected. DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS: The ideal candidate will possess the following desirable qualifications: An advanced college degree in Information Systems, Information Technology, or a closely related field.Strategies for gathering, reviewing, analyzing, and documenting system requirements.Prioritize requirements and create conceptual prototypes and mock-ups.Coordinate with users and development team members on systems development and enhancement projects to ensure successful implementation of software solutions.Interview and engage with users and project stakeholders to decipher and obtain data requirements and processing needs regarding projects.Develop conceptual and comprehensive business specifications documentation.Create comprehensive test scenarios and ensure functionality by performing QA tests.Confirm with development team that customer requirements are met.Provide user application support and training.Produce business process documentation describing project scope, analysis findings, and design requirements.Make recommendations on proposed systems, software, upgrades, modifications, and solutions.Exercise appropriate independent judgment and effectively respond to changing business needs throughout the system development life cycle.Excellent written and oral communication skills throughout the system development life cycle.Work effectively, independently and follow through on assignments.Work effectively with clients, users and management team.Experience with productivity tools such as Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Team Foundation Server.EXAMINATION INFORMATION: PART I: Qualifying evaluation of education, training and experience based upon submitted application materials and supplemental questionnaire.  PART II: An online examination, weighted 100%, covering the areas listed below. No person may complete this assessment more than once every 12 months. CUSTOMER REQUIREMENTS ANALYSIS - Covers analysis, building the system, data gathering methods, defining the system, documenting, problem analysis, user needs analysis, and validation.INDUCTIVE REASONING - Covers the ability to draw inferences from, and understand relationships between various concepts and working out patterns in a set of images.VERBAL REASONING - Covers the ability to evaluate, analyze, interpret, and draw conclusions from written statements and oral information.APPLICATION and FILING INFORMATION: Applications may only be filed online. To learn how to apply online, please access the Online Employment Application Guide. Los Angeles Superior Court reserves the right to verify all submitted documentation prior to appointment. The Court will only consider completed applications submitted, along with the required documents, and will reject incomplete applications. A resume will not substitute for a fully completed employment application. To facilitate the full and proper consideration of your work experience, clearly specify what professional experience meets the required job qualifications. When listing your work experience, please specify the beginning and end dates for each job you held and describe your experience for each position.  Please provide a current and accurate e-mail address for the Court to communicate with you about this job opportunity. Human Resources staff will notify all applicants of their application status via e-mail. We recommend that you add info@governmentjobs.com to your SAFE SENDERS list to avoid the notification being filtered as spam mail.  Los Angeles Superior Court is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants with disabilities who require reasonable accommodations to participate in the recruitment process can contact the e-mail address provided below. For additional employment information, please click here.  Questions regarding this posting may be e-mailed to mpenate@lacourt.org WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT: We will notify you of the outcome after each step of the recruitment process has been completed. Applicants who successfully pass each (and all) examination part(s) will be placed on an eligible list which will remain valid for up to one year. Other vacancies may be filled using this list.  Exam No.: R9868C  Business Systems Analyst II  Applications may be submitted online at www.lacourt.org  OR via the HR computer kiosk at  Los Angeles Superior Court  Human Resources Administration  111 N. Hill Street, Room 203  Los Angeles, CA 90012

Name: Data/Business Analyst
Description: Responsibilities:Manage tasks associated with stakeholder communication, data analysis and documentationPerform analysis for documenting detail data lineage (source to target)Document data flowsBecome proficient in use of the standard tools determined by the Data ProgramUnderstand Risk Reports and provide data domain expertise within report contentWork within the POD allocating necessary time attending daily meetings, status report development, issue escalations, etc.Proficient in describing details on Risk Reporting schedule process flows, data flows, aggregation routines (etc.) related to assignments for the current state analysis processMay be cross-trained and assigned to multiple subject and risk areas in support of detail current state analysis activitiesWork with Analysts and ISA/CDO to identify gaps in business process, controls and data flowsSpecify business requirements for future state how to workIdentify data control (new) requirements. IE. Reconciliations and validations. Identify data thresholds, as an example. Name: Talent Acquisition Operations Analyst
Description: Build a high-performing team. Our People Operations team achieves this mission by recruiting the right talent, equipping them with the right resources to make an impact, and growing our Titans into the right career paths that best match their individual talents and interests. We are united in our passion and desire to unlock the extraordinary potential of every single person in our organization: so that we may lose, learn, and win as a team. Every day is an opportunity for change; and for our People Operations team - it is an opportunity to make a positive difference in the employee lives we touch. Talent Acquisition Operations Analyst ServiceTitan is looking for a talented Analyst for the Talent Acquisition team. Under the general direction of the Talent Acquisition Operations Lead, this role will be responsible for the management of TA analytics. This role will partner closely with business leaders, Human Resources and Recruiters to closely monitor ways to bridge the gaps across HR, Recruiting, Business Leaders and Finance. This role will lead the development and deployment of TA dashboards for tracking TA goals and trends that drive strategic decisions, tracking TA initiatives through maintenance of the TA Operations Plan. What You'll DoDeliver recruiting analytics that tells the story of how we are performing and the people we hireTrack, analyze, and report on PeopleOps Key Performance Indicators: time to fill, source of hire, candidate experience, quality of hire, etc.Lead market and intelligence researchProactively analyze the competitive landscape and understand where the talent isThrough research, come up with key data points to drive the right talent-acquisition strategies to be more proactive vs. reactivePartner with other internal teams such as HR, Finance and Operations to ensure that TA systems and data are integrated with the larger systems mapDevelop and maintain standard tools, templates and reporting frameworks in support of TA, including development of TA dashboardsDevelop standard and ad - hoc reports from ATS to facilitate business decisionsDevelop a Diversity & Inclusion recruiting process based on analytical dataImplement new systems and administer existing systemsWhat You'll NeedBachelor's Degree or equivalent experience2-3 years of experience in Talent AcquisitionAdvanced Excel skills. Experience with Google Suite is preferredExtremely organized, detail oriented, and a fast learnerExcellent communication, written, interpersonal, and client service skillsTeam player with a high sense of urgency to interact at all levels of the organizationDemonstrated ability to think creatively, strategically, and operationally with strong analytical skillsAbout ServiceTitan ServiceTitan is a mobile, cloud-based software platform that helps home service companies streamline operations, improve customer service, and grow their business. ServiceTitan's end-to-end solution for the multi-billion dollar residential home service industry includes CRM, intelligent dispatch, comprehensive reporting, Marketing management tools, mobile connectivity for field techs, and Quickbooks integration. ServiceTitan brings a fully operational modern SaaS infrastructure to an industry traditionally underserved by software. ServiceTitan is here to champion the people in home services. ServiceTitan helps them provide a wonderful customer experience, improve sales and more easily manage their business.  Inc 5000 Best Workplaces 2018  Los Angeles Business Journal Best Places to Work 2018  Forbes Cloud 100 2018  Los Angeles Business Journal Top 100 Fastest Growing Private Company for 2017  Inc. 5000 America's Fastest Growing Companies 2017  Forbes - Next Billion-Dollar Startup List 2017

Name: Finance Business Analyst
Description: Finance Business AnalystLocation: Los Angeles, CAFull-Time Employment with ClientSummary The Business Technology Solutions (BTS) Business Analyst is a member of a highly-motivated BTS team responsible for partnering with multiple Tech and business divisions to evaluate, understand and deliver solutions for complex business problems. The team works as the strategic interface with assigned business divisions for the purpose of business-Tech strategy development, solutions delivery, service management, risk management and relationship management. The BTS team provides highly-valued strategic consulting level support and guidance throughout key business technology initiatives.  The Finance Business Analyst is a full-time position responsible for analyzing finance business problems and implementing solutions in our Enterprise Services platforms. The business analyst supports the user community, elicit, manage requirements and specifications as well as execute a variety of testing disciplines (test plans, scripts, unit testing and user acceptance) to drive development and validate results.  The Finance Business Analyst will report to the BTS Enterprise Services Manager within the Business Technology Solutions Global Operations group and act as a business relationship management function as described below. traceability from business capability to test case.Business Process Modelling:Process/Workflow analysis; work with project teams to gather, analyze and compile business process needs.Create process, models, specifications, diagrams and charts on current business processes and workflows.Technology Solutions Delivery:Support prioritization of Tech initiatives based on the division's needs/strategy, Tech workload and budget.Promote business knowledge of Tech process, roles, and procedures to ensure the best possible outcomes.Support on solution options analysis, risks evaluation and impacts on end-user solutions and services, business processes/workflows and system priorities.Participates in planning sessions with BTS team members.Support the development of business cases and contribute to the "project greenlight” process, including cost benefit analyses.Build a trusted relationship with multiple roles.Partner with BTS and Service Mangers to deliver Tech solutions to further our goals, all while managing customer expectations around what Tech can deliver.Analyze technology trends to determine impact to the achievement of BTS goals.Support the development of project plans and project charters.Support the project management process, reporting on status, accomplishments and risks.Quality Assurance:Develop test plans and test case scenarios based on project requirements.Assist and conduct user acceptance testing.Research and document issues / bugs before reporting these to the developers.Supports change management activities; training and user support.Supports the BTS manager in monitoring and reporting on escalated issues.Works collaboratively with service managers to develop clear and concise communications with respects to incidents, problems, and change management as needed.Required CapabilitiesExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills.Experience implementing Enterprise Services applications with specific knowledge of finance and accounting modules.Experience using Concur for expense and travel.Experience using Dynamics AX 2012 or Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations a plus.Advanced Excel skills, in particular around data validation, pivot tables and reporting financial data.Expert in business workflow modeling.Exceptional oral and written communications skills.Demonstrate initiative and ownership of tasks and projects.Ability to prioritize, coordinate and complete tasks to meet deadlines.Ability to work effectively both independently and in team environments.Ability to present complex problems in simple terms with great presentation skills.Experience extracting insights from data.Experience in Agile or waterfall SDLC.Experience using requirements management tools and test management tools.Thorough understanding of GAAP accounting.Thorough understanding of source control, unit testing, and continuous integration practices.Possess the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high growth environment.Attention to detail to be vigilant in analysis to come to correct conclusions.Be a team player who is approachable and supportive; able to contribute ideas and recommendations.

Name: Workday Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionOur client is one of the top-tiered major universities in Los Angeles, CA. They have established a Workday Financials deployment program covering their academic enterprise as well as their hospitals. This program is critical to their overall goals to improve administrative efficiency. Workday Financials will be paired with their existing Workday HR and Payroll solutions implemented in 2013. There are eight vacancies for this role. These are a fixed-term position with an anticipated end date of December 31, 2021. Please note that these are full-time role eligible for benefits, including medical, dental, and vision plans.  We are currently seeking 8 Workday Business Analysts to join their Workday Financials deployment program team in Los Angeles, CA.  If you have a bachelor’s degree in business administration, organization development, communication or related discipline and 2 years of business analysis experience, please submit your resume in Word format to careers@ragerresources.com Summary The Business Analysts will be responsible for ensuring that the overall Workday solutions meet the business requirements. This includes requirements gathering, solution design, build, test, and deployment. Design will involve extracting from requirements the fundamental needs of the business while leveraging the most efficient solution provided by Workday. The ideal candidates must possess 2 years of business analyst experience with a solid understanding of project management methodologies, business process flow, and documentation procedures. Experience with large enterprise software projects, Workday or other Financial ERP solutions and within Higher Education/Healthcare are strongly preferred. Responsibilities · With Organization Change Management (OCM) Analyst and support from Communication and Training resources, assess school and departmental needs and opportunities in Workday Finance transition. Develop and execute plans to achieve optimal adoption of WD Finance functionality and realization of transformation benefits in financial management processes  · Develop expertise in Foundation Data Model to effectively assist schools and departments in translating current data resources to FDM environment  · Develop expertise in selected WD Finance functional areas. Provide expert support to other members of OCM team in those functional areas, consult as needed with other department OCM teams to address particular needs of schools and departments  · Facilitate design workshops and work closely with business owners to gather and document user stories within the tracking software  · Translate user stories into detailed requirements and Workday use cases  · Work with project leadership and business owners to adapt requirements with an eye for business process optimization  · Develop subject matter expertise for assigned business and associated system functionality  · Work collaboratively in an iterative agile ‘style’ environment  · Work with project team members and consultants to configure the application  · Help manage execution of the testing strategy  · Assist project team members in the design of new (or redesign of existing) integrations  · Draft project documentation including configuration manuals and business cases (e.g., white paper, policy challenges) supporting the escalation of business decisions  · Meet with customer groups to determine IT business requirements  · Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.  · Provide information to developers and subject matter experts for the establishment of the technical vision and performance needs  · Serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development or business process re-engineering team through which requirements flow  · Participate in project meetings to review project deliverables and timelines.  · Work with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of project  · Participate in testing developed software or new process flow  · Perform other duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any time Requirements · Bachelor’s degree in business administration, organization development, communication or related discipline  · 2 years of business analysis experience  · Strong knowledge and understanding of project management methodologies, business process flow, and documentation procedures  · Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and tools  · Strong oral and written communication skills  · Ability to multitask, interact with multiple stakeholders and navigate changing priorities.  · Ability to work on moderately complex programming activities under supervision of senior IT Business Analyst  · Experience supporting grant post award/accounting administrative processes
