Name: Bilingual Business Analyst (Japanese)
Description: AXS is a company whose core values reflect a culture that celebrates individual differences, collective achievements, and respect of one another. We start small and are never afraid to try (Be The Spark). We believe open, honest, and proactive communication builds trust and empowers us to be our best (Make it Personal). We handle our problems constructively and together (Be Real). We go above and beyond to build something truly special and lasting (Bring Your 'A' Game). Most importantly, we celebrate and communicate our success by recognizing each other across all teams and levels of our organization (Pat The Back).  Our culture is a representation of who we are now, and whom we aspire to be in the future. If you are looking for a fast-paced environment where collaboration, accountability and visibility enable you to make a difference every day, then AXS may be a perfect match.  AXS is looking for a talented and highly motivated professional to join our technology team as Bilingual Business Analyst. In this role, you will provide internal/external user support for our custom-built enterprise ticketing platform. You'll investigating root cause of software issues to figure out the best solution. If you share our passion for building great internet products, want to take on significant responsibility that will directly grow our business, and are able to work well both individually and as a team player, we want to hear from you! What you'll be doing:Eliciting, compiling, and delivering detailed product requirements to all internal functional groups required to produce a working product.Responsible for discovering, synthesizing, and analyzing information from a variety of sources to ensure product requirements align with overall company priorities.Identifying and managing solutions for systemic software bugs and discrepancies.Drive segmentation and A/B test features to maximize user satisfaction and performance.Analytics and more analytics.you will be responsible to review, analyze, and make recommendations based on data analytics.Performing user acceptance testing.Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.Serving as a liaison between business stakeholders and the technology team.Skills and experience we're seeking:Fluent in Japanese in written and verbal capacities.Bachelor of degree in business, or related field or and MBA.Minimum 4 years of experience in business analysis, product management, applications/software development, or ERP systems support.Proven success in building products that are scalable and flexible.Excellence in problem solving, troubleshooting, and critical thinking.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Knowledge of iterative software development frameworks.Ability to stay organized in a highly demanding environment.Experience with using ticketing systems such as JIRA, Trello, etc.Excellent documentation skills.Experience in drafting requirements and delivering software solutions.Exemplary customer service skills across various levels of an organization.Ability to travel as needed.And you'll really get our attention if you have:Ticketing / sports and live entertainment experience.Experience synthesizing key learnings from research, user data and competitive benchmarks.Direct web development coding experience.Advance technical skills. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, AXS is a leading ticketing, data, and marketing solutions provider in the US, UK and Europe. The company and its solutions empower more than 200 clients teams, arenas, theaters, clubs and colleges to turn data into action, maximize the value of all their events and create joy for fans. AXS is an enterprise event technology platform that services venues, promoters and sports teams; providing fans the opportunity to purchase tickets directly from their favorite venues via a user-friendly ticketing interface. AXS serves all phases of the event life-cycle beyond just ticketing, through its consumer facing website, AXS.com and the AXS App. To learn more about the company and our employment opportunities, please visit us at www.axs.com

Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSr Business AnalystAccount Manager – Glas LLCCOMPANY INFORMATION: Glas, LLC  www.glasvapor.com  Glas, LLC is an extremely fast growing, manufacturing company in a high growth segment of the electronic cigarette industry. The company and brand are highly regarded and considered one of the leaders in high quality luxury devices and premium e-liquid.  Over the course of the last two years, we have developed excellent manufacturing capabilities and an extremely vast domestic and international distribution network of brick-and-mortar stores and online retailers. Keys to Glas-Branded Success – Our Philosophy A-List Players & Fierce Company Culture  We hire for talent and train for expertise. We love our company, our whole team does, and it shows in the finished product and the service we provide to every single customer and end-user.  Best-in-Class Systems  From CRM to AI Marketing Platforms, we use some of the best systems in the world to drive our business and the results speak for themselves in terms of service rate and product availability.  Data-Driven Decisions  With a focus on market analytics and business intelligence, everything we do is based on quality research and highly-targeted, accurate data. It shows in the product and flavor development and in our territory-specific product launch strategies. Our Guiding Principles 1. Collaboration: Leverage collective genius Leadership: The courage to shape a better futureQuality: What we do, we do well!Pursue growth & learningBuild a positive team and family spiritEmbrace and drive changeBe humble, Work hard, Have Fun!Deliver a WOW experienceStay focused & always do what you say you’re going to doOpen and honest communicationBe passionate and determinedBe adventurous, creative, and open mindedThink long termCommitted to GreatnessCelebrate Success! ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES: As a consumer centric company, our ability to analyze data, forecast, and create accurate financial models are a top priority here at Glas. We are looking for a Sr Business Analyst to help us review current business and forecasting models, and creating financial models for new company initiatives, including market-specific product launches and strategic partnership viability.  This role requires the ability to lead high impact, high visibility work and to go both broad and deep simultaneously.  The candidate will work across all areas of the organization, including Sales & Marketing, Finance, Operations, & Supply Chains to accumulate, assimilate, and parse data, creating models and forecasts, and helping to create efficiencies company-wide. Key takeaways from analysis will include analytical insights on customer, product, sales, & marketing trends. The candidate will assist in help estimating the end-to-end impact of sales & marketing decisions, and manufacturing and supply chain changes. Someone who enjoys understanding and improving business processes and systems is ideal.  Core activities will include:  o Analyzing financial data and creating financial models for new products and business segments  o Grow financial performance through analysis of financial results, forecasts, variances, and trends.  o Reporting on financial performance and create recommendations to be presented to executives  o Creating financial reports, forecasting, and operational tracking metrics  o Analyzing past results, identifying trends, and make recommendations for improvements  o Work closely with the accounting team to ensure accurate financial reporting and decision support  o Evaluate financial performance by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts  o Recommend actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; study proposed changes in methods and materials  o Identifying and driving process improvements, including creation of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools and Excel dashboards  o Increasing productivity by developing automated reporting/forecasting tools  o Market research, data mining, business intelligence, and valuation comps PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:3+ years of business finance or other relevant experience5-10 years overall work experienceHigh proficiency with financial modeling and techniquesStrong fluency with Excel formulas and functionsBA, BS or B.Com degree required (Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting/Finance/Economics)Strong analytical and data gathering skillsGood business acumenOutstanding structured and critical thinking skills and a passion for understanding complex issues with a data driven approachSolid communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionallyInnate drive to get things done and improve business outcomes Company DescriptionGlas LLC was founded in Los Angeles in January of 2014 and is now one of the premiere e-cigarette hardware and e-liquid companies around the world in a high growth segment of the consumer products industry. We represent the very best of our industry, following a set of core values: a commitment to excellence, innovation, passion, and integrity – all of which has driven Glas to become an internationally recognizable, award-winning brand.  Our sales & marketing office is located in West Los Angeles, with our manufacturing base here in Southern California, and distribution points all over the world. Our products are sold in 15+ countries and over 3,500 stores worldwide. Our brand is highly regarded with a strong reputation for producing incredible products thanks to our exquisite hardware, incredible flavors, iconic packaging, and unparalleled customer service.

Name: Business System analyst/ IT Business analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Title: Business System Analyst/ IT Business Analyst  Location: Los Angeles, CA 90011  Contract: 6 Months  About our Client: Our Client is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions underpinned by the worlds largest delivery network Our Client works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 425,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Our Client drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives.  Role The person in this role will serve as the primary systems analyst for the rollout of Office 365 services to the user populationThe role entails wearing different hats in the Office 365 implementation team business-systems analyst, tester and facilitatorThe role should fit into traditional waterfall projects as well as agile scrum model Reporting This role reports into the O365 PMSkills and success criteria:Prior experience as an analyst, architect or designer in the Office 365 implementation program is a mustMust have strong foundational knowledge of Office 365 platform including Exchange, Intune, Skype for Business Online, Azure AD and Azure ecosystemMust have a strong passion to learn and absorb new functionalities in the O365 spaceMust possess essential business analysis skills including but not restricted to requirements facilitation, elaboration, mapping current to future stateResponsibilities:Provides Office 365 subject matter expertise, business analysis, facilitation and quality assurance services to the projectGain functional and system knowledge of the current state of Office, messaging, email and mobility management in the company.Possess strong knowledge of the fundamentals of Office 365 services, capabilities and features from a functional and technical standpoint. The services of interest are Exchange Online, Azure AD, Intune MDM and MAM, Skype for Business Online and Office Pro PlusLead requirements gathering, documentation, review and sign-off exercisesParticipate in design sessions and lead the current state to future state mapping exercises Qualifications and Previous Experience Must have 4+ years of degree relating to one of the areas Computer Sciences, Information Management, Information Technology, Law, Compliance or Business AdministrationMust have 4+ years of experience as an IT Business AnalystMust have experience working as an architect, designer or systems business analyst in an O365 implementationPrevious experience as management consultant will be given preferenceCertifications in Office 365 and Azure platform are pluses About ASK: ASK Staffing is an award-winning technology and professional services recruiting firm servicing Fortune 500 organizations nationally. With 5 nationwide offices, two global delivery centers, and employees in 42 states-ASK Staffing connects people with amazing opportunities #ASK123Contact: Sherman @ Shermane@askstaffing.com, : 678-250-9916

Name: Compliance Analyst AR
Description: Position Title: Compliance Analyst - Ad Review, Cetera Financial GroupWhat we need:Cetera Financial Group is currently seeking a Compliance Analyst for Advertisement Review. This is a unique opportunity to join our team to ensure that all advertising and sales literature complies with state and federal laws, rules and regulations, and internal standards. This may include Federal and State Insurance Regulations as well as FINRA and SEC Rules. This position will work in the area of insurance and securities.What you will do:Review advertising and sales literature against applicable laws and regulations. Interpret the impact of laws on new and existing advertising and sales literature. Communicates changes and important issues to the affected business unit, field and customers. Effectively track advertising and sales literature using applicable methods and tools per industry/company record retention requirements.Involved in the following activities to ensure compliance with laws and regulations:Assists in researching, drafting and/or reviewing insurance/securities products and/or advertising materialsCorrespond with applicable regulatory bodies for clarification of advertising regulations as needed. This may include the NAIC, state DOIs, SEC, or FINRA.Assist in researching and responding to comments and/or inquiries received from state insurance departments or FINRA. Assist in researching and responding to customer and/or producer inquiries about compliance issues.Manages subject matter expert review process to ensure materials are reviewed by all applicable individuals/units.Strives for consistency of the reviews on an ongoing basis to ensure reviews are performed consistently across the organization.Assist in maintaining internal compliance materials such as manuals, reference material, reports and website.Other duties as assignedWhat you need to have:Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experienceThree years relevant experience in compliance (Advertising Compliance experience preferred).Series 7 & 24 FINRA registrations required.Working knowledge of life insurance and annuity productsGeneral knowledge of advanced marketing conceptsGood communications skills a must.Ability to manage high volumes under tight deadlinesWhat we give you in  return:Our competitive Health  program offers a comprehensive benefits package that supports healthy  lifestyles, preventative care and helps to protect against hardship. Our  retirement plan offers our employees the opportunity to plan ahead for a strong  financial future well beyond their working years. About Cetera Financial  Group: Cetera Financial Group® ("Cetera")  is a leading network of independent retail broker-dealers empowering the  delivery of objective financial advice to individuals, families and company  retirement plans across the country through trusted financial advisors and  financial institutions. Cetera is the second-largest independent financial  advisor network in the nation by number of advisors, as well as a leading  provider of retail services to the investment programs of banks and credit  unions.  Through its multiple  distinct firms, Cetera offers independent and institutions-based advisors the  benefits of a large, established broker-dealer and registered investment  adviser, while serving advisors and institutions in a way that is customized to  their needs and aspirations. Advisor support resources offered through Cetera include  award-winning wealth management and advisory platforms, comprehensive  broker-dealer and registered investment adviser services, practice management  support and innovative technology.  *"Cetera Financial Group" refers to the network of retail independent broker-dealers  encompassing, among others, Cetera Advisors, Cetera Advisor Networks, Cetera Financial Institutions, Cetera Financial Specialists, First Allied Securities, and Summit Brokerage Services.  Cetera Financial  Group is committed to providing an equal employment opportunity for all applicants  and employees. For us, this is the only acceptable way to do business.  Accordingly, all employment decisions at the Cetera Financial Group, including  those relating to hiring, promotion, transfers, benefits, compensation, and  placement, will be made without regard to race, color, ancestry, national  origin, citizenship, age, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition,  pregnancy, genetic characteristics, religion, religious dress and/or grooming,  gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status,  U.S. military status, political affiliation, or any other class protected by  state and/or federal law. Please Note: Cetera does not accept unsolicited Agency resumes. Any  unsolicited resumes received from Agencies will be considered the property of  Cetera unless specifically requested by Human Resources. Unsolicited  resumes will be ineligible for referral fees.

Name: Senior Analyst, Business Analytics
Description: DINE Brands Global, is looking for a highly motivated individual with demonstrated strength in analytics, problem solving, intellectual curiosity, and relationship management to serve as a Senior Analyst. Reporting to the Dine Research Institute, this individual will conduct timely and accurate business analysis and reporting to assist with strategic decision making in the organization. Provide quantitative and technical expertise to assigned business units/leaders to ensure that all relevant financial, marketing, and operational data are available to support business decisions. Key deliverables will include:  • Assist the DRI team in mining for insight across all data platforms. Insights will include focusing on sales drivers and identifying new opportunities.  • Working with the team to create trackers for national programs and business units internationally.  • Assist the team in diving deep into DINE Brand’s vast collection of data and weaving together an impactful story to drive business results.  • Influence Marketing to assist in designing best-possible campaigns  • Prepare presentations for International team and Executive Teams  • Proactively monitor business results and preemptively bring forth analysis explaining“why” and root causes behind shifts in performance.  • Critically analyze information, clearly articulate findings, and concisely present recommendations to management team.• Perform industry/category/market analysis to identify drivers of growth  • Provide summaries of earnings release transcripts for Dine Brand’s competitive set to the organization Requirements • BA required; analytical degree preferred (e.g., Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, or related discipline)  • Working knowledge of basic statistical concepts• 2-4+ years analytically oriented business leadership / Job level will be commensurate with experience  • Strong internal motivation, intellectual curiosity, logical thinking and desire to have a large impact on our organization  • Superb interpersonal and communication skills, with ability to partner well with other team members  • Strong organizational skills, with ability to work independently and multi-task in a complex, fast-paced, and deadline-driven environment•  Resourceful nature, with strong problem-solving and customer-service orientation  • Highly versed in applications software including advanced Excel and particularly strong understanding of PowerPoint.  • Familiarity with business intelligence software (e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, SQL) and/or statistical software (e.g. R, SAS).  • Experience building dashboards using a business intelligence tool.  • Ability to communicate complex analysis to non-technical audience.  • Ability to think holistically, leveraging several sources of data and bringing them together to tell a story

Name: Associate Manager, Business Analyst
Description: Requisition ID:  2544 Company:  Epson America, IncExternal Job Description  The Business Analyst will be responsible for the analysis of pricing, market conditions, and profitability for Epson Business Inkjet products in the commercial channels of North America. They will need to build pricing models, profitability matrixes and other tools to help them quickly analyze the market and develop reports for their internal customers. The Business Analyst will need to be highly proficient in MS Excel as well as utilizing internal Epson reporting systems and programs. They also will provide business analytical support for major accounts and commercial bid opportunities, pricing proposals, profitability analysis and sales proposals to drive Epson’s Business Inkjet Printer line growth. Responsible for:Bid Proposals – Final proposals supporting sales for major accounts and channel partners.Commercial Pricing Proposals – aligned with market requirements and Epson profit targets.TCO Analysis – Considering Hardware, supplies, service and solutions components.Internal Pricing analysis fur current and future products adjustmentsCollaborates with/Key Customers include:Product Marketing – North America and Latin AmericaSEC – Corporate headquarters in JapanSales – Channel and End User Sales TeamsService – EAI Service OrganizationSales Ops – EAI Sales Operations Minimum Experience Requirements  C - Requires Experience at an intermediate level (5-8 years)  Education  E - Completion of an undergraduate program required (B.A. or B.S.).Epson America, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability and protected veteran status, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.Nearest Major Market: Los Angeles Job Segment: Business Analyst, Assistant Manager, Sales Operations, Manager, Marketing Manager, Finance, Management, Sales, Marketing

Name: Analyst
Description: DescriptionCompany Description: Resolution Economics is a leading economic consulting firm focused on providing economic, statistical, and financial analysis; litigation and consulting support; and expert testimony to the world’s leading companies and law firms. Resolution Economics is headquartered in Los Angeles with offices in Washington, D.C., Chicago, and New York City.  Working at Resolution Economics is a rewarding experience where teamwork, creativity, and academic rigor combine to generate real-world results. We regularly apply advanced data analytical, statistical, and economic methods to create compelling narratives that are digestible to non-technical audiences. Our work often plays an important role in influencing State and Federal case law, and directly impacts the outcomes of future litigation and the creation of workplace policies. In addition, the analyses that we perform often inform settlement discussions, as parties attempt to resolve issues out of Court. Given the high-stakes and the large number of potential class members, our clients depend on our adaptability, efficiency, and ability to maintain an extremely high degree of reliability in our work.  The Labor and Employment Practice typically engages in matters relating to Wage and Hour or Discrimination litigation as well as other employment-related business consulting. We frequently provide analysis and support related to minimum wage/overtime claims, meal and rest break claims, employee misclassification claims, and discrimination matters related to hiring, pay, promotion, and/or wrongful termination at all stages of the litigation process. Clients typically rely on us to provide complex exposure models, expert reports, preparation for depositions, rebuttals to the work of other experts, and expert testimony at deposition or trial. Clients also often seek out or services for data collection efforts in the form of surveys, video content analysis, and on-site observational studies. Job Description: The Analyst position is the entry-level position at Resolution Economics and no prior work experience is required to apply. Analysts will assist with the managing of documents and data received from our clients. This includes converting raw data into analytical files, verifying data integrity, running preliminary statistical analyses, creating charts and tables, and finalizing documents and data for production. In some cases when the appropriate data is not available, Analysts may be required to assist in collecting data via observation studies or in-person surveys at client locations. In addition to learning how to process and interpret data using SAS and other statistical software packages, the Analyst’s primary goal is to develop a sense of the big picture for each case and to learn how to translate data into a coherent story supported by prevailing economic theories and statistical methods.  The ideal candidate for the Analyst position is highly motivated and intellectually curious, with a positive attitude and some exposure to basic statistical or computer programming. The litigation environment can be unpredictable, so the Analyst should be able to handle multiple requests and accommodate tight deadlines confidently. For the right candidate, the position will be as rewarding as it is demanding. Analysts will quickly learn that they have the support of a team of intelligent and highly motivated individuals who have a genuine interest in their professional development and advancement to higher positions. We aren’t hiring Analysts, we’re hiring future Managers. Responsibilities of this position may include:Becoming effective at using SAS and MS Office to analyze data and present results both internally and to clientsGathering data from a variety of file formats using SAS programming, OCR, data entry, or other methodsBuilding analytical datasetsSummarizing findings in charts and tablesResearching additional data sources (e.g., Bureau of Labor Statistics, U.S. Census, etc.)Assisting staff at all levels with project tasks and quality controlReviewing and summarizing documentsShadowing and documenting employee activities during observation studiesTravel may be required on certain projectsJob Qualifications:Skills and AbilitiesHigh level of competence using computers (especially Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)Some general programming knowledge (knowledge of SAS, R, STATA, VBA, SQL, or Python is a big plus)Strong attention to detailAbility to quickly learn and apply new conceptsAbility to work in a team environmentSolid work ethic and commitment to successAbility to balance several projects and client requests at onceWillingness to work an unpredictable scheduleEducation and Work ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative fieldEconometrics coursework is a big plus

Name: UAT Analyst / Business Analyst
Description: Support user acceptance testing including planning, execution and summary. Create Test Plans, Test Completion Reports, Traceability Matrixes. Create functional cases to ensure final software product meet customer requirements. Created Automated case using development tools (Java JDK, Webdriver) and programming languages (Java). Collect business user feedbacks and suggestions and communicate them as technical requirements to development team. Execute cases through test management system (HP Quality Center) and other backend tools and technologies (TOAD, SQL, Unix, JSON and XML). Report found defects in defect management systems (JIRA). Coordinate overall testing efforts to ensure that all in scope components and scenarios are tested

Name: Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst
Description: Joybird is the leading maker of handcrafted, custom-built furniture for the modern home and office. Through an innovative online shopping model, Joybird is transforming the way people purchase furniture by putting the customer at the center of the design process. With hundreds of fabrics, finishes and custom dimensions to choose from, each piece of furniture is as unique as the customer creating it. Inspired by mid-century modern design, LA-based Joybird utilizes responsible sourcing and manufacturing practices and offers a 365-day home trial.  We are seeking a Business intelligence Analyst who will affect business change through the creation and development of analytics and data insight capabilities within Joybird. The ideal candidate must have excellent communication, be self-driven and self-directed, and have a keen ability to analyze data to identify and communicate patterns. What You'll Do:Researching and assisting in the integration of quality third party data sourcesStrategize customer segmentation and demographicsLiaise between the data team, marketing and executivesCollaborate on relevant research projectsWork with data visualization tools such as Tableau and DomoWhat You'll Need:Minimum of 3 years professional experience in e-commerceExpert level knowledge of SQL, Tableau, Amazon RedshiftStrong data visualization and presentation skillsExperience with R and Python a plusExceptional analytical skills and a passion for dataOur Core Values:Customer Centric - You are passionate about delivering an end-to-end WOW experience for every customer.Transparent You exchange information and feedback frequently to strengthen relationships, ensure alignment, and elevate problem solving.ResultsDriven You aim high and go beyond tradition and standards to reach our goals.Constantly Evolving You're never satisfied and are unafraid to be a better version of yourself. Perks:Competitive salaryA business that trusts and embraces techA leadership team that wants to do it right and is open to new ideasA startup with a proven business model that's growing fastGenerous benefits including medical, dental, vision, FSA, 401(K) with an abbreviated waiting periodAmple Paid Time OffFully stocked pantry with your choice of snacks and drinksFurniture discounts (for friends and family too!)$2,000 and up for two weeks of your time for self-directed professional development

Name: Product Data Analyst
Description: About us: A Santa Monica-based tech company, EZ Texting's voice and text marketing platform is revolutionizing how businesses communicate. We are passionate dreamers who believe that technology can make a meaningful difference to any organization's success. Located in the heart of Santa Monica, we've created a unique work-space that the Los Angeles Business Journal has named one of the Top 100 places to work in LA - for the last four years running. Come find out why.  EZ Texting is looking for a talented and passionate Product Data Analyst to join our Business Intelligence Team.  The Analyst will be responsible for providing multiple types of analyses in support of product development activity. The Analyst will focus on user behavior and partner with the Product Team, UI Designers and Data Scientists/Engineers to analyze our users (behavioral, quantitative, qualitative, demographics, use case, etc.) to measure results, identify problems, surface opportunities, provide insights, inform decisions and support recommendations. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, highly versatile work environment that values team-based product development to solve business problems and scale for growth. Required Skills:Analyze data to drive product decisions (creation, measurement and analysis of product KPIs)Create KPIs & dashboards to measure performance and efficacy of existing product features and effectiveness of changesAnalyze A/B tests and test user hypothesis (including statistical significance)Attention to detail with ability to manage multiple tasks/priorities while working in a fast-paced environment with limited supervisionHighly proficient with SQL, advanced Excel and analytical skills requiredQuantitative analysis and critical thinking skillsExcellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills (with a focus on quality)Experience with A/B testing tools is a plus (Google Analytics, VWO, Fullstory, Pendo)Qualifications:BS/MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or related field from an accredited college or university, or the equivalent combination of education and experienceMinimum of 3 years of relevant Data Analysis or Product experienceKnowledge of Google Analytics and A/B testing frameworksExperience with Pendo & Domo is a plusExperience working in an Agile environmentBenefits:Fully paid medical (medical, dental, vision) benefits, 50% for families401 (k) planUnlimited sick leaveStock optionsPaid vacationDog friendly officeGeneral awesomeness

We are one of the leading producers of software for the cinema market worldwide. Vista software is used to operate cinemas in over 65 countries around the world including the USA, Canada, Mexico, UK, India, China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Australia, New Zealand and many more.  Vista’s Los Angeles office is responsible for implementation projects, sales, customer support, and development for Vista’s client base in North America.  For more information about Vista please visit our web site, www.vista.co  Summary  Reporting to the Vice President of Product, the Product Analyst position is an exciting opportunity to join and contribute to the development of new features of the US customer base of Vista. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our winning team, located in our Global Services Office in downtown Los Angeles. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.  The Business Intelligence Analyst will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.  As a Business Intelligence Analyst at Latham, you will be responsible for developing, researching and implementing data analysis projects including but not limited to data reporting, data visualizations, and ad-hoc research projects. You will work closely with the Technology Development management team on planning, design, installation, configuration and maintenance of said systems. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that our data systems are engineered for greater flexibility and reuse. You will work with various department to ensure that their future data needs are met with our current and future designs while accomplishing these and other critical functions: Working with Firm Management to further Enterprise Analytics and Business Intelligence reporting and visualization capabilities.Administering the Business Objects reporting environments including server side administration and user / security administration through CMC and design universes/reportsWorking with Senior Management on research projects to design, develop and deploy new universes / reports.Analyzing and verifying internal consistency, completeness and accuracy of data systems and makes required adjustments.Acting as a resource to the firm on various data related questions for staff and other users. Responding to user questions and issues in a timely manner and assists with solutions.Working with vendors in order to resolve complex issues.Staying abreast of current and new development processes, tools, technologies, and market trends as they relate to systems development and implementation in support of the legal industry.Working with various firm department and practice group attorney leadership or designees to provide guidance and support for development projects as they relate to more specific areas in the practice of Law at the Firm. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Business Intelligence Analyst must have strong administration experience with SAP Business Objects, including installing, upgrading, troubleshooting, and auditing the environment; strong skills in Business Objects universe and report development; strong SQL skills, including data profiling skills to identify and understand anomalies; the ability to comprehend and accurately perform advanced data analysis and communicate data findings. Experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools is preferred, along with experience with R, Python, NoSQL technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra, Apache Storm, MongoDB and Basho a plus.  A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Math, Economics or a related field is preferred. Four (4) years of experience with Business Objects, (Server Administration, CMC, Universe Designer, Web Intelligence) and experience with data analysis and working with users is required, along with one (1) to two (2) years' experience with data visualization, Tableau preferred.  Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the 'Apply Now' link.  Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.  Latham & Watkins LLP will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance.  For information regarding family care and medical leave (CFRA), click here.SDL2017

Name: Entry-Level Business Development Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionInterested in being a part of a dynamic, rapidly growing eCommerce company that helps improve the lives of sleep apnea patients?  Located a short, 5-minute drive from the UCLA campus, Easy Breathe is looking for an eager self-starter to join our team and learn the ins and outs of our growing eCommerce company. From analyzing data to developing strategies aimed at refining current operations, Easy Breathe is dedicated to providing our team members with hands-on experience to jump-start their careers.  The Opportunity  If you have strong intellectual curiosity and an interest in working with and helping others, this position offers you a number of compelling opportunities. In this role, you will: Make an impact as a team member focused on enhancing the companys business operations, from researching new strategies to analyzing market dataSupport our mission of making it easier for people to obtain and correctly use sleep apnea therapy products, helping improve the quality of their livesJoin an innovative eCommerce company that is posting 40% to 50% growth year over year - growth that will create opportunities for strong performersBe part of a smart and interesting team in a positive, results-oriented culture at a company that cares about its employeesEnjoy competitive compensation, benefits and unique perks, like a gym membership and snacks in the kitchen Your Role  Because of the growth-oriented nature of Easy Breathe, responsibilities can change quickly. Here is a general overview of what the role is but keep in mind that this is neither exhaustive nor restrictive.  Reporting to the Vice President of one of our five departments (Operations, Web Development, Digital Marketing, Development, and Finance and Compliance), you will be exposed to a variety of responsibilities that are all essential to the success of our day-to-day operations as well as long-term growth. From working in logistics and communicating with warehouses, to creating web development strategies or analyzing digital marketing campaigns, our goal is to show you all that goes into operating a rapidly growing eCommerce company. Our vision is to tailor the position to your interests and strengths while giving you hands-on experience in an assortment of areas.  What We Are Looking For  To be a good fit for the Entry-Level Business Development Analyst opportunity, you will have: Strong creative problem-solving abilityMeticulous attention to detailA strong analytical mindset and a demonstrated ability to glean action-oriented insights from dataExcellent oral and written communication skillsThe ability to relocate to Los Angeles At Easy Breathe, character traits and culture fit are just as important as experience. We are looking for an individual who is: Practical, fact-minded, and logic-drivenMeticulous in attention to detail but also grasp the big pictureHighly self-motivated and able to learn quicklyMotivated to exceed expectations and has a strong work ethicHighly organized and able to manage multiple activities and prioritiesDedicated, hard-working, and driven to do the right thingAble to augment their analytical skills with a dash of creativity in solving problemsAble to achieve goals independently but also contribute as a team playerFlexible and adaptable in our fast-paced environment Please submit a cover letter with your application. All applications without a cover letter will not be accepted.  Keys to Success  To excel in this role, you will be driven by intellectual curiosity. For example, when an idea does not work as expected, you will get excited about leveraging the lessons learned to be more effective next time. You will take a customer service approach to supporting our various departments, acting with the best interests of our customers in mind when making decisions. You should be passionate about results, driven constantly to try new things, tweak existing tactics to get results, and embrace change as the only constant.  Whats In It for You  Strategic Impact  Easy Breathes rapid growth has created the need for more creative solutions for our customers as well as for our team. At Easy Breathe, you will be immersed in strategic discussions and be able to implement measures that will accelerate further growth for the company.  Great Environment  Weve created systems and processes that make each day run smoothly. Our culture here at our office is casual and the energy is high; we drive for results and have fun in the process. Our offices are located in the Brentwood area, near shops, restaurants, and a 5-minute drive from the UCLA campus.  Outstanding Team  You will work with a diverse team of talented people who enjoy helping others. Our team comes from a variety of backgrounds and has varied interests, making it a fun, smart and interesting team.  Help People Live Better  Sleep apnea can cause marked drowsiness during the daytime and contribute to cardiovascular disease, high blood pressure, stroke, diabetes and other serious conditions. Our customers have enough on their minds without worrying about deductibles or health records. We help them get the therapy products they need while eliminating the hassle.  Career Options  Easy Breathe offers all the opportunity you would expect from a growing eCommerce company. We are committed to helping our people develop professionally. As we continue to expand, we will provide opportunities for team members to take on additional responsibilities.  Unexpected Perks  We understand the importance of attracting and retaining top talent, so in addition to a competitive wage, health insurance, and paid time off, we offer some unique perks, such as a birthday spas, gym memberships, discounts to UCLA Extension courses, and a fully stocked kitchen.

This position is responsible for collaborating with stakeholders to identify business and functional requirements for our Credit Risk monitoring systems, perform user acceptance testing for enhancements and root cause analysis for problems identified.
