Name: Market Data Analyst
Description: Req ID: 28441 Experience Level: Entry-Level  Other Location(s): N/A Relocation offered: Yes Travel required: None Come grow with us At Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.  Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous.  NAD Business Analysis and Data Acquisition team provides business services such as reporting, vendor management, and business/data analysis. As member of this team, you will work with the wider Insights & Analytics team within North American Distribution (NAD) and all other NAD departments.    Responsibilities:Serves as primary contact for NAD departments with complex third party data needs Communicates with users to understand their business needs and the use of the vendor products/services. Ensures users and teams have the most suitable vendor data solutions, recommending changes as appropriateKeeps users and support teams informed regarding product changes, enhancements, and service issuesPrepares and distributes status reports, presentations, and other updates to users and management Leads/Participates in projects with vendor identification, analysis, selection, and onboardingNegotiates complex vendor MSAs, contracts, and agreements and leads Capital Group “Buy” teams to develop and execute effective vendor negotiation strategiesCompiles and analyzes third party data usage and inventory to identify opportunities for efficiencies and cost savingsManages relationships with key/strategic market data  Participates in setting strategic direction for relationships with vendors with complex offerings Prepares and delivers vendor scorecardsLead/Participates in vendor accountability meetings, QBR, and onsite visitsManages the licensing and contract process with vendorsPerforms in-depth analysis for third party data (3PD) related business research Assists business and IT partners to effectively incorporate 3PD products into business and technology solutions   Qualifications:3-5 years of data vendor management experience and/or financial services industry experienceAdvanced skills in SQL and Excel; working knowledge in data visualization tool such as Tableau, SSRS, etc; Big data experience preferredBS/BA required, MBA preferredMeaningful experience with project management practice from intake/due diligence through successful executionAbility to deal effectively with all organizational levelsSolid problem solving skills, effective conflict resolution abilitiesAbility to effectively multi-task and respond to dynamically changing work environment and to positively prioritize and influence business outcome   Company Overview: Founded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.7 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers.     We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Name: Business Analyst, Strategic Insights
Description: Objective: Barry's is looking for a Business Analyst, to help support our Strategy & Operations Team. This cross-functional role will support Real Estate, Marketing, Operations, Finance, HR, and Retail to identify and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) to drive studio and national level business results. The ideal candidate will be proactive, intellectually curious, have a knack for numbers and the communication skills necessary to share actionable insights with our senior leadership team. Report to: Director of Strategic Insights Type: Full Time Responsibilities:Assess operations and initiatives to identify areas for growth, resolve issues, and increase buy-in.Analyze customer, competitor and market insights and recommend ways to improve customer journey and experience.Design both recurring and ad hoc analysis on key business metrics and present findings in a clear and actionable format to give management visibility and support decision making.Leverage existing corporate systems and recommend enhancements, changes, or new systems to support/improve KPIs and reporting.Identify, aggregate, and analyze data to communicate business trends.Build data models to support complex analyses.Support national and studio-level marketing campaigns and work cross-functionally to develop forecasts.Company Culture ResponsibilitiesWork to uphold Barry's community and culture standards, and live the company mission, vision, and values daily.Represent the Barry's brand within the studio and throughout the LA fitness community.Assist in participating in and enhancing the community with your studio and regional teams.Required/Qualifications:2+ years of work experience in an analyst role.Degree in Finance, Business or Marketing.Proficiency in MS Office Suite PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook. Experience with Python a plus.Strong quantitative skills.Excellent attention to detail.A likeable and outgoing personality, able to work well in teams.Strong multi-tasking skills.Strong sense of responsibility and able to work independently. Barry's is the Best Workout in the WorldTM®. Founded in West Hollywood in 1998, it's the original strength and cardio interval fitness experience that provides an immersive, high-intensity, one-hour workout that's as effective as it is fun. Our fitness classes alternate between working out with weights and running on a treadmill. Each day focuses on a different muscle group in order to achieve real results and to prevent injuries. Our program is designed to tone muscle and maximize fat loss, while spiking the metabolism for up to 48 hours following the class.

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job Description IBM HR is undergoing a huge transformation and we are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join our Technology Transformation Team.  The team is driving innovation by bringing in best in class software systems as well as overseeing the build of innovative Watson powered AI solutions. The technology we bring are focused on enabling the talent, executive, and learning teams. Our goal is to have the highest performing workforce with the best skills aligned to the right roles at the right time.  You enjoy solving the toughest challenges and roadblocks and can also take responsibility independently. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Work closely with Product Manager, project manager, development organization and third party vendors.Create Business Definition or Business Requirements Document and Use CasesUtilize design thinking skills to help the business arrive at their desired requirements.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needsSuccessfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneouslyStrong analytical skills including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Name: IT Business Analyst

obtains appropriate IT and business signoff· Conducts research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible· Accountable for the delivery of business and technical requirements documentation· Works closely with Application Designers and Developers to ensure understanding of requirements that will be used for creating application architecture and design specifications· Communicates technical integration decisions, issues and plans with project team· Develop use cases, flow charts, functional diagrams and descriptions to communicate application design specifications· Work with the development team to ensure that specifications are understood· Assists QA team to ensure that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans· Creates and manages traceability matrix and ensure that the proper testing plans have been completed and can be mapped back to requirements· Participates in test results meetings and executes traceability activities to determine cause of bugs, system errors and failures during testing· Assists with the documentation, coordination, and organization of production readiness· Supports projects through all production and post production milestones (as needed)Qualifications· Bachelors or Master’s degree in one of the following subject areas: Business Administration, Information Systems/Technology or related field preferred; only candidates most closely matching the requirements of the position will be contacted. Name: Yield Management Analyst
Description: ConsumerTrack™ is unique in the digital marketing and media industry - we combine marketing, digital, content and fintech. Our performance based approach increases brand awareness and generates targeted audience engagement on our internal web properties and partner sites.  Learn More About What We Do  This Yield Management Analyst will help define, analyze, and report on data and trends. As an individual contributor, you will liaise with business stakeholders (Ad Ops, Media, Sales, Analytics) to tackle our business’ biggest challenges. You will identify and prioritize opportunities, develop hypotheses and extract actionable insights by identifying patterns in structured and unstructured data. You will work with stakeholders to develop recommendations to drive business performance and to operationalize solutions into business processes.  This role will be primarily focused in 3 areas: conducting daily analysis, making recommendations based off of that analysis and ensuring data integrity. This requires a balance of technical experience in dealing with data, data sources and reporting platforms (Tableau) with business acumen and the understanding of how to create intuitive reports, insights and actionable intelligence for each business unit and various departments. Analyze and provide insights around inventory capacity, client fulfillment and pricing across all channels, verticals, ad products and platforms.Analyze web and mobile behavior, conversion trends, and success metrics to identify patterns and realize product opportunities.Effectively communicate and socialize actionable results and findings throughout the organization.Delivery daily recommendations to drive actionable business decisions and measure the impact of those decisions against actual performance.Suggest campaign optimizations to ensure that they not only deliver in full, but also meet key performance indicators (KPIs)Work closely with Ad Ops, Analytics and Data teams to ensure campaigns are configured for the accurate and effective collection of data.Work with cross-functional teams to develop requirements for tracking, data management, and data structure needs to enable the team to successfully run reporting and analyticsRequirements3+ years of working experience in yield management or analytics role within the digital advertising area.BA/BS in technical or business-related field.Complex problem solving skills and ability to work with large amounts of data. Name: EDM TECHNICAL ANALYST

Managing and prioritizing a request queue for new data governance requests related to development on the data governance platform  Skills and Knowledge: Proven experience translating business problems into actionable data governance initiatives  Familiarity with current trends in Data governance technologies.  Good knowledge on Data mapping experience - mapping data sources to and from multiple applications  Must possess good oral and written communication and presentations skills with the ability to lead meetings effectively  Experience in SDLC Process  Good understanding of data governance principles  Strong experience on data governance workflows , technical metadata and technical lineage  Hands-on experience with data governance tools like Collibra, Informatica Metadata Manager etc.  Detailed understanding of Informatica Axon and Informatica EDC preferred  Knowledge of standards, guidelines and best practices for Axon and EDC preferred  Basic Qualifications: *3-5 years of data governance experience performing data governance, technical lineage, and technical metadata capture preferably in a data-intensive financial company. 3-5 years' experience in defining and deploying data Governance programs and tools on enterprise data projects3-5 years' experience in Information technology development across all phases of the SDLC process in the data space Preferred Qualifications: 1-2 years hands-on experience with Informatica EDC and Axon  3-5 years experience in Banking or Financial sector especially in terms of regulatory and strategic needs for data governance.  Bachelor's Degree preferably in Information Systems or Business Administration. Master's Degree in a related field is strongly desired.

Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. Capable and willing to travel within California approximately 25 30%

Name: Bilingual Business Analyst
Description: AXS is a company whose core values reflect a culture that celebrates individual differences, collective achievements, and respect of one another. We start small and are never afraid to try (Be The Spark). We believe open, honest, and proactive communication builds trust and empowers us to be our best (Make it Personal). We handle our problems constructively and together (Be Real). We go above and beyond to build something truly special and lasting (Bring Your A Game). Most importantly, we celebrate and communicate our success by recognizing each other across all teams and levels of our organization (Pat The Back).  Our culture is a representation of who we are now, and whom we aspire to be in the future. If you are looking for a fast-paced environment where collaboration, accountability and visibility enable you to make a difference every day, then AXS may be a perfect match.  AXS is looking for a talented and highly motivated professional to join our technology team as Bilingual Business Analyst. In this role, you will provide internal/external user support for our custom-built enterprise ticketing platform. You'll investigating root cause of software issues to figure out the best solution. If you share our passion for building great internet products, want to take on significant responsibility that will directly grow our business, and are able to work well both individually and as a team player, we want to hear from you! What youll be doing:Eliciting, compiling, and delivering detailed product requirements to all internal functional groups required to produce a working product.Responsible for discovering, synthesizing, and analyzing information from a variety of sources to ensure product requirements align with overall company priorities.Identifying and managing solutions for systemic software bugs and discrepancies.Drive segmentation and A/B test features to maximize user satisfaction and performance.Analytics and more analytics.you will be responsible to review, analyze, and make recommendations based on data analytics.Performing user acceptance testing.Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.Serving as a liaison between business stakeholders and the technology team.Skills and experience were seeking:Fluent in Japanese in written and verbal capacities.Bachelor of degree in business, or related field or and MBA.Minimum 4 years of experience in business analysis, product management, applications/software development, or ERP systems support.Proven success in building products that are scalable and flexible.Excellence in problem solving, troubleshooting, and critical thinking.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Knowledge of iterative software development frameworks.Ability to stay organized in a highly demanding environment.Experience with using ticketing systems such as JIRA, Trello, etc.Excellent documentation skills.Experience in drafting requirements and delivering software solutions.Exemplary customer service skills across various levels of an organization.Ability to travel as needed. And youll really get our attention if you have: Ticketing / sports and live entertainment experience.Experience synthesizing key learnings from research, user data and competitive benchmarks.Direct web development coding experience.Advance technical skills. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, AXS is a leading ticketing, data, and marketing solutions provider in the US, UK and Europe. The company and its solutions empower more than 200 clients teams, arenas, theaters, clubs and colleges to turn data into action, maximize the value of all their events and create joy for fans. AXS is an enterprise event technology platform that services venues, promoters and sports teams; providing fans the opportunity to purchase tickets directly from their favorite venues via a user-friendly ticketing interface. AXS serves all phases of the event life-cycle beyond just ticketing, through its consumer facing website, AXS.com and the AXS App. To learn more about the company and our employment opportunities, please visit us atSDL2017

Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Req ID: 18467 Experience Level: Professional Other Location(s): N/A Relocation offered: Yes Travel required: None Come grow with us At Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.  Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous. Full Time Associate HighlightsCompensation: We target the upper quartile of the market for total cash compensation, including base salary and bonuses. We also take a pay-for-performance approach, rewarding each associate commensurate with their contribution to the organization.Benefits: In addition to health, life, and retirement benefits starting from day-one, you will have access to a wealth of additional benefits, ranging from tuition assistance to ample paid time off.Professional Development: We provide guidance on specific topics that you and your manager can discuss during your monthly one-on-one meetings that are completely tailored to you as an individual. Information Management is a department within Capital's Investment Operations group focused on providing a comprehensive set of investment management data capabilities. Within Information Management, our Data Strategy and Operations (DSO) team is responsible for improving all of the ways we acquire, store, manage, share and use Investment Management data. Ultimately DSO is helping Investment Operations and Capital Group become more data driven by changing the way we work with and the value we derive from our investment management data. DSO does this by defining our Data North Star by creating the investment management data roadmap, as well as partnering with the Emerging Technology team to solve business problems with technologies that leverage Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence. DSO also provides strategic data solutions that optimize for self-service, automate manual operations, and reduce operational risk.  As a Senior Data Solutions Analyst based in Los Angeles, you will serve as an investment management data expert. You will provide direction to Analysts and Associates and assist them in completing their assignments. You will participate in the training and development of other associates and serve as a positive role model and mentor. Responsibilities:Provide guidance on prioritizing data requirements within a business unitEvaluate new and alternative data sources and new integration techniquesContribute to data models and designs for the data warehouseWork with complex data structures and provide innovative ways to solution for complex data delivery requirementsPrototype complex reporting and/or data visualization solutions in partnership with IT and other business unitsEstablish standards for documentation and ensure your team adheres to those standardsInfluence and develop a thorough understanding of standards and best practices used by your teamQualifications:5+ years of experience with business intelligence, analytics, reporting, and data transformationDemonstrated experience in translating unstructured business problems into clearly defined requirements frameworkBachelor's degree requiredAdvanced knowledge of SQLAdvanced knowledge technical and functional designs for databases, ETL, data warehousing, and reportingAdvanced knowledge scripting tools for automation such as R, Python, Alteryx, etc.Advanced knowledge with reporting/data visualization tools such as Tableau, SSRS, etc.Company Overview: Founded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.7 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers. We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

This includes overseeing the functional discovery, design, testing, and deployment process. Experience with Workday Financials is also required. USC is also seeking transformation within its departments and schools, so the successful candidate must also be able to help USC evaluate and optimize existing business processes based on a proven understanding of how Workday should be deployed. ITS provides essential, university-wide services such as: Enterprise information systemsUniversity wired and wireless networksEducational TechnologyResearch ComputingIT Security This is a fixed-term position with an anticipated end date of December 31, 2021 Please note that this is a full-time role eligible for benefits, including medical, dental, and vision plans. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst (Business Objec
Description: Job TitleBusiness Intelligence Analyst (Business Objects experience is required) - ID:32808  DurationPermanent  Start DateASAP  Job Skills Four (4) years of experience with Business Objects, (Server Administration, CMC, Universe Designer, Web Intelligence) and experience with data analysis and working with users is required, along with one (1) to two (2) years' experience with data visualization, Tableau preferred.  LocationLos Angeles, CA  Date Posted11/01/2018  Business Intelligence Analyst  The Business Intelligence Analyst will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in the comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.  As a Business Intelligence Analyst you will be responsible for developing, researching and implementing data analysis projects including but not limited to data reporting, data visualizations, and ad-hoc research projects. You will work closely with the Technology Development management team on planning, design, installation, configuration and maintenance of said systems. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that our data systems are engineered for greater flexibility and reuse. You will work with various department to ensure that their future data needs are met with our current and future designs while accomplishing these and other critical functions:  Working with Firm Management to further Enterprise Analytics and Business Intelligence reporting and visualization capabilities.  Administering the Business Objects reporting environments including server side administration and user / security administration through CMC and design universes/reports  Working with Senior Management on research projects to design, develop and deploy new universes / reports.  Analyzing and verifying internal consistency, completeness and accuracy of data systems and makes required adjustments.  Actnig as a resource to the firm on various data related questions for staff and other users. Responding to user questions and issues in a timely manner and assists with solutions.  Working with vendors in order to resolve complex issues.  Staying abreast of current and new development processes, tools, technologies, and market trends as they relate to systems development and implementation in support of the legal industry.  Working with various firm department and practice group attorney leadership or designees to provide guidance and support for development projects as they relate to more specific areas in the practice of Law at the Firm.  As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Business Intelligence Analyst must have strong administration experience with SAP Business Objects, including installing, upgrading, troubleshooting, and auditing the environment; strong skills in Business Objects universe and report development; strong SQL skills, including data profiling skills to identify and understand anomalies; the ability to comprehend and accurately perform advanced data analysis and communicate data findings. Experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools is preferred, along with experience with R, Python, NoSQL technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra, Apache Storm, MongoDB and Basho a plus.  A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Math, Economics or a related field is preferred. Four (4) years of experience with Business Objects, (Server Administration, CMC, Universe Designer, Web Intelligence) and experience with data analysis and working with users is required, along with one (1) to two (2) years' experience with data visualization, Tableau preferred. Name: Business Development Analyst - Client Development
Description: Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Business Development Analyst to join our winning Client Development team, located in downtown Los Angeles. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.  The Business Development Analyst will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.  As a Business Development Analyst at Latham, you will work closely with the Senior Manager of Client Development and the Manager of Client Insight to support and advance the firm's key client relationships and provide client-specific research, analysis, and intelligence, while accomplishing these and other critical functions: Assisting with the tracking of client account efforts which includes maintaining and auditing client team portals, as well as creating and maintaining centralized client team work product and resource storage.Working closely with the Manager of Client Insight to support on project management and administration of global Client Insight initiatives.Supporting data analysis and the creation of powerful and compelling reports and presentations summarizing client insight data for the firm.Collecting and collating impact and ROI data for client insight initiatives and the broader client development program.Producing client intelligence reports including news alerts for client teams, executive moves alerts, and top client reports.Collecting, cataloging, and updating internal and external client intelligence and research, as well as client development resources and tools on the Client Development intranet site.Managing the business development research site and sharing dossiers with the broader department monthly.Acting as administrative coordinator for client team trainings as directed by Senior Manager of Client Development and Client Development Manager of Client Insight.Assisting with Strategic Client Committee initiatives.Aggregating and analyzing internal newsletters, mandate information, and deal announcements by clients.Monitoring and analyzing competitor activity, product and market trends, industry research and other external data that may impact approach and plan of action.Contributing to the maintenance of information in the firm's client relationship management (CRM) system, which requires an understanding of the various technologies and systems in place and marrying the financial data with client activities and client research.Hosting calls and drafting agendas for the Client Development team and ensuring communication and information flow between various client account management, client targeting and cross-selling efforts.Collaborating with other practice and industry business development teams, firm leadership, and the Strategic Client Committee to ensure alignment and consistency with the firm's overall global strategy.Assisting with special projects as needed until completion. As a Business Development Analyst on our Client Development team, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Analyst must have excellent research, and quantitative and qualitative analytical skills including a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail. The successful applicant will have the ability to analyze data from a range of sources and synthesize this into clear conclusions, as well as outstanding professional interpersonal skills, tenacity, and enthusiasm. The Analyst must have superior organizational skills needed to manage time well, prioritize effectively, and handle multiple deadlines, and the ability to work in a global team environment. The ideal candidate will have experience supporting a client account management program, as well as experience supporting a client insight or feedback program.  A Bachelor's degree is required. A JD or advanced marketing, business, or science degree is a plus. Two (2) to three (3) years of experience supporting business development or marketing initiatives at a professional or financial services firm is required.  Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the 'Apply Now' link.  Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.  Latham & Watkins LLP will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance. Please click here to review the Ordinance.  For information regarding family care and medical leave (CFRA), click here.SDL2017

Name: Business Systems Analyst I or II
Description: Job Title: Business Systems Analyst I or II Full Time/ Part Time: Full-time Job Description:***Please Note: This position may be filled at the Business Systems Analyst I or II level (SA4/SA5) based on the experience of the candidate.*** Participates in the planning, design, implementation and maintenance of ESRI ArcGIS GIS Desktop, Server, and Portal applications or AutoCAD suite (Civil 3D, Plant 3D, Electric, Basic) or AVEVA suite (Engineering, Electrical, Instrumentation, P&ID, E3D) applications, laser scanning systems, engineering application and related systems within Gas Engineering and various client groups. Manages and directs small projects and tasks required to implement requests for computing services within Gas Operations. Develops methodologies for solving specific technical problems and manages the application of those methodologies by Company personnel. Provides first, second and third level support to end users for software applications. Individuals must be able to work projects of varying terms and scopes and meet their strict deadlines.; perform systems acceptance testing and contract administration duties; Conduct interviews with employees in the business units to define scope, business drivers, business process, and requirements necessary to develop specifications for information technology solution.  - Support Operations/Engineering group with technical advice, research, and data to address operational needs of the organization.  - Monitor performance of recent program implementations and adjust as required to achieve desired results.  - Participates in development and implementation of application documentation and end user training.  - Perform initial investigations and research to develop project plans for assigned projects and tasks specific to the expertise or knowledge required for the position.  - Perform other duties as assigned. Knowledge of Gas Utility practices, procedures, work flows and past practices are also desired in candidates.Understanding of ESRI ArcGIS GIS Desktop, Server, and Portal or AutoCAD app suite (Civil 3D, Plant 3D, Electric), or AVEVA app suite (Engineering, Electrical, Instrumentation, P&ID, E3D), and Basic applications and conceptsUnderstanding of relational databases and their functionality (joins, relates, types of relationships, Oracle)Experience with SQL Developer is strongly desiredEffectively communicates with team by scheduling and leading meetings, preparing meeting agendas, meeting minutes, and scheduled status reports.Continuous client interaction to understand business issues and future business needs. Continuous information technology relationship to understand how the business needs can be answered utilizing technology innovation.Manage medium size system initiatives such as complex system enhancement or new system development utilizing proven project management methodologies. May lead project team that includes business clients and other analysts. Work closely in coordinating with IT Project Team Lead.Develop documentation such as Scope, Project Plan, Requirements, Design Recommendations, Test Plans, Job Aides, training material, and Implementation Plans to support system request.Utilize tracking tools effectively (SIRS, Help Desk Logs) to assist in the prioritization of work and resource allocation.Works in an office environment. May be required to work nonstandard days and shifts. May travel to remote locations to resolve problems and support user needs. Qualifications:Requires a bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience, preferably in Geographic Information systems, computer science, mathematics or engineering and three years of experience (1-3 years experience for Business Systems Analyst I level) in the use of computer systems such as GIS, AutoCAD or AVEVA, and knowledge of Gas Utility business or equivalent training and/or experience. Familiarity with structured systems development methodology, project management techniques. Must have a thorough knowledge of user or system support processes, a general knowledge of data processing and an understanding of structured development methodology. Analytical abilities, ingenuity and excellent oral and written communication skills are required to identify, understand and translate user requirements into system applications.Posting End Date:

Name: Business Analyst, Strategic Insights
Description: Objective: Barry's is looking for a Business Analyst, to help support our Strategy & Operations Team. This cross-functional role will support Real Estate, Marketing, Operations, Finance, HR, and Retail to identify and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) to drive studio and national level business results. The ideal candidate will be proactive, intellectually curious, have a knack for numbers and the communication skills necessary to share actionable insights with our senior leadership team. Report to: Director of Strategic Insights Type: Full Time Responsibilities:Assess operations and initiatives to identify areas for growth, resolve issues, and increase buy-in.Analyze customer, competitor and market insights and recommend ways to improve customer journey and experience.Design both recurring and ad hoc analysis on key business metrics and present findings in a clear and actionable format to give management visibility and support decision making.Leverage existing corporate systems and recommend enhancements, changes, or new systems to support/improve KPIs and reporting.Identify, aggregate, and analyze data to communicate business trends.Build data models to support complex analyses.Support national and studio-level marketing campaigns and work cross-functionally to develop forecasts.Company Culture ResponsibilitiesWork to uphold Barry's community and culture standards, and live the company mission, vision, and values daily.Represent the Barry's brand within the studio and throughout the LA fitness community.Assist in participating in and enhancing the community with your studio and regional teams.Required/Qualifications:2+ years of work experience in an analyst role.Degree in Finance, Business or Marketing.Proficiency in MS Office Suite PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook. Experience with Python a plus.Strong quantitative skills.Excellent attention to detail.A likeable and outgoing personality, able to work well in teams.Strong multi-tasking skills.Strong sense of responsibility and able to work independently. Barry's is the Best Workout in the WorldTM®. Founded in West Hollywood in 1998, it's the original strength and cardio interval fitness experience that provides an immersive, high-intensity, one-hour workout that's as effective as it is fun. Our fitness classes alternate between working out with weights and running on a treadmill. Each day focuses on a different muscle group in order to achieve real results and to prevent injuries. Our program is designed to tone muscle and maximize fat loss, while spiking the metabolism for up to 48 hours following the class.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Position Overview We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join our superstar team! As a Senior Business Analyst, you combine a love of data with both insightful business judgment and impactful communication skills to develop and execute company-wide growth initiatives. The ideal candidate will be passionate about digging into data and have a firm understanding on what the data is showing. You’ll partner with our leadership team to develop company strategy and goals, share updates with the Board, and work with teams across the business to drive actionable insights and business impact. Position Duties/ResponsibilitiesDesign and build key company data tables, dashboards, and insights tools that power decisions across the company.Analyze complex business problems using data sets from both internal and external resources.Provide actionable insights to leadership to influence strategy, performance, and growth.Reviews reporting and analytic methodologies and implements recommended improvements.Identifies, troubleshoots, and resolves data issues, working with various teams and other areas as needed.Contribute to complex and time-critical projects for leaders by quickly understanding context and developing a prioritized business approach for resolution.Communicate findings to senior leadership by preparing polished presentations and identifying key takeaways and action items.Evaluate processes, data and systems using a systematic, disciplined and data-driven approach.Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans to actionable items.Facilitating project meetings and presentations to all types of diverse audiencesParticipates as needed in special department projects.Position QualificationsBachelors degree in Business Administration or related degree5+ years of experience analyzing data and managing multiple projectsEffective communicatorTechnical understandingExpert multitasker & prioritizerProblem solverCreative & critical thinkerOutstanding presentation skillsData drivenAttention to detailAdvanced MS office skillsManagement Consulting or Investment Banking experience preferredMBA a plusAbout Beyond Limits Beyond Limits is a pioneering Artificial Intelligence company with a technology legacy in Space Exploration. A spinoff of NASA's Jet Propulsion Lab and Caltech, Beyond Limits provides advanced intelligence solutions that go far beyond conventional AI. Our cognitive computing technology mimics human thought processes and provides autonomous reasoning to aid human-like decision-making.  Beyond Limits provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Beyond Limits complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  Beyond Limits expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Beyond Limit’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Name: Business and Sales Analyst, SQL
Description: About Herbalife Nutrition  Herbalife Nutrition is a global nutrition company whose purpose is to make the world healthier and happier. We have been on a mission for nutrition - changing people's lives with great nutrition products & programs - since 1980. Together with our Herbalife Nutrition independent distributors, we are committed to providing solutions to the worldwide problems of poor nutrition and obesity, an aging population, skyrocketing public healthcare costs and a rise in entrepreneurs of all ages. Herbalife Nutrition offers high-quality, science-backed products, most of which are produced in Company-operated facilities, one-on-one coaching with an Herbalife Nutrition independent distributor, and a supportive community approach that inspires customers to embrace a healthier, more active lifestyle.  Herbalife Nutrition's targeted nutrition, weight-management, energy and fitness and personal care products are available exclusively to and through dedicated distributors in more than 90 countries.  Through our corporate social responsibility efforts, Herbalife Nutrition supports the Herbalife Family Foundation (HFF) and its Casa Herbalife programs to help bring good nutrition to children in need. Herbalife Nutrition is also proud to sponsor more than 190 world-class athletes, teams and events around the globe, including Cristiano Ronaldo, the LA Galaxy, and numerous Olympic teams.  Herbalife has over 8,000 employees worldwide, and our shares are traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: HLF) with net sales of approximately $4.4 billion in 2017. To learn more, visit Herbalife.com or IAmHerbalife.com. POSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT: The Business Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and presenting information relating to the company sales, Member and Herbalife Marketing Plan. Use knowledge of the Herbalife business and keen analytical skills, while leveraging technology to access and integrate data from various systems, to identify business trends, monitor key performance metrics to support decisions related to Members, events and promotions, sales/marketing and overall company strategy. The role will also support reporting and analysis for wide range of company strategic initiatives and business enhancements. DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES:Generate on-going statistical reports, data investigations, "what-if" modeling and analyses for Sr. Management to support critical decisions related to the overall company strategy.Support monthly and quarterly Member Metrics and trends validation process to ensure accuracy. The validation process includes ensuring that data is accurately captured from various data sources, understanding and interpretation of data formulas, and calculations and troubleshooting of variances.Develop and execute complex data mining analyses, which involve the design and execution of statistical programs to extract data.Develop logic, build from scratch and maintain Member analytical reports (both ad-hoc and scheduled) using Excel, BI/Micro Strategy and/or Access programs.Design, build, and implement new report formats and layouts on a customized basis. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Requisition ID: 42790All Locations: El Segundo, CA (California) A trusted partner. A national resource. A leader in national security space. We are THE Aerospace Corporation. A team that takes pride in our readiness to solve some of the most complex technical challenges in existence. With challenges spanning government to commercial, you’ll have the unique opportunity to work on projects that are literally evolving our nation's space and launch capabilities. We all share a common passion and aspiration – to serve a mission much bigger than ourselves. When you join our team, you’ll be part of a rare collection of thought leaders and game-changing innovators. Are you ready to launch your career?ResponsibilitiesThe Economic and Market Analysis Center (EMAC) supports Aerospace’s core mission through functional coverage in four domains: Government Acquisition Support, Industrial Base (IB) Assessments & Risk Analysis, Economic and Market Analysis, and Integrated Decision Frameworks and Modeling. Key FunctionsSpearhead the development of business intelligence analytics tools for government customersPossible projects may include building recommender systems, anomaly detection, market trend forecasting, predictive portfolio and financial analytics, and automated company assessment toolsParticipates with an interdisciplinary team in ongoing research or technical programs with academic collaboration partnersApplies standard techniques and procedures to carry out a series of prescribed scientific and/or engineering tasksQualificationsRequiredBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Natural Sciences or related STEM disciplinesAt least two years of experience in machine learning or/and statistics ( Master's degree can be used in lieu of experience)Extensive expertise in machine learning and statistics to include predictive modeling, parametric and nonparametric analysis Experience building an analytics pipeline to include acquisition & curation of both structured and unstructured business and technical data, onboarding onto datastores (for example, AWS or Google Compute), training of learning models, and distribution of analytics productsExperience with data visualization packages Expert developer in Python, R, Julia, or ScalaDeep knowledge of core ML and Data Processing libraries in the chosen development languageExtensive knowledge of Natural Language ProcessingStrong interpersonal, communication skills (written and oral), leadership and problem-solving abilities as well as the ability to present to senior managementMust be a team player and possess the ability to work with multidisciplinary and cross-organizational teams of contractor, FFRDC, and government personnel with flexibility and versatilityAbility to obtain and maintain a security clearance PreferredMaster's or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Natural Sciences or related STEM disciplines Current TS/SCI clearance Business undergraduate degree or equivalent experience (ability to support business case analysis or assess company/technology viability)Familiarity with the aerospace/defense industryExperience with Graph Databases, for example, MongoDB or Neo4j, and familiarity writing queries in CypherExperience with Spark, Hadoop, Hive, or PigExperience with FlaskExperience with deep learning architecturesTranscript RequirementTranscripts are required for this position. Additional Requisition DetailsClearance Requirement: None Access: None Polygraph: None Relocation Available: Yes Employment Type: Regular Work Schedule: Full Time Company StatementThe Aerospace Corporation has provided independent technical and scientific research, development, and advisory services to national security space programs since 1960. We operate a federally funded research and development center (FFRDC) for the United States Air Force and the National Reconnaissance Office, and support all national security space programs. We also apply more than 50 years of experience with space systems to provide critical solutions to technologically complex systems in such areas as communications, shipping, law enforcement, and cyber, among others.From our inception, our highly skilled technical staff has focused on ensuring the success of every mission and developing the most effective and economic space-related hardware and software in the world. Our greatest asset is the technical expertise of our people. Our state-of-the-art laboratory facilities are staffed by some of the leading scientists in the world.Equal Opportunity CommitmentThe Aerospace Corporation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We believe that a diverse workforce creates an environment in which unique ideas are developed and differing perspectives are valued, producing superior customer solutions. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, color, religion, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, national origin, protected veteran status, physical disability, medical condition, mental disability, or disability status and any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. If you’re an individual with a disability or a disabled veteran who needs assistance using our online job search and application tools or need reasonable accommodation to complete the job application process, please contact us by phone at 310.336.5432 or by email at ieo.mailbox@aero.org. You can also review The Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law poster and the supplement, as well as the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

Name: EDM TECHNICAL ANALYST
Description: Enterprise Data Governance Technical Analyst - Direct-Hire/Permanent - Los Angeles, Ca.  Genuent is hiring an Enterprise Data Governance Technical Analyst. This is a Direct-Hire/Permanent position with a premiere client in Los Angeles, Ca. If you're a match, please apply.  The Enterprise Data Governance Technical Analyst is a key role responsible for developing and supporting an Enterprise data governance solution. This role will provide technology support and oversight to business and Data Governance office in their ability to govern data and support configuration of associated workflows, facets, and lineage, metadata and business glossaries. In order to enable data governance, our client is implementing a Data Governance platform consisting of Informatica Axon, EDC and IDQ to enable end to end data governance. Responsibilities Data Governance Development Partner with the Data Governance Office in ensuring the correct deployment and usage of CNB's Data Governance platform  Responsible for full cycle development (designing, testing, deploying, and documenting the workflows ,Facets, lineage , roles and other components)  Responsible for deploying and validating objects within different environments  Responsible for ensuring best practices and standards when creating objects (Workflows etc.)  Support integration of Data governance and technical lineage and metadata solutions  Support integration of Data governance and data quality solutions  Enterprise Lineage and Metadata Development Partner with the Data Governance Office in the utilization of the data governance platform for Technical metadata, Technical lineage, linkage of business term to technical terms etc.  Execute and analyze technical metadata ingestion and technical lineage development  Aptitude to understand business challenges related to Data governance and offer advice on how to solve them with the data governance platform  Support impact analysis related to system changes  Support creation of custom Attributes  Implement and manage Resource-Level Security  Manage and monitor the metadata resources, metadata extract schedules, profiling runs  Data Governance as a Service Develop and implement additional data governance functionality based on requirements gathered from business units.  Managing and prioritizing a request queue for new data governance requests related to development on the data governance platform  Skills and Knowledge: Proven experience translating business problems into actionable data governance initiatives  Familiarity with current trends in Data governance technologies.  Good knowledge on Data mapping experience - mapping data sources to and from multiple applications  Must possess good oral and written communication and presentations skills with the ability to lead meetings effectively  Experience in SDLC Process  Good understanding of data governance principles  Strong experience on data governance workflows , technical metadata and technical lineage  Hands-on experience with data governance tools like Collibra, Informatica Metadata Manager etc.  Detailed understanding of Informatica Axon and Informatica EDC preferred  Knowledge of standards, guidelines and best practices for Axon and EDC preferred  Basic Qualifications: *3-5 years of data governance experience performing data governance, technical lineage, and technical metadata capture preferably in a data-intensive financial company. 3-5 years' experience in defining and deploying data Governance programs and tools on enterprise data projects3-5 years' experience in Information technology development across all phases of the SDLC process in the data space Preferred Qualifications: 1-2 years hands-on experience with Informatica EDC and Axon  3-5 years experience in Banking or Financial sector especially in terms of regulatory and strategic needs for data governance.  Bachelor's Degree preferably in Information Systems or Business Administration. Master's Degree in a related field is strongly desired.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Avvo is changing what it means for consumers to find professional legal help. Every year millions of people seek professional legal assistance and Avvo has profiles for nearly all 1.3 million US registered lawyers on our platform. We are looking for a Business Analyst who’s excited to produce work that will empower the team to make data driven decisions.  You are an organized self-starter with a keen business sense who loves digging into data to understand trends and performance. You have a passion for manipulating large volumes of data, building dashboards and have a consistent focus on efficiency. You easily understand requirements, and communicate the progress and status of your work. You have a bias for action and know when to apply the 80/20 rule. You’re also a great teammate who likes a rapidly changing environment and wants to join a company that offers a ton of opportunity to build your skills. In this role, you will:Become a subject matter data (and business) expert related to appointed areas of responsibility.Apply a broad range of analytical approaches, from back-of-envelope approximations, to what-if scenarios, to deep dives, uncovering patterns in order to identify trends and new opportunities.Develop visualizations and other methods for conveying key insights and reports.Simplify and automate reporting, audits, and other data-driven activities; build solutions to have maximum scale and self-service ability by partners.Support the business with time-critical data analyses.Collaborate with agile engineering teams to design flexible solutions to support analytic needs.Required Qualifications:2+ years’ experience in a hands-on analytical role with a focus on analyzing business problems.Highly Proficient with creating, maintaining, and optimizing Tableau workbooks.Proficient in tools used for data analysis and reporting (SQL, Excel).Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.Preferred QualificationsAbility to communicate complex quantitative analyses and business needs in a clear, precise, and actionable manner to diverse audiences.Knowledge of Python.Experience working with Marketing, Product and Sales teams. Success starts with having the right people. At Internet Brands, we value and mentor each member of our growing team. We seek out talented, goal-oriented professionals who live and breathe the Internet and thrive in a flexible but challenging work environment. Our team of innovators has enabled Internet Brands to sustain high levels of profitability and success while evolving along with the Internet for over 20 years.  At IB, we promote an entrepreneurial, friendly culture that applauds innovation and results while embracing change and independence. Our employees are intensely driven and constantly encouraged to reach higher and use creativity to achieve success – all the while enjoying high levels of collaboration and the luxury of coming to work in jeans and sneakers. We are proud to offer a unique blend of the innovation of a start-up with the history, stability, and benefits of an established corporation.  Internet Brands and its wholly owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Business Systems Analyst-IT
Description: POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop and maintain an accurate understanding of Clients supply side business practices and in-depth knowledge of the IT applications that support them.  Provide business support and maintenance for supply side solutions in Clients production environments.  Define and document any new business requirements, needs, and processes tied to supply side solutions. These applications include procurement, manufacturing, distributed order management, warehousing, and distribution systems.  Assist in the testing, configuration, administration, validation, and training of Client's supply side solutions.  Acts as the liaison between business personnel, vendor partners, and internal technical resources with regards to Client's supply side solutions.  Ensure adherence to security best practices and controls as related to Clients supply side solutions.  Provides second-level support and troubleshooting for system challenges and problems associated with supply side solutions and interfaces.  Ensures pertinent system, user guide, and training documentation tied to supply side solutions are complete, current, and stored appropriately.  Assists in the evaluation and prioritization of new enhancements, vendor packages, and in-house solutions in the supply side space. Focus areas include procurement, manufacturing, distributed order management, warehousing, packaging, and distribution. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelors Degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, Technology or related field.  Minimum 3 5 years experience working as Business Systems Analyst or similar capacity in a mid- to large-size manufacturing company.  Experience working in retail / manufacturing corporation with food and beverage experience is strongly preferred.  Experience working with food manufacturing ERP and WMS solutions is a definite plus.  Experience with Aptean / Ross ERP and warehouse management solutions is ideal.  Familiarity and experience working with different vendor packages or applications focusing on procurement, manufacturing, distributed order management, warehouse management, packaging, and distribution.  Capable of interacting and working well with both business personnel and technical resources.  Strong communication and organization skills.  Strong capabilities in multi-tasking and work prioritization.  Willing and able to focus on both new supply side solution development and enhancement / on-going maintenance efforts for Client's supply side solutions.  Capable and willing to travel within California approximately 25 30%

Name: FINANCIAL ANALYST

Name: Bilingual Business Analyst
Description: AXS is a company whose core values reflect a culture that celebrates individual differences, collective achievements, and respect of one another. We start small and are never afraid to try (Be The Spark). We believe open, honest, and proactive communication builds trust and empowers us to be our best (Make it Personal). We handle our problems constructively and together (Be Real). We go above and beyond to build something truly special and lasting (Bring Your A Game). Most importantly, we celebrate and communicate our success by recognizing each other across all teams and levels of our organization (Pat The Back).  Our culture is a representation of who we are now, and whom we aspire to be in the future. If you are looking for a fast-paced environment where collaboration, accountability and visibility enable you to make a difference every day, then AXS may be a perfect match.  AXS is looking for a talented and highly motivated professional to join our technology team as Bilingual Business Analyst. In this role, you will provide internal/external user support for our custom-built enterprise ticketing platform. You'll investigating root cause of software issues to figure out the best solution. If you share our passion for building great internet products, want to take on significant responsibility that will directly grow our business, and are able to work well both individually and as a team player, we want to hear from you! What youll be doing:Eliciting, compiling, and delivering detailed product requirements to all internal functional groups required to produce a working product.Responsible for discovering, synthesizing, and analyzing information from a variety of sources to ensure product requirements align with overall company priorities.Identifying and managing solutions for systemic software bugs and discrepancies.Drive segmentation and A/B test features to maximize user satisfaction and performance.Analytics and more analytics.you will be responsible to review, analyze, and make recommendations based on data analytics.Performing user acceptance testing.Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.Serving as a liaison between business stakeholders and the technology team.Skills and experience were seeking:Fluent in Japanese in written and verbal capacities.Bachelor of degree in business, or related field or and MBA.Minimum 4 years of experience in business analysis, product management, applications/software development, or ERP systems support.Proven success in building products that are scalable and flexible.Excellence in problem solving, troubleshooting, and critical thinking.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Knowledge of iterative software development frameworks.Ability to stay organized in a highly demanding environment.Experience with using ticketing systems such as JIRA, Trello, etc.Excellent documentation skills.Experience in drafting requirements and delivering software solutions.Exemplary customer service skills across various levels of an organization.Ability to travel as needed. And youll really get our attention if you have: Ticketing / sports and live entertainment experience.Experience synthesizing key learnings from research, user data and competitive benchmarks.Direct web development coding experience.Advance technical skills. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, AXS is a leading ticketing, data, and marketing solutions provider in the US, UK and Europe. The company and its solutions empower more than 200 clients teams, arenas, theaters, clubs and colleges to turn data into action, maximize the value of all their events and create joy for fans. AXS is an enterprise event technology platform that services venues, promoters and sports teams; providing fans the opportunity to purchase tickets directly from their favorite venues via a user-friendly ticketing interface. AXS serves all phases of the event life-cycle beyond just ticketing, through its consumer facing website, AXS.com and the AXS App. To learn more about the company and our employment opportunities, please visit us atSDL2017

Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Req ID: 18467 Experience Level: Professional Other Location(s): N/A Relocation offered: Yes Travel required: None Come grow with us At Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.  Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous. Full Time Associate HighlightsCompensation: We target the upper quartile of the market for total cash compensation, including base salary and bonuses. We also take a pay-for-performance approach, rewarding each associate commensurate with their contribution to the organization.Benefits: In addition to health, life, and retirement benefits starting from day-one, you will have access to a wealth of additional benefits, ranging from tuition assistance to ample paid time off.Professional Development: We provide guidance on specific topics that you and your manager can discuss during your monthly one-on-one meetings that are completely tailored to you as an individual. Information Management is a department within Capital's Investment Operations group focused on providing a comprehensive set of investment management data capabilities. Within Information Management, our Data Strategy and Operations (DSO) team is responsible for improving all of the ways we acquire, store, manage, share and use Investment Management data. Ultimately DSO is helping Investment Operations and Capital Group become more data driven by changing the way we work with and the value we derive from our investment management data. DSO does this by defining our Data North Star by creating the investment management data roadmap, as well as partnering with the Emerging Technology team to solve business problems with technologies that leverage Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence. DSO also provides strategic data solutions that optimize for self-service, automate manual operations, and reduce operational risk.  As a Senior Data Solutions Analyst based in Los Angeles, you will serve as an investment management data expert. You will provide direction to Analysts and Associates and assist them in completing their assignments. You will participate in the training and development of other associates and serve as a positive role model and mentor. Responsibilities:Provide guidance on prioritizing data requirements within a business unitEvaluate new and alternative data sources and new integration techniquesContribute to data models and designs for the data warehouseWork with complex data structures and provide innovative ways to solution for complex data delivery requirementsPrototype complex reporting and/or data visualization solutions in partnership with IT and other business unitsEstablish standards for documentation and ensure your team adheres to those standardsInfluence and develop a thorough understanding of standards and best practices used by your teamQualifications:5+ years of experience with business intelligence, analytics, reporting, and data transformationDemonstrated experience in translating unstructured business problems into clearly defined requirements frameworkBachelor's degree requiredAdvanced knowledge of SQLAdvanced knowledge technical and functional designs for databases, ETL, data warehousing, and reportingAdvanced knowledge scripting tools for automation such as R, Python, Alteryx, etc.Advanced knowledge with reporting/data visualization tools such as Tableau, SSRS, etc.Company Overview: Founded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.7 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers. We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Overview  The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for developing relationships with various user groups to recognize needs, analyze business processes, evaluate alternatives, recommend strategic solutions, and troubleshoot problems. The incumbent will manage user expectations, engage in multiple initiatives, perform issue tracking and resolution, and ensure that projects are delivered on time. This role also serves as a liaison between the business units and the software development teams by assisting in the requirements definition process and testing software to ensure quality standards are met.  Some projects require being embedded in the department most impacted or concerned with specific work flow and systems changes for an indefinite period. This will normally occur only on the largest and most high risk/reward projects. In those situations, the incumbent will have a dotted line reporting relationship to the senior manager of the business unit to which he/she is embedded. Name: Business Intelligence Administrator (Business
Description: Business Intelligence Administrator  As a Business Intelligence Administrator you will be responsible for developing, researching and implementing data analysis projects including but not limited to data reporting, data visualizations, and ad-hoc research projects. You will work closely with the Technology Development management team on planning, design, installation, configuration and maintenance of said systems. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that our data systems are engineered for greater flexibility and reuse. You will work with various department to ensure that their future data needs are met with our current and future designs while accomplishing these and other critical functions:  Working with Firm Management to further Enterprise Analytics and Business Intelligence reporting and visualization capabilities.  Administering the Business Objects reporting environments including server side administration and user / security administration through CMC and design universes/reports  Working with Senior Management on research projects to design, develop and deploy new universes / reports.  Analyzing and verifying internal consistency, completeness and accuracy of data systems and makes required adjustments.  Actnig as a resource to the firm on various data related questions for staff and other users. Responding to user questions and issues in a timely manner and assists with solutions.  Working with vendors in order to resolve complex issues.  Staying abreast of current and new development processes, tools, technologies, and market trends as they relate to systems development and implementation in support of the legal industry.  Working with various firm department and practice group attorney leadership or designees to provide guidance and support for development projects as they relate to more specific areas in the practice of Law at the Firm.  As a Business Intelligence Administrator, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Business Intelligence Analyst must have strong administration experience with SAP Business Objects, including installing, upgrading, troubleshooting, and auditing the environment; strong skills in Business Objects universe and report development; strong SQL skills, including data profiling skills to identify and understand anomalies; the ability to comprehend and accurately perform advanced data analysis and communicate data findings. Experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools is preferred, along with experience with R, Python, NoSQL technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra, Apache Storm, MongoDB and Basho a plus.  A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Math, Economics or a related field is preferred. Four (4) years of experience with Business Objects, (Server Administration, CMC, Universe Designer, Web Intelligence) and experience with data analysis and working with users is required, along with one (1) to two (2) years’ experience with data visualization, Tableau preferred.
