Name: Workday Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionOur client is one of the top-tiered major universities in Los Angeles, CA. They have established a Workday Financials deployment program covering their academic enterprise as well as their hospitals. This program is critical to their overall goals to improve administrative efficiency. Workday Financials will be paired with their existing Workday HR and Payroll solutions implemented in 2013. There are eight vacancies for this role. These are a fixed-term position with an anticipated end date of December 31, 2021. Please note that these are full-time role eligible for benefits, including medical, dental, and vision plans.  We are currently seeking 8 Workday Business Analysts to join their Workday Financials deployment program team in Los Angeles, CA.  If you have a bachelor’s degree in business administration, organization development, communication or related discipline and 2 years of business analysis experience, please submit your resume in Word format to careers@ragerresources.com Summary The Business Analysts will be responsible for ensuring that the overall Workday solutions meet the business requirements. This includes requirements gathering, solution design, build, test, and deployment. Design will involve extracting from requirements the fundamental needs of the business while leveraging the most efficient solution provided by Workday. The ideal candidates must possess 2 years of business analyst experience with a solid understanding of project management methodologies, business process flow, and documentation procedures. Experience with large enterprise software projects, Workday or other Financial ERP solutions and within Higher Education/Healthcare are strongly preferred. Responsibilities · With Organization Change Management (OCM) Analyst and support from Communication and Training resources, assess school and departmental needs and opportunities in Workday Finance transition. Develop and execute plans to achieve optimal adoption of WD Finance functionality and realization of transformation benefits in financial management processes  · Develop expertise in Foundation Data Model to effectively assist schools and departments in translating current data resources to FDM environment  · Develop expertise in selected WD Finance functional areas. Provide expert support to other members of OCM team in those functional areas, consult as needed with other department OCM teams to address particular needs of schools and departments  · Facilitate design workshops and work closely with business owners to gather and document user stories within the tracking software  · Translate user stories into detailed requirements and Workday use cases  · Work with project leadership and business owners to adapt requirements with an eye for business process optimization  · Develop subject matter expertise for assigned business and associated system functionality  · Work collaboratively in an iterative agile ‘style’ environment  · Work with project team members and consultants to configure the application  · Help manage execution of the testing strategy  · Assist project team members in the design of new (or redesign of existing) integrations  · Draft project documentation including configuration manuals and business cases (e.g., white paper, policy challenges) supporting the escalation of business decisions  · Meet with customer groups to determine IT business requirements  · Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.  · Provide information to developers and subject matter experts for the establishment of the technical vision and performance needs  · Serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development or business process re-engineering team through which requirements flow  · Participate in project meetings to review project deliverables and timelines.  · Work with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of project  · Participate in testing developed software or new process flow  · Perform other duties as assigned or requested. Name: Yield Management Analyst
Description: ConsumerTrack™ is unique in the digital marketing and media industry - we combine marketing, digital, content and fintech. Our performance based approach increases brand awareness and generates targeted audience engagement on our internal web properties and partner sites.  Learn More About What We Do  This Yield Management Analyst will help define, analyze, and report on data and trends. As an individual contributor, you will liaise with business stakeholders (Ad Ops, Media, Sales, Analytics) to tackle our business’ biggest challenges. You will identify and prioritize opportunities, develop hypotheses and extract actionable insights by identifying patterns in structured and unstructured data. You will work with stakeholders to develop recommendations to drive business performance and to operationalize solutions into business processes.  This role will be primarily focused in 3 areas: conducting daily analysis, making recommendations based off of that analysis and ensuring data integrity. This requires a balance of technical experience in dealing with data, data sources and reporting platforms (Tableau) with business acumen and the understanding of how to create intuitive reports, insights and actionable intelligence for each business unit and various departments. Analyze and provide insights around inventory capacity, client fulfillment and pricing across all channels, verticals, ad products and platforms.Analyze web and mobile behavior, conversion trends, and success metrics to identify patterns and realize product opportunities.Effectively communicate and socialize actionable results and findings throughout the organization.Delivery daily recommendations to drive actionable business decisions and measure the impact of those decisions against actual performance.Suggest campaign optimizations to ensure that they not only deliver in full, but also meet key performance indicators (KPIs)Work closely with Ad Ops, Analytics and Data teams to ensure campaigns are configured for the accurate and effective collection of data.Work with cross-functional teams to develop requirements for tracking, data management, and data structure needs to enable the team to successfully run reporting and analyticsRequirements3+ years of working experience in yield management or analytics role within the digital advertising area.BA/BS in technical or business-related field.Complex problem solving skills and ability to work with large amounts of data. Ability to use data to produce insights.Advanced Microsoft Office knowledge, Expert level in Excel, Power Pivot or Power BI a plus.Basic SQL knowledge, experience in data profiling and solid understanding of data warehousing a plus.Basic to Intermediate experience working with creating reports and dashboards using Tableau Desktop, experience with Tableau Server a plus.Some knowledge of third party web and ad tracking such as DoubleClick (DFP & DFA), CJ, Rakuten, Impact Radius, Google AdWords, Google Analytics data sources and in utilizing BI tools (Tableau) to build reports, dashboards and provide insights into those data sources.High energy, detail-oriented, proactive self-starter with ability to take direction.Exceptionally high standards in communicating the results of analysis in a clear and effective mannerExperience working with JIRA or similar project management systems on Agile Scrum/Kanban projectsExperience working with multi-disciplinary teams, external partners/clients, and managing stakeholders -- Strong cross functional leadership and consensus buildingFlexibility – able to flow with project changes; when things shift course mid-stream, you can pivot and help the team re-orient quicklyBenefitsCompetitive salary with excellent growth opportunity; we pride ourselves in having a team that exudes leadership, high initiative, creativity, and passion.Awesome medical, dental and vision plans with heavy employer contribution.Paid vacation, holidays, and sick days.401k- We match 3% of employee’s salary after the first year of employment.In-office gym and weekly fitness and yoga classes.Fully stocked kitchen with snacks and beverages.We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Business Systems Analyst-IT
Description: POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop and maintain an accurate understanding of Clients supply side business practices and in-depth knowledge of the IT applications that support them.  Provide business support and maintenance for supply side solutions in Clients production environments.  Define and document any new business requirements, needs, and processes tied to supply side solutions. These applications include procurement, manufacturing, distributed order management, warehousing, and distribution systems.  Assist in the testing, configuration, administration, validation, and training of Client's supply side solutions.  Acts as the liaison between business personnel, vendor partners, and internal technical resources with regards to Client's supply side solutions.  Ensure adherence to security best practices and controls as related to Clients supply side solutions.  Provides second-level support and troubleshooting for system challenges and problems associated with supply side solutions and interfaces.  Ensures pertinent system, user guide, and training documentation tied to supply side solutions are complete, current, and stored appropriately.  Assists in the evaluation and prioritization of new enhancements, vendor packages, and in-house solutions in the supply side space. Focus areas include procurement, manufacturing, distributed order management, warehousing, packaging, and distribution. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelors Degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, Technology or related field.  Minimum 3 5 years experience working as Business Systems Analyst or similar capacity in a mid- to large-size manufacturing company.  Experience working in retail / manufacturing corporation with food and beverage experience is strongly preferred.  Experience working with food manufacturing ERP and WMS solutions is a definite plus.  Experience with Aptean / Ross ERP and warehouse management solutions is ideal.  Familiarity and experience working with different vendor packages or applications focusing on procurement, manufacturing, distributed order management, warehouse management, packaging, and distribution.  Capable of interacting and working well with both business personnel and technical resources.  Strong communication and organization skills.  Strong capabilities in multi-tasking and work prioritization.  Willing and able to focus on both new supply side solution development and enhancement / on-going maintenance efforts for Client's supply side solutions.  Capable and willing to travel within California approximately 25 30%

Name: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Loot Crate was founded in 2012 around a simple idea: put the awesomeness of Comic-Con in a box. Today, we ship some of the coolest geek, gaming, and pop-culture collectibles and accessories to a subscriber base in the hundreds of thousands (with no signs of slowing down) making us one of the top subscription box services in the world! We have assembled an amazing team of passionate, ambitious, impossibly nerdy people who cultivate our amazing fan community, provide support of the highest caliber, and generally just sit there in radiating niceness. We are always on the lookout for fun, hard-working new people to join our team and make Loot Crate even better.  As a Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst, you will specialize in delivering powerful insights through Report Development, Data Visualization and Analysis. You will be a member of the Data Science & Engineering team, which is a center of excellence for Data Science, Data Transport and Cluster Computing at Loot Crate. The role requires close collaboration with business stakeholders and teammates in requirements gathering, sprint planning, acceptance testing, and delivery of data products. To thrive in this position, you need to have a thorough understanding of our business metrics and analytics platforms. You will also need to be an effective advocate for the needs of internal data consumers. RESPONSIBILITIES:Design and implement business metrics, reports and dashboards pulling from Data MartsCollaborate with BI Developers to cleanse data and develop Data MartsCollaborate with Data Scientists on exploratory analysis and hypothesis testingCommunicate analysis results and make recommendations to Business StakeholdersServe as Product Owner for the data products consumed by various business unitsVerify that data products support the requirements of data consumers, and ensure their integrity and cleanlinessMonitor analytics and metrics results to identify and understand anomaliesSUCCESS FACTORS:An integral partner and subject matter expert for various business unitsGuaranteed data cleanliness and integrityCommitment to lifelong learning. Taking online courses, attending conferences, and experimenting with the latest software and platforms are critical to successQUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors degree in a technical field, or equivalent work experience8+ years holding similar responsibilitiesStrong understanding of e-commerce and subscription business modelsStrong knowledge of data warehousing, reporting and analytics, with expertise in defining metrics and dashboards for managers and executivesSuperior knowledge of relevant query languages and analytics platformsExcellent communication skills and ability to work in a team

Description: Recruiter Hitachi  Location Los Angeles, California  Salary Competitive  Posted 12 Nov 2018  Closes 12 Dec 2018  Ref 41312  Sector Power and Nuclear  Category Business and Commercial, Management, Skilled Trades  Contract Type Permanent  Hours Full Time  You need to sign in or create an account to save  Senior Manager, Business/ Data Analyst Lead  As Hitachi, Ltd.'s (NYSE: HIT) global consulting company, Hitachi Consulting is a recognized leader in delivering proven business and IT solutions to Global 2000 companies. We leverage decades of business process, vertical industry, and leading-edge technology experience to understand each company's unique needs. Hitachi Consulting's client base includes nearly 35 percent of the Fortune 100 and many leading mid-market companies. This leader will participate in analytical sales pursuits (proposal creation, estimation, presentations, etc.), in strategic analytical assessments, and in developing and delivering analytical solutions with a global delivery team. This program is critical to USC's overall goals to improve administrative efficiency. Workday Financials will be paired with the existing Workday HR and Payroll solutions implemented in 2013. What You'll Do:Facilitate design workshops and work closely with business owners to gather and document user stories within USC's tracking softwareTranslate user stories into detailed requirements and Workday use casesWork with project leadership and business owners to adapt requirements with an eye for business process optimizationDevelop subject matter expertise for assigned business and associated system functionalityWork collaboratively in an iterative agile 'style' environmentWork with project team members and consultants to configure the applicationHelp manage execution of the testing strategyAssist project team members in the design of new (or redesign of existing) integrationsDraft project documentation including configuration manuals and business cases (e.g., white paper, policy challenges) supporting the escalation of business decisionsMeet with customer groups to determine IT business requirementsElicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.Provide information to developers and subject matter experts for the establishment of the technical vision and performance needsServe as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development or business process re-engineering team through which requirements flowParticipate in project meetings to review project deliverables and timelines.Work with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of projectParticipate in testing developed software or new process flowPerform other duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any timeThe Must Haves:Bachelor's degree in business administration, organization development, communication or related discipline2 years of business analysis experienceStrong knowledge and understanding of project management methodologies, business process flow, and documentation procedures Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and toolsStrong oral and written communication skillsAbility to multitask, interact with multiple stakeholders and navigate changing priorities.Ability to work on moderately complex programming activities under supervision of senior IT Business AnalystExperience supporting procurement administrative processesThe Nice to Haves:3-5 years of business analyst experience focused on large enterprise software projects or supportSome experience working within a Higher Education and/or Health Care industryExperience with Workday or other Financial ERP solutions through on-going support or deploymentBenefits: USC benefits include a choice of retirement programs, 12 paid vacation days per year, 12 paid sick days per year, university holidays, a choice of medical and dental plans, and discounts to football games, basketball games, and other campus events.  Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree, Combined experience/education as substitute for minimum education  Minimum Experience: 2 years, Combined education/experience as substitute for minimum experience  Minimum Field of Expertise: Sound knowledge of documentation procedures, project management methodologies, program flow charts and operator instructions. Competent to work on moderately complex programming activities under supervision of senior IT Business Analyst.  USC is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law or USC policy. USC will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring ordinance. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Applicants with questions about access or requiring a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should contact USC Human Resources by phone at (213) 821-8100, or by email at uschr@usc.edu. Inquiries will be treated as confidential to the extent permitted by law. Name: Entry level Business Analyst
Description: About the Role: We are looking for Business Analysts who would assist our clients in applying our software applications to their organization. Come be a part of a very talented and innovated team and help ensure that the system output supports the clients operations and serves to manage their operating margins by applying your systems skill sets. Responsibilities:While working under close supervision and direction, gather and organize information on business requirements, problems and procedures.Create and maintain software development artifacts not limited to BRDs, FRDs, Data Dictionaries.Document findings of study and prepare recommendations for implementation of new systems, procedures, or organizational changes.Assist in the development, integration and definition of Systems Process procedures and roadmaps. Review documentation and analyze data gathered to develop solutions or alternative methods of proceeding.Subject to review and approval by a supervisor, provide content knowledge for ongoing process development, and sustain user base support. Assist with interviewing personnel and conduct on-site observation to ascertain unit functions, work performed, and methods, equipment, and personnel used.Qualifications:Masters DegreeStrong Communication & Technical skillsData Analysis: MS Excel, SQL querying.Responsible, dependable, quick learnerDemonstrated ability to adapt to new technologyPreferred willingness to relocate nationwide in the US for projects

Name: SaaS Implementation Business Analyst (Los Angeles)
Description: Are you experienced in working closely with external customers throughout a software implementation and enjoy traveling? Does working for an award-winning organization sound enticing to you? If you are looking for a career move that will give you all of these things, then look no further as we have a fantastic opportunity to join e-Builder as a Business Analyst. About e-Builder: Founded in 1995 and based in Plantation, Florida, e-Builder, a Trimble Company, is the pioneer of a fully integrated, cloud-based construction management software. Our client list reads as the "who's, who" in all our vertical markets: Facebook, CalTech, INOVA Healthcare, and Chicago Transit Authority to name just a few - . As one of the fastest growing companies in South Florida, we are proud to be named a 'Florida Company to Watch,' to be nominated as one of South Florida's best places to work and have our CEO named South Florida Business Journal's Ultimate CEO. We're excited to find innovative ways to combine technology with construction with a fun work environment. To learn more about our award-winning organization and corporate culture visit www.e-builder.net  In this role you will be responsible for implementing e-Builder and guaranteeing product adoption for our clients by working closely with them throughout the entire implementation lifecycle. This includes but is not limited to: Analyze client business process/requirements and develop corresponding process and data flowsPerform gap analysis activities to identify and document any possible requirement gaps as well as provide creative solutions to ambiguous business problemsDevelop materials and deliver training required for each client assigned implementationConfigure based on requirements and business rules for new/existing implementationsAssist with UAT strategies, conditions and evaluation of expected resultsCreate and distribute meeting minutes, status reports, and required documentationAttributes/Skills Required:SaaS Software implementation experienceAbility to effectively present and communication information to customers, strategic business partners, and company managementPrior experience with writing and analyzing business and system requirement documents that convey complex business analysis and technology solutionsExperience with SaaS software testing strategies, conditions and evaluation of expected resultsHistory of recommending and implementing process improvementsGeneral understanding of financial reporting (Cash flows, G.L. Accounts, etc.)Proficient experience with MS Office Suite, Visio and web technologiesCollege degree preferred If you have the ability to travel around the country up to 75% of the time and can accomplish the above then you will make you an excellent match for this position and will have what it takes to be a successful Business Analyst here at e-Builder! We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free Workplacewww.e-builder.net

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAutomotive Performance Parts industry leader is looking for a Business Analyst to join their team and be part of their ERP implementation project.  The BA will work with the ERP Project Team and users from business departments (sales, accounting, finance) in order to gather and document requirements. The BA will identify areas of conflict in a process and areas in need of improvements. BA will conduct tests on the functional areas of the new software platform and assist in user training. Duties:Serve as functional lead and subject matter expert in a functional area as part of ERP implementation project.Gather business requirementsPartake in development of conceptual business model views and business process designs.Develop necessary work products for the business process.Assist in prototyping business applications to ensure accuracy in design and applicability to user requirements.Provide guidance to less experienced members.User support for new software and procedures.Skills/Education:B.S. degree or equivalent experience.Experienced in Information Technology as Business Analyst preferred.Ability to work with Technical and Non-Technical staffExperience and strong exposure to ERP implementationOrder to Cash (Sales Tracking)Order ManagementMS Dynamics AX/D365 is a plusE-Commerce/Retail/Wholesale

Name: Systems Analyst IV
Description: Conducts business process analysis and needs analysis in an effort to align information technology solutions with business initiatives. The systems analyst will work directly and collaboratively with the business and technical teams to deliver high quality functional IT specifications, gathering and creating specifications from the business teams. Analyzes, interprets and recommends through formal proposals and presentations to bank management on new and effective ways to provide new/updated technology based business systems applications. Possesses and routinely provides broad knowledge of business analysis processes and procedures.  Has the ability to provide solutions to most business problems and serves as a resource to others in the resolution of the more complex issues. Problems encountered are frequently diverse in scope where experience and judgment is relied upon for obtaining solutions. Applies a detailed knowledge of business analysis concepts, practices and procedures to determine most effective business system applications. Fully competent to work at the highest level of all phases of business analysis.  May train and guide the work of less experienced analysts. Need the knowledge and skills in delivering requirements and functional design for internally developed products and 3rd party applications requiring customization. Requires an individual who has the ability to gather and document user requirements and translate the information collected to functional requirements including scoping documents, mock-ups, functional requirements and technical specifications. Includes data-mapping and interface mapping to databases and multiple internal and external (3rd party) applications.Basic Qualifications:*Minimum 5 years experience working with Information technologies required.*Minimum 7 years experience working in a business analysis function required.*Minimum 3 years Microsoft Office software experience required.Skills and Knowledge:Experience working as a systems analyst for banking related efforts highly preferred.Excellent of project management methodologies and procedures.Experience in Agile and Waterfall methodologies.Good written and verbal communication skills.Work in a team environment on task driven work.Work in a structured team environment on task and timeline driven work.Thorough understanding of "business needs analysis" process and how system requirements relate to daily business operations.Ability to collect requirements using a variety of methods (one-on-one, group, Jad sessions, etc).Ability to document existing and recommended flows using Visio (or like product) and ability to create use cases.Ability to interact with functional and technical counterparts to ensure that the application will meet requirement specifications.Represents basic qualifications for the position. To be considered for this position you must at least meet the basic qualifications. City National Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer -- Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans. Note: This preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Note: Candidates should be advised that City National Bank does not pay interviewee travel expenses or relocation expenses for candidates who are hired unless previously agreed.#LI-AD1#ca-ad Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Name: Bilingual Business Analyst (Japanese)
Description: AXS is a company whose core values reflect a culture that celebrates individual differences, collective achievements, and respect of one another. We start small and are never afraid to try (Be The Spark). We believe open, honest, and proactive communication builds trust and empowers us to be our best (Make it Personal). We handle our problems constructively and together (Be Real). We go above and beyond to build something truly special and lasting (Bring Your 'A' Game). Most importantly, we celebrate and communicate our success by recognizing each other across all teams and levels of our organization (Pat The Back).  Our culture is a representation of who we are now, and whom we aspire to be in the future. If you are looking for a fast-paced environment where collaboration, accountability and visibility enable you to make a difference every day, then AXS may be a perfect match.  AXS is looking for a talented and highly motivated professional to join our technology team as Bilingual Business Analyst. In this role, you will provide internal/external user support for our custom-built enterprise ticketing platform. You'll investigating root cause of software issues to figure out the best solution. If you share our passion for building great internet products, want to take on significant responsibility that will directly grow our business, and are able to work well both individually and as a team player, we want to hear from you! What you'll be doing:Eliciting, compiling, and delivering detailed product requirements to all internal functional groups required to produce a working product.Responsible for discovering, synthesizing, and analyzing information from a variety of sources to ensure product requirements align with overall company priorities.Identifying and managing solutions for systemic software bugs and discrepancies.Drive segmentation and A/B test features to maximize user satisfaction and performance.Analytics and more analytics.you will be responsible to review, analyze, and make recommendations based on data analytics.Performing user acceptance testing.Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.Serving as a liaison between business stakeholders and the technology team.Skills and experience we're seeking:Fluent in Japanese in written and verbal capacities.Bachelor of degree in business, or related field or and MBA.Minimum 4 years of experience in business analysis, product management, applications/software development, or ERP systems support.Proven success in building products that are scalable and flexible.Excellence in problem solving, troubleshooting, and critical thinking.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Knowledge of iterative software development frameworks.Ability to stay organized in a highly demanding environment.Experience with using ticketing systems such as JIRA, Trello, etc.Excellent documentation skills.Experience in drafting requirements and delivering software solutions.Exemplary customer service skills across various levels of an organization.Ability to travel as needed.And you'll really get our attention if you have:Ticketing / sports and live entertainment experience.Experience synthesizing key learnings from research, user data and competitive benchmarks.Direct web development coding experience.Advance technical skills. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, AXS is a leading ticketing, data, and marketing solutions provider in the US, UK and Europe. The company and its solutions empower more than 200 clients teams, arenas, theaters, clubs and colleges to turn data into action, maximize the value of all their events and create joy for fans. AXS is an enterprise event technology platform that services venues, promoters and sports teams; providing fans the opportunity to purchase tickets directly from their favorite venues via a user-friendly ticketing interface. AXS serves all phases of the event life-cycle beyond just ticketing, through its consumer facing website, AXS.com and the AXS App. To learn more about the company and our employment opportunities, please visit us at www.axs.com

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: In this role, the Senior Business Analyst will work with the entire Zest client engagement team, including world class modelers, product management leadership, and engineers, to showcase the compelling business value our machine learning expertise brings to our high profile clients. The Senior Business Analyst will have the opportunity to build client-facing skills while becoming an expert on the application of machine learning to credit-specific business problems.In this role, you will:Drive analytical projects to help our clients optimize financial product design and credit policyDrive strategic insights to deliver business value to clientsWork closely with a team of data scientists to build machine learning models against specific business objectivesCoordinate across functions of the business to extract insights from our client engagements and drive the ZAML product development feedback loopWe are looking for:Bachelor's Degree in analytical/quantitative field (Economics, CS, Philosophy, Engineering, Math) from a highly competitive school. MBA preferred4+ years of experience in complex, data-driven problem solving4+ years of experience in tactical problem solving. Experience implementing large projects preferredTop 1% quantitative analytics skillsStrong interpersonal, leadership, and communication skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environmentPerks and benefits:People the best part of ZestRobust healthcare plans, matching 401K and unlimited vacation timeDog friendly office with lounge areas, video games and gigantic jigsaw puzzlesOn-site gym with yoga, salsa, and other employee run fitness classesGenerous family leave policy (6 month maternity leave/3 month paternity leave)Tuition reimbursement, conference allowance and Zest talksComplimentary massages, manicures, pedicures and moreDaily catered lunches from LAs best restaurants and fully stocked kitchenAbout ZestFinance:ZestFinance, Inc. applies its unique credit-decisioning technology platform based on data science and machine learning to help lenders effectively predict credit risk so they can increase revenues, reduce risk and ensure compliance. ZestFinance was founded in 2009 by Douglas Merrill and a team of former Google employees with the mission of making fair and transparent credit available to everyone.We are committed to diversity in hiring, professional development, and everyday discussion. Zest is determined to hire crazy smart people who are different from each other to create broad thinking, lots of different ideas, and by extension, the best team possible.

Name: CGM - Front Office Risk Analyst
Description: Apply now Job no: CGM-943790 Work type: Full time Location: London Group: Commodities and Global Markets Division: Central Recruiter: Melissa RampaulYou will assist the business with product valuations, risk methodologies and system improvements, including the evaluation of new products. You’ll engage with all desks on a variety of queries from booking exotic trades to setting up new products. This will include configuring tailored risk reports for both the desk and external clients; getting involved in regulatory projects from front office perspective and working with risk and settlement functions to resolve valuation questions/issues.  You will be mathematical, with programming experience ( Python, VBA preferred ) and be looking to build on your current exposure to financial markets and derivative products.  If you enjoy a wide scope and using your strong problem-solving skills in a dynamic environment, then please apply now.  Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.  Find out more about Macquarie at www.macquarie.com/about  Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.  Macquarie is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, marriage, civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, race (including colour and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief.Advertised: 29 Nov 2018 GMT Standard Time Applications close:

Name: Retail Analyst
Description: Overview The Beautiful Group is the largest owner and operator of luxury salons and spas in the world. We are based in Beverly Hills, California and operate over 1,160 locations throughout North America and Europe including Regis Salons, MasterCuts, Supercuts UK, Carlton Hair, Hennessy and others. Providing a luxurious, everyday experience is our passion - giving our guests confidence to take on the world.  Working as an integral part of the Operations team, this role supports the company's objectives by delivering business and analytical insights and ad hoc reporting. The Retail Business Analyst utilizes POS data and other data sources to deliver sales reporting, promotional analysis and identify business opportunities. The analyst will extract data, prepare the data, apply critical thinking and make recommendations that will enhance the business moving forward. ResponsibilitiesProvide analytic support to measure sales/KPI/promotional activityManage strategic projects by performing due diligence and analysis, evaluating and prioritizing strategic alternatives, developing actionable recommendationsPartner closely with Finance and other functional teams to collect relevant information, assess needs, and develop action plansCollect and analyze data to develop insightful and meaningful recommendations and solutionsPerform POS and data analysis to provide insights into sales growth, and identify opportunitiesCreates exception reporting to monitor trends, salon strengths/opportunities, areas of concernMaintain and generate standardized/ad hoc reports for field and operations teams.Develop metrics and dashboards to monitor results and progressPosition RequirementsStrong financial, analytical, and business acumen, with ability to translate date into actionable formatAbility to sustain high accuracy and work performanceStrong comprehension and problem-solving skillsDemonstrates agility in a fast paced environment, with ability to handle multiple projects at onceAbility to analyze large amounts of data quickly and provide recommendations.Positive attitude and an ability to work independently as well as collaboratively, self-prioritizing work load in a fast paced, team-oriented work environment.Strong collaboration skills and ability to build strong partnershipsPassion for beauty and serviceProficiency in Word, PowerPoint, Excel

Name: Project Manager / Business Analyst
Description: Project Manager / Business Analyst ~ Studio City ~ Media  W-2 Contract or C2C WHO IS AFFINITY? Affinity is a privately held national IT Solutions Consulting firm based in Milwaukee, WI. We serve as strategic advisors and thought leaders to our prestigious base of Fortune 500 clients. Our clients and employees value our approach as a company "big enough to do complex, high impact work, but small enough to truly care". Visit our  website to learn more about us and all the exciting things we are doing here at Affinity: www.affinityit.com.  What you will do in this role:  Do you frequently look at processes in place and think of ways they can be done easier or more efficiently? Are you creative, energetic, consultative by nature and interested in identifying and solving client business problems?  We are seeking a Project Manager/Business Analyst to join our team. You should have a blend of business and change management kills, the ability to comfortably communicate and work with all levels from users to executives while being an advocate of the business!  Project Management Organize and facilitate the necessary meetings with Project Team members and Business StakeholdersEffectively communicate, track, and communicate project status and updates as it relates to deliverables, and business outcomesUnderstand process and when to engage in escalation of issues and/or impedimentsEnsure contractual obligations are met and aligned to projectMonthly Governance Provide tracking and monthly reportsMonthly Governance Make recommendations to internal and client for process and solution improvements Business and IT Alignment Conduct interviews and workshops to gain thorough understanding of Business User processes and practicesPerform detailed analysis of system problemsProvide functional solutions that meet business needs, and translate to technical & process changesServe as an advocate for Business Users, and align with IT Leadership to provide solutions for both the short and long termMaintain awareness of changing business needs to recommend proactive optionRequirements:5-7+ years experience as a combination between Project Manager and Business Analyst (this is a hybrid role)Must possess the capability to set and explain prioritizationStrong interpersonal and diplomacy skillsProficient in business process modelingSolid understanding of Agile methodology and practices for applications projectsComfortable working within a diverse matrix environment, composed of consultants, clients, on-shore, and offshore team membersSystem agnostic, however Salesforce is the current custom base platformBachelor's Degree; preferably in Business and/or ITPrevious Project Managment/ BA work in the Entertainment / Media IndustriesExcellent communication skills both written and verbal. Able to adapt style as needed for purpose and audience.What we offer:W-2 contract with possibility of full timeFull benefits including full medical, dental, 401K, PTO and holiday, disability, life, etcA culture of collaborationChallenging work at the enterprise levelContemporary and emerging technologiesThe opportunity for high-impact workRespected partnersEntrepreneurial spiritCollaborative performance reviews and career planningPersonalized training and career developmentOpportunities for advancement Apply here or contact our fulfillment team directly! JANE KNAUS Fulfillment Leader  Direct: 310.316.3737  jknaus@affinityit.comSDL2017

Carrington has built the infrastructure necessary to maximize value during any market cycle. We are currently hiring a Business Systems Analyst to join the Carrington Mortgage Holdings team in Anaheim, CA. Consider Carrington Today!ResponsibilitiesThe Business Systems Analyst will be working with the Project Manager, the BSA will be responsible for engaging with the business to gather requirements, perform analysis and design implementation solutions. Will be deeply involved throughout the solution development lifecycle as the requirements subject matter expert and is expected to take personal responsibility and ownership for the requirements artifacts they produce under the direction of the Program/Project manager. Will perform all duties in accordance with the company’s policies and procedures, all US state and federal laws and regulations, wherein the company operates. The successful candidate must be able to work independently with guidance on key requirements provided by business partners. Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: The Sr. Business System Analyst acts as a SME to be responsible to gather, analyze, and document the business and system requirements, conduct data analyses, and identify all gaps among submissions, internal exclusions, and regulators’ responses; and reconcile the volume charts and all submissions from hospitals. The Sr. Business System Analyst is responsible to support Sr. Programmer Analyst by providing all business and system requirements, QA/UAT any relevant process and data/report results; and work with all internal and external stakeholders to ensure the success of this project accurately and timely. Responsibilities:Analyze, gather, and validate business and functional requirements; and translate them to functional requirements in Private and Public Hospital Payments programsCreate complex SQL queries to conduct comprehensive data analyses, identify all gaps among submissions, internal exclusions, and regulators’ responses; and reconcile the volume charts and all submissions from hospitals accurately & timelyUnit Test Plan & Unit TestingProject DocumentationMinimum and Preferred Qualifications:Education:Minimum Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology (IT) or related discipline that includes technology concentrations from an accredited universityA Master’s degree in Computer Science related discipline is desirable.Experience/Skills:Minimum of 7years related experience working in a managed care environment, preferably in a data analysis, operation management, and informatics positionMinimum of 7 years prior experience with State and Federal regulatory data standards and requirementsAbility to comprehend and work with HIPAA standard transaction sets, specifically 837P, 837IKnowledge of healthcare management in IPA, Hospital, Provider Network Operations, Member Enrollment, Claim Process, Medical Payment and Revenue Reporting, and Encounter submissions and measuresProficient in MS Access and Oracle database, SQL, and MS OfficeAbility to conduct comprehensive data analyses, find the root causes of the rejections and issues, and interpret business requirements, data, to identify the opportunities for the gap analysesLead, manage, and assist all aspects of the project, including gathering business and system requirements, translate to functional requirements, support Sr. Programmer analyst to reconcile all volume charts and hospital encounter submissionsAbility to take the initiatives to develop methodologies, strategic plan to optimize the process and performanceAbility to write analytical reports and comprehensive summariesAbility to effectively communicate with management and staff, as well as with external submittersAbility to prioritize and lead multiple projects concurrentlyAble to work in a fast paced environment with frequently changing work demands

Name: Senior Manager, Business/ Data Analyst Lead
Description: Senior Manager, Business/ Data Analyst LeadAs Hitachi, Ltd.'s (NYSE: HIT) global consulting company, Hitachi Consulting is a recognized leader in delivering proven business and IT solutions to Global 2000 companies. We leverage decades of business process, vertical industry, and leading-edge technology experience to understand each company's unique needs. From business strategy development through application deployment, we are committed to helping clients quickly realize measurable business value and achieve sustainable ROI.Hitachi Consulting's client base includes nearly 35 percent of the Fortune 100 and many leading mid-market companies. We offer a client-focused, collaborative approach and transfer knowledge throughout each engagement.Position Overview:Looking for a leader to join the Hitachi Insights & Analytics (I&A) consulting delivery group who has a proven track record in helping business customer gain insights into their data. This person will have a well-developed ability to identify data patterns and anomalies, have strong root-cause analysis skills, and be able to present complex findings to the business so they may make meaningful decisions. This person will have strong SQL skills to wrangle data (i.e., mine, enhance and transform) and develop deep insights, as well as strong business communication and presentation skills to communicate insights and recommendations.This leader will participate in analytical sales pursuits (proposal creation, estimation, presentations, etc.), in strategic analytical assessments, and in developing and delivering analytical solutions with a global delivery team. This person will demonstrate strong critical thinking, have natural curiosity/desire to solve the entire problem, and naturally takes ownership to drive themselves and their team to a correct and complete conclusion.Required Qualifications8 years of Business Data Analysis Skills for Analytic Efforts6 years of experience with data query methods SQL, PIG4 years of Management experience3 years of experience with leading consulting delivery teams3 years of developing / understanding end-to-end data process flows and usage scenarios2 years with data visualization (Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau, Power BI, R)Experience with working with data from ERP, SCM, and IoT sourcesStrong consulting skills including: analysis and problem solving, written and verbal communication, presentation preparation/delivery, and team collaborationStrong math skills (e.g., applied statistics, linear algebra, numeric analysis)Ability to work across a variety of database technologiesBachelor’s Degree RequiredOptional QualificationsHands-on experience with cloud-based analytical services (AWS, Azure, GCP)Experience with scripting languages (R, SPSS, SAS)6 Sigma green-belt certification with focus on root-cause analysis methodsTravel Typical travel requires consultants to be at the client location Monday-Thursday LocationUSHitachi Consulting offers excellent benefits and career growth to all employees!Hitachi Consulting Is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V “Equal Opportunity Employer: EOE - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities”·“If you need a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job at Hitachi, please send the nature of request and contact information accommodations@hitachiconsulting.com. Queries other than accommodation requests will not be responded to.

Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: Business Operations Analyst =========================== New  Rosemead, California, United States  Administration/Operations  19 hours ago Post Date ******* Requisition # for JobShare this JobJoin our Talent Network JOB SUMMARY Working under direct supervision, provides routine day-to-day  operations and administrative support for the Operations and Sourcing  teams. Collects and analyzes data. Designs reports to measure  performance of the services delivered on the account. Assists in the  development of recommendations to solve problems and issues related to  business operations and communicates with other departments as  necessary. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Compiles and analyzes a variety of operating, financial and  statistical information as needed to respond to management requests.  Coordinates work with other departments. May add commentary to  complete analysis reports.  Designs & implements reports to support account, client and sourcing  requirements.  Performs analytics and benchmark reporting (Tableau and Excel) as  required to identify opportunities to improve service delivery to  internal and external customers.  Supports monthly/quarterly reporting activities, including completion  of client/vendor scorecards. Validates that work is completed in  accordance with account Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) as well as  ensuring data integrity and accuracy.  Manages updates to account playbooks and rolls out/trains applicable  team members.  Supports the development of presentations for account team, client and  vendor meetings.  Troubleshoots and resolves simple inquiries and requests from internal  and external clients.  Performs other duties as assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. Provides  informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to  coworkers. May lead project teams and/or plan and supervise  assignments of lower level employees.  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to  perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed  below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability  required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with  disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE  Bachelor s Degree (BA/BS) or equivalent from a four year college or  university plus a minimum of two years related work experience within  one or more of the following areas: business analytics, project  management, business operations, procurement/sourcing or vendor  management; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Big Four consulting experience is a plus.  CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  None COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong  organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient,  timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to  effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to  calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or  commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. REASONING ABILITY Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to  solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires  intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.  OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES  Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel and  PowerPoint. Spreadsheet skill set to include advanced functions such  as graphics/charts, pivot tables and V-lookups. Tableau and/or  database experience preferred. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies  to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own  project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to  co-workers and supervisor.

Name: Analyst
Description: Insight Education Group is seeking a full-time analyst to support Insights work across a variety of contracts and projects. Reporting to the Director of Policy & Research, analysts are responsible for supporting members of the Service Delivery team to conduct research and data analysis; produce client-facing documents, resources and tools; and serve as point for the overall administrative and operational support across a portfolio of contracts. Analysts at Insight wear a variety of hats and their responsibilities are multi-faceted, but their work generally falls into three categories:  Service Delivery Support the work of consultants across a portfolio of projects with schools, districts, and state education agencies Business Development Support all aspects of the development and submission of proposals for new partnerships and federal grant applications Administration Print, make copies, ship materials as neededInternal project coordination; note-takingSpecific responsibilities includeCollaborate with colleagues across the organization to develop content and materials that will support the delivery of Insights services and fulfillment of Insights contracts with a variety of partnersResearch and analyze school, district, state, and national-level data and communicate outcomes succinctly and effectively to a variety of audiencesConduct research and write narrative to support the development of proposals and federal grant applicationsCopy-edit written and visual contentPrint and ship proposals and grant applications Please note, you MUST submit a cover letter with your resume to be considered for this position. Required QualificationsBachelors or masters degreeBackground in education; experience working in a school environment; experience working with educational grants/initiativesSkills/CharacteristicsAcademic writingKnowledge of education policy and research landscapeProject management, prioritization, balancing competing deadlinesSkilled in content development, specifically as it relates to educator professional development (slide decks, toolkits, reports)Analytical, highly organized, and detail-orientedAble to problem solve, work autonomously, and quickly synthesize informationEffective oral and written communicatorAble to embrace ambiguity and sometimes unpredictable nature of the workSelf-motivated, fast learner with the ability to work on a team and independentlyLocation Insight Education Group is a virtual company headquartered in Encino, CA. We seek to hire the best person for the position, regardless of location. The location for this position is flexible and we will accept candidates in either the Boston area or on the West Coast/Pacific Time Zone. Compensation Insight Education Group provides competitive compensation and an attractive benefits package including a performance-based bonus based on individual and firm success, health care coverage, and access to 401(k) accounts.  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Contracts: 1 year (Preferred)Administrative: 1 year (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred)

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: GENERAL SUMMARY: The Divisional Business Process Data Analyst is responsible for providing business and operational support for Director of Business Process Improvement. The Divisional Business Process Analyst will also assist the Regional Company Management and Field personnel with certain business process related activities such as acquisitions, SOPs, branch audits, order to cash, collection issues, improving processes by creating efficiencies, contract administration, customer master data, pricing and other ad hoc analyses related to the maintenance and integrity of data in the ERP system (SAP). This will require a seasoned professional that is data savvy and must possess exceptionally strong analytical skills. ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:Ability to draw inferences from process details and link these inferences to the big picture by considering business objectives in identifying process improvements.Audit and analyze data produced by the field sales, branch and operations functions in the SAP system.Develop and use various business reports and metrics to evaluate, interpret, and provide critical information in support of strategic and operating decisions, looking for opportunities to streamline processes and introduce efficiencies while maintaining key controls.Work with BSC and Regional Company stakeholders to identify order-to-cash process and other ARG/Customer issues impacting the customer’s ability or willingness to pay.Act as problem research liaison engaging subject matter experts including Credit/Collections, Special Handling, Central Billing Cash Applications, Sales, Customer Service, etc. in evaluating the issue and determining a course of action.Analyze product price increase processes and provide support and analysis for sales and marketing related to the accurate input and administration of customer pricing.Work closely with the VP-Finance Director of Business Process Improvement and other Business Analysts to support field personnel to understand system inputs, processes, and trends; modify, document and train employees on proper processes maintenance in the SAP system.Assist/lead acquisition data conversions and integrations as neededCoordinate acquisition activities among personnel responsible (Regional, Divisional and National)Responsible for Sale Office/Plant mergers, creations and closings.Work with BSC and Regional Company stakeholders to identify order-to-cash process and other ARG/Customer issues impacting the customer’s ability or willingness to pay.Act as problem research liaison engaging subject matter experts including Credit/Collections, Special Handling, Central Billing Cash Applications, Sales, Customer Service, etc. in evaluating the issue and determining a course of action.Support the evaluation of order-to-cash process improvement opportunities.Collaborate with the other Divisional Business Process Improvement TeamsOther duties as assigned.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:To perform this position successfully, an individual must be able to perform each job duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.Builds effective relationships both internal and external at all levels.Exceptionally strong analytical skills and a thorough understanding of how to leverage a wide variety of data and related computer tools to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the organization.Demonstrates leadership skills required to drive continuous improvement of processes.Strong SAP skills and continuous willingness to learn.Solid understanding of process improvement methodology, and ability to understand and evaluate the difference between a customer ‘want’ vs. a ‘need’.Proven ability to work effectively under deadlines and with little supervision in order to complete a high volume of paperwork accurately and on time.Proficiency with entering and extracting data into and from a computer.Required Education: · Bachelor’s degree in finance or related 3-year’s experience in related field. Required Length & Type of Experience: · Five-plus years experience in business process analysis in positions of increasing responsibility. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities (KSA’s):Strong computer skills (Google products, MS Word, Excel) and experience with SAP and Business Explorer required.Experience in working with different departments and cross-functional teams, including people development skills and leadership qualities.Ability to manage multiple priorities and juggle between Divisional and local management and demands.Strong organizational, team-building, and communication skills. The ability to work and navigate within a complex matrix organization.Able to demonstrate strong leadership skills and the ability to assume increasing responsibilities in a rapidly-changing environment. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability  Employer will consider for employment qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the FCIHO.
