Name: Database Analyst
Description: WHO WE AREAMAZING INDIVIDUALS WORKING FOR POSITIVE PEOPLE at AIDS Healthcare Foundation! Does the idea of doing something that really makes a difference in people’s lives while being well-compensated intrigue you? Are you looking to work for an organization that encourages growth and success from each and every one of its employees? If so, AIDS Healthcare Foundation is the place for you! Founded in 1987, AIDS Healthcare Foundation is the largest specialized provider of HIV/AIDS medical care in the nation. Our mission is to provide cutting edge medicine and advocacy, regardless of ability to pay. Through our healthcare centers, pharmacies, health plan, research and other activities, AHF provides access to the latest HIV treatments for all who need them. AHF’s core values are to be: • Patient-Centered  • Value Employees  • Respect for Diversity  • Nimble  • Fight for What’s Right  Aids Healthcare Foundation is seeking Sr. Database Developer to work on a regular, full-time basis. This great opportunity is to join our Information Technology Department located in Downtown Los Angeles, CA. AHF offers a competetive salary, DOE plus great benefits and an amazing work environment. STILL INTERESTED? Please continue!YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO OUR SUCCESS!A Database Developer contributes to AHF's mission by building strong and lasting client relationships through excellent interpersonal skills. Working with Partners and Directors to develop compelling propositions which target relevant client issues. Advocate for data-driven decisions, strong data governance, and other initiatives. Within their duties of partnering with management to understand and deliver performance insights and key analytics, reports or BI solutions and managing staff in accordance with organization’s policies and applicable legislation. This position has the opportunity to help enhance focus on assisting clients and provide right type of data and information to the right people in a timely manner.  The Database Developer will assist the team in providing specialized consulting services in Managed Care Data Processing and Reporting to clients across different business lines. In addition, giving feedback to their manager about how service could be improved will allow the team member to enhance their contribution.  The Data & Analytics team will be enhanced by the Database Developer‘s focus on assisting clients and executing their strategy by optimizing the use of information, and delivering a quality end product.

Name: Business Analyst - Business Operations
Description: Irvine Technology Corporation (ITC) is a leading provider of technology and staffing solutions for IT, Security, Engineering, and Interactive Design disciplines servicing startups to enterprise clients, nationally. We pride ourselves in the ability to introduce you to our intimate network of business and technology leaders – bringing you new opportunity coupled with personal growth, and professional development! Join us. Let us catapult your career! Business Analyst - Business Operations Location: Long Beach, CA  Duration: Contract-Hire IMMEDIATE NEED for a Business Analyst - Business Operations. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the charge on a 5 Star Quality Program, a new customer experience platform for healthcare plans. Responsibilities:Create informative process flows to demonstrate current state of process and recommended future state of the process. Perform process analysis using data and six sigma training and utilize process redesign concepts to implement recommendationsPerforms root cause analysis using relevant techniques and create recommendations for addressing the root causes. Pushes creative thinking beyond the boundaries of existing industry practices and client mindsets with the ability to separate what is important from the noiseGather and create business and functional specifications/requirements by facilitating cross functional meetings and workshops of business and IT stakeholders. Create user stories and use cases to define user specifications and functional requirementsCreates informative, well-organized presentations to the Senior Leadership with compelling story line and utilize data to inform decision makingAbility to understand and analyze data with strong skills in excel and SQL is preferred. Must be able to find and translate insights from the data.Work with the Project Manager to create an action plan for implementing recommendationsQuickly understands the business issues and data challenges of client's organization and industry. Ability to understand member experience and issues using outside in thinking and ability to relate to human behavior driving specific experiencesDevelops relationships with internal and external stakeholders to enable seamless implementationsCommunicates effectively with stakeholders to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions with support from project management. Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.Assists in the facilitation of team and client meetings.Functions as an expert in process redesign and process expert to the team, providing guidance as needed.Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.Requirements:Bachelor of Science in Computer Information Systems or equivalent work experience is preferred.7+ years of professional experience.5+ years of healthcare experience.Green Belt Certification required with Black belt preferredVery proficient with Visio and Workflow Diagrams to communicate current state and future state.Strong experience in writing business and functional requirements and facilitating workshop sessions to gather requirementsPerform root cause analysis using different methodologiesAbility to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully.Ability to facilitate effective cross functional team interaction.Background in Psychology, Behavioral Science, Cognitive Science is highly preferred Please send your resume to Andrew Butler, Senior Technical Recruiter for immediate consideration. Let us help you secure an interview! ABOUT US Irvine Technology Corporation (ITC) is an award-winning Information Technology Solutions and Staffing provider with roots in Southern California. For over fifteen years, we have had the privilege of serving exceptional client organizations as both a local and national resource. Our team is comprised of seasoned technologists, staffing industry thought leaders, top-notch recruiters, dedicated account executives, and a world class support staff. Irvine Technology Corporation provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Irvine Technology Corporation complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Name: Quantitative Analyst, Growth
Description: Why Work at Grindr? Since 2009, Grindr has built the world's largest social network for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. Now more than just an app, we're a family of lifestyle brands with the shared mission to connect LGBTQ people with the world around them:  Grindr The location-based social app that started it all. Over 3 million people use Grindr daily, from every country on the planet.  INTO A digital magazine dedicated to queer perspectives: news, culture, commentary, video, and more.  Grindr for Equality (G4E) Our social mission to promote justice, health, and safety for LGBTQ individuals around the globe.  Gaymoji A one-of-a-kind collection of over 500+ stickers available on iOS, Android, and in the Grindr app.  We're fueled by endless curiosity, constant collaboration, and a knack for crossing every finish line all within an agile growth environment. We also enjoy tons of perks, great social events, and stunning views from our HQ in West Hollywood. Summary Our team is growing, and we're looking to add a Quantitative Analyst to our Growth team. Simplifies complex data into dashboards to gauge ongoing performance and forecast impact.Possesses a vision of the BIG picture - sees beyond the SQL query and connect the dots to the overarching goal.Is able to easily prioritize projects and requests by their level of impactEnjoys data-driven debates with team members to ensure projects receive peak performance.Eager to work alongside product managers and creatives in a fast-pace environment. Provides data-driven recommendations to validate and optimize performance throughout stage of growth initiatives In the role, you will work directly with the growth manager and other team members to constantly be optimizing subscription performance. Moreover, cross-functional work with engineering, product, and finance is common. You will support in executing and optimizing campaigns to grow our user base and drive key recommendations and action plans to support growth while having high-visibility with a team that shapes the focus and direction of our company. ResponsibilitiesPerform in-depth data analysis to identify user behaviors (understand what makes users stay on the app) and interpret findings of the subscription business, and make recommendations to the marketing teamTrack and reporting trial conversion optimization initiatives, and communicate the business impact to the marketing and growth teamSupport cross-functional teams by collecting, cleaning, and maintaining data pipelinesAnalyze results from user upsell and cross-sell initiatives by the marketing and growth teamDerive insights through A/B tests, funnel analysis and user segmentationAssist in analytical ad-hoc projects aiming to spot usage and trends across the app and determine causationSupport revenue and lifetime value forecasting of subscribers across different offeringsSkills and QualificationsA degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative disciplineAt least 4+ years of post-collegiate in a quantitative field in finance, consumer web, subscription services or mobile companyExperience working with relational databases and SQL query languagesExperience working with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environmentQuantitative forecasting experienceSignificant experience with ExcelAbility to communicate the results of your analyses clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders Nice to have: Experience with R or PythonMandarin language proficiency a plusBenefits & Perks 100% covered medical, dental and vision insurance  Generous Parental Leave  Unlimited sick policy  Competitive Salaries  401(k)  Catered daily lunch  Stocked kitchen  Free on-site parking  Casual dress environment  Grindr is an equal opportunity employer  *Recruiting firms that submit resumes to Grindr without first entering into a written contract will not be entitled to any compensation on candidates referred by that firm.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DutiesJob QualificationsJob DutiesResponsibilitiesThe Department of Medicine’s Division of Infectious Diseases is engaged in the management of the AIDS Clinical Trials Group (ACTG), a cooperative group funded by the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID), and other collaborating NIH Institutes and Centers, as well as industry partners. The ACTG is an international, multicenter clinical trials network to advance therapeutics in HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and viral hepatitis. This operation requires coordination of a research and clinical trials infrastructure that includes the fields of virology, immunology, pharmacology, mycobacteriology, specimen banking, clinical trials design, clinical trials data management, and new drug and laboratory testing regulatory affairs. The Financial Analyst is responsible for assisting in the maintenance of the financial responsibilities of the ACTG Leadership and Operations Center (LOC) for the Network. Under minimal direction, the financial analyst will perform financial management for all accounts in the UCLA ACTG to include: Compile and analyze fiscal information to be used for preparation of the ACTG’s annual budget. Prepare financial reports, monthly statements, overdraft reports, and design and maintain on-line and manual financial reporting systems. Analyze personnel and financial information, define problems, formulate logical solutions, develop alternative solutions and make recommendations. Complete bookkeeping transactions and prepare various related forms. Perceiving and Defining cause and effect relationships between expenditure rates and budgetary projections. Prepare complex calculations including algebraic equations and forecasting. Administer multiple complex accounts from federal and private agencies. Manage a heavy workload with constant interruptions, changing priorities and competing demandsJob QualificationsQualificationsAnalytical skills to assess financial information, practices and procedures, define problems, formulate logical solutions, develop alternative solutions and to make recommendations. Ability to identify and resolve complex financial problems. Skill in perceiving and defining cause and effect relationships between expenditure rates and budgetary projections. Mathematical skills to prepare complex calculations including algebraic equations and forecasting. Skill in analyzing information to discover errors and to formulate and initiate corrective actions. Ability to track and project expenses to specific end date. Skill in the administration of complex multiple accounts from federal and private agencies. Ability to manage a heavy workload with constant interruptions and changing priorities and to ensure completion of all work in a timely manner. Demonstrate ability to use MS Windows, Ms Excel, MS Word , Adobe Acrobat software packages to perform word processing, database management and spreadsheet analysis. Demonstrate ability to use spreadsheet and database software to analyze, design and write financial system programs on an IBM computer system. Ability to establish and maintain rapport with University faculty and staff, as well as with people from non-University entities, to effectively and efficiently solve problems and function as part of a team. Ability to use judgment when dealing with confidential or sensitive information. Verbal skills to clearly and concisely convey complex information to faculty and staff. Skill in organizing and maintaining accurate, up-to-date bookkeeping records on-line. Skill in establishing and maintaining alpha/numeric files. Reading skills to comprehend University policy and procedure manuals. Skill in working independently and following through on assignments with minimal direction. Skill in writing concise, logical and grammatically correct business correspondence. Preferred: Demonstrate knowledge of University Purchasing, Material Management, and General Accounting policies and procedures. Knowledge of the University’s extramural fund and gift tender process.

Name: Budget/Business Analyst - IS Portfolio Management Office
Description: Minimum Education:Bachelors Degree in Accounting or Finance requiredMinimum Experience/Knowledge:2-4 years of accounting or financial analysis experience in a hospital or similar environment (Information Technology knowledge a plus)2-4 years of purchasing or procurement experience.Required License/Certification:Fire and Safety Certification. If no card upon hire, one must be obtained within 30 days of hire, and maintained by renewal before expiration date. Supports the Information Technology Department with budget and financial record keeping and budget analysis. Has the ability to perform multiple projects, meet deadlines, and communicate effectively with department Directors, managers and staff. Performs the purchasing function (quoting and invoicing) for the IT department.  USC is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law or USC policy. USC will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring ordinance. Name: Senior Corporate Security Business Analyst
Description: ENERGY FOR WHAT’S AHEADAre you looking to make a difference in your career? We’re working on smarter grids, cleaner energy and tools to help people manage energy more efficiently.About Corporate Security:The primary responsibility of Corporate Security is to protect worker safety, prevent crime on SCE property, and mitigate risks of physical attacks to critical infrastructure. Physical security operations within Corporate Security covers contract security officer services, the Edison Security Operations Center (ESOC), investigation of security incidents and threats, intelligence-gathering, the SCE Badging Office, NERC Physical Security compliance, and background investigations and PRAs.Position Overview:You will provide strategic, analytical, technical support for business and security planning activities. You will also collaborate with Corporate Security planning teams and business clients to identify, collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation (using appropriate tools and models) from which business cases and initiative roadmaps are developed. Conducts business case development, designs presentations and performs business process analysis to ensure integration, communication, alignment and proper hand-offs.You may act as a leader for business planning applications, performance metrics, Excel analytics, and other business support systems. Performs problem analysis, directs implementation of resolution and mitigation. Will ensure all appropriate planning artifacts are completed.Typical Responsibilities:Business Analysis – Lead analysis of business requirements and the development of operational requirements and specifications to address complex business needs.You will performs statistical analysis to support a wide variety of business initiatives to integrate work across related areas, develop business strategies and services, improve client satisfaction and productivity, manage risks appropriately, execute business plans, and coordinate information.Gathers, documents, analyzes, and draws conclusions or presents recommendations on data and information; plans or assists in analyses, presentations, and implementation strategies for some complex analysis or for a portion of a complex analysis. Business Intelligence – You will share valuable input to business intelligence roadmaps and development plans. Including ad-hoc report development and data mining.Corporate Security Partnerships – You will collaborate with key business partners and Corporate Security teams, leads work to understand business priorities, identify strategic initiatives. Assesses business imperatives and goals and articulates them as Corporate Security needs.Facilitates translation of business needs to develop business cases.Partners with business and security partners to elicit, analyze, translate, and document business requirements into security requirements. Identify gaps in the potential capabilities and communicate to internal decision makers.Project Management – Coordinates projects/programs, process improvement efforts, performance analytics/metrics, optimization, cost budgets, project resources to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget. Including the creation, tracking and coordination of the investment planning documents (Investment and project proposals)Process Improvement – You will lead gathering business requirements, and related processes and the identification and training on the use of appropriate tools to support the work intake and routing processes. Develops, analyzes, and tracks performance metrics.Work Management - You will effectively works independently and within a team environment. Independently determines and develops approach to solutions. Minimum QualificationsFive years of experience in the field of analysisExperience defining requirementsDesired QualificationsBachelor Degree in applicable profession, business, or technical discipline or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.Experience in defining requirements, project scope, and performing cost/benefit analysis.Experience with physical security and planning applications.Ability to make effective decisions that meet business needs while minimizing risk and operating within company policies and all levels of regulations.COMMENTSCandidates for this position must be legally authorized to work directly as employees for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.Relocation does not apply to this position.Additional testing may be administered as part of the selection process. Southern California Edison, an Edison International (NYSE:EIX) company, serves a population of approximately 15 million via 5 million customer accounts in a 50,000-square-mile service area within Central, Coastal and Southern California. Join the utility leader that is safely delivering reliable, affordable electricity to our customers for over 125 years.SCE is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Job SummaryJob Description: Domain:  Mortgage Lending expertiseMinimum 8+ years of experience RequiredRequired Skills:  Strong Business Analysist with good communication skills and Mortgage Lending expertise (must)Desired Skills:  preferably with working knowledge Loan Origination systems like Encompass.Job Type: ContractExperience:Business Analyst: 7 years (Preferred)

Name: Business Analyst - Cash Product Office
Description: The Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco (Bank) believes in the diversity of our people, ideas, and experiences and are committed to building an inclusive culture that is representative of the communities we serve.  Business Analyst Primary location: Los Angeles, CA.  Open to secondary locations of: San Francisco, CA, Seattle, WA, Cleveland, Ohio & Richmond, VA.  The Federal Reserve System Cash Product Office (CPO) has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst. In this role in the CPO's National Operations group, you will support a variety of projects and tasks that may include operations support, inventory management, third party vendor program management, market intelligence, and business resiliency for the Federal Reserve System. The CPO's primary goal is to provide leadership and strategic direction for the Federal Reserve Cash Services function to ensure continued fulfillment of the Federal Reserve's mission. About the Cash Product Office: The mission of Federal Reserve Cash Services (FedCash® Services) is to supply currency and coin to meet both domestic and international demand, maintain the quality and integrity of currency and coin in circulation, and ensure depository institutions have ready access to Cash Services.  The national Cash Product Office (CPO) provides strategic direction and operational support for FedCash® Services. The CPO provides operational guidance and technology strategies for U.S. currency and coin supplied to depository institutions by the twelve Federal Reserve Banks and their branches. In coordination with the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, the CPO formulates policies related to the handling of coin and currency. Highlights of the Position:Prepare, interpret, and present a variety of operational analyses and presentations, including weekly/monthly reports, analyses of large datasets, and recommendations to executive management for decision-making. Examples include status reports, dashboards, and development of ad-hoc business models and papers.Perform day-to-day project management and administration tasks in support of department-led projects and initiatives in a collaborative, team-based environment.Establish and maintain effective customer relations with Reserve Bank peers, management, and industry partners to meet short, mid, and long term national objectives.Collaborate with all levels of the organization and industry partners on decisions and strategic options that may have operational, policy, or financial impacts to the business area.Prepare and present information to diverse partners within and outside of the organization.Develop, implement, and lead analytical and operational projects and actively find opportunities for further refinement of existing processes and initiate analysis supporting cash operations and processes.Utilize varied data points and moderate to complex information to distill it into meaningful results.Some travel (up to 15% of the time) will be required based on assignments.Qualifications:Undergraduate Degree in Business or related subject3 years of related experienceStrong skills in the area of:analytics, problem solving, critical thinking, organization, prioritization, multi-tasking, and follow-through;verbal and written communication skills; ability to interact and work successfully with all levels of staff/management;proven ability to work independently and within a teamleading/facilitating meetings/project groups; andpresenting qualitative and quantitative information to audiences, in person and via phone or video conferenceProven expertise in spreadsheet and database development for the purposes of manipulating, dissecting, analyzing, and presenting data, highlights and trends, using the Microsoft office product suite such as MS Excel, Access, and SharePoint. Demonstrated expertise in presentation development.Ability to coordinate and work with diverse groups of subject matter experts in person, via phone, video conference, and written communications.Ability to work effectively with or without direct supervision, in teams or independently.Strong communicator who takes complex scenarios and breaks them down in an articulate and simplistic manner.Strong personal initiative, excellent time management, project management, problem solving and organizational skills.Strong leadership and influence skills, adept written communication skills, dynamic verbal communicator, accomplished analytical skills.Desired Skills:MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visio)Expertise in data visualization software tools such as Tableau or Power BIMinimum of 2 years Reserve Bank Cash operation experience, or comparable commercial Bank Cash operations experience The Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity Employer.SDL2017

Name: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Loot Crate was founded in 2012 around a simple idea: put the awesomeness of Comic-Con in a box. Today, we ship some of the coolest geek, gaming, and pop-culture collectibles and accessories to a subscriber base in the hundreds of thousands (with no signs of slowing down) making us one of the top subscription box services in the world! We have assembled an amazing team of passionate, ambitious, impossibly nerdy people who cultivate our amazing fan community, provide support of the highest caliber, and generally just sit there in radiating niceness. We are always on the lookout for fun, hard-working new people to join our team and make Loot Crate even better.  As a Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst, you will specialize in delivering powerful insights through Report Development, Data Visualization and Analysis. You will be a member of the Data Science & Engineering team, which is a center of excellence for Data Science, Data Transport and Cluster Computing at Loot Crate. The role requires close collaboration with business stakeholders and teammates in requirements gathering, sprint planning, acceptance testing, and delivery of data products. To thrive in this position, you need to have a thorough understanding of our business metrics and analytics platforms. You will also need to be an effective advocate for the needs of internal data consumers. RESPONSIBILITIES:Design and implement business metrics, reports and dashboards pulling from Data MartsCollaborate with BI Developers to cleanse data and develop Data MartsCollaborate with Data Scientists on exploratory analysis and hypothesis testingCommunicate analysis results and make recommendations to Business StakeholdersServe as Product Owner for the data products consumed by various business unitsVerify that data products support the requirements of data consumers, and ensure their integrity and cleanlinessMonitor analytics and metrics results to identify and understand anomaliesSUCCESS FACTORS:An integral partner and subject matter expert for various business unitsGuaranteed data cleanliness and integrityCommitment to lifelong learning. Taking online courses, attending conferences, and experimenting with the latest software and platforms are critical to successQUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors degree in a technical field, or equivalent work experience8+ years holding similar responsibilitiesStrong understanding of e-commerce and subscription business modelsStrong knowledge of data warehousing, reporting and analytics, with expertise in defining metrics and dashboards for managers and executivesSuperior knowledge of relevant query languages and analytics platformsExcellent communication skills and ability to work in a team

Name: Business Systems Analyst - Financial Systems
Description: Business Systems Analyst of Financial Systems will be part of Oracle ERP Cloud and other suite of applications in the Finance area. This role belongs in IT and will act as System Analyst for all financial applications.  Required Qualifications  All qualified candidates must possess the following core qualifications:  Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V 1+ years of experience with Oracle Financial cloud (aka Oracle ERP Cloud, Oracle Cloud Fusion Financials), procurement cloud and overall 3+ years of deep experience in corporate finance area.Functional design and deep understanding of General Ledger (GL), Sub-ledger Accounting (SLA), Fixed Assets, Accounts Receivables, Accounts Payable, Projects billing and costing, Cash Management, procure to Pay (P2P).Help and lead in documentation of business requirements, functional design, testing of functionality, creating mapping documents of legacy and new systems.Involved in mapping business requirements to the base product functionality to present a product fit. Lead complex functional analysis and review the solution overview, functional designs, technical designs, configuration within the project. Overall contributor to deliver a fully-functioning solution to the business.Design and develop reporting solutions using BI publisher (BIP), Oracle Transaction Business Intelligence (OTBI), Financial Reporting Studio (FRS), Smart View and BI cloud service (BICS). Deliver analytic dashboards, alerts and scheduled jobs for security audits, risk assessment, sensitive data accessibility and expense and payables related transaction anomalies.Execute data conversion activities, perform deep dive sessions to map legacy data with Oracle FBDI (File Based Data Integrator) and HDL (HCM Data Loader) templates. Prepare comprehensive data mappings sheets to ensure business continuity post go-live. Lead data conversion team and responsible for high volume data conversion execution on time for successful go-livesPerform feasibility analysis on future potential project efforts and technology roadmaps. Investigate benefits and drawbacks of innovative strategies, technologies, processes and products. Present strategies, technical research, architecture and best practices at internal technical conferencesProvide help in defining systems strategy, developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping practical business solutions, identifying and consulting on business process transformation, optimization and best-practice initiatives, testing, training, managing go-live and system cutovers, defining support proceduresHelp with cut-over activities: Define security roles, user creation, configuration, code migration, data conversion execution for INT, UAT and go-live milestones.SDL2017

Name: Business/Data Analyst Intern-Coop - Boston
Description: Job Description IBM CIO (Chief Information Office) Organization is looking for innovative talent for our Boston area locations who bring fresh new ideas to create a productive environment for all IBMers across the globe through our internship program offering. Our mission is to provide the best work experience in a digital workplace to all IBM employees and consequently positively impact on the way IBM deliver what our clients need.  Are you interested in working in an innovative and collaborative environment for the summer? If so, this is your chance to work in the first IBM area to become agile and to create meaningful solutions that impact our technology and business transformation for a new business era - all in just one summer!Required Technical and Professional Expertise Experience with User Experience (UX) designMinimum of 1-year experience using problem solving skills such as: Analyze causes using existing techniques or tools, prepare and recommend solution alternativesAbility to absorb professional knowledge quickly and develop skillsAbility to draw upon professional concepts to collaborate with others to carry out assigned dutiesAbility to challenge the validity of given procedures and processes with the intent to enhance and improveEnrolled in a Bachelor of Science in Business Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or a similar degree programAbility to work in the United States without the need for current or future IBM sponsorship Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Experience using Agile and Design Thinking methodologiesExperience working with leaders of designExperience writing user stories and requirements documents using analytical skills EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Business Process Improvement Analyst ($27.00-$30.00/hr)
Description: At First Entertainment Credit Union, we believe that every story matters - that includes our members, employees, community, and those interested in joining our growing team. The Credit Union has served its members since 1967 and has grown to manage over $1.5 Billion in assets. Today, First Entertainment is the financial partner for the creators of entertainment and those who support them.  We are looking for talented individuals who are passionate about member service and teamwork, have a deep sense of respect and integrity for their co-workers and our members and are also driven to pursue excellence in all that they do. We are constantly aiming for higher goals that depend upon growth-minded individuals who share our core values and vision.  If you are looking for a workplace where you can make a positive impact for our members and opportunities for advancement, read on!  Under the limited supervision of the Business Process Improvement Manager, the Business Process Improvement Analyst will be responsible for analyzing organizational processes, recommending improvements and leading project teams in implementing improved processes. Uses past experience along with superior analytical, technical, and writing skills to identify redundancies, unnecessary steps, and inefficiencies to set forth process improvement measures. The Business Process Improvement Analyst will effectively document each BPI project, communicate with project staff and be responsible for delivering projects on time, in scope, and meeting process goals.  Responsibilities: Use critical analysis skills to examine process data and prioritize which improvement projects will most effectively support enterprise level strategies.Engage project sponsors and stakeholders to create project related support material.Use business process information, gathered through expert user interviews and existing documents, to create accurate process maps that include decision points, process owners, work areas, and objectives.Collaborate with process owners to map new process designs that eliminate non-value added tasks, combine or rearrange tasks for streamlining and/or create new steps if required to meet objectives. Work cohesively with development team to implement streamlined processes.Use provided tools, and when needed develop new tools, to gather all the required Key Process Indicators (KPI) in order to precisely document process efficiency, both before and after improvement completion. Qualifications: High school graduate, two-year college degree or equivalent preferred, or completion of a specialized course of study in a relevant field at a business or trade school.A minimum of three to five years of work-related experience in a full-service financial institution or experience in a related position in a related field.Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusion or approaches to complex problems.Strong problem-solving skills to effectively research, investigate, and offer solutions to issues that are more complex and difficult in nature.Work requires analytical ability, judgment, and ingenuity.Flexible and adaptable to change.Able to handle multiple tasks, responsibilities and/or projects.Knowledge of how to use a personal computer and project management tools.Ability to resolve interpersonal conflict and miscommunications.Good knowledge of analytical and process documentation tools such as Visio and other data visualization tools and techniques. Certifications: Project Management and/or Lean/Six Sigma certification preferred.Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Description: Job Description• Leads the analysis, workflows and requirements gathering of the Company’s portfolio of emerging applications and reporting/analysis tools as part of an integrated team.  • Learn, own and become expert at the Company’s technical business processes in the areas of Contributions, Eligibility, Employer Compliance, and Claims.  • As needed, assume Product Owner role as assigned on Agile team development projects.  • Provides consultation and proactively proposes process improvements to internal stakeholders where applicable.  • Collaborates and coordinates tasks between the business analysis and the development teams.  • Identifies areas for improvement, proposing features and functionalities to new or existing processes where appropriate to enhance user experience.  • Follow best practices to ensure the delivery of high quality work in the development of assigned projects and tasks.  • Protect operations by keeping all information confidential.  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Does not have to be Healthcare. Insurance, Banking, Finance etc. all workable but experience with Anthem and Healthcare Claims ideal. Entertainment Finance would work as well. Name: Business Systems Analyst Manager
Description: Job Title: Business Systems Analyst Manager Are you a skilled Business Systems Analyst with leadership experience? Do you love to work with people? This is your chance to work for a trusted and reliable name in the industry. Our client is a leader in investment and banking services, with nearly 100 offices in over 6 major metropolitan areas in the U.S. This company is a household name and has been for over 60 years and counting. As a Business Systems Analyst Manager:You will lead a team of six business systems analysts working on several financial-related projectsYou will partner closely with business and technical teams on appropriate tasksAdditionally, you will:Handle resource loading, project planning, work allocation, training, and facilitationAnalyze and resolve business needs, support proposals, and recommend solutions for business cases (including deadline and budget estimates)Gather user requirements to build and deliver functional IT specificationsDocument existing and recommended flows and build use casesPerform data evaluation, data mapping, and interface mapping to databases and multiple internal/external applicationsWe are looking for someone who can:Lead team in supporting improvements and new functionalities for end user applications/systemsDeliver requirements and functional design for internally-developed products and customizable third-party applicationsProvide mentorship on applicable methodologies, systems and business processesConduct staff performance reviews and provide constructive feedbackWhat Gets You the Job?2 to 3 years of recent, formal experience leading business analysts7+ years’ experience as a Business/Systems Analyst with proven successful management and leadership of multiple projects5+ years’ overall information technology experienceFinancial/banking experience is requiredProven knowledge of both Agile and Waterfall methodologiesIn-depth analysis experience including resource allocation systems/process improvements3+ years’ experience using MS Office software, platform and programsUnderstanding of scoping documents, mockup, functional requirements and technical specificationsEffective communication and interpersonal skills (written, verbal, presentation)Ability to communicate technical- and business-related informationExcellent organization and prioritization skills We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.- provided by Dice  Team management (not PM), previous experience as Systems Analyst, SQL, WebServices, data mapping, interfaces, agile, waterfall, data transformation, workflow diagrams, MSOffice, JAD sessions

Name: SAP FICO Business Analyst
Description: At 99 Cents Only Stores, LLC, we are recruiting talented individuals for the position of SAP FICO Sr. Business Analyst.  99 Cents Only Stores is a unique extreme value retailer of primarily name brand consumables and general merchandise. We provide an exciting primary shopping destination for value-conscious consumers, and a fun treasure-hunt shopping experience for individuals and families in our communities! Our corporate associates support our stores in delivering an exemplary experience to customers with a fun, friendly and energetic approach, resourceful problem-solving, and innovating ideas that bring great products at great value to families throughout the communities we serve. We offer competitive medical, dental and vision plans, an outstanding 401K plan, and fantastic career opportunities! If this sounds like your next career step, read on!  The Position  The SAP FICO Sr. Business Analyst will be responsible for working with business users to identify and resolve process and technical related production issues in the SAP FICO space as well as for defining, configuring and coordinating the development of enhancements that help improve the business process, user experience, data quality and/or information availability.  Duties and Responsibilities Supports Accounts Payable, Fixed Asset Accounting, Banking, and the Controller's Office by resolving production support issues and identifying and addressing the root causes be it internal to SAP, in the inbound or outbound interfaces, or related to business process / user-training.Performs analysis of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into proper system requirement specifications. Coordinates custom development with the off-shore ABAP development team.Assists with project management by playing a key role in planning, testing, and implementation of new, non-SAP software applications and enhancements supporting the Finance and Accounting organization.Works independently as a "self starter" to liaison with the business to identify, prioritize and define business requirements for SAP enhancements and change requests in the FICO module.Is responsible for all FICO configuration in the system to support current and evolving business needs.Works on multiple, simultaneous projects of which he/she will apply their applicable technical and system functionality background.Facilitates and elicits customer, user, systems administration, operations and support requirements from project stakeholders.Reviews and edits requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solutions.Understanding and communicating priority, risk, benefit, effort, stability and organizational impact of business initiatives and re-engineering efforts.Pushes creative thinking beyond the boundaries of existing industry practices and mindsets.Ensures completion of all deliverables according to user expectations and within schedule, budget and quality constraints. Skills and Requirements Highly motivated self-starter who can work with minimal supervision and inspire teams.Deep experience in end-to-end SAP Accounts Payable processes (LIV "matching" process, invoice management, blocking, unblocking, variance approvals, reversals, etc.).Knowledge of OpenText VIM a big plusExperience with bank payment files (ACH, Wire, Positive Pay) and inbound EBS MappingExperience with Asset Management (internal orders, asset creation, depreciation, impairment, etc.)Solid knowledge of G/L maintenance, account determination, Profit/Cost center accounting, standard FICO reporting and experience with custom FICO reportsExperience with Winshuttle a plusUnderstanding of end-to-end Procure to Pay cycle and material costing (how PO pricing, delivery costs and freight affect moving average cost; understanding of PPV accounts and the GR/IR clearing process)Experience working with end-business users in Finance/Accounting (AP, Fixed Assets, General Accounting, Bank Management, Planning)Excellent communication skills7-9 years FICO experienceExperience in Retail or CPG industry a plusMinimum BS/BA in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Systems or related degree or 7+ years' experience as a Business/Systems Analyst, Business Process Engineer or Project Manager.Ability to work with end-users and translate requires into requirements and train users on end-solutions.Experience working and coordinating with off-shore development partners.Technical knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel and Visio).Consistent record of delivering high-quality services to Business Partners.Strong analytical, organizational and teamwork skills.Experience with cross-functional teams consisting of developers, business analysts, architects, and testers.Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the enterprise including senior-level executives, business users, and entry-level developers, and store employees.Ability to balance multiple priorities simultaneously. 99 Cents Only Stores, LLC operates nearly 400 stores in California, Texas, Arizona, and Nevada, and employs over 16,000 individuals proudly serving their communities! 99 Cents Only Stores, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionA global professional services firm seeks a Financial Analyst to join their Los Angeles team.  Responsibilities: Providing project management-focused financial and analytical support for the firm.Assisting in the integration of new technology solutions by performing data integrity and report accuracy checks, interfacing with the Technology department to make improvements, and developing training on how to use these solutionsMonitoring and responding to requests initiated for project management support. This includes the development of financial reports, Key Performance Indicator (KPI) dashboards, budget templates, client reporting templates, task code reports, and general matter maintenance.Summarizing large volumes of data in executive summary reports, develop financial models, provide billing summaries, and deliver analytical support to partners, Finance and Accounting department management, and other department managers as requested, while accomplishing these and other critical functions:Retrieving routine financial information from firm financial systems pertaining to client project performance and creating reports for management and attorneys to review.Handling basic and routine requests regarding client billing history, inventory balances, timekeeper statistics, and rate comparisons.Performing data integrity and report accuracy checks as requested and partnering with the Technology department to identify areas for improvement.Preparing recurring reports related to client statistics and firm financial metrics.Assisting the team with report and workflow documentation.Maintaining detailed records documenting procedures and assumptions, methodologies and sources of information employed during the performance of all analytical tasks.Preparing ad-hoc financial analysis related to client statistics and firm financial metrics.Assisting team with administrative tasks pertaining to process efficiency, documentation, data entry, cross-training, and project tracking. Qualifications: Moderate Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word skills are required. Knowledge of Microsoft Access, Visual Basic & SQL, and Elite 3E is a plus.Knowledge of reporting applications, including SAP Business Objects, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, and QlikView is also a plus.Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, Statistics, or related fields, is required.1-2 years of analytical experience in finance, accounting, or project management is desired.Experience responding to ad-hoc requests, developing analysis, and producing reports is also desired. Prior experience managing costs, fees, and budgets is required, and previous experience in a customer-focused position is a plus.  #zr

Description: Job DescriptionMust have experience supporting and maintaining financial systems, and general accounting knowledge. The Senior Business Systems Analyst will focus on 5 key areas of responsibility: Business Engagement, Project Delivery, Project Management, Quality Assurance, and Production Support while interacting with on and offshore development resources, vendors, professional service providers, and global business partners. Name: Business System Analyst - LIMS
Description: Business System Analyst - LIMS  If you are a MES Systems Administrator, please read on!  Are you ready to work for a company dedicated to saving the lives of children?! We are a leader in the Life Sciences industry focused on serving children who are born into the NICU. Our nutritional product line is provided to critically ill, premature infants who need immediate assistance once born. We are a company committed to pushing the envelope forward and have built an established team of scientists and engineers who are also committed to our mission. Many of our employees share an experience in their own lives that relates to our work and drives their passion to be part of our team. Our engineering team is critical to our business and we are currently hiring an MES Systems Administrator to develop and implement FDA compliant IT systems. If you are ready to join a company that is making an impact on our human population today, we are the company for you! Name: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Avvo is changing what it means for consumers to find professional legal help. Every year millions of people seek professional legal assistance and Avvo has profiles for nearly all 1.3 million US registered lawyers on our platform. We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst with a track record helping consumer-focused companies grow.  You are an organized self-starter with a keen business sense who loves digging into data to understand trends and performance. You have a passion for translating data into insights to find opportunities for growth and can effectively communicate them internally.  You are a creative thinker who can recommend, plan, and execute an analytical approach that results in actionable business improvements. You’re also a great teammate who likes a rapidly changing environment and wants to join a company that offers a ton of opportunity to build your skills. In this role, you will:Serve as a subject matter expert and mentor around data analysis and related best practices to business partners.Provide guidance, mentorship, and technical expertise to a junior analyst.Collaborate with agile engineering teams to design flexible solutions to support analytic needs.Produce recommendations and insights for key partners that will help shape business decisions.Apply a broad range of analytical approaches, from back-of-envelope approximations, to what-if scenarios, to deep dives, uncovering patterns in order to identify trends and new opportunities.Develop visualizations and other methods for conveying key insights and reports.Deliver presentations to senior leadership, including C-level executives, to explain and illustrate complex analytical findings.Simplify and automate reporting, audits, and other data-driven activities; build solutions to have maximum scale and self-service ability by partners.Support the business with time-critical data analyses. Required Qualifications:5+ years’ experience in a hands-on analytical role with a focus on analyzing business problems.Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.Highly proficient in tools used for data analysis and reporting (SQL, Excel, Tableau).Ability to communicate complex quantitative analyses and business needs in a clear, precise, and actionable manner to diverse audiences.Strong Communication skills, able to simplify complex topics for a variety of audiences and present in person as well as virtually. Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of Python.Experience with web analytics.Experience with data modeling and KPI definition.Experience working with Marketing, Product and Sales teams.  Success starts with having the right people. At Internet Brands, we value and mentor each member of our growing team. We seek out talented, goal-oriented professionals who live and breathe the Internet and thrive in a flexible but challenging work environment. Our team of innovators has enabled Internet Brands to sustain high levels of profitability and success while evolving along with the Internet for over 20 years. At IB, we promote an entrepreneurial, friendly culture that applauds innovation and results while embracing change and independence. Our employees are intensely driven and constantly encouraged to reach higher and use creativity to achieve success – all the while enjoying high levels of collaboration and the luxury of coming to work in jeans and sneakers. We are proud to offer a unique blend of the innovation of a start-up with the history, stability, and benefits of an established corporation.  Internet Brands and its wholly owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Retail Business Strategy Analyst, Assistant Vice President
Description: Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) the world's 5th largest financial group in the world with total assets of over $2.4 trillion (as ranked by SNL Financial, April 2016) and 140,000 colleagues in nearly 50 countries. In the U.S., we're 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. We achieve this by delivering on our values, putting people first, fostering long-term relationships built on honesty and mutual understanding, and inspiring the best in each other. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Join a team that's working to fulfill its vision to be the world's most trusted financial group. Job Summary: Provides comprehensive and complex financial and business analyses for the Branch and Private Banking team. Prepares complex analytical reports. Interprets data to provide insights and recommendations. Conducts and directs technical research and analysis projects. Supports the strategic direction of the bank and helps drive profitability or efficiency. Makes presentations to management and partners. Major Responsibilities:Conduct complex financial and business analyses to provide information and recommendations to management, such as variance, trend, peer group, budget, or performance analyses.Provide written analyses and interpretation of results.Propose recommendations and present findings to executive management.Partner with various sales and product channels to determine risks and opportunities and develop solutions for efficiencies.Develop and run complex financial models to produce projections, simulate scenarios, and obtain comparative financial data.Establish financial and business assumptions and critical decision variables.May develop and track key performance indicators.May provide work direction to junior analysts or act as project leader.Requires a degree from a four-year college (e.g., B.A., B.S.) and 3+ years of technical experience as a financial or business analyst or equivalent, comparable experience.One or more of the following designations: MBA, CFA, CPA and/or Big 4 Consulting/Audit is preferred.Requires the ability to design and develop spreadsheets and presentations for self and others.Requires the ability to communicate comfortably and concisely with executive management. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities duties and skills required of personnel so classified.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.  A conviction is not an absolute bar to employment. Factors such as the age of the offense, evidence of rehabilitation, seriousness of violation, and job relatedness are considered in all employment decisions. Additionally, it's the bank's policy to only inquire into a candidate's criminal history after an offer has been made. Federal law prohibits banks from employing individuals who have been convicted of, or received a pretrial diversion for, certain offenses.

Name: Financial/ALM Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Title: Financial/ALM Analyst Job ID: UBJP00010900 Location: 445 SO FIGUEROA ST Los Angeles, California 90071 Overview: Manager also open to someone sitting in Woodland Hills, CA.  21700 Oxnard St  Woodland Hills, CA 90367  The Financial / ALM Analyst will assist the ALM Modeling team as it generates and socializes the CCAR forecast. Duties will include but will not be limited to: Responsibilities:Generation of reporting and presentations detailing the forecasts for lines of business / portfolio owners requiring interaction and collaboration with Subject Matter Experts (SME) and Senior Management.Meeting coordination including meeting minutes and takeaways.Prepares, supervises, and provides quality control in the preparation of forecasts, associated analyses and presentations.Take ownership of forecast questions and feedback to ensure proper resolution in terms of performing financial analysis with proper documentation.Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree with 5-7 years of experience.Understanding of banking products & financial statements (including income statement, balance sheet, cash flow analysis, and performance measurement).Advanced skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) gained through extensive hands-on experience in prior jobs. Specific knowledge of pivot tables, large data preferred.Solid presentation & written communication skills.Ability to model and create complex spreadsheets, look up tables, pivot tables.Intermediate to advanced skills in data analysis and design, and data mapping.Detail oriented with the ability to work efficiently and independently with little supervision.Excellent time management skills working under time pressure and handling multiple tasks/projects at the same time.Problem resolution experience requiring strong financial analytical skills, sound judgment and ability to work effectively with clients and technical staff.Experience with financial database/software (knowledge of Hyperion or SQL is a plus, but not a requirement).Experience with the Quantitative Risk Management (QRM) Enterprise Risk Framework is preferred but not a requirement. Company DescriptionComrise is the bridge to the first-rate talent for organizations that recognize the value of their workforce. With locations in the U.S., China, and Hong Kong, we help our clients reach far and wide for both local and international resources which yield the highest return on their human capital investments. Headquartered in New Jersey since 1984, Comrise is a staffing, consulting and enhanced search technology company. For over 30 years we have delighted our clients and consultants by focusing on customer satisfaction, innovation, and flexible workforce solutions. By combining our global networks with our outstanding local offices, Comrise provides high-quality executive search, temporary and temporary to permanent staffing solutions, and cross-border placement services.

Name: Business Analyst - ECM
Description: Title: Senior ECM Business Analyst Location: Culver City, CA Duration: 3 Months Contract iManage experience is highly desired. The Senior Business Analyst in IT serves as a primary interface to the business users, with the guidance from a business relationship manager to assist the ADM teams in understanding the business processes, workflows, and information requirements of the users. The Senior Business Analyst will primarily serve in the support of the current and future applications and the requirement analysis process. Providing consulting on reactive, proactive and enhancement support services, as well as testing services to one or many applications Responsibilities Function as Functional Business Analyst on Enterprise Content Management strategy, capabilities, technology and vendors. Working with client team and other consultants, develop current state ECM technology architecture, gap analysis, and future state technology architecture to address client architecture gaps Evaluate ECM vendors and related technology to determine the best fit and help make recommendations to clients around technology and services acquisition Review and integrate all ECM application requirements, including functional, security, integration, performance, quality and operations requirements. Leads and contributes to the definition of content governance procedures and business requirements, functional designs, and workflows for creating, managing and publishing web content Lead multiple workstreams for an end to end ECM project and programs from strategy through implementation in a global environment Leverage vendor relationships to enable teams and bring innovation to our clients Assist with business process redesign, roadmap planning, and identifying touch points through multi-channel applications Mentor and coach team members by sharing perspective and knowledge of Content Management initiatives and maintaining an open dialogue with colleagues and clients Support the development of strong client relationships by building trust, rapport and strong working relationships with key sponsors, stakeholders, and team members Basic Qualifications 4 years of functional experience using various ECM-related technologies 3 years of experience as lead BA or delivery leader on ECM projects Bachelor's Degree Preferred Skills Demonstrated experience working with senior level stakeholders Strong attention to detail Experience working with Cloud technologies Hands on experience ECM products and platforms including iManage, SharePoint, Alfresco, and other cloud content management tools. Knowledge of best practices in all areas of ECM systems including ECM governance, document workflow, Master Data Management Ability to lead functional discussions and scoping decisions based on best practices for implementing ECM applications. Experience eliciting high-level business requirements and creating detailed functional specs as well as other documentation like requirement traceability matrixes, work-flow diagrams, and use-cases. Experience with records management implementations. Ability to understand content migration needs and to define and execute content migration plans. Experience in a consulting environment with a demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity, and innovation. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal with strong presentation skills. Strong interpersonal, team building, organizational and motivational skills. If interested, please share your resume at naveen.chilagani(@)ispace.com - provided by Dice"business Analyst", "ECM",

Name: IT Business Analyst - Customer Accounts and Revenue
Description: The University of Southern California (USC) has established a Workday Financials deployment program covering our academic enterprise as well as our hospitals. This program is critical to USC's overall goals to improve administrative efficiency. Workday Financials will be paired with the existing Workday HR and Payroll solutions implemented in 2013.  We are currently seeking a Business Analyst Customer Accounts and Revenue to join our Workday Financials deployment program team. The Business Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that the overall Workday solutions meet the business requirements. This includes requirements gathering, solution design, build, test, and deployment. Design will involve extrapolating from requirements the fundamental needs of the business while leveraging the most efficient solution provided by Workday. In some cases, we expect to challenge and optimize current business process.  The ideal candidate must possess 2 years of business analyst experience with a sound understanding of project management methodologies, business process flow, and documentation procedures. Experience with large enterprise software projects, Workday or other Financial ERP solutions and within Higher Education/Healthcare are strongly preferred.  ITS is committed to providing information technology services and support to the university. ITS provides essential, university-wide services such as: Enterprise information systemsUniversity wired and wireless networksEducational TechnologyResearch ComputingIT Security This is a fixed-term position with an anticipated end date of December 31, 2021 Please note that this is a full-time role eligible for benefits, including medical, dental, and vision plans. What You'll Do:Facilitate design workshops and work closely with business owners to gather and document user stories within USC's tracking softwareTranslate user stories into detailed requirements and Workday use casesWork with project leadership and business owners to adapt requirements with an eye for business process optimizationDevelop subject matter expertise for assigned business and associated system functionalityWork collaboratively in an iterative agile 'style' environmentWork with project team members and consultants to configure the applicationHelp manage execution of the testing strategyAssist project team members in the design of new (or redesign of existing) integrationsDraft project documentation including configuration manuals and business cases (e.g., white paper, policy challenges) supporting the escalation of business decisionsMeet with customer groups to determine IT business requirementsElicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.Provide information to developers and subject matter experts for the establishment of the technical vision and performance needsServe as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development or business process re-engineering team through which requirements flowParticipate in project meetings to review project deliverables and timelines.Work with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of projectParticipate in testing developed software or new process flowPerform other duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any timeThe Must Haves:Bachelor's degree in business administration, organization development, communication or related discipline2 years of business analysis experienceStrong knowledge and understanding of project management methodologies, business process flow, and documentation procedures Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and toolsStrong oral and written communication skillsAbility to multitask, interact with multiple stakeholders and navigate changing priorities.Ability to work on moderately complex programming activities under supervision of senior IT Business AnalystExperience with supporting or managing revenue administrative processes (e.g., tuition, ticket sales, hospitality, etc)The Nice to Haves:3-5 years of business analyst experience focused on large enterprise software projects or supportSome experience working within a Higher Education and/or Health Care industryExperience with Workday or other Financial ERP solutions through on-going support or deploymentBenefits: USC benefits include a choice of retirement programs, 12 paid vacation days per year, 12 paid sick days per year, university holidays, a choice of medical and dental plans, and discounts to football games, basketball games, and other campus events.  Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree, Combined experience/education as substitute for minimum education  Minimum Experience: 2 years, Combined education/experience as substitute for minimum experience  Minimum Field of Expertise: Sound knowledge of documentation procedures, project management methodologies, program flow charts and operator instructions. Competent to work on moderately complex programming activities under supervision of senior IT Business Analyst.  USC is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law or USC policy. USC will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring ordinance. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Applicants with questions about access or requiring a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should contact USC Human Resources by phone at (213) 821-8100, or by email at uschr@usc.edu. Inquiries will be treated as confidential to the extent permitted by law. Name: Data Analyst
Description: As a Data Analyst at AppOnboard, you will join our growing Analytics & Insights team to help support our growing business intelligence needs. This person will be responsible for extracting, analyzing, and modeling data that will lead to insights we can share with the worlds top developers who leverage AppOnboards demo technology and platform.  AppOnboard is a next-gen platform that powers Full-Fidelity Demos, which allow users to instantly experience an app or game in the highest quality possible before downloading it. AppOnboard enables app and game testing, driving insights to product teams and optimizing app launches and onboarding. The company was founded in late 2016 by Jonathan Zweig, the founding CEO of AdColony (which sold to Opera Software for $350 million).  This is a unique opportunity for someone looking to have an impact at one of the hottest startups in Los Angeles and top companies defining the future of app development. In Q1 we also secured our official $15 million Series A fundraising round! Responsibilities:Analyze a plethora of real-time data sets to extract meaningful insights about app demos that run on AppOnboards platform and in other places (e.g. Google Play Store via App Store Demos/Google Play Instant)Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques to increase accuracySupport internal teams from Insight, Product, Business Development, Business Ops, Creative, and Sales with daily data requests and needsEstablish data analysis process and set of tools that can help improve internal efficiencies and be taught to future hiresBuild KPI reports and dashboards to help key stakeholders measure, optimize and understand performance of demos across platforms and target audiencesEnsure timely and accurate data analysis in a fast-paced, start-up environmentWhat We're Looking For2-4 years of experience at a digital/mobile/tech company with a proven track record of using data analysis to drive significant businessStrong mathematical or statistical background preferredHighly proficient with programming languages, especially for data manipulation (e.g. SQL, Python are highly important in this role).Knowledge of BI/Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau) to create insightful reports, visualizations, and interactive dashboards for Commercial teams and customersExperience in and comfortable with data analysis, wrangling, and curationStrong project management skills with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlinesPassion for mobile technology, mobile apps, and gamingSelf-starter with a positive attitude and team-first spiritEager to learn new technologies and skills in data processing and analyticsBachelors degree in Math, Statistics, Business, Economics, or a related field
