Name: Budget/Business Analyst
Description: Information Sciences Institute (ISI), a unit of USC's Viterbi School of Engineering, is a world leader in the research and development of advanced information processing, computing, and communications technologies. ISI operates one of the world's largest academic high-performance computing clusters. ISI has three research campuses: one in Marina Del Rey, CA; one in Arlington, VA; and one in Waltham, MA. This position is located in Marina del Rey, CA.*Job Summary: USC Information Sciences Institute is seeking a team player with solid analytical and interpersonal skills to join the ISI Business Office team. A Budget Business Analyst who is proactive, detail-oriented and able work in a fast pace environment.  The Budget Business Analyst will be responsible for monitoring, reconciling and analyzing ISI budgets and business transactions. Will help ensure ISI financials comply with federal research requirements and university policies and procedures. Job Accountabilities: Oversee ISI financial transactions including but not limited to business expenditures, payables, reimbursements, administration of USC travel and procurement cards, general ledger transfers, tuition allocation, facilities, ASR reviews and effort certification. Reviews requests against available budgets and university policies to help ensure compliance with both university and federal government requirements. Ensures financial transactions are complete, accurate and submitted in a timely manner.  Reviews business expenditure for accuracy and works closely with ISI Business Office staff, account managers and division admins to resolve any issues which may arise. Advises on specific federal requirements and university guidelines to assist ISI divisions with the administration and allowability of project expenditure. Advises on unit specific financial policies and procedures. Provides ISI employees with guidance and interpretations to non-routine or complex situations. Serve as a resource for other university offices and staff requesting information or assistance.  Assists with monitoring income and expense budgets and process general ledger transfers when needed. Sets up and maintains accounts by submitting chart of account requests. Reconciles account balances and activity to university financial records and initiates correcting entries to resolve discrepancies. Prepares and submits financial reports as required and reviews for accuracy prior to distribution. Troubleshoots problems, including research of pertinent facts and interacts with appropriate university staff to achieve resolution.  Assists in local planning of short and long term unrestricted budget allocations by compiling and organizing data for use in forecast plans. Reviews data gathered by others for accuracy. Collects and formats data for special projects and management studies. Assist with the review and collection of supporting documentation for internal and external audits. Assist with university year-end financial transactions and closing activity.  Will lead one or more employees performing similar work. Job Qualifications: Education: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business or closely related field preferred. Combined experience/education as substitute for minimum education.  Experience and Skills: 1 to 3 years of related work experience Directly related accounting or budget administration experience in a university environment.Knowledge of university financial policies, procedures and systems preferred.Experience with federal post award research administration a plus.Ability to interpret and apply university policies and the applicable federal government regulations.Highly organized with good time management skills, accuracy and work ethics.Must have effective written and oral communication skills. Ability to interact and effectively communicate with all levels of management and staff.Must be able to anticipate potential issues, be proactive in formulating solutions and resolve any discrepancies in a timely manner.Strong problem solving skills, including ability to research, organize and analyze information.Advance proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Adobe Acrobat.Solid understanding and application of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.A results oriented focus with demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage time sensitive transactions while meeting strict deadlines. Required Application Documents: Resume and Cover Letter  The University of Southern California values diversity and is committed to equal opportunity in employment.  Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree, Combined experience/education as substitute for minimum education  Minimum Experience: 1 year  Minimum Field of Expertise: Business administration, accounting or related degree and budget experience including knowledge of government and fund accounting. Strong computer skills with use of automated spreadsheets.  USC is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law or USC policy. USC will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring ordinance. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Name: Senior Business Analyst, IDM
Description: Senior Business Analyst, IDMThe Senior Business Analyst in our Corporate IT BRM team serves as the conduit to the business users with the primary goal of understanding the business processes, workflows, and information requirements of the users. The Senior Business Analyst will interact with stakeholders from various business units including IT, Legal, HR, and Information Security in support of current and future applications.  This role will be expected to perform data/functional requirement analysis and to create functional designs to ensure business requirements are completed successfully for the project assigned. The ideal candidate must also have a proven track record of supporting complex initiatives where multiple business units and processes are impacted.  Responsibilities include: Liaison between IT and the business defining stakeholder demand and delivering technology to enable and meet business strategy and support day-to-day operations.Initiating and facilitating communications between stakeholders, acting as a primary point of contact for defined groups.Facilitating open communication and discussion between stakeholders. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Business Intelligence AnalystREF#: 32123 CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS Interactive JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff JOB SCHEDULE:JOB LOCATION: Burbank, CA ABOUT US: CBS Interactive is the premier online content network for information and online operations of CBS Corporation as well as some of the top native digital brands in the entertainment industry. Name: 2019 Business Management Analyst 2
Description: Your opportunities for achievement are limitless with Northrop Grumman Mission SystemsAt Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on projects and programs that impact people’s lives around the world today, and for generations to come. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to improve the present, invent the future, and have a lot of fun along the way. The candidate must:Be completing or has completed their degree (Masters) from an accredited institution Be majoring in or having majored in Business Administration, Business Management, Finance, Accounting, Economics, International Business, or closely related discipline Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.25/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile) Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)Preferred QualificationsHave an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70/4.0 or higher Previous internship/co-op or other work experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular) Self-motivated, willing to learn, and interested in working in a team environmentNorthrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. Name: Telecom Implementation Analyst
Description: We accompany our customers every step of the way from the moment they partner with us to the end of their journey. We bring passion to what we do every day because what we do matters to real people. We share happy and sad moments with our customers, we laugh and cry with them, and we build relationships that go far beyond a business partnership. We are a group of ambitious, intelligent, hard-working, and fun people. If you are passionate about helping real hard working people, love technology, aren't afraid of a challenge or two, and have a desire to push yourself to your maximum potential, our CS team is where you belong.Telecom Implementation Analyst We are looking for a Telecom Implementation Analyst to be in charge of the successful planning, managing, and executing of phone porting and integration projects that will help us deliver the ultimate customer experience to our clients. This individual will be the subject matter expert and in charge of coordinating the porting. This is an exciting and rewarding opportunity to join a rapidly growing team responsible for our entire customer base. This role is located in Glendale, CA.What you'll do Serve as the single point of contact during customer's phone integration onboarding/implementation/success process  Schedule & conduct detailed phone integration discovery calls with clients to determine any changes or requirements needed to have all qualified numbers integrated seamlessly and without any interruptions  Coordinate and/or implement client's entire port over process from beginning to end  Coordinate and follow up with clients to ensure all documentation needed for porting gets submitted in a correct and timely way  Submit port requests to carrier(s) as needed  Track and follow up on all submitted port requests with carrier(s) in a timely way  Provide on­going updates to clients throughout the port process  Process, keep track, & update all phone integration related Zendesk tickets as needed in a timely way  Ability to troubleshoot any basic phone integration issues  Work with members of multiple teams (including but not limited to Success, Advocacy, Onboarding, and Product)  Manage day-­to-­day operational aspects of all ongoing projects What you'll need Intelligent, strategic, quick thinking, dedicated, ambitious, and fast learning  Superb customer service skills  Great time management and excellent communication skills  Self­starter who thrives in an entrepreneurial, fast­paced environment, with an ability to "roll with the punches"  Proven ability to multi­task and manage multiple moving pieces at a time while paying strict attention to detail  BA degree  3+ years of related project management experience  Some basic telecom experience About ServiceTitan ServiceTitan is a mobile, cloud-based software platform that helps home services companies streamline operations, improve customer service, and grow their business. ServiceTitan's end-to-end solution for the multi-billion dollar residential home services industry includes CRM, intelligent dispatch, custom reporting, marketing automation, mobile solution for field techs, and accounting integration with Intacct and QuickBooks. ServiceTitan brings a fully operational modern SaaS infrastructure to an industry traditionally underserved by software. ServiceTitan is the preferred software for hundreds of the world's most successful plumbing, HVAC, and electrical companies. For more information about ServiceTitan, visit www.ServiceTitan.com.  Los Angeles Business Journal Best Places to Work, 2018  Los Angeles Business Journal Top 100 Fastest Growing Private Company, 2018  Deloitte Fast 500, 2018  Inc 5000 - Best Workplaces, 2018  Inc. 5000 America's Fastest Growing Companies, 2018  Glassdoor/Battery Ventures Highest Rated Cloud Computing Companies, 2018  Mogul Top 1000 Companies Worldwide for Millennial Women 2018  Forbes - Next Billion-Dollar Startup List, 2017

Name: Tech Finance Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Business Technology Solutions (BTS) Business Analyst is a member of a highly-motivated BTS team responsible for partnering with multiple Tech and business divisions to evaluate, understand and deliver solutions for complex business problems. The team works as the strategic interface with assigned business divisions for the purpose of business-Tech strategy development, solutions delivery, service management, risk management and relationship management. The BTS team provides highly-valued strategic consulting level support and guidance throughout key business technology initiatives.  The Tech Finance Business Analyst is a full-time position responsible for analyzing finance business problems and implementing solutions in our Enterprise Services platforms. The business analyst supports the user community, elicit, manage requirements and specifications as well as execute a variety of testing disciplines (test plans, scripts, unit testing and user acceptance) to drive development and validate results.  The Tech Finance Business Analyst will report to the BTS Enterprise Services Manager within the Business Technology Solutions Global Operations group and act as a business relationship management function as described below. ResponsibilitiesRequirements ManagementElicit, analyze, and document business requirements, from user groups and project stakeholders.Create and manage backlog of items by documenting business requirements and translating into technical specifications for solution implementation.Manage requirements prioritization, implementation estimation and dependencies; traceability from business capability to test case.Business Process ModellingProcess/Workflow analysis; work with project teams to gather, analyze and compile business process needs.Create process, models, specifications, diagrams and charts on current business processes and workflows.Technology Solutions DrivenSupport prioritization of Tech initiatives based on the division’s needs/strategy, Tech workload and budget.Promote business knowledge of Tech process, roles, and procedures to ensure the best possible outcomes.Support on solution options analysis, risks evaluation and impacts on end-user solutions and services, business processes/workflows and system priorities.Participates in planning sessions with BTS team members.Support the development of business cases and contribute to the “project greenlight” process, including cost benefit analyses.Build a trusted relationship with multiple roles.Partner with BTS and Service Mangers to deliver Tech solutions to further CAA’s goals, all while managing customer expectations around what Tech can deliver.Analyze technology trends to determine impact to the achievement of BTS goals.Support the development of project plans and project charters.Support the project management process, reporting on status, accomplishments and risks.Quality Assurance Develop test plans and test case scenarios based on project requirements.Assist and conduct user acceptance testing.Research and document issues / bugs before reporting these to the developers.Supports change management activities; training and user support.Supports the BTS manager in monitoring and reporting on escalated issues.Works collaboratively with service managers to develop clear and concise communications with respects to incidents, problems, and change management as needed.Required CapabilitiesExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills.Experience implementing Enterprise Services applications with specific knowledge of finance and accounting modules.Experience using Concur for expense and travel.Experience using Dynamics AX 2012 or Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations a plus.Advanced Excel skills, in particular around data validation, pivot tables and reporting financial data.Expert in business workflow modeling.Exceptional oral and written communications skills.Demonstrate initiative and ownership of tasks and projects.Ability to prioritize, coordinate and complete tasks to meet deadlines.Ability to work effectively both independently and in team environments.Ability to present complex problems in simple terms with great presentation skills.Experience extracting insights from data.Experience in Agile or waterfall SDLC.Experience using requirements management tools and test management tools.Thorough understanding of GAAP accounting.Thorough understanding of source control, unit testing, and continuous integration practices.Possess the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high growth environment.Attention to detail to be vigilant in analysis to come to correct conclusions.Be a team player who is approachable and supportive; able to contribute ideas and recommendations.Environment CAA has a service oriented collaborative environment where we help our colleagues then focus on our own work.

Name: Senior Manager, Business/ Data Analyst Lead
Description: Senior Manager, Business/ Data Analyst LeadAs Hitachi, Ltd.'s (NYSE: HIT) global consulting company, Hitachi Consulting is a recognized leader in delivering proven business and IT solutions to Global 2000 companies. We leverage decades of business process, vertical industry, and leading-edge technology experience to understand each company's unique needs. From business strategy development through application deployment, we are committed to helping clients quickly realize measurable business value and achieve sustainable ROI.Hitachi Consulting's client base includes nearly 35 percent of the Fortune 100 and many leading mid-market companies. This person will have strong SQL skills to wrangle data (i.e., mine, enhance and transform) and develop deep insights, as well as strong business communication and presentation skills to communicate insights and recommendations.This leader will participate in analytical sales pursuits (proposal creation, estimation, presentations, etc.), in strategic analytical assessments, and in developing and delivering analytical solutions with a global delivery team. This person will demonstrate strong critical thinking, have natural curiosity/desire to solve the entire problem, and naturally takes ownership to drive themselves and their team to a correct and complete conclusion.Required Qualifications8 years of Business Data Analysis Skills for Analytic Efforts6 years of experience with data query methods SQL, PIG4 years of Management experience3 years of experience with leading consulting delivery teams3 years of developing / understanding end-to-end data process flows and usage scenarios2 years with data visualization (Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau, Power BI, R)Experience with working with data from ERP, SCM, and IoT sourcesStrong consulting skills including: analysis and problem solving, written and verbal communication, presentation preparation/delivery, and team collaborationStrong math skills (e.g., applied statistics, linear algebra, numeric analysis)Ability to work across a variety of database technologiesBachelor’s Degree RequiredOptional QualificationsHands-on experience with cloud-based analytical services (AWS, Azure, GCP)Experience with scripting languages (R, SPSS, SAS)6 Sigma green-belt certification with focus on root-cause analysis methodsTravel Typical travel requires consultants to be at the client location Monday-Thursday LocationUSHitachi Consulting offers excellent benefits and career growth to all employees!Hitachi Consulting Is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V “Equal Opportunity Employer: EOE - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities”·“If you need a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job at Hitachi, please send the nature of request and contact information accommodations@hitachiconsulting.com. Queries other than accommodation requests will not be responded to.

are followed as they apply to this position Abides by all applicable laws and regulations as mandated by state and federal laws and prevents being excluded or sanctioned from any state and/or federal programs as they pertain to healthcareREQUIREMENTS: Minimum Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology (IT) or related discipline that includes technology concentrations from an accredited university A Master's degree in Computer Science related discipline is desirable Minimum of 7years of related experience working in a managed care environment, preferably in a data analysis, operation management, and informatics position Minimum of 7 years of prior experience with State and Federal regulatory data standards and requirements Ability to comprehend and work with HIPAA standard transaction sets, specifically 837P, 837I Knowledge of healthcare management in IPA, Hospital, Provider Network Operations, Member Enrollment, Claim Process, Medical Payment and Revenue Reporting, and Encounter submissions and measures Proficient in MS Access and Oracle database, SQL, and MS Office Ability to conduct comprehensive data analyses, find the root causes of the rejections and issues, and interpret business requirements, data, to identify the opportunities for the gap analyses Lead, manage, and assist all aspects of the project, including gathering business and system requirements, translate to functional requirements, support Senior Programmer analyst to reconcile all volume charts and hospital encounter submissions Ability to take the initiatives to develop methodologies, strategic plan to optimize the process and performance Ability to write analytical reports and comprehensive summaries Ability to effectively communicate with management and staff, as well as with external submitters Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Senior Analyst, Digital Analytics & Business Intelligence
Description: Come party with a million people a day in celebrating important events in their lives! Evite, the world's leading digital platform, is looking for passionate and creative Sr. Analyst, Digital Analytics and Business Intelligence to join our team in Los Angeles. We are looking for people who will contribute to our mission of bringing people together to celebrate their most important life moments. Evite's Analytics team & Data Infrastructure team is seeking a Sr. Analyst, Digital Analytics and Business Intelligence to support the all aspects of our business, with a focus on supporting three key areas: Digital Advertising, Marketing and Web/Mobile Products.  Core Capabilities Proven track record of turning raw data into meaningful analysis, presenting to business stakeholders, and driving value for the business. Ability to see the business challenge behind analytics challengesProven track as a power user of Tableau (or similar BI tool), SQL and Google Analytics (or similar Analytics tool). Knowledge of Python and/or R a plus.Strong experience and leadership using data and analytics to optimize digital media The 3C's (Candidate must have all three C's) Communication - You're an eloquent speaker who can explain anything to everyone. You are also a clear and concise writer.Critical thinking - You love logic and data. Thinking strategically is your forte. You enjoy diagnosing complex problems and formulating plans of attack to resolve them. You enjoy an environment where everyone is encouraged to add value at the most strategic level.Cultural fit - You have a craving to fit in a fast-paced, high-integrity, low hand-holding environment (but you will get a hug if you need it). EQ as important as IQ. Bullies need not apply. You want to help bring our "What If" philosophy to life.ResponsibilitiesUse data to drive continuous improvement and decision making, with an emphasis on:Optimizing digital publisher ad inventory for both direct (CPM) sales and programmaticOptimizing user experience and ROI for free and premium digital products on web and mobile appSupporting marketing initiatives across online channelsData-driven strategic business decision makingCreate Tableau dashboards/reports and maintain our library of self-serve Tableau dashboards to support business users across the organizationGoogle Analytics power userWork collaboratively with stakeholder groups in Sales/Advertising, Product, Marketing and Finance to define business needs and translate them into Data Analytics solutionsBe a mentor to other team members and stakeholders in other departments Other Preferred Requirements BA/BS degree with a quantitative emphasis (Business, Marketing, Economics, Statistics or similar). Master's Degree preferred.4+ years of experience of supporting digital organizations with all analytics needs, preferably in high data volume environments3+ years of experience with Tableau (or similar BI platform). Ideally a Tableau power user3+ years of experience with SQL advanced SQL skills a must3+ years of experience with Google Analytics (or similar). Google Tag manager and/or multi channel attribution a plusStrong MS-Excel and PowerPoint skillsStrong Experience with DoubleClick Platform, SSP/DSP data and reporting, programmatic advertisingKnowledge of A/B testing. Optimizely a plus. Note: No relocation assistance provided for this position. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Evite, Inc. is committed to equal employment opportunity and values a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or perception, national origin, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetics or other legally protected characteristics.SDL2017

Name: Configuration Analyst

Chrome River is laser focused on growing our employees - we understand that happy employees make for happy customers.Come join us at The River!Join our Configuration Team as a Configuration Analyst for our online expense reporting and invoice management service! We are expanding in the U.S., globally, and are always looking for talented, clever, innovative and out-of-the-box thinkers to help drive our growth. If you want to join a company that leads by example and is a leader in cloud-based and mobile financial software solutions, we'd love to hear from you!US-based positions: This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

Name: Business Intelligence Administrator (Business
Description: Job TitleBusiness Intelligence Administrator (Business Objects experience is required) - ID:32808  DurationPermanent  Start DateASAP  Job Skills Four (4) years of experience with Business Objects, (Server Administration, CMC, Universe Designer, Web Intelligence) and experience with data analysis and working with users is required, along with one (1) to two (2) years' experience with data visualization, Tableau preferred.  LocationLos Angeles, CA  Date Posted11/01/2018  Business Intelligence Administrator  As a Business Intelligence Administrator you will be responsible for developing, researching and implementing data analysis projects including but not limited to data reporting, data visualizations, and ad-hoc research projects. You will work closely with the Technology Development management team on planning, design, installation, configuration and maintenance of said systems. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that our data systems are engineered for greater flexibility and reuse. You will work with various department to ensure that their future data needs are met with our current and future designs while accomplishing these and other critical functions:  Working with Firm Management to further Enterprise Analytics and Business Intelligence reporting and visualization capabilities.  Administering the Business Objects reporting environments including server side administration and user / security administration through CMC and design universes/reports  Working with Senior Management on research projects to design, develop and deploy new universes / reports.  Analyzing and verifying internal consistency, completeness and accuracy of data systems and makes required adjustments.  Actnig as a resource to the firm on various data related questions for staff and other users. Responding to user questions and issues in a timely manner and assists with solutions.  Working with vendors in order to resolve complex issues.  Staying abreast of current and new development processes, tools, technologies, and market trends as they relate to systems development and implementation in support of the legal industry.  Working with various firm department and practice group attorney leadership or designees to provide guidance and support for development projects as they relate to more specific areas in the practice of Law at the Firm.  As a Business Intelligence Administrator, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Business Intelligence Analyst must have strong administration experience with SAP Business Objects, including installing, upgrading, troubleshooting, and auditing the environment; strong skills in Business Objects universe and report development; strong SQL skills, including data profiling skills to identify and understand anomalies; the ability to comprehend and accurately perform advanced data analysis and communicate data findings. Experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools is preferred, along with experience with R, Python, NoSQL technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra, Apache Storm, MongoDB and Basho a plus.  A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Math, Economics or a related field is preferred. Four (4) years of experience with Business Objects, (Server Administration, CMC, Universe Designer, Web Intelligence) and experience with data analysis and working with users is required, along with one (1) to two (2) years' experience with data visualization, Tableau preferred. Name: Finance Business Systems Analyst SAP BPC HANA
Description: Job DescriptionFinance Business System Analyst SAP BPC HANA long term contract in Los Angeles, CA (Burbank area).Synopsis:Our client has kicked off a Finance Innovation initiative in support of the transition to a monthly close. They need engagement in a number of projects relating to this effort. Duties/Qualifications:Proven track record with successful financial system related implementationsAugment project team to help support requirements gathering, design, master data analysis and testingGood level of consultant experience with SAP BPC & or HANA related projectsNot looking for a manager or someone with a few years experienceProven track record as a BSA responsible for use case design for financial system related implementations and facilitating business and technical design sessionsAbility to assess business feasibility of proposed solutions and develop an initial point of view/recommendationAnalyses of details of all the issues and collaborating with the technical teams and our business users on identifying the best possible solutionWorking knowledge of studio accounting practices preferred (specifically forecast & planning in the M&E space) but non studio finance knowledge is also OKLarge scale system & data integrations (specifically SAP BPC & HANA) that include complex mapping logic & interface builds, master & transactional data clean up, and establishing associated governance & data controlsExcellent communication skills, attention to detail and experience working with many different groups and levels across IT & Business-Participation inExecutive Steering Committee meetings and lead specific topics as needed#TA

Name: Business Analyst Retail Sales
Description: Job DescriptionTransamerican Auto Parts is a multi-national, multi-channel distributor (retail, Wholesale, e-commerce and catalog) of aftermarket automotive parts as well as a manufacturer of several branded product lines. Transamerican Auto Parts is a vertically integrated, multi-channel reseller that does business under the following B2C and B2B brands: 4 Wheel Parts, 4 Wheel Parts of Canada, 4 Wheel Drive Hardware, Transamerican Wholesale and the Transamerican Manufacturing Group.  We are looking for a Dynamic Business Analyst – Retail Sales to join our team!  The Business Analyst will work with the functional area they are assigned to with the purpose of gathering and documenting requirements. This includes observing the current process, documenting and flow-charting the process flow. Identify areas where a process has conflicts or could use some attention. Perform testing on the new software platform for their functional area and assist in UAT and training.  This opportunity will be located at our Corporate Office in Compton, CA in the Greater Los Angeles area.Key ResponsibilitiesActs as functional lead and subject matter expert on MS Dynamics ERP implementation;Gathers business requirements through a variety of techniques (e.g. work sessions and interviews);Assists with the development of conceptual business model views and high-level and detailed business process designs;Develops the required work products for the business process and application domains of change;Assists in prototyping business applications to ensure accuracy in design and applicability to user requirements;Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel;Communicates in formal presentation settings including proposal orals and client workshops; develops proposal sections, methodology work products and formal written deliverables covering area(s) of expertise;Trains users on new software and procedures;Works with PMO to keep project timeline and reporting;Skills required/desiredBachelor’s Degree is required;Microsoft Dynamics 2012/D365 experience;Microsoft CRM;Ability to work with Technical and Non-Technical staff;Experience in retail sales point of sales applicationsAutomotive industry experience is a plus;Basic accounting/collections practices and procedures;Working knowledge of Microsoft tools (Sharepoint, visio, project, excel, etc);Excellent oral and written communication skills;Experience communicating with Multi-cultural teams; Transamerican Auto Parts is an equal opportunity employer, and is proud of our diverse employee population. Employment offers include a requirement for successful completion of a background investigation, and pre-employment drug screening. We use E-Verify to determine employment eligibility for all new employees. E-Verify is a joint effort among employers, the U.S. Social Security Administration (“SSA”) and U.S. Department of Homeland Security (“DHS”).Company DescriptionAPPLY and complete the application for this opportunity at http://4wheelparts.com/jobs ABOUT TRANSAMERICAN AUTO PARTSTAP OVERVIEW: For more than 50 years, Transamerican Auto Parts (“TAP”) has been an industry leader in the manufacture, distribution, and sale of off-road parts for Jeeps and light trucks. TAP has numerous entities serving various niches in the automotive aftermarket under its corporate umbrella. From 4 Wheel Parts to Transamerican Wholesale, TAP subsidiaries provide the best parts and services for the customer at the most competitive prices.  Since 1961, TAP has grown with the popularity of off-roading. The company began by supplying Jeep parts to local dealers and independent service centers that catered to 4×4 enthusiasts. The original company did not deal directly with the consumer at first, but as the company grew, so did its focus. In the ensuing decades, TAP established and acquired industry leading brands, including Pro Comp, Smittybilt, Rubicon Express, and G2 Axle & Gear. The company also launched Off-Road Adventures, a magazine for off-road enthusiasts.  TAP conducts business through a three-pronged sales, service, and manufacturing paradigm. The company supplements a robust mail-order system with 80 plus brick-and-mortar retail centers, staffed with experienced product and installation specialists. In addition to the retail initiative, TAP has accelerated its business with the e-commerce marketplace. Led by its flagship Websites 4WheelParts.com and 4WD.com, TAP’s 22 consumer-oriented sites have collectively grown beyond 2.6 million visitors each month. The TAP e-commerce network facilitates consumer sales, service, and support. TAP’s manufacturing system features a 100,000 square foot research and production facility that incorporates an in-house conceptualization, design, and implementation process. From the beginning, TAP has dedicated its resources to serving its customers, and to establishing itself as the premier supplier and distributor of high quality automotive parts.  To learn more about us, visit: http://transamericanautoparts.com/

Name: Performance and Portfolio Analyst
Description: Req ID: 25521 Experience Level: Professional Other Location(s): Irvine (CA); N/A Relocation offered: Yes Travel required: None Come grow with us At Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.  Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous.  Information and Insights is a global operational team with locations in Los Angeles, Irvine, London, Tokyo and Singapore. Our larger team is responsible for delivering accurate and timely results data and analysis to the investment group, marketing, governance, clients, shareholders, and other teams. There are several opportunities within this team in our Los Angeles and/or Irvine locations:Results & Attribution - This role will be responsible for providing portfolio performance and attribution for Portfolio Managers and Research Analysts, including return validation and reporting. In addition, the role will support the implementation of a new results and attribution system (BISAM B-ONE), partnering with the implementation team to design and evolve data transformation, automated processes and our business operating model.Capital System Measurement & Analytics – This role will be responsible for providing portfolio performance, attribution and descriptive analytics for Portfolio Managers and Research Analysts. This will include validation, maintenance, reporting and analysis of the Capital System investment portfolios.Distribution Results & Attribution – This role will be responsible for providing portfolio performance, attribution, and ad-hoc analysis for our Distribution stakeholders (includes Sales, Marketing, and Investment Services). This will include Attribution through FactSet and providing data and analysis for new business opportunities in the Equity and Multi-Asset (Balanced Funds, Fund of Funds) space.Responsibilities:Performance measurement – calculate, validate, maintain, and interpret portfolio total & asset level results and statisticsPerformance evaluation – portfolio attribution, style analysis, trend analysis, benchmark analysis, transaction and holdings analysis (e.g. transaction and process impact analysis)Portfolio analytics – select, define, validate & report portfolio results, holdings and transaction characteristicsCustom Index construction – maintain custom indices for portfolios including custom calculations & data managementSystem expertise – subject matter expertise for one or more internal or external industry applications, understanding methodologies for various investment types, and partner with other departments or external vendors on system design and implementationResults process analysis – troubleshoot issues, understand system flows & dependencies as well as purpose, mechanics and impact of transactions on results, and support on-going design for data mapping & transformationProcess optimization – continuously develop & evolve best practices, increase efficiency, and enhance capabilities including identification of system enhancementsRisk mitigation - design and develop business processes, risk control measures, and metric evaluations to meet evolving business needs and adherence with compliance regulationsQualifications:Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science, MIS, or other quantitative field, preferredDomain knowledge in performance measurement and attribution, preferredA related charter (CIPM or CFA) or professional experience in an analytical/quantitative business role, preferredExcellent MS Excel skills (e.g., functions, charting, and pivot tables) is required for some of the roles; SQL knowledge is preferredExcellent problem solving & analytical skills, ability to manage complexity, and intellectual curiosity for both data and processesStrong innovation mindset and keen focus on process optimizationAbility to work effectively in a team environmentFamiliarity with portfolio accounting transactions and their impact to performance measurement is preferred for some of the rolesExperience with performance measurement systems, particularly BI-SAM B-ONE is a plus for some of the roles*Location flexibility between Los Angeles and Irvine will depend on the functional team you are interested in.Company Overview: Founded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.7 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers. Name: Senior Business Analyst, Business Systems
Description: Our WorldActivision Blizzard, Inc., a member of the S&P 500, is the worldʹs most successful standalone interactive entertainment company. We delight hundreds of millions of monthly active users around the world through franchises including Activisionʹs Call of Duty®, Destiny and Skylanders®, Blizzardʹs World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Hearthstone®, Diablo®, StarCraft®, and Heroes of the Storm®, and Kingʹs Candy Crush™, Pet Rescue™, Bubble Witch™ and Farm Heroes™. The company is one of the Fortune ʺ100 Best Companies to Work For®ʺ. Headquartered in Santa Monica, California, Activision Blizzard has operations throughout the world, and its games are played in 196 countries. More information about Activision Blizzard and its products and services can be found on the companyʹs website, www.activisionblizzard.com Your MissionThe Sr. Business Analyst is a versatile and highly motivated individual who works with the other IT team members and Business Users on the technical and functional requirements definition, design, implementation and maintenance of systems applications. The position will work with the Sr. Director of IT and Business Users in defining, prioritizing and executing application enhancements, projects and end-user support.Responsibilities:• Ensure IT alignment with the business through delivery of quality technology solutions• Requirements gathering and scope definition with non-technical Business User constituencies. • The ability to interview various non-technical managers to understand complex, dynamic business rules/process and then create detailed, specific and comprehensive documentation. • Engage Business Users spanning multiple departments and ensure cohesive articulation of business goals and processes to ensure effective solutions.• Engage Business Users to support all necessary clarification to design and implement an effective solution. • Manage components of a project plan or projects. • Manage and address support tickets of various priority. • Strong functional understanding of the systems supported and the development framework for customizations. • Verification of feasibility of Business User’s request functionality and business rules based on existing technical systems and data structures.• Manage multiple priorities, projects in fast paced and dynamic environment• Work with third Party logistics providers • Provide training and documentation when required • Ability to create and present key requirements artifacts: Scope Documents, Use Cases, Detailed Specification of Key Business Rules, Test plans and Test scenarios, Activity Diagrams, Business Process Mapping Diagrams and Documentation, Application Gap analysis• Other duties may be assigned.Your Platform· Bachelor’s degree in a technical/business discipline· 8+ years professional experience, with 4 to 6 years practical functional experience and 4+ lifecycle implementations for the Finance/SCM Oracle EBS 11i or R12 modules (R12 preferred). · Strong written and verbal communication skills. · Strong knowledge of Oracle Application functionality, schemas and development frameworks. · Strong knowledge of the Oracle EBS “Order to Cash” and “Procure to Pay” processes. · Good knowledge of the following Oracle E-Business Suite R12 modules: Order Management, Purchasing, Inventory, iExpense, iProcurement, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable and underlying database objects. · Experience with global implementations of Oracle applications 11i and/or R12.· Ability to identify system impact for small and large-scale initiatives.· Knowledge of Project and/or Software Development Life Cycle.· Proficiency with PL/SQL based queries.· Experience with Microsoft Office, Visio, and Project.· Ability to gracefully manage multiple priorities, commitments and projects in fast-paced dynamic environment.· Strong interpersonal skills.· Strong project management skills.· Previous experience in this role servicing a consumer-packaged goods company either as an internal employee or as a consultant. · International experience. · Knowledge/experience integration of third party systems with Oracle 11i/R12 applications.Your PlatformActivision Blizzard and Activision Publishing are headquartered in Santa Monica, California. Activision Blizzard is the parent company of Activision Publishing and Blizzard Entertainment, providing corporate shared services (e.g., HR, IT, Finance, Legal, Sales, and Supply Chain) for both companies globally. Activision is a global interactive entertainment software leader and the world’s largest independent video game publisher.* The video game industry and therefore our business are fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.

Name: IT Systems Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionENERGY FOR WHATS AHEAD Are you looking to make a difference in your career? Were working on smarter grids, cleaner energy and tools to help people manage energy more efficiently. About Information Technology The role of IT goes beyond the traditional Information Technology service provider. Many of the innovative ideas and projects that shape the companys future and move SCE forward are dependent on technology. IT employees are at the heart of these projects, collaborating, designing and executing technology solutions that are transforming our industry. About You:You are a natural problem solver who wants to grow in a flexible, empowered culture.You are relentlessly curious and always asking why do we do it this way?.You are deeply analytical with an ability to critically think through complex business issues.You have the ability to develop and maintain strong client relationships.You are adaptable, thriving off variety and new challenges.Position Overview Provides strategic, analytical, technical support for business and technology solution planning activities. Works with IT planning teams and business clients to identify, collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation (using appropriate tools and models) from which business cases and initiative roadmaps are developed. Conducts business case development, designs presentations and performs business process analysis to ensure integration, communication, alignment and proper hand-offs.Plays a key role in soliciting and documenting business requirements as the team is moving to a Capabilities Based Model. May act as a subject matter expert for Transmission & Distribution/OU specific applications including asset management (e.g., Design Manager), work management systems, planning systems and other business support systems. Performs problem analysis, directs implementation of resolution and mitigation. Will ensure all appropriate IT and OU technology planning artifacts are completed.Typical ResponsibilitiesIT Systems Business Analysis Lead analysis of business requirements and the development of system requirements and design specifications to address complex business needs. Performs statistical analysis to support a wide variety of business initiatives to integrate work across relevant areas, develop business strategies and services, enhance client satisfaction and productivity, manage risks appropriately, execute business plans, and manage information.Business Intelligence Provides valuable input to business intelligence roadmaps and development plans. Including ad-hoc report development and data mining. IT Technology Partnerships Work with key business partners and IT teams, leads work to understand business priorities, identify strategic initiatives. Assesses business imperatives and goals and articulates them as Information Technology needs. Facilitates translation of business needs to develop business cases. Partners with business and technology partners to elicit, analyze, translate, and document business requirements into technical requirements. Identify gaps in the potential solution and communicate to stakeholders.Project Management Coordinates projects/programs, process improvement efforts, performance analytics/metrics, optimization, cost budgets, project resources to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget. Including the creation, tracking and coordination of the investment planning documents (Investment and project proposals) Process Improvement Leads the demand intake process and the identification and training on the use of appropriate tools to support the work intake and routing processes.QualificationsMinimum QualificationsBachelors degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or related major/ discipline.Eight (8) or more years of experience in defining system requirements, project scope, and performing cost/benefit analysis.Experience gathering data from different sources and formats (MS Excel, Access, SAP, etc.) and compiling it for the ease of analysis.Two (2) or more years of experience with Microsoft Excel performing advanced functions such as VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, filtering/sorting, charts and graphing.Desired QualificationsMasters degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or related major/ discipline.Ten (10) or more years of experience in defining system requirements, project scope, and performing cost/benefit analysis.Experience with Remedy Ticketing system.Experience with electric utility systems, for example Design Manager and Work Planning applications.Ability to make effective decisions that meet business needs while minimizing risk and operating within company policies and all levels of regulations.CommentsCandidates for this position must be legally authorized to work directly as employees for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.Relocation does not apply to this position.Additional testing may be administered as part of the selection process for this position. Southern California Edison, an Edison International (NYSE:EIX) company, serves a population of approximately 15 million via 5 million customer accounts in a 50,000-square-mile service area within Central, Coastal and Southern California. Join the utility leader that is safely delivering reliable, affordable electricity to our customers for over 125 years.  SCE is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status.

Name: Investment Information Services Analyst
Description: Req ID: 26461Experience Level: Professional Other Location(s): N/A Relocation offered: NoTravel required: NoneCome grow with usAt Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous.Global Client Services is part of Capital Group’s Investment Operations organization, with offices in Los Angeles, London, Singapore, and Tokyo. GCS services Capital’s institutional clients, prospects and intermediaries, and supports institutional marketing, sales and distribution teams. The mission of Global Client Services is to deliver a superior client experience and enable the distribution of Capital Group’s investment services globally. Based in Los Angeles, the Investment Information Services Analyst will provide key organizational investment strategy and portfolio information to institutional investors, fund shareholders, and consultants. The individual in this role will also partner with senior staff on complex projects, analysis and related tasks as well as identify opportunities to streamline department processes, applications and system efficiencies. Responsibilities:Provide comprehensive investment reporting to Capital Group’s institutional client base; including results, portfolio characteristics, portfolio attribution, investment commentary and organizational statistics. Monitor the integrity of information, investigate and resolve discrepancies. Drive continuous improvement efforts to optimize processes and ensure accuracy and completeness of data.Provide data expertise to Client Service and Sales and Marketing teams, as well as complex client queries on quantitative data.Support enterprise wide initiatives and strategic objectives. Qualifications:3+ years of experience within investment management or financial services industry highly preferred, undergraduate degree required. CFA a plus.Familiarity with investments and general portfolio statistics, with the ability to analyze data and information.Knowledge of standard processes, tools, and deliverables for projects and business analysis, including: requirements gathering, documentation, analysis, testing through implementation, and on-going support with business and IT partners.Ability to build strong relationships, establish credibility, and obtain buy-in from key stakeholders. Company Overview:Founded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.7 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers. Name: IT Business Analyst - Budget Prep Plan, Assets, Inventory
Description: The University of Southern California (USC) has established a Workday Financials deployment program covering our academic enterprise as well as our hospitals. This program is critical to USC's overall goals to improve administrative efficiency. Workday Financials will be paired with the existing Workday HR and Payroll solutions implemented in 2013.  We are currently seeking a Business Analyst Budget Prep Plan, Assets, Inventory to join our Workday Financials deployment program team. The Business Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that the overall Workday solutions meet the business requirements. This includes requirements gathering, solution design, build, test, and deployment. Design will involve extrapolating from requirements the fundamental needs of the business while leveraging the most efficient solution provided by Workday. In some cases, we expect to challenge and optimize current business process.  The ideal candidate must possess 2 years of business analyst experience with a sound understanding of project management methodologies, business process flow, and documentation procedures. Experience with large enterprise software projects, Workday or other Financial ERP solutions and within Higher Education/Healthcare are strongly preferred.  ITS is committed to providing information technology services and support to the university. ITS provides essential, university-wide services such as: Enterprise information systemsUniversity wired and wireless networksEducational TechnologyResearch ComputingIT Security This is a fixed-term position with an anticipated end date of December 31, 2021 Please note that this is a full-time role eligible for benefits, including medical, dental, and vision plans. What You'll Do:Facilitate design workshops and work closely with business owners to gather and document user stories within USC's tracking softwareTranslate user stories into detailed requirements and Workday use casesWork with project leadership and business owners to adapt requirements with an eye for business process optimizationDevelop subject matter expertise for assigned business and associated system functionalityWork collaboratively in an iterative agile 'style' environmentWork with project team members and consultants to configure the applicationHelp manage execution of the testing strategyAssist project team members in the design of new (or redesign of existing) integrationsDraft project documentation including configuration manuals and business cases (e.g., white paper, policy challenges) supporting the escalation of business decisionsMeet with customer groups to determine IT business requirementsElicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.Provide information to developers and subject matter experts for the establishment of the technical vision and performance needsServe as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development or business process re-engineering team through which requirements flowParticipate in project meetings to review project deliverables and timelines.Work with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of projectParticipate in testing developed software or new process flowPerform other duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any timeThe Must Haves:Bachelor's degree in business administration, organization development, communication or related discipline2 years of business analysis experienceStrong knowledge and understanding of project management methodologies, business process flow, and documentation procedures Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and toolsStrong oral and written communication skillsAbility to multitask, interact with multiple stakeholders and navigate changing priorities.Ability to work on moderately complex programming activities under supervision of senior IT Business AnalystExperience supporting administrative processes for budget checking, asset management, or inventory managementThe Nice to Haves:3-5 years of business analyst experience focused on large enterprise software projects or supportSome experience working within a Higher Education and/or Health Care industryExperience with Workday or other Financial ERP solutions through on-going support or deploymentBenefits: USC benefits include a choice of retirement programs, 12 paid vacation days per year, 12 paid sick days per year, university holidays, a choice of medical and dental plans, and discounts to football games, basketball games, and other campus events.  Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree, Combined experience/education as substitute for minimum education  Minimum Experience: 2 years, Combined education/experience as substitute for minimum experience  Minimum Field of Expertise: Sound knowledge of documentation procedures, project management methodologies, program flow charts and operator instructions. Competent to work on moderately complex programming activities under supervision of senior IT Business Analyst.  USC is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law or USC policy. USC will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring ordinance. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Applicants with questions about access or requiring a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should contact USC Human Resources by phone at (213) 821-8100, or by email at uschr@usc.edu. Inquiries will be treated as confidential to the extent permitted by law. Name: ALM Modeling Analyst
Description: Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world (as ranked by S&P Global, April 2018) with total assets of over $2.9 trillion (106.2 (JPY) as of March 30, 2018) and 150,000 colleagues in more than 50 countries. In the U.S., we’re 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. At Union Bank, we aim to be the premier and most-trusted West Coast bank, serving customers with high-touch, local delivery and global capabilities as we leverage our rich, 150-year history. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by competitive Total Rewards, including our cash balance pension plan. Join a team that’s working to fulfill its vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group.Job SummaryReporting to the Director of Asset Liability Modeling, the ALM Modeling Analyst will primarily be focused on supporting the Interest Rate Risk (IRR) measurement process, including the Economic Value of Equity (EVE) and Earnings at Risk (EAR) measures. The Analyst will leverage the IRR framework for periodic stress testing (CCAR and DFAST), support other deliverables including monthly budget / forecasting needs, implement models and tools and participate in all associated governance. The positon will provide expertise and support for data generation / ETL process, work with various lines of business and be responsible for ad hoc analysis as needed.The position performs work that is complex and varied by nature and includes a significant amount of attention to detail and flexibility to support management and regulatory reporting.Major Responsibilities: Own, manage and develop processes associated with periodic Stress Testing (CCAR and DFAST) including specific model and analytical tool implementationContribute to the expanded use of Stress Test processes (increased frequency and integration into other bank processes)Support the monthly Interest Rate Risk (IRR) processes associated with Economic Value of Equity (EVE) and Earnings at Risk (EAR)Develop a deep understanding of the Bank's balance sheet, individual product profiles and associated risksWork with management to craft strategies in the mitigation of Interest Rate and other riskDemonstrate outstanding quantitative, communication and presentation skillsWork with large data sets for analytical purposes, data extraction and loading and reconciliation.Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Business Administration, Financial Engineering, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Mathematics or related discipline. Masters preferred.Experience desired in a commercial or retail bank, including accounting, financial reporting, fixed income security analysis, financial modeling, programming, database development, or a combination of education and experience sufficient to satisfactorily perform the duties of this job. Experience with Financial Database Systems such as SQL Server, Oracle, Hyperion, etc. desired.Knowledge and understanding of a bank’s balance sheet including individual financial instruments (e.g. fixed-income analysis) and regulatory requirements is desired. A solid understanding of accounting theory, economic drivers and the banking industry is preferredCFA or FRM, or in process testing, a plusKnowledge of MS Office Suite (emphasis on Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Visio)QRM Enterprise Risk Framework or similar Interest Rate Risk measurement program experience desiredKnowledge of Python and VBA programming languages desiredThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities duties and skills required of personnel so classified.We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category. A conviction is not an absolute bar to employment. Factors such as the age of the offense, evidence of rehabilitation, seriousness of violation, and job relatedness are considered in all employment decisions. Additionally, it’s the bank’s policy to only inquire into a candidate’s criminal history after an offer has been made. Federal law prohibits banks from employing individuals who have been convicted of, or received a pretrial diversion for, certain offenses.

Name: Associate Manager, Business Analyst
Description: Requisition ID:  2544 Company:  Epson America, IncExternal Job Description  The Business Analyst will be responsible for the analysis of pricing, market conditions, and profitability for Epson Business Inkjet products in the commercial channels of North America. They will need to build pricing models, profitability matrixes and other tools to help them quickly analyze the market and develop reports for their internal customers. The Business Analyst will need to be highly proficient in MS Excel as well as utilizing internal Epson reporting systems and programs. They also will provide business analytical support for major accounts and commercial bid opportunities, pricing proposals, profitability analysis and sales proposals to drive Epson’s Business Inkjet Printer line growth. Name: Data Analyst
Description: Joybird is the leading maker of handcrafted, custom-built furniture for the modern home and office. Through an innovative online shopping model, Joybird is transforming the way people purchase furniture by putting the customer at the center of the design process. With hundreds of fabrics, finishes and custom dimensions to choose from, each piece of furniture is as unique as the customer creating it. Inspired by mid-century modern design, LA-based Joybird utilizes responsible sourcing and manufacturing practices and offers a 365-day home trial.  We are looking for a Data Analyst to help us evolve our data landscape to deliver high impact, high visibility dashboards and reporting using tools like R, Tableau, Domo, Redshift and Heap. The ideal candidate will be supporting departments with data research and requests, which measure marketing initiatives and making proactive recommendations that deliver the key goals of Joybird. What You'll Do:Creating, writing and optimizing SQL scripts to support the data teamSupport all departments with data requests (building Tableau reports, Domo reports, ad hoc data pulls etc.)Experience with data visualization and analytic dashboard in TableauWork cross-functionally to help inform the teams on key learnings from data analysisTechnical documentation of all reports and data projects (Confluence)Collect, maintain, manage, interpret and analyze data received from internal and external data sources.Support in research projects - developing reports to present findings to leadershipWhat You'll Need:Minimum 3 years professional experience in related fieldExpert level knowledge of SQL, Tableau, Amazon RedshiftStrong data visualization skillsAbility to make data digestible to non-data centric team membersMust work quicklyExperience with R and Python a plusExperience working with an ecommerceOur Core Values:Customer Centric - You are passionate about delivering an end-to-end WOW experience for every customer.Transparent You exchange information and feedback frequently to strengthen relationships, ensure alignment, and elevate problem solving.ResultsDriven You aim high and go beyond tradition and standards to reach our goals.Constantly Evolving You're never satisfied and are unafraid to be a better version of yourself. Perks:Competitive salaryA business that trusts and embraces techA leadership team that wants to do it right and is open to new ideasA startup with a proven business model that's growing fastGenerous benefits including medical, dental, vision, FSA, 401(K) with an abbreviated waiting periodAmple Paid Time OffFully stocked pantry with your choice of snacks and drinksFurniture discounts (for friends and family too!)$2,000 and up for two weeks of your time for self-directed professional development

Name: Senior Digital Product Analyst
Description: The Product Analyst - Senior (PAS) works closely with the Product Owner to facilitate requirements gathering (stories) for all projects. He/she is a key member of the team for the duration of the project and is accountable for consulting with stakeholders to understand project goals and objectives, processes, and requirements. The PAS collaborates with other members of the delivery team to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into user stories and conceptual designs, from which applications and solutions are developed. This person needs to have a solid understanding of existing processes and systems. This person will also serve as the Product Owner when needed. This person will also assist with the overall strategy and competitive analysis as needed.General Responsibilities:Determine product and system needs and objectives and consult with stakeholders regarding problems with current business applications or systems, enhancements, or new functionality.Facilitates story gathering sessions, including leading discussions.Prepare and maintain product backlog for maintenance/enhancements and present recommendations to management.Creates test scriptsProvides clarification of stories to other project team members to assist them in the creation of their specific project deliverables (e.g., assists the QA team in the creation of the Testing Strategy and Testing Execution Plan for UAT)Conduct user testing on current systems, new systems and future maintenance. Verifies the appearance of the testing output to ensure it meets the requirements.Collaborate with Digital Channels, BATS, Legal and Compliance, Product Management and others to create and implement correct operational and business documentation as they relate to the product or system application.Basic Qualifications:*Bachelor's degree (preferably in an IT related field of study*Minimum 8 years of related experience as an analyst supporting medium to large size projects or 3 years of related experience and advanced degree*Minimum 3 years of experience in banking/financial services industryPreferred Qualifications:Has the ability to balance role responsibilities and work load appropriatelyAbility to work with business and technology stakeholdersAbility to disseminate both business and technical content to a wide variety of stakeholdersStrong organizational skillsKnowledge of testing strategies, test plans, test execution.Ability to multi task between multiple projects and dutiesAbility to collect requirements and translate them into stories using a variety of methods (one-on-one, group, JAD sessions, etc.)Ability to interact with functional and technical counterparts to ensure that the application will meet requirement specificationsThorough understanding of "business needs analysis" process and how requirements relate to daily business operationsExcellent project management methodologies and proceduresBe proactive and highly motivated; demonstrate the ability and desire to work independently and confidently, yet also as part of a teamStrong time management skills and the ability to self-motivateExcellent communication skillsDemonstrates excellent writing and documentation skillsPossesses solid problem-solving and analytical skillsCommunicates easily with varying stakeholders *Represents basic qualifications for the position. To be considered for this position you must at least meet the basic qualifications. Name: Asset and Corporate Action Analyst
Description: Req ID: 23862 Experience Level: Professional Other Location(s): N/A Relocation offered: Yes Travel required: None Come grow with us At Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.  Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous.  Partner Facing Operations directly supports Capital Group's investment professionals, implements investment decisions and facilitates the investment process, operating from locations in North America, Europe, and Asia. As an Analyst you will play a critical role on the Asset and Corporate Action team. The team focuses on corporate action monitoring, asset setup and maintenance across equity and fixed income portfolios for retail, institutional and private clients. Our team works closely with Analysts and Portfolio Managers, Custodian Banks, Internal Operations teams, and Legal. Responsibilities:Interact with Portfolio Managers and Research Analysts to provide information and research on corporate action events, and implement front office electionsWork with other business units to verify compliance within the guidelines, tax consequences and other restrictions on eventsIndependently research asset information by leveraging Bloomberg, term sheets and/or prospectusProvide support for the set up and ongoing review and maintenance of asset data in Investment Systems across various investment classesQualifications:Experience of finance or investment operations preferredBachelor's degree requiredHigh level of accuracy and attention to detail with high service orientation, integrity, ownership of work and strong communication skillsIntermediate to Advanced technical skills: Microsoft Excel (v-lookup, pivot tables, macros)Sound judgment in identifying and resolving complex issues with the ability to assess/anticipate impacts and challenges within the departmentCompany Overview: Founded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.7 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers. We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment.
