Name: Senior Investment Information Services Analyst
Description: Req ID: 25701Experience Level: Professional Other Location(s): N/A Relocation offered: YesTravel required: NoneCome grow with usAt Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous.Global Client Services (GCS) is part of Capital Group’s Investment Operations organization, with offices in Los Angeles, London, Singapore, and Tokyo. GCS services Capital’s institutional clients, prospects and intermediaries, and supports institutional marketing, sales and distribution teams. The mission of GCS is to deliver a superior client experience and enable the distribution of Capital Group’s investment services globally. Based in Los Angeles, the Senior Investment Information Services Analyst will provide portfolio information and key organization investment strategy to institutional investors, fund shareholders, and consultants. The individual in this role will also partner with senior staff on complex projects, analysis, and related tasks as well as identify opportunities to streamline department processes, applications and system efficiencies.Responsibilities:Provide comprehensive investment reporting to Capital Group’s institutional client base; including results, portfolio characteristics, portfolio attribution, investment commentary and organizational statistics.Monitor the integrity of information, investigate and resolve discrepancies. Drive continuous improvement efforts to optimize processes and ensure accuracy and completeness of data.Provide data expertise to Client Service and Sales and Marketing teams, as well as complex client queries on quantitative data.Support enterprise wide initiatives and strategic objectives.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics or related field; CFA designation preferred3-5 years of experience within investment management or financial services industry highly preferred,Familiarity with investments and general portfolio statistics, with the ability to analyze data and information.Knowledge of standard processes, tools, and deliverables for projects and business analysis, including: requirements gathering, documentation, analysis, testing through implementation, and on-going support with business and IT partners.Ability to build strong relationships, establish credibility, and obtain buy-in from key stakeholders.Company Overview:Founded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.7 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers. We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Name: Senior Analyst, Film Strategy & Business Development
Description: Job Title Senior Analyst, Film Strategy & Business Development  16-Nov-2018 Business Segment Filmed Entertainment Group ResponsibilitiesRole Summary: The Film Strategy department is a highly visible group that works closely with senior executive management across Comcast (including the Chairman of the Filmed Entertainment Group, Chairman of Universal Pictures & President of Universal Pictures) and worldwide. The group works in conjunction with other business units within UP on a wide range of strategic initiatives including identifying key growth opportunities as well as operating efficiencies, examining film financing & acquisition deals, release dating and managing the film greenlight process  Universal Pictures seeks a highly qualified candidate for the position of SeniorAnalyst, Film Strategy & Operations. This position will manage strategic planning activities across Universal Pictures. Specific projects will include research, analysis, financial modeling, and recommendations related to greenlighting, internal business performance improvement, emerging industry trends and competitive threats as well as support for M&A or strategic investments. The position offers unique exposure to a wide variety of businesses within the media and entertainment industry. Essential Responsibilities:Work closely with groups across Universal Pictures to formulate the vision and strategy at both a business-unit and corporate-levelFacilitate various deliverables including long range planning, release dating and strategic slate analysisFormulate presentations for executive management on current Universal Pictures’ initiativesWork closely with team members of all-levels to execute on tactical and strategic operations of the businessPreparing financial models related to film acquisition, film financing, production and distributionJob Number41869BRPosting Category Strategy & Business Development Country United States Sub-Business Film Business Development About Us At NBCUniversal, we believe in the talent of our people. It’s our passion and commitment to excellence that drives NBCU’s vast portfolio of brands to succeed. From broadcast and cable networks, news and sports platforms, to film, world-renowned theme parks and a diverse suite of digital properties, we take pride in all that we do and all that we represent. It’s what makes us uniquely NBCU. Here you can create the extraordinary. Join us. State/Province California Career Level Experienced Qualifications/RequirementsBasic Qualifications: Universal Pictures is seeking exceptional candidates with 2-4 years of experience in strategic planning, management consulting, business development or investment banking, ideally in the entertainment industry. The role requires superior strategic, financial and relationship skills. The individual must possess the ability to interface effectively with multiple levels of management, ranging from senior corporate executives to business unit managers and third parties. The ideal candidate will also possess: BS/BA degree Excellent quantitative and analytical skills, including significant financial modeling experience Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to author and deliver presentations Eligibility Requirements:Interested candidates must submit a resume/CV online to be considered Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States Must be covered by Solutions, NBCU’s Alternative Dispute Resolution Program Desired CharacteristicsAbility to handle multiple tasks under tight deadlines A solid understanding of the film and/or media markets/ business models Ability to work independently as well as part of a team Prior investment banking and/or management consulting experience preferred City Universal City Notices NBCUniversal’s policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, where applicable.

Name: Senior Business Technology Analyst (Los Angeles area, CA)
Description: ZS is the world’s largest consulting firm focused exclusively on improving business performance through sales and marketing consulting solutions, from customer insights and strategy to analytics, operations and technology. Together, we design and implement strategies that lead to greater market share, more competitive operations and increased use of today’s latest technologies. From our worldwide offices, ZS professionals draw on deep industry and domain expertise to deliver impact where it matters for clients. We are particularly known for our expertise in the pharmaceutical and health care sectors, yet work across a range of industries. ZS's Business Technologygroup focuses on strategizing, designing and building marketing and sales technology solutions to improve commercial effectiveness. The types of solutions include enterprise information management, reporting, analytics, CRM/SFA and business process automation enablement. We provide a complete spectrum of business technology solutions, from strategy and roadmap definition to full implementation and on-going operations. Our team possesses deep expertise in leading analytic, business intelligence, CRM and system integration technologies, which we apply in a pragmatic fashion to create and deliver optimal architecture and implementation solutions. The Solution Delivery team implements technology based solutions in the areas of business intelligence, analytics, information management, reporting and mobility. In addition, this team configures ZS' proprietary software used to streamline business processes for commercial groups at client organizations. This team takes overall ownership of the delivery of the technical solution leading the design and development phases and collaborating with other teams for business requirements and system testing. SENIOR BUSINESS TECHNOLOGY ANALYSTResponsibilities:Lead design and development phases during implementation of world-class technology solutions to solve business problems across multiple client engagements;Partner with program lead to build comprehensive implementation project plans with well-defined tasks and owners;Leverage information from requirements-gathering phase and utilize past experience to design a flexible and scalable solution;Apply appropriate development methodologies (e.g.: agile, waterfall) and best practices (e.g.: mid-development client reviews, embedded QA procedures, unit testing) to ensure successful and timely completion;Collaborate with other team members (involved in the requirements gathering, testing, roll-out and operations phases) to ensure seamless transitions.Communicate business requirements & work closely with development teams to ensure accurate understanding and implementation;Lead the development of project outputs such as business case development, solution vision and design, user requirements, solution mockup, prototypes, and technical architecture (if needed), test cases, and deployment plans;Help lead user adoption and change management activities during inception, UAT and post implementation phases;Qualifications:Bachelor's/Master's degree with specialization in Computer Science, MIS, IT or other computer related disciplines;4-6 years of relevant consulting-industry experience working on medium-large scale technology solution delivery engagements;Minimum 1 year working with big data tools and technologiesExtensive experience working with front-end user reporting (e.g.: MSTR, Business Object, Cognos), back-end database management (e.g.: Oracle, Teradata) and/or ETL interfacing (e.g.: Informatica, SSIS) technologies; - Big Data preferredManage team of analyst across different development skill-sets (Front-end user reporting, Back-end database management, ETL interfacing).Additional skills:Deep understanding of data management best practices and data analyticsUp to speed with latest technologies in reporting, data warehousing, and data managementAbility to lead requirements sessions with clients and project teams;Excellent verbal and written communication, organization, planning and leadership skills;Ability to distill complex concepts into easy-to-understand frameworks and presentationsStrong leadership, verbal and written communication skills with ability to articulate results and issues to internal and client teamsProven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environmentAbility to work within a virtual global team environment and contribute to the overall timely delivery of multiple projectsWillingness to travel to other global offices as needed to work with client or other internal project teams ZS is a global consulting firm; fluency in English is required, additional fluency in at least one European or Asian language is desirable.  Candidates must possess work authorization for their intended country of employment. An on-line application, including a cover letter expressing interest and a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered.  ZS offers a competitive compensation package with salary and bonus incentives, complete medical/dental/life insurance programs and retirement savings benefits. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.Connect with ZS on social media:Like ZS Careers on FacebookFollow ZS Careers on Twitter and InstagramFollow ZS on LinkedIn for more job opportunitiesSubscribe to the ZS YouTube channelExplore the Life at ZS blog ZS has been recognized globally for its expertise in consulting and its flexible work environment. View ZS’s accolades. #LI-PS1

Name: Business Intelligence Administrator (Business Objects experience is required)
Description: Business Intelligence Administrator As a Business Intelligence Administrator you will be responsible for developing, researching and implementing data analysis projects including but not limited to data reporting, data visualizations, and ad-hoc research projects. You will work closely with the Technology Development management team on planning, design, installation, configuration and maintenance of said systems. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that our data systems are engineered for greater flexibility and reuse. You will work with various department to ensure that their future data needs are met with our current and future designs while accomplishing these and other critical functions: Working with Firm Management to further Enterprise Analytics and Business Intelligence reporting and visualization capabilities. Administering the Business Objects reporting environments including server side administration and user / security administration through CMC and design universes/reports Working with Senior Management on research projects to design, develop and deploy new universes / reports. Analyzing and verifying internal consistency, completeness and accuracy of data systems and makes required adjustments. Actnig as a resource to the firm on various data related questions for staff and other users. Responding to user questions and issues in a timely manner and assists with solutions. Working with vendors in order to resolve complex issues. Staying abreast of current and new development processes, tools, technologies, and market trends as they relate to systems development and implementation in support of the legal industry. Working with various firm department and practice group attorney leadership or designees to provide guidance and support for development projects as they relate to more specific areas in the practice of Law at the Firm. As a Business Intelligence Administrator, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Business Intelligence Analyst must have strong administration experience with SAP Business Objects, including installing, upgrading, troubleshooting, and auditing the environment; strong skills in Business Objects universe and report development; strong SQL skills, including data profiling skills to identify and understand anomalies; the ability to comprehend and accurately perform advanced data analysis and communicate data findings. Experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools is preferred, along with experience with R, Python, NoSQL technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra, Apache Storm, MongoDB and Basho a plus. A Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Math, Economics or a related field is preferred. Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: EducationBachelor's DegreeSkillsExcelMicrosoft PowerpointBenefitsRetirement PlanFlexible Spending Account Company Overview  SmartAction is a cutting-edge Intelligent Voice Automation (IVA/IVR) and digital customer self-service services company on a rapid growth trajectory. Our disruptive, yet well-proven technology, strong customer base, and financial strength, form a solid foundation for long-term viability.  Our solution is based on over 10 years of artificial intelligence research and development and is well positioned to fill the significant void between current technology and human call center agents. It is a truly unique solution within a rapidly expanding technology market for Cloud based AI solutions. We offer an energetic work environment, a great product, and operational and technical support, to enable the right candidate to be successful.  What You'll Do  Process Improvement  Take a proactive approach to improving sales, partner and related business processes including data capture and integrity  Working with sales and partner management to refine and/or redefine sales/business processes and the point of data captured during the sales cycle making sure its efficient, intuitive, necessary, and adopted  Business Analysis  Lead the analysis of sales, partner and related business data to identify patterns, missed opportunities, blueprints, areas of improvement, etc.  Present key findings to sales, partner and business management with actionable recommendations to improve success  Identifying white-space opportunities, good and bad habits, areas of expansion, sales rep competencies, etc.  Reporting  Be the owner and go-to-person for creating views, dashboards and reports and ensuring key stakeholders in the sales, partner and business units receive and consume the necessary intelligence to run their business efficiently  Responding to requests as well as identifying, defining and creating a library of repeatable reports that are required on a regular basis (e.g., Sales meetings, BOD meetings, etc.) for the key stakeholders (e.g., management, sales, sales reps, partners)  Management  Own, manage and be the guardian for all sales and partner data, and the tools used by SmartAction, including SFDC, Outreach, ********, ZoomInfo, Zoom, Calendly, LinkedIn, Channeltivity, etc.  Vendor management, license ordering, support, maintenance, data inspection and cleansing, integrations, and creation of a taxonomy covering terminology and best practices for each tool  What We're Looking For  The candidate for Business Operations Analyst will be our sales and business ambassador. In ition, the ideal candidate will have:  Bachelor's Degree in Business or related field  5-7+ years of experience in analytics, operations, and sales  Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills  Advanced Salesforce skills  High level of attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, and ability to prioritize demands and meet deadlines  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Proven ability to analyze complex data and distill this information into meaningful reports and presentations  Candidate should be hands on - not afraid to wear multiple hats - no job being too small or too large  Other Personal Characteristics  Intelligent, bright, conceptual thinker and a quick learner with the ability to quickly assess a situation and generate new insights and usable ideas  A leader as well as a team player who takes responsibility for results  Ability to positively influence others to achieve goals  Good chemistry and fit with the firm's culture; a constructive positive attitude; mature and self-confident; a consensus builder and team player  Creative and curious, able to develop new and innovative solutions to complex problems  Outstanding reputation of professional integrity with the potential to be personally credible within the organization  Physical Demands and Work Environment  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.  We offer a fun and energetic work environment in ition to M/D/V, 401k, FSA, vacation, and work-life balance.  The company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, drug free workplace, and complies with ADA regulations as applicable.  Job Type: Full-time  To for this position please email your resume and cover letter to **********************. Be sure to put the job title Business Operations Analyst in the subject line.  This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. Name: Senior Manager, Business/ Data Analyst Lead
Description: Recruiter Hitachi  Location Los Angeles, California  Salary Competitive  Posted 12 Nov 2018  Closes 12 Dec 2018  Ref 41312  Sector Power and Nuclear  Category Business and Commercial, Management, Skilled Trades  Contract Type Permanent  Hours Full Time  You need to sign in or create an account to save  Senior Manager, Business/ Data Analyst Lead  As Hitachi, Ltd.'s (NYSE: HIT) global consulting company, Hitachi Consulting is a recognized leader in delivering proven business and IT solutions to Global 2000 companies. We leverage decades of business process, vertical industry, and leading-edge technology experience to understand each company's unique needs. From business strategy development through application deployment, we are committed to helping clients quickly realize measurable business value and achieve sustainable ROI.  Hitachi Consulting's client base includes nearly 35 percent of the Fortune 100 and many leading mid-market companies. We offer a client-focused, collaborative approach and transfer knowledge throughout each engagement. Position Overview: Looking for a leader to join the Hitachi Insights & Analytics (I & A) consulting delivery group who has a proven track record in helping business customer gain insights into their data. This person will have a well-developed ability to identify data patterns and anomalies, have strong root-cause analysis skills, and be able to present complex findings to the business so they may make meaningful decisions. This person will have strong SQL skills to wrangle data (i.e., mine, enhance and transform) and develop deep insights, as well as strong business communication and presentation skills to communicate insights and recommendations.  This leader will participate in analytical sales pursuits (proposal creation, estimation, presentations, etc.), in strategic analytical assessments, and in developing and delivering analytical solutions with a global delivery team. This person will demonstrate strong critical thinking, have natural curiosity/desire to solve the entire problem, and naturally takes ownership to drive themselves and their team to a correct and complete conclusion. Qualifications Required Qualifications  8+ years of Business Data Analysis Skills for Analytic Efforts  6+ years of experience with data query methods SQL, PIG  4+ years of Management experience  3+ years of experience with leading consulting delivery teams  3+ years of developing / understanding end-to-end data process flows and usage scenarios  2+ years with data visualization (Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau, Power BI, R)  Experience with working with data from ERP, SCM, and IoT sources  Strong consulting skills including: analysis and problem solving, written and verbal communication, presentation preparation/delivery, and team collaboration  Strong math skills (e.g., applied statistics, linear algebra, numeric analysis)  Ability to work across a variety of database technologies  Bachelor's Degree Required  Optional Qualifications  Hands-on experience with cloud-based analytical services (AWS, Azure, GCP)  Experience with scripting languages (R, SPSS, SAS)  6 Sigma green-belt certification with focus on root-cause analysis methods  Travel  Typical travel requires consultants to be at the client location Monday-Thursday  Location US Hitachi Consulting offers excellent benefits and career growth to all employees!  Hitachi Consulting Is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V  'Equal Opportunity Employer: EOE - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities' 'If you need a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job at Hitachi, please send the nature of request and contact information ************************************ . Solid presentation & written communication skills.  Ability to model and create complex spreadsheets, look up tables, pivot tables. Excellent time management skills working under time pressure and handling multiple tasks/projects at the same time.  Problem resolution experience requiring strong financial analytical skills, sound judgment and ability to work effectively with clients and technical staff.  Experience with financial database/software (knowledge of Hyperion or SQL is a plus, but not a requirement).  Experience with the Quantitative Risk Management (QRM) Enterprise Risk Framework is preferred but not a requirement.

Name: Lead Business Analyst-IT
Description: Posting Title Lead Business Analyst-IT Requisition Number 182310 Location Mattel-El Segundo Zip Code 90245 Job Category Information Technology Company  Mattel is a global, purpose-driven company that helps children learn and develop through play. By inspiring wonder in the next generation, Mattel is committed to shaping a brighter tomorrow, with play experiences that capture kids’ hearts, open their minds and unlock their potential through play. With worldwide net sales of more than $5.5B, a workforce in 40 countries, and products sold in over 150 nations, Mattel is a Fortune 500, multinational design, marketing and manufacturing powerhouse. Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst for Planning, your specific duties and responsibilities are: Serve as the primary business-facing liaison for Global Supply Chain Planning functions. Develop and maintain business partnerships to support the enhancement and global delivery of Advanced Planning IT solutions. Compare input from various sources to draw insightful conclusions. Employ effective approaches when partnering with third party and internal teams.Provide Supply Chain functional expertise when partnering with business teams to help identify opportunities for improvement – both via process re-engineering and from automation through technology.Provide Supply Chain packaged solution and process expertise when connecting IT and business stakeholders and identifying new IT-enabled solutions. Evaluate packaged solution options against IT roadmap, key requirements, and various constraints.Develop business case documentation along with financial justification and ROI for all initiatives. Partner with IT leadership to establish project approach, timeline, and staffing requirements.Ensure development and sign-off of project scope. Adhere to rigorous change management process.Deliver against approved project budgets. Ensure timely and accurate invoicing and reconciliation.Facilitate design sessions with business. Elicit business requirements and translate into high-level technical requirements, use cases, and user acceptance test plans. Identify gaps against packaged solution configurations.Demonstrate skill when documenting current-state and future-state business process and data flows.Lead user acceptance testing and ensure that systems address business needs from users’ point of view.Manage multiple projects to coordinate all aspects of implementation and delivery of tasks necessary for successful project execution.Evaluate timing of software version upgrades and facilitate migrations.Partner with onshore and offshore IT Production Support teams to ensure stellar customer service and maintain reliability of GDPS Planning. For any noted production issues, validate root cause analysis and drive complete resolution.Create succinct, executive-level summaries to effectively convey project status and production support remediation to business and IT leadership.Develop formal mentoring and support relationships with junior GIT resources to foster development and continuous learning opportunities. Ability to communicate effectively with different functions across GIT and different levels within the organization. About Us ABOUT US Mattel is a leading global children’s entertainment company that specializes in design and production of quality toys and consumer products. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. We engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic franchises, including Barbie®, Hot Wheels®, American Girl®, Fisher-Price® and Thomas & Friends®, as well as other popular brands that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies. Since its founding in 1945, Mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in exploring the wonder of childhood and empowering kids to reach their full potential. Visit us online at www.mattel.com. Name: Business Data Analyst
Description: BUSINESS DATA ANALYST Responsible for ensuring the business makes better decisions through collection and usage of data. Ensures business data and analysis requirements are met by properly applying data concepts, including data structures, collection and cleansing, and structured and unstructured data analysis and reporting. Ability to collect, analyze, manipulate, and report on Kedren data. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESPerforms ad-hoc, strategic analysis of structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources, reflecting Kedrens business data as a part of the platform management team for Project Management.Develops data structures and pipelines to organize, collect, cleanse, and standardize data to generate insights and addresses reporting needs.Defines data requirements and gathers and validates information, using judgment and statistical tests.Utilizes programming and analytical tools, including relational database tools to formulate models and/or extract insights.Well versed in knowledge of creating algorithms, identifying patterns and insights from structured and unstructured data sets utilizing graphs, trees and/or other visual data representation techniques as required.Identifies and troubleshoots data integration and integrity issues in cooperation with the appropriate Kedren business units;Designs work flows and procedures.Identifies opportunities to maximize data usage, applying modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve business performance.Develops ad-hoc analytics and reporting based on analysis of existing data sources, utilizing a variety of tools (i.e. SSRS, Tableau, Power BI or other standard BI tools).Exhibits analytical rigor, judgment, and ability to present a comprehensive 'data story' to multiple levels of the organization.Other Duties as Assigned QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.EDUCATION and EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree in computer science, math, engineering or related fieldMinimum of 3 years of experience in:quantitative analysis, data modeling, reporting, relational database tools, data warehousing, database architecture, and SQL, SAS and/or SPSS2-3 years technical experience in software development, machine learning or statistical analysis, data engineering and data visualization related work. MS Office VBA automation, R, Python experience is ideal, but not required.COMMUNICATION SKILLSExcellent written and verbal communication skills.Strong organizational and analytical skills.Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers.Ability to effectively present information.HEALTH CARE KNOWLEDGERequires knowledge of health care terms and principles.REASONING ABILITYAbility to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents.Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations.Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIESExperience with Microsoft BI stack (e.g., SQL, SSRS, Power BI) a bonus.Experience with MS Office VBA automation.Proficient in analytics programming (R, Python).Works with Business Partners and builds working relationshipsStrong experience with Tableau server (or similar application)Ability to provide leadership in predictive analytical projectsProficient in Microsoft Office Suite including Access, Advanced Excel (pivots, formulas, functions), PowerPoint, Word and SharePoint Strong analytical skills. Job Type: Full-time  Experience: quantitative analysis, data modeling and reporting: 3 years (Preferred)R. Python: 2 years (Preferred)technical software development: 2 years (Preferred)

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Senior Financial AnalystREF#: 32368 CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS Television Studios JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff JOB SCHEDULE: Full-Time JOB LOCATION: Los Angeles, CA ABOUT US: CBS Television Studios is one of the industry’s leading suppliers of programming for broadcast, basic and premium cable and streaming platforms. The Studio’s primetime programming includes the phenomenally successful NCIS franchise; the critically acclaimed series Madam Secretary, Jane The Virgin, Crazy Ex-Girlfriend and Reign; the hit dramas Elementary, Blue Bloods, Hawaii Five-0, MACGYVER, BULL and Scorpion; the popular comedies The Great Indoors, Kevin Can Wait, SUPERIOR DONUTS and MAN WITH A PLAN; and the summer series ZOO and new suspense thriller SALVATION. The Studio also produces the Daytime Emmy Award-winning talk show THE TALK, as well as the acclaimed THE LATE SHOW with STEPHEN COLBERT and the Emmy-nominated THE LATE LATE SHOW with JAMES CORDEN. For CBS All Access, CBS Television Network’s subscription video on-demand and live-streaming service, the Studio produces the highly anticipated Star Trek: Discovery, as well as critically acclaimed THE GOOD FIGHT. The Studio also produces two new series based on popular, viral segments from THE LATE LATE SHOW, CARPOOL KARAOKE for Apple and DROP THE MIC for TBS; the scripted summer series AMERICAN VANDAL for Netflix; and the comedy anthology THE GUEST BOOK for TBS. DESCRIPTION: The CBS Studios, Inc. unit of CBS Corporation is seeking a highly motivated Senior Financial Reporting Analyst that is a self-starter and team player. Ideal candidate must be detailed oriented, organized and possess good communication skills. This position with work with other departments and divisions within the corporation. Key responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following: Accurate and timely accounting and financial reporting of assigned business units and the consolidation of those results. Includes monthly, quarterly and annual preparation and presentation to management.Preparation of financial results and reconciliations.Perform financial statement variance analysis and deliver results to management.Assisting with quarterly internal / external audit requestsPerform controls testing to ensure compliance with Sarbanes Oxley regulations.Preparation of Ad-hoc reports and special projects.Preparation of monthly Balance Sheet and inventory schedules, including variance analysis from plan and prior month or quarter.Preparation of the monthly balance sheet as well as quarterly supplemental balance sheet rollforwards and other supporting schedules.Performing accounting and financial reporting system implementation and enhancement testing and continuously looking to identify process improvementsPreparation and input of journal entries necessary for month/quarter/year end accruals.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance, with 3-5+ years of comprehensive accounting experienceCPA preferred, not requiredOracle experience preferredCognos experience a plusStrong research, analytical, and problem solving skillsStrong work ethic that takes ownership of assigned areas and is capable of performing a variety of time sensitive tasksExcellent oral and written communication skillsWorks well in a team oriented environmentProficient with Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint) and able to learn other software applicationsA mix of public and private industry preferred #LI-CW1 EEO STATEMENT: Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Business Systems Analyst  Category: IT/Technical Description: TAD PGS, Inc. is currently seeking aBusiness Systems Analyst for an exciting opportunity in the Manhattan Beach, CA surrounding area. This is a long term contract or Corp. to Corp. position.  Applies a detailed knowledge of business and systems analysis concepts, practices and procedures to determine most effective business system application solutions. Requires an individual who has the ability to gather and document user requirements and translate the information collected to functional specifications including scoping documents, mock-ups, functional requirements/specifications and technical specifications. Includes data-mapping and interface mapping to databases and multiple internal and external (3rd party) applications. Experience in creating functional specifications for Internet web applications and familiarity with collecting and defining security requirements.  Skilled in producing functional specifications documents which include screen mockups and written functional requirements for screen and field functionality, screen flow, and interaction with databases, web services and interface files.Unless otherwise specifically requested, the systems analyst should have some significant experience doing systems analysis work for financial organizations (preferably banks). Skillsets required: + Excellent time management skills.  + Ability to work independently and manage work and deliverables.  + Excellent business and technical writing skills.  + Excellent communications skills (verbal and listening)  + Ability to communicate well with various audiences with and without technical knowledge . This involves working closely with Business Colleagues, and internal User Experience, Development and QA teams.  + Good interviewing skills  + Ability to ascertain current processes and business rules around processes.  + Ability to understand current processes and be able to identify and recommend process changes.  + Experienced in interviewing small to large groups of people at one time.  + Ability to collect requirements using a variety of methods (one-on-one, group, JAD sessions, etc).  + Ability to dig beneath the surface to discover all requirements including alternate processing rules and exception paths.  + Ability to elicit requirements and clarifications from our business users who may not all be in-house.  + Experience in Agile and Waterfall methodologies.  + Familiar with Business Requirements tools.  + Skilled in identifying interface requirements between products (includes field to field mapping) and in writing interface functional specifications.  + Experienced in data analysis/data mapping. + SQL: + Ability to understand SQL tables and field characteristics.  + Ability to understand SQL queries and stored procedures.  + Ability to write basic SQL queries.  + Some initiatives require someone who can understand complex data structures/models.  + Ability to identify and document business and data transformation rules.  + Web Services/API  + Experienced with Web Services and API interfaces.  + Ability to data map to web services and API?s.  + Ability to identify and document business and data transformation rules.  + File Mapping  + Ability to data map to file layout.  + Ability to identify and document business and data transformation rules.  + Ability to create workflow diagrams.  + Ability to create use cases. Company Description: TAD PGS, INC. specializes in delivering secure, reliable and rapidly implemented workforce solutions to the U.S. Federal marketplace, including U.S. Government agencies and their prime contractors. With more than 50 years of experience, TAD PGS, INC. has earned a reputation for accountability, a value that government agencies and prime contractors both demand and deserve.TAD PGS, INC. sources professionals for the full spectrum of federal positions, from administrative to management, and those contracts requiring extremely niche-oriented technical skills and the highest levels of security clearance.VEVRAA Federal Contractor / Request Priority Protected Veteran Referrals / EOE Protected Veterans/Disability  Location: El Segundo , CA Minimum Experience (yrs): Required Education: Bachelors Degree

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: DescriptionAs a member of the Finance team, you will be integral in efficiently scaling our fast growing business. You’ll build reports, financial models and processes to support a wide range of financial planning and analysis. You’ll be empowered with visibility to the entire organization, which provides a unique opportunity to develop insights that will meaningfully impact our business. You’re a team player who possesses deep analytical skills; critical thinking; and enjoys solving complex business problems.WHAT YOU'LL DO Provides financial analysis support to various areas of the company.Leader in annual budgeting process, including store and corporate expenses, capital expenses and balance sheet items.Collaborates proactively with department heads to ensure budgeted goals are met.Assists with short and long term financial forecasts.Updates forecast in an accurate and timely manner based on information provided by department heads.Manages preparation of weekly, monthly and quarterly financial analysis schedules of actual vs. budget variances.Provides insightful revenue and expense reporting and analyses on a recurring and ad-hoc basis and enables senior management to make informed decisions.Acts as a partner to senior management in evaluating new business ideas or processes.WHAT YOU'LL NEEDA Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Economics5-7 years related work experience in financial analysis; your feet are wet and ready to dive into deeper watersDetail-oriented with strong organizational and problem-solving skillsTechnical chops: solid MS Excel/spreadsheet skills and are comfortable working with and building complex financial modelsAlthough not an accounting position, you will be working closely with our accounting department and should have a solid understanding of accounting principles #mathskillsYou work well in a demanding, fast-paced environment and can manage competing prioritiesAbility to meet deadlines, prioritize appropriately, cope well with change, and maintain composure under pressureDrive; you’re highly self-motivated, you have a stellar work ethic and you’re looking for the right company to support your growth potential Our company participates in E-Verify. E-Verify is a program that electronically confirms a candidate’s eligibility to work in the United States after completing the Employment Eligibility Verification (Form I-9). The information provided on the Form I-9 is compared to the records contained in the Social Security Administration and Department of Homeland Security (DHS) databases. This helps employers verify the identity and employment eligibility of newly hired employees. Share Job

Name: Junior Level Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary:Looking for high powered and quantitatively oriented IT Business Analyst to support the Projects in IT Domain. Analyst will be required to analyze specific business problems and drive value in strategic areas of business. What you will get to do:Typically the customers would be Senior Managers / Directors from different Domains located in US, Latin America, and Asia Pacific.The analyst would typically handle a high impact project at any time which should result in bottom line impact.Most of the work would be around business understanding, data understanding, guiding junior analysts in data preparation, working with the statistical team to create models if required and result presentation. The analyst would be required to understand the business model, business brief, and the information available for analysis.Adhoc requirements would need to be fulfilled from time to time as well.High Level of Business analysis skills is necessary.Graduate or Post Graduate from Tier 1 with 0-2 years of experienceIdeal candidate would have strong analytical skills, ability to understand business situations and provide data backed analysis.Basic Requirement:Graduate degree in Computer Science. Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science.Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.

Name: UM - Senior Analyst, Decision Sciences
Description: Position Summary We are looking for you - dynamic, best-in-class talent - to join the UM team as a Senior Analyst, Decision Sciences. In this role you will assist in the analytics process for our top clients and help take data management to the next level. As a Senior Analyst, Decision Sciences you will create, innovate, and guide the analytics process. This opportunity will grow your career in media analytics and provide a platform to partner with the world’s leading consumer brands. Essential FunctionsManipulate multiple sources of data to analyze the state our clients’ business across multiple marketing channelsApply substantial amounts of independent critical thinking, and from the analyses, uncover media and marketing communications opportunitiesParticipate in brainstorming sessions with communication planners, creative assets, media planners, buyers, clients and other partner agenciesBe a thought leader and provide creative solutions to comprehensively analyze campaigns and business performanceContribute to the department’s overall capabilities and understanding of media and communications channelsQualifications Education: Bachelor’s degree required; degree in marketing, advertising, or a related field preferred Work Experience: 2-3 years of experience of analytical experience, background in the media industry a bonus Skills:Must enjoy working with databases and analyzing complex data to formulate recommendations, learning and test plansBe organized and comfortable juggling multiple projects at once across multiple marketing mediumsFamiliarity with direct response analysis frameworks and marketing optimization strategies a plusStrong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skillsPossess excellent written, oral, and organizational skillsProficient with Excel, PowerPoint, DCM, GA, Tableau. Working knowledge of SQL. Working knowledge of Alteryx is a plus.About Us UM’s culture is an inclusive one, where people are encouraged to bring their full selves to the office, and where personal and professional growth are a priority of every member of the team. The executive leadership is dedicated to building a culture that permeates every element of the company, from work flexibility, to career planning and regular talent reviews, to an active culture club. They proudly uphold the following values:  A full-service media agency, UM strives to use Better Science and Art to create moments that drive business momentum for brands. Founded in 1999, UM is made up of entrepreneurially-minded planners, researchers, investment experts, decision scientists, account executives, and content and activation specialists—over 4,800 employees across 130 offices in over 100 countries around the world. They are globally headquartered in New York, with six additional North America offices in Dallas, Detroit, Los Angeles, Miami, San Francisco, and Toronto. Courage: having the courage to try the things that make us afraid, present something to a client that we know isn’t what they are expecting, taking on roles that we may be a bit intimidated by, inventing the future, etc.Candor: pushing ourselves to have the hard conversations with colleagues, team members, clients and media partners that will make us all better.Curiosity: being curious about the world, media, our clients and each other and using this curiosity to find new and innovate ways of doing everything we do.Commitment: being committed to UM, our teams, and our clients and going above and beyond when it is required.Community: being an active and positive participant in the UM community, our team and client communities, our local community and the world and creating valued communities with the people, clients and partners that we work with.Caring: caring about those around us – both their work lives as well as their personal lives and working to make everyone have as complete and fulfilling a life as possible. As a company, they are constantly pushing themselves to improve, under their Better Science, Better Art, Better Outcomes banner, striving to set the bar in the ever-evolving media landscape. Key clients include J&J, Sony, HULU, H&M, Coca-Cola, Hershey’s, Spotify Exxon, and BMW.

Name: Senior Business Analyst, Revenue Cycle
Description: Overview  Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.  The primary purpose of the Sr Business Analyst role is responsibility for creating the business and/or functional requirements necessary for technology solutions that meet customer needs, expected delivery dates, and exceptional quality standards for our client, Children's Hospital of LA.The Sr Business Analyst will be responsible for workflow analysis, content development, testing and support activities on McKesson STAR applications. ResponsibilitiesWork under the direction of the Manager to provide application solutions for assigned business areas.Possess senior level functional knowledge of assigned application technology.Interact with business users to understand new business requirements and enhancement requestsServe liaison role between application technology vendors, internal IS groups, and business users.Translate business requirements into product-specific designs and configuration, detailed requirement specifications and use cases.Deliver functional specifications, design documents, business process workflow and related documentation for new development projects and/or enhancement and modification requests to be used by Systems Analyst.Interact with Systems Analysts during the software build and/or configuration process and testing process.Perform functional application configuration and configure /run reports at user request.Design and execute functional, integration, and regression test plans for new application functionality, product releases and enhancement and regulatory modifications using business scenarios and use cases.Ensure programs meet business specifications.Demonstrate new functionality to business users seeking inputs on future direction.Review vendor provided documentation and user manuals needed to support the product.Directly interface with business users by responding to support calls escalated by the Service Desk.Participate in user focus groups and requirements workshops, vendor training and demonstrations. These are consistent accountabilities for all staff. Assist in supporting activations and rollouts.Consistent efforts to deliver quality solutions as per agreed scope.Customer focus and close alignment with the customers' business objectives.Ensure efforts to continually improve domain knowledge.Ensure the quality of the deliverables as per the defined defects standardsDocument issues with resolutions and share with team members to improve team productivity.Provide data to generate team performance metrics.Knowledge transfer with other team members to improve overall team education levelTake complete ownership for the assigned task and timely inform the progress of the project / task to all stakeholders.Adherence to the defined standards.Take initiative and drives to bring to logical conclusion; proactive approach.Provide accurate and timely information and escalates when there are issues.Actively participate in meetings and make valuable contribution.QualificationsAcademic and Professional Qualifications:BA or BS degree preferred and/or other relevant combination of training and experience.Experience:2-5 years Health IT industry experience preferred5-10 years practical experience in providing business process and functional support for revenue cycle applications preferredExperience supporting the Allscripts STAR application in both registration and revenue cycle areasExcellent client facing skills with the ability to thrive in a highly critical, fast paced environment.Travel Requirements:May require local travelMay require other travel for business needsWorking Arrangements:May require after hours on call supportWork is performed in a standard office environment with minimal exposure to health or safety hazards At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 post-acute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a competitive total rewards package, including holidays, vacation, and medical, disability and life insurance.  Allscripts' policy is to provide equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in all of its employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for North American based positions with Allscripts must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.  From a "VEVRAA Federal Contractor" We request Priority Referral of Protected VeteransSDL2017

Name: Applications Analyst, Web Product
Description: Software Resources has an immediate job opportunity for an Applications Analyst, Web Product in Los Angeles, CA. 6+ month contractPOSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT: The Applications Analyst, Web Product translates customer needs and technology directions into product definition. The individual liaises with Development, Quality Assurance and end users on the functional requirements definition, design, implementation and maintenance of software systems. The Applications Analyst reviews, analyzes, develops, and modifies functional documentation for business applications. This individual works within the web product team to support software projects from ideation through implementation and maintenance including working on proposals, specifications, wire frames and site maps to help define the user experience for new software applications. The Application Analyst detects, analyze, diagnose, report and resolve problems and enhancement requests associated with applications.DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES: - Manage discrete projects that require coordination between development, QA and product teams. - Requirements gathering and scope definition with non-technical user constituencies. - Work with internal stakeholders to understand complex, dynamic business rules, and apply those rules into detailed, specific and comprehensive documentation. - Engage end users spanning multiple business units and ensure cohesive articulation of business goals and processes to ensure an effective technological solution. - Engage end users to support all necessary clarification for the Project, Development and Production Support teams to design and implement an effective solution. - Functional understanding of the systems supported and the development of a framework for system implementation and maintenance. - Verification of the feasibility of requested functionality and validation of support for business rules based on existing technical systems and data structures. - Review and track online application trends for recommendations and implementation - Ability to create and present key requirements artifacts including but not limited to: - Scope Document - Business Requirements Document - Detailed Specification of Key Business Rules - Use Cases - Wire Frames - Activity Diagrams - Business Process Mapping Diagrams and Documentation - Application Gap analysisDon't delay. Join the Software Resources team today! Software Resources specializes in connecting talented IT professionals with challenging job opportunities that transform jobs into careers. To meet our clients hiring needs, we continuously source talented IT Professionals with all levels of expertise and in all disciplines. We offer world class major medical, dental and vision benefits, 401(k) with match, short term disability, Life Insurance and AD&D. You, our future employees, can make a tremendous difference to our company and our clients. Please apply to this job and experience the Software Resources difference. You can view all of our jobs at https://www.softwareresources.com/it-careers/it-job-search/Company Overview Software Resources specializes in IT talent recruitment services and workforce staffing solutions. Founded in 1992 as an IT staffing services firm, we are a privately held women-owned business enterprise (WBE), celebrating our 25th year in business. We are headquartered in Lake Mary, Florida, just outside of Orlando. With branches and sales professionals throughout the U.S., Software Resources is the staffing agency of choice for clients and consultants. We specialize in IT. It's what we do and what we know, every day. We provide contract, contract to hire and direct hire placement IT staffing solutions for Energy, Entertainment/Gaming/New Media, Financial Services, Government, Healthcare, Hospitality, Professional Services, and Security.Id: 11999348

Name: MBA Campus Equity Investment Analyst - Summer Associate
Description: Req ID: 15142Come grow with usAt Capital Group, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it’s more than that. It’s smart and highly driven people united in purpose to serve our investors and one another.Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You’ll be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You’ll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you’ll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks among the most generous.Capital Group seeks bright, highly motivated and self-directed individuals for Equity Investment Analyst internship opportunities in Los Angeles, London, and Hong Kong. As a summer intern, you will analyze companies in an industry with the objective of presenting an original investment recommendation to an audience of portfolio managers and analysts.You will analyze economic, financial, and industry trends, and travel to companies to interview senior management. You will be guided in your work by an investment analyst, although you will be largely self-directed in your approach and conclusions. Throughout the summer, you will learn more about investment management, and have access to the industry’s most respected investment professionals. Your internship with Capital will provide you with hands-on experience similar to that of a full-time analyst.Qualifications:MBA degree candidate with a graduation date of December 2019 or May/June 2020 from an accredited university, or business schoolDemonstrated academic achievementAbility to direct independent work effort in a cooperative environmentUnderstanding of financial statements and a curiosity about how companies operateHealthy appetite for research, writing and business travelExcellent communications skills, both written and verbalApplication Instructions:If we are holding on-campus interviews at your school, please apply by the school-specific deadline. All others please apply by December 7, 2018.Company Overview:Founded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.7 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers. We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. Name: EDM Data Quality Technical Analyst
Description: The Enterprise Data Quality Technical Analyst is a key role responsible for developing and supporting an Enterprise data quality solution for City National Bank. This role will support the business in the ability to analyze and assess the data quality in the various data environments (Transactional, MDM etc.). This is critical in supporting the Data Governance organization with actionable information to improve the quality and value of information assets. CNB is consolidating its data management platform on Informatica including Informatica MDM, Power Center, Data Quality (IDQ), EDC and Axon .Responsibilities:Data Quality DevelopmentResponsible for full cycle development (designing, testing, deploying, and documenting the data quality procedures and their outputs).Document at a functional level how the procedures work within the data quality applications.Perform data load and mappings from source.Responsible for migrating objects.Responsible for deploying and validating objects to different environments for Scheduled, Batch or real time environment.Responsible for development of scheduling of Batch jobs and invoking of the jobs.Responsible for standards across all the SDLC phases.Business and Technical rules Management  Partner with the Data Governance Office and business data stewards to provide summary results of data quality analysis, which will be used to make decisions regarding how to measure business rules and quality of the data.Translate the business data quality rules into technical rules which are implemented on the platform.Execute and analyze Data profilingDevelop and implement additional data quality monitoring based on requirements gathered from business units.Provide Data Quality Scorecards, Dash-Boards and Ad-Hoc reportingProvide recommendations for modification or creation of business rules based on data results  Implement on-going monitoring jobsAptitude to understand business challenges and offer advice on how to solve them with Data Quality.Data Quality as a ServiceDevelop and implement additional data quality monitoring based on requirements gathered from business units.Manage and prioritize a request queue for new data quality monitoring requests over new data elements, new data quality rules, and maintenance to existing rules.  Provide reports to provide insight to data quality errors.Skills and KnowledgeExperience in data profiling & data quality rules development.Experience with Data Quality tools like Atacama, Experian, and Informatica IDQ etc.Proven experience translating business problems into actionable data quality initiatives.Familiarity with current trends in Data Quality technologies.Good knowledge on Data mapping experience - mapping data sources to and from multiple applicationsPossess good oral and written communication and presentations skills with the ability to lead meetings effectivelyExperience in SDLC ProcessGood understanding of data governance principalsStrong experience on data quality development process, issue management, and data remediationKnowledge of Informatica Data Quality standards, guidelines and best practices preferredBasic Qualifications:3-5 years of data analyst experience performing data profiling, data mapping, data validation, data manipulation, data analysis, use case, test cases, etc. preferably in a data-intensive financial company.3-5 years' experience in defining and deploying data quality programs and tools on enterprise data quality projects3-5 years' experience in Information technology development across all phases of the SDLC process3-5 years of experience in Data QualityPreferred Qualifications:3-5 years hands-on experience with Informatica Data Quality (IDQ) toolset3-5 years' experience in Banking or Financial sector especially in terms of regulatory and strategic needs for data quality management.Bachelor's Degree preferably in Information Systems or Business Administration. Master's Degree in a related field is strongly desired. *Represents basic qualifications for the position. To be considered for this position you must at least meet the basic qualifications. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Name: QA Analyst
Description: About LumiLumi helps ecommerce brands produce memorable and sustainable packaging through our online platform and worldwide network of factories. Tens of millions of packages are being shipped every year with Lumi products.By joining Lumi you will have a front row seat to the rapidly changing way people buy things, and the supply chain behind everything that gets shipped to your doorstep. Learn more Were transforming the custom manufacturing and packaging industries by building new tools that allow our customers to reach a previously untapped network of global manufacturers. Our goal is to enable seamless collaboration between our clients, business users, and manufacturing partners in order to deliver beautiful, cost effective, and sustainable packaging solutions.As a QA Analyst on our Digital Products team, youll have the ability to work across several new products and features that will drive the next phase of growth for our company. You will be primarily responsible for defining, building, and maintaining our manual testing framework, with the goal of increasing the stability and correctness of our production software. You will develop and execute a manual test suite with the aim of minimizing the expected failure rate of our software going into our production environment.As Lumis first full-time QA hire, youll have the opportunity to drive the vision and direction of all software testing needs at Lumi. Your work will directly impact our ability to design new experiences for our clients, improve the workflows across our teams, and create new platforms for our partners.Responsibilities: Work with the development team to define acceptance criteria for our releasesWork with the product team to extend our product specification to include testing documentationInvestigate technologies for manual and automated testingPerform manual testing of web applications and related backend applications and systemsCreate Test Plans outlining test approach and risk mitigationCreate and document Test Cases based on product requirementsExecute Test Plans and Test CasesLog and report test resultsWrite detailed defect reports and work with development to assist with troubleshooting, resolution and validationSupport release process and perform production site verification testingQualifications:3-5 years industry experience in software quality assuranceFamiliarity and/or desire to learn about the packaging supply chain industryExperience working in an agile development environmentExperience with Linux bash/sed/awk and comfortable executing commands involving directory navigation, directory listing and program executionAbility to multi-task to meet deadlinesExperience running automated testsUnderstanding of the architecture around web applications (web server, client/server communication, databases, proxy, etc.)Ability to execute SQL Queries and to make simple changes to existing onesExperience with Microsoft Command Prompt/Powershell/Terminal and ability to execute commands involving directory navigation, directory listing and program executionStrong attention to detail and work ethicStrong analytical and problem solving skillsExcellent communication (both written and verbal) and interpersonal skillsWhat we look forOur team is made up of people from diverse backgrounds, often working remotely across the world. We believe cross-pollination is one of the best ways to foster community and new ideas. For that reason we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to any of our positions.Creating a great environment for everyone on the team is something we care deeply about. There are a few qualities we look for in anyone joining Lumi. Here are some of the questions we'll be asking ourselves when reviewing your application:Curiosity: Your role will evolve as time goes on. Do you have an eagerness to learn new skills, adapt to new situations and get out of your comfort zone?Communication: Whether it is in written or spoken form, are you able to communicate clearly and concisely with others?Empathy: Do you collaborate well with others? How do you deal with disagreements? Do you relate to the challenges we seek to solve for our customers?Work ethic: Do you have a can-do attitude? In the ever-moving world of logistics, will you do your best to not keep others waiting? Can we rely on you to bring rigor and enthusiasm necessary to your work?Good taste: Are you attentive to details? Do you care about creating an elegant, pleasant experience for customers and those around you?Note that due to the volume of applications we are not able to reply to everyone. Rest assured, we do read every application. Thanks for considering us!

Understand the value of getting the job done well and delivering AV's best  Accommodate different working styles and needs  Analytical  Draft basic questionnaires  Do data checks such as checking questionnaire programs for logic, accuracy and completeness, edit/proof data tables, review/approve codes  Perform basic analysis  Execute subgroup analyses  Prepare presentation charts and reports in PPT  Begin contributing analytically to client deliverables and ensure that they tell a logical story  Client Service  Handle client and internal requests with a positive attitude  Demonstrate ability to work in a fast-paced deadline-driven environment

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Welcome to Pabst! We may be 174 years old but we will never stop exploring with energy and excitement.We have some of America’s most iconic brands and are on a quest to realize their future potential. We want you to join the team if you are….A DOER WHO DARES TO DREAMYou love freedom, relish challenge, realize potential, have a thirst for knowledge; you are innovative, confident yet humble, open to possibilities, courageous, true to your values, and passionate about making people’s lives better.You have spirit and grit; are restless and determined. You take action…because it represents opportunity, not fear.When you see progress, it gives you hope and inspires you.Right now we need a Financial Analyst. Someone with a natural curiosity to enable and inspire execs and peers. We are a group of courageous pioneers and want to add a like-minded person to assist us in realizing the potential of Pabst. You will develop informative, data-driven conclusions and analysis, with the goal of optimizing performance across the portfolio. Your role is to ensure the quality and integrity of information driving key business drivers to empower the organization. An important component to this position is the development of tools that underscore the importance of timely, accurate and consistent reporting.  You enjoy using Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook email, and are great at financial modeling. More importantly, you will love being part of a finance team ensuring everyone is on the same page and moving forward.  Preferred requirements are Bachelor’s degree.  If this is you please apply now!PBC takes pride in developing and promoting talent as an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. By fostering a diverse business environment, PBC welcomes opportunities to learn from each other, our customers, and business partners.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: The Business Process Analyst transforms change through process and change interventions that integrate strategy, technology and people. He drives value for clients and deliver Business Processes and related documentation of the Management System of the Company.  6 to 12 months  Main activities:  · Act as a change agent to define business needs (Elicitation) and recommend solutions that deliver value to stakeholders  · Analyze the as-is of the processes and the to-be as per BPIR (Business Process Improvement Requests) or improvement initiatives  · Facilitate workshops with Process Owners and Subject Matter Experts and challenge them to ensure governance and prepare change management.  · Propose and Design new or modify existing business processes/supporting documents using (Business Process Modelling) BPM Tool according to defined standards and conventions and ensure consistency in the Company Management System process model  · Maintain the change registers, reports and master data, e.g. Improvement Requests, Roles, Process Owners, KPIs, process/document workflows for review and approval  · Participate in the publication of the Management System website  Mandatory skills:  Professional English /Communication skills / Organizational skills / Creative, Problem solving & Analytics skills / Collaborative, Team player, Driver, “Out-of-the box Thinker” / Reliable, Open minded / Experienced user of MS Office applications in particular Word and Power point  Desired skills:  Project management skills / Familiar with Management System Standards (e.g. ISO, etc.) / Industry knowledge (e.g. EPC: Engineering, Procurement & Construction, capital project, energy sector)  Resume + Cover Letter

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Our client, a marketing agency has an immediate need for a Data Analyst (Manager, Analytics) to deliver data-driven, actionable insights on behalf of our clients. This is a freelance position onsite that starts as soon as next week.  Ideal candidates will be fluent in the various technologies, platforms and best practices that define the online space and are passionate about understanding their impact on consumer behavior.
