In this role, you will be a key contributor to the analytics team, driving innovative measurement strategies, leading business intelligence efforts, execution of analysis and overall market awareness and understanding. RESPONSIBILITIES: Leverages a variety of statistical methods to compile and analyze data from online and offline sources Derives insights from data to create a compelling narrative that moves clients to act on our recommendations Creates visually compelling presentations of reporting and insights that allows a client to easily evaluate performance relative to their business objectives Creates measurement framework to evaluate program performance across paid, earned and owned channels Guides clients and account teams through the process of establishing KPIs and targets based a program’s goals and channel strategy BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 3+ years of experience in Data Science, Marketing Analytics, Digital Marketing, or a business related fields. Experience with relational databases and statistical analysis tools such as SAS and SQL Able to leverage scripting to complete analysis, data cleansing or data integration tasks. Proficient in at least one programming language such as R, Python or Javascript Highly proficient with data visualization tools including: Excel, Google Data Studio, Tableau or Domo Additional Qualifications: Experience leading and producing work for a marketing analytics program – Bonus: experience with analytics for a communications program with earned media as a tactic Expertise with site analytics and social platforms including: Adobe, Google, Facebook, Twitter Experience using media intelligence, marketing intelligence, social listening or other research tools such as: Sysomos, Critical Mention, Quid, Brandwatch, Affinio, Buzzsumo, Comscore or Mintel Experience with A/B/MVT testing and optimization for site and social media content (paid and organic) Highly proficient in working with behavioral data from digital channels including SEO, paid media platforms, site analytics and organic social  Send your resume today! Name: Data Analyst - Risk Adjustment
Description: Company Overview Health Data Vision, Inc., is a fast-growing tech company that provides a SaaS-based healthcare workflow and analytics platform (MRCS) for medical records analysis  and targeted solutions for HEDIS® Hybrid, Medicare, and Exchange Risk Adjustment and comprehensive, year-round clinical data analysis efforts as well as RADV Audits. The platform provides flexible scalable workflows and automation for medical records-intensive project needs of health plans in the United States. Job Responsibilities:Act as the primary data analyst for risk adjustment data-related efforts including but not limited to data integration operations for new and existing clients, coding result extracts, ad hoc reporting.Partner with internal risk adjustment subject matter experts (SMEs) to help coordinate data reporting workflows based on the information they help provide in addition to aiding with research to help enhance our current data extract interfaces as well as adding industry-standard output extracts used for CMS submissions.Coordinate and organize the periodic updates of the diagnosis and HCC tables utilized by the companys application suite as well as for ad hoc report needs.Work directly with the Clinical Operations Team to help support the design and deployment of report sets such as those, which would give read-outs on coding quality and additional HCC gains obtained through the coding process.Required Experience/Education:3-5 years of experience in healthcare data analysis/analytics space with a focus on risk adjustment and IVA related data including but not limited to ICD9 and ICD10 codes and CMS-HCC risk adjustment model data.3-5 years of experience using Microsoft SQL Server T-SQL language for the development of SQL tables, queries, stored procedures, views, and user-defined functions. (Candidates will have SQL skills evaluated in the interview process.)1-2 years of experience using SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) for ETL development and SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) for online report development strongly preferred.Proficiency with converting XML documents into relational database structures and creating XML from data queried from the database used with our coding platform.1-2 years of experience a program language such as .Net (VB or C#) or Powershell for program control and file I/O operations.Competency with the Microsoft Office suite of products including but not limited to  Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.Demonstrates good communication skills that will be effective in working with  teammates internally as well as with technical staff for external partners and clients.M.S., M.A., B.S or B.A. degree in computer science, data science, computer information  systems, business administration, or the engineering and sciences preferred. Other  degree programs strongly considered when accompanied by associated industry  experience.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: ASMK BS Encino - IT Business Systems AnalystResponsibilitiesActs as the liaison between IT and business stakeholders during analysis, requirements definition and design activities for new solutions and/or integration projectsCollaborates with business stakeholders to facilitate and document business requirements, use cases and functional specifications. Provides strategic advice for business processes and solutions.Gains a holistic understanding of a broad range of business processes and related systems.Interacts with and directs technical partners to develop solution alternatives.Has a good understanding of technical terminologies around UI, API and DatabasesCommunicate effectively both orally and in writing to management, team members, and business partners.Analyze and solve complex business problems and determine suitable IT solutions.Apply broad business knowledge and practical experience to the analysis / solution generation processEstablish and maintain productive working relationships with departmental staff, and internal business partners.Generate use cases and participate in user acceptance testing.Communicate complex information clearly and concisely both orally and in writing to technical and non-technical audiences.Qualifications5+ years’ experience working as a Business Systems Analyst on small to medium sized projectsExceptional written / oral communication and interpersonal skillsDegree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Finance related field.Proven experience creating business functional requirement documents and other BSA artifactsAble to mine and analyze large amounts of data; strong analysis and problem solving skills.Must be highly detail oriented, meticulous, and self-directed.Proficient in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, and Outlook).Experience in the wealth management or financial services industry a plus.Experience with Microsoft Access a plusYour passion for technology, exceptional critical-thinking skills and ability to creatively think-on-your feet will fit perfectly in our IT Business Systems Analyst position at AssetMark. This is an ideal time to join our organization and you will be a key player as you analyze, design and QA on our internal systems. We are in an exciting phase and you will enjoy working on a wide array of projects and will be recognized and rewarded for delivering world-class, excellent results. Fully utilize your creative talents and true desire to enhance clients' business needs; take the next step and apply today!As an IT Business Systems Analyst, based in Encino, CA you will participate in the full project lifecycle from conception through post-deployment. In this IT Business Systems Analyst role, you'll present information regarding proposed solutions as you detail business and functional requirements, assess project progress and monitor the effectiveness of deployed initiatives. Key to this role is expertise in process mapping, process engineering and process modeling. Your high energy and natural sense for creativity will lend itself well to tackling any variety of issue and position you to be an expert at recommending streamlined process that implement increased efficiency in these processes. Additionally, your ability to be adaptive in an environment of changing priorities will give you a head start to success in this position. You’ll also use your highly organized abilities in conducting customer and process analysis to develop plans, requirements, and solutions. Your demonstrated success eliciting business requirements using appropriate tools and techniques including, but not limited to, interviews, document analysis, surveys, site visits, use cases, scenarios, business process, task, and workflow analysis will all be key. Being able to write business requirement documents and functional requirements are a must as well. We are seeking those individuals who want to help us grow as well as enhance their own professional growth along the way. If you’re ready for the next step in your career, join us today!AssetMark, Inc. is a leading strategic provider of groundbreaking investment and consulting solutions created to serve independent financial advisors and help them create great outcomes for their clients. Through a consistent program of engagement, education and community-building, AssetMark brings like-minded advisors together to share their ideas, experiences and solutions. This collaboration guides our development of investment, client relationship and practice management tools that advisors can tap to help clients achieve their investment objectives and life goals.We are always seeking bright, creative, energetic individuals who want to learn and grow with the company. AssetMark is an innovative organization, delivering the best services in the industry. We offer a rewarding work environment, competitive salaries, full benefits, and excellent opportunities for career growth. We are headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area. We also have regional offices in Chicago, IL, Phoenix, AZ, Encino, CA, and State College, PA. Become a part of our growing team today!https://app.hiremojo.com/mojo/jobs/#/candidate-experience/jobs/462435460&sourceType=29

Name: Risk Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPayments Solutions Specialist is the front-line person responsible for performing operational and administrative support duties of the Payments Solutions Department. Assists and supports all areas of the Department as directed; provides technical and general support to customers and Bank personnel; prepares and maintains customer files; resolves problems within given authority. Helps in the coordination and support of audits and examinations. Develop and maintain working knowledge of banking rules and regulations in regards to the electronic payments industry. Understand policies and procedures in relation to the ACH application for processing and monitoring customers' files. Performs a variety of routine daily tasks; reviews reports, prepares correspondence; and assigned special department projects.  PRIMARY FUNCTIONS (Other Duties May Be Assigned) Train new staff. Be a point of contact for PS Representatives.Responsible for the implementation and maintenance all clients' information.Notifies affiliates of errors and exceptions.Disperses notices to clients of activity.Maintains required reports and logs.Recognizes and resolves technical problems with equipment and software for department and clients.Performs reconciliation of settlement and work-in-progress accounts.Responsible for daily Automated Clearing House origination procedures, including processing files from clients and internal systems, returns, reversals, rejects, death notification entries, and reclamations.Respond to emails and in-house communications to meet SLAsAssist with monitoring the ACH application to ensure files have been processed and received from and sent to the internal and external customersUnderstanding of Regulation E, BSA, KYC, AMLPerform other job duties as assignedPerforms wires, transfers, maintenance of accounts, new account boarding, new account documentationAssists with underwriting of TPPP and merchant/originator filesCompletes daily/monthly/quarterly/as required items from check list and procedures as may change from time to timeReview risk reports and escalate issuesMay involve rotating Sundays for ACH processingMay involve shift work that starts as early as 6:00 am or ends as late as 11:00 pmQUALIFICATIONS:Education/Training/Experience: Required: High school diploma or equivalent 5-7 years of banking operations experience,  Desirable: Bachelors degree in business administration, finance, or closely related field. Knowledge of:Banking laws, Bank policies and procedures and regulationsBasic Mathematical skillsBasic Computer softwareWord, Excel, SpreadsheetsPayments (ACH or BankCard) experience highly preferredAbilities:Excellent communication, and interpersonal skillsManage priorities to ensure effective accomplishment of objectives.Solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists

Name: Sales Analyst
Description: Sales Analyst, North America, Professional Beauty  COTY, Calabasas, CA PURPOSE Our purpose is to celebrate and liberate the diversity of beauty. We challenge convention through invention, expanding our horizons to enrich your reality with possibility. We build brands to inspire and enable our consumers to experience the confidence and joy of expressing their beauty, their way. MISSION AND RESPONSIBILITIES This position is responsible for monitoring and coordinating statistical information to support sales functions, tracking sales achievements against forecast and prior years, developing analytical reports based on market intelligence and providing information to the sales planning process based on knowledge of market data. This position also prepares reports for and works with sales and marketing during the planning process, monitors sales, and analyzes performance trends to identify issues and opportunities. Essential Functions:Analyzes and compiles reports in compliance with daily, weekly, and monthly sales reporting requirementsProvides support for the sales team to include coordination or analysis of sales planning and administration events and activitiesGenerate standardized reports on sales information to monitor progress towards growth objectives, e.g., sales results, historical growth, market growth trends, sales exceptions and product useDevelop monthly inventory flows plans to include to track sales and inventoryIntegrates information from multiple sources and develops actionable insights and recommendations in support of sales initiativesAnalyzes and monitors trade spend, works closely with Sales team to gain understanding of risk and opportunitiesAnalyzes sales forecasts to plan product procurement and inventory needs, verifying risks of backorders and shortages, with particular attention to top accountsMonitors and reports on various projects to sales leadersCollaborates with cross-functional departments on the development and execution of products and cost savings initiativesAssists in coordinating meetings, meals, and other special eventsMaintains up to date rosters and regular sales mailings for assigned groupsCompletes ad hoc requests and projects as assigned by leadershipQUALIFICATIONSBachelor's Degree3 years minimum experience in similar capacityProficient in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and related software skillsExcellent problem-solving and analytical skillsAbility to adapt in a constantly changing environmentHighly organized, detail-oriented and excellent customer service skillsStrong management skills with ability to manage multiple projects in fast paced & highly demanding environmentPrior experience in the Beauty or Cosmetics industries preferred We are Coty and our people make us who we are. It's important that we find individuals who are a great fit for our business, not just for us but for you too. We want people to thrive here and, if you are the right culture fit with us and we with you, you'll be able to shine and achieve beyond your own expectations. For us, beauty is and beauty does. We are very focused because we all want the same thing: to help our consumers celebrate and liberate the diversity of their beauty and that takes creativity, excellence and radical thinking we are here to disrupt the beauty industry on behalf of consumers and you need to want to join that mission to succeed here.We have an energetic intensity about us. We're quite relentless in our determination to deliver, always accountable for our actions and tenacious. We will not be beaten by obstacles.Responding quickly with agile thinking to business challenges and opportunities is second nature to us. We like it that way as it means we can be creative and find new ways to make things happen fast. Colleagues will expect it of you and you'll expect it of them we're a team and we help each other. We're all in it together irrespective of level or part of the business.We always go the extra mile, pushing the boundaries to be that best partner we can be to our customers and to excite and delight our consumers.When you join Coty, you become part of a vibrantly diverse and energetic group who have fun in an intense sort of way. Because we're not just here for the ride, we want to change things.ABOUT US Coty's purpose is to celebrate and liberate the diversity of our consumers' beauty. Aligned to this is our mission to strive over time to become the global industry leader by being the clear challenger in beauty, delighting consumers and creating long term shareholder value.  We are one of the world's largest beauty companies with approximately $9 billion in revenue, and our strong entrepreneurial heritage has created an iconic portfolio of leading beauty brands.  As the global leader in fragrance, a strong number two in professional salon hair color & styling, and number three in color cosmetics, we operate across three divisions: Coty Consumer Beauty: focused on color cosmetics, retail hair coloring and styling products, body care and mass fragrances sold primarily in the mass retail channels with brands such as COVERGIRL, Max Factor and RimmelCoty Luxury: focused on prestige fragrances and skincare with brands such as Calvin Klein, Marc Jacobs, Hugo Boss, Gucci and philosophyCoty Professional Beauty: focused on servicing salon owners and professionals in both hair and nail with brands such as Wella Professionals, Sebastian Professional, OPI and ghd Coty is a truly global player with over 20,000 employees, operations in more than 40 countries in Asia, Latin America, Australia, Middle East and Africa, as well as Europe and North America and products sold in over 130 countries and territories. Our headquarters are in London, New York, Geneva and Paris.  Want to know more?  For additional information about Coty Inc., please visit www.coty.com.  At Coty, we embrace Diversity. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability.  Equal Employment Opportunities  We offer equal employment opportunity to qualified individuals without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We strongly believe that cultivating a diverse workplace gives a company strength. The combination of unique skills, abilities,experiences and backgrounds creates an environment that produces extraordinary results.  EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled.  English - Please click on this link to review the Notification of Equal Opportunity Rights poster  Español - Por favor, haga un clic en el enlace para revisar el poster de la Ley de los Derechos de Igualdad de EmpeoSDL2017

Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Clutter is an on-demand, physical storage and moving, technology company based in Los Angeles that is disrupting the $50B/year self-storage and moving industries. We've built an end-to-end logistics and supply chain platform, enabling us to offer consumers a much more convenient solution at price parity with the incumbents. We've raised $100M from a number of VCs, including Sequoia Capital, Atomico and GV, formerly Google Ventures. We have 750+ team members and tens of thousands of customers in 7 major markets across the US with plans to be in 50+ markets, domestically and internationally, within the next 5 years!  At Clutter, we're fortunate to be providing a consumer value proposition that people love and one that makes economic sense - a true product/market fit that few startups ever find. To deliver on our promise to consumers, team members and investors, we're focused on hiring, training and retaining exceptional individuals. This means that we have a very thorough interview process and maintain high performance expectations, but we'll always be transparent with you and respectful of your time. The Opportunity: As a Senior Data Analyst you will play a critical role in analyzing data to identify key opportunities and drive strategic business initiatives. We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who is resourceful, passionate about improving data quality, and can communicate complex ideas with ease. You'll work closely with our Head of Product to help define the way that our data is collected, calibrated, and what questions should be asked in order to drive actionable insights. As a Senior Data Analyst - you will:Analyze business data to identify trends, draw conclusions, and develop recommendations and help drive data-driven decision-makingCollaborate with cross-functional teams to deeply understand business objectives and create meaningful narratives that drive efficiency and growthDevelop mechanisms to discover, monitor, and improve data quality and reportingWhat we're looking for:B.S. in economics, applied math, statistics or other quantitative field; M.S. preferredStrong experience analyzing data in SQL; proficiency in R or Python a plusExperience developing data-driven hypotheses and effectively communicating actionable insights to decision-makersPossesses extreme attention to detail but understands the big picture without getting stuck in paralysis by analysis

Name: Quality Assurance Analyst
Description: Our client has an immediate need for a Temp Quality Assurance Analyst in their Downtown Los Angeles office.The Temp Quality Assurance Analyst leads the development of test approaches, estimates, plans and coordinates testing activities for complex integrated systems, and drives successful execution to ensure end result aligns with business need in collaboration with other teams.In this capacity, the Temp Quality Assurance Analyst will: Ensure the highest standards of excellence and operational coherence in the business’ software systems;Provide input on functional requirements and advise on design and configuration of client software applications;Ensure delivery of testable and traceable requirements and effectively applies appropriate testing techniques to ensure comprehensive end-to-end black box testing;Provide solutions for complex test approaches and plans;Design, develop, document and maintain test artifacts for functional, integration, system, and acceptance testing;Prepare and may oversee the preparation of test data and readiness of test environment prior to test execution;Manage and participate in requirements analysis, user story and test case development, and test execution;Analyze test results to identify defects, errors and configuration issues, and advises on the severity of issues;Perform defect triage and assesses potential impact and resolution, providing enough details for the development team to fix issues;Publish and communicate effective test metrics that enable effective decision making around quality; andMake recommendations regarding delivery quality and influences the business in implementation decisions. Qualifications: At least 3 years of Quality Assurance experience supporting large, critical business applications;Experience with TFS or JIRA or equivalent test and issue management tool;Excellent verbal and written communication skills that non-technical end users can understand;Excellent problem solving and analytical skills;Extensive knowledge of software testing methodologies (Agile a plus);Must be highly effective within a collaborative environment;Strong experience leading teams of peers and partners;Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to look at a process multiple times with the same level of scrutiny;Initiative and self-motivation to organize, prioritize, and work independently on multiple projects in a deadline-driven environment;Expert knowledge of Quality Assurance best practices;Expert proficiency with Microsoft applications, legal software applications, and document management systems;Advanced knowledge of testing activities, manual and automated testing procedures and tools;Advanced knowledge of SDLC in an Agile environment;Advanced skills in designing and implementing test cases and test scripts; andA passion for great usability and quality of software solutions.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Why Work at Grindr? Since 2009, Grindr has built the world's largest social network for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. Now more than just an app, we're a family of lifestyle brands with the shared mission to connect LGBTQ people with the world around them: Grindr The location-based social app that started it all. Over 3 million people use Grindr daily, from every country on the planet.INTO A digital magazine dedicated to queer perspectives: news, culture, commentary, video, and more.Grindr for Equality (G4E) Our social mission to promote justice, health, and safety for LGBTQ individuals around the globe.Gaymoji A one-of-a-kind collection of over 500+ stickers available on iOS, Android, and in the Grindr app.Slumbr An event series for the high-minded partygoer, combining fashion, music, and art. Behind the brands, Grindr is an inclusive and passionate family of thinkers, innovators, leaders, and most importantly, doers. We're fueled by endless curiosity, constant collaboration, and a knack for crossing every finish line all within an agile growth environment. We also enjoy tons of perks, great social events, and stunning views from our HQ in West Hollywood. Summary Grindr is looking for a Financial Analyst to join our Finance team. The Financial Analyst will be responsible for providing key financial insights to drive the company's strategic decisions. Strong analytical and communication skills are necessary to be successful in this role. You will report to the Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Manager  The core functions of the role include providing monthly expense forecasts and guidance, weekly pacing, creating and managing the annual operating plan, including independent analysis as well as consolidation of business unit inputs, supporting Accounting in the month-end close process, as well ad-hoc analysis as a means for decision support.  Key outputs include preparation of forecasts and reporting packages, coordinating data-gathering across the organization, and assessing risk and opportunity ranges for initiatives and trends. The role will also assist in streamlining and standardizing processes across the organization. ResponsibilitiesBuild out and manage short-term and long-term operational and expense forecasts in line with Grindr's business strategyPerform financial analyses to help executives and department leaders make critical decisionsStreamline and standardize reports and processes to mitigate risks and identify opportunities within the businessPartner with the accounting team to update forecasts and perform variance analysis reporting during month-end closeWork with data source providers and technology teams to ensure that the key data for decision making is accurate and automatedSupport the FP&A Manager with special projects and workflow process improvementsSupport all budget and forecasting activities as neededCreate, evolve, and standardize company reporting to align cross-business unit communication ExperienceBA or BS in Finance or related experience2+ years' experience in full P&L or corporate level planningAdvanced Excel and experience in modeling and analyticsExcellent interpersonal skills to work with various stakeholders across the organizationA passion for problem-solving and comfort with ambiguityStrong attention to detail and organizational skillsBasic understanding of accountingExperience with Oracle and/or SmartView a plusExperience in tech or digital media industries preferred but not requiredBenefits & PerksFull coverage medical and dental insuranceUnlimited sick policyCompetitive Salaries and Options401(k)Catered lunch, every dayStocked kitchenFree on-site parkingCasual dress environment

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionTitle: Data AnalystLocation: Los AngelesTeam: ModelingReports to: Vice President of Modeling☒ Full-time or ☐ Part-time☒ Exempt or ☐ Non-exempt Praedicat is a funded FinTech startup in Los Angeles that is delivering innovative new “foresight modeling” to commercial clients built on cutting-edge big data analytics and technologies. Our cloud-based SaaS products, CoMeta™ and Oortfolio™, are pushing the limits of scalable risk modeling and big data. Our team is blazing new trails in forward-looking, science-based risk analytics using advanced machine learning algorithms and related technologies.  We are looking for a strong candidate to join our growing team in Los Angeles as a Data Analyst. We need a creative thinker with expertise in data manipulation and analysis who can own data pipelines bringing data in-house from external sources through to its use in models. You will be expected to develop an understanding of Praedicat’s clients and proprietary analytics and think creatively about how Praedicat can solve their problems through data-driven solutions delivered through software and analytics. Team members in this position will have an opportunity to grow into a variety of different roles.  · Making a difference: Our products deliver data from peer-reviewed science into the workflow of business so that our clients can use it to make better decisions – cleaner technologies, safer products, a healthier environment.  · Multidisciplinary collaboration: We work in teams with smart people from multiple disciplines to develop creative solutions.  · Hard problems and cutting-edge technologies: Our data science, modeling and software engineering challenges are hard and innovative solutions are necessary. ResponsibilitiesPerform various tasks of data ingestion, data transformation, and data visualizationsConduct data analysis, data integration, data management and feature engineeringUnderstand and programmatically implement mathematical, statistical data, and computational solutionsCreate internal documentation for data sets and completed analysesRequirements · Bachelor of Science or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (bioinformatics, bioengineering, chemistry, engineering, mathematics, physics, economics, etc.) plus 2 years of experience or equivalent  · Ability to solve problems thoroughly, quickly, and creatively with an eye for detail  · Hands on experience in many aspects of data management activities involving large data sets (e.g. data gathering and profiling, data analysis, pipeline creation, data validation)  · Strong background in exploratory data analysis and visualization  · Experience using data analysis packages and ability to independently produce in-depth analyses of large data sets  · Proven track record of leveraging large amounts of data to solve real-world problems  · Strong written and verbal communication skills to support interactions with subject matter experts and create documentation as needed Preferred SkillsSubject matter knowledge in chemistry and/or medicine-related areasFacility with SQL, data manipulation, and data analysis for business intelligenceExperience with and mastery of high-level programming languages for data analysis, such as Python, C#, or MATLABExperience with modeling approaches such as regression analysis, principal component analysis, clustering, etc. To apply, send your cover letter and resume as one .pdf via ZipRecruiter. Incentive Compensation and Benefits Praedicat believes in a work-life balance that is supported by a competitive compensation and benefits package. All full-time regular employees are eligible for benefits such as: Participation in Praedicat’s Stock Incentive Plan offering equity-based incentives for employees, including annual equity bonuses tied to individual and company performanceThe ability to contribute to a Praedicat-sponsored 401(k) planMedical insurance coverage, with both HMO and PPO options, as well as dental and vision coverageGenerous allotment of PTO (paid time off) and official holidays each yearAbout Praedicat® Praedicat, Inc. is dedicated to improving the underwriting and management of liability catastrophe risk. Our multidisciplinary team leverages cutting-edge analytics to solve problems for clients. Our patent-pending technology delivers information extracted from scientific literatures on emerging risk. We analyze the risk with a structured approach incorporating applied legal reasoning and economics. Our analysis is focused to directly inform core business functions of liability insurers and reinsurers. Praedicat is developing a comprehensive system of software products, Litagion® Risk Management, designed to bring 21st Century science-based risk analytics to liability insurance. Praedicat was created by the RAND Corporation and Risk Management Solutions, Inc. after the two companies collaborated on research and development to improve the identification and prioritization of emerging risks using modeling and cutting-edge computer science. Praedicat is an independent corporation launched in March 2012.  Praedicat is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment with Praedicat is determined on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.Company DescriptionPraedicat, Inc. is dedicated to improving the underwriting and management of liability catastrophe risk. Our multidisciplinary team leverages cutting-edge analytics to solve problems for clients. Our patent-pending technology delivers information extracted from scientific literatures on emerging risk. We analyze the risk with a structured approach incorporating applied legal reasoning and economics. Our analysis is focused to directly inform core business functions of liability insurers and reinsurers. Praedicat is developing a comprehensive system of software products, Litagion® Risk Management, designed to bring 21st Century science-based risk analytics to liability insurance. Praedicat was created by the RAND Corporation and Risk Management Solutions, Inc. after the two companies collaborated on research and development to improve the identification and prioritization of emerging risks using modeling and cutting-edge computer science. Name: Business Analyst Sr - HCI
Description: Business Analyst Sr. - HCILong Beach, CAFull-timeAbout SCAN Our mission is simple: Keeping Seniors Healthy and Independent–that’s been our mission for almost 40 years. Rated as one of the top Medicare Advantage plans in California, SCAN Health Plan employees are passionate about what they do. Understanding that success is based on achieving the mission, SCAN employees are afforded with the training and tools necessary to do their jobs and they are rewarded for their efforts and recognized as experts in their fields. Ask anyone who works here and we’ll proudly tell you that SCAN’s commitment has never wavered. We are as steadfast in our pledge to help our members live healthy and independent lives. The job Act as liaison among 5 STAR Member Satisfaction Workgroup and internal business/IT stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems. Understands business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and performs root cause analysis to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. You willCreate informative process flows to demonstrate current state of process and recommended future state of the process. Perform process analysis using data and six sigma training and utilize process redesign concepts to implement recommendations.Performs root cause analysis using relevant techniques and create recommendations for addressing the root causes. Pushes creative thinking beyond the boundaries of existing industry practices and client mindsets with the ability to separate what is important from the noise.Gather and create business and functional specifications/requirements by facilitating cross functional meetings and workshops of business and IT stakeholders. Create user stories and use cases to define user specifications and functional requirements.Creates informative, well-organized presentations to the Senior Leadership with compelling story line and utilize data to inform decision making.Ability to understand and analyze data with strong skills in excel and SQL is preferred. Must be able to find and translate insights from the data.Work with the Project Manager to create an action plan for implementing recommendations.Quickly understands the business issues and data challenges of client's organization and industry. Ability to understand member experience and issues using outside in thinking and ability to relate to human behavior driving specific experiences.Develops relationships with internal and external stakeholders to enable seamless implementations.Communicates effectively with stakeholders to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions with support from project management. Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.Assists in the facilitation of team and client meetings.Functions as an expert in process redesign and process expert to the team, providing guidance as needed.Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.Actively supports the achievement of SCAN’s Vision and Goals.Other duties as assigned.RequirementsYour qualificationsBachelor's Degree required (Computer Information Systems or equivalent work experience preferred).7+ years of professional experience.5+ years of healthcare experience.Green Belt Certification required with Black belt preferredExcellent Presentation skills with ability to communicate a visual story.Strong experience in writing business and functional requirements and facilitating workshop sessions to gather requirements.Perform root cause analysis using different methodologiesAbility to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully.Ability to facilitate effective cross functional team interaction.Background in Psychology, Behavioral Science, Cognitive Science is highly preferred.Conditions of WorkOffice Hours: Monday-Friday, 8am to 5pm. Extended work hours, as needed.What's in it for you? Qualified employees will receiveA competitive compensation and benefits programAn annual employee bonus programGenerous paid-time-off (PTO)Ten paid holidays per yearExcellent 403(b) Saving Plan, providing up to 4% match and vesting after three yearsCasual attireA work-life balance and much more! We're always looking for talented people to join our team! Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply now!

Name: Business Analyst III
Description: Position Purpose: Perform various analysis and interpretation to link business needs and objectives for assigned function. Support business initiatives through data analysis, identification of implementation barriers and user acceptance testing of various systemsIdentify and analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing processesPerform detailed analysis on multiple projects, recommend potential business solutions and ensure successful implementationsIdentify ways to enhance performance management and operational reports related to new business implementation processesCoordinate with various business units and departments in the development and delivery of training programsDevelop, share, and incorporate organizational best practices into business applicationsDiagnose problems and identify opportunities for process redesign and improvementFormulate and update departmental policies and proceduresServe as the subject matter expert on the assigned function product to ensure operational performance.Ability to travel Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4-6 years of business process or data analysis experience, preferably in healthcare. Master's degree in business, finance, economics, health care administration, public health administration, statistics, mathematics, or a directly related field preferred.  Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. Name: Cyber Security Analyst
Description: Posted Date: 08/25/2017 Responsibilities:Requirements: Job Title: Cyber Security Analyst  Location: Los Angeles, CA  Duration: 6+ Months Job Description Identify and communicate threat intelligence to appropriate stakeholders.  Create and maintain key Cybersecurity metrics.  Perform reviews of business application and infrastructure systems and projects to identify Cybersecurity risk.  Acts as a technical and process SME for Cybersecurity operations. Including attestations, checks and functions.  Assist with Cybersecurity reviews of application and infrastructure systems.  Review and consult with Project Team on various Cybersecurity related Controls and resources.  Perform periodic attestation, control, and performance procedures as deemed necessary.  Participation in Cybersecurity Operations on-call program. Skills Required: A thorough understanding of key networking protocols, security Solutions and operating Systems.  Have an understanding of Minimum Security Baseline, OWASP guidelines and secure Code Analysis tools.  Assess Vulnerabilities and provide Recommendations to remediate.  Ability to analyze business applications to determine and communicate risk to stakeholders in an understandable way in a consultative manner.  Experience with the creation and maintaining of Cybersecurity related metrics.  Liaison with Client Security Team and Other Project’s team to review security posture and implement Security controls  Experience in scripting using PERL, Python, VB Script or similar scripting tools is desirable  CISSP / Security +  Mail in your Resume to : apps@krgtech.com

Name: Growth Insights Analyst
Description: You love numbers. And ecommerce. (And shoes?) More than anything, you’re interested; curious, detail oriented, and have excellent judgement. You appreciate the importance of converting data into meaningful and actionable insights. You are excited about understanding channel dynamics & customer behavior. And you’re into the idea of building a company that’s at the forefront of fashion and ecommerce.  Lucky for you, we’re just getting started.  We’ve hit reset at Tamara Mellon. On our own business, and in turn, the women’s luxury shoe industry. Tamara Mellon, co-founder and former chief creative officer of Jimmy Choo, is no stranger to success or rule breaking. After a more traditional start of her eponymous label, Tamara decided it was time to do things differently—really differently. So she closed up shop and started over in Los Angeles, launching the first direct-to-consumer women’s luxury shoe brand: No retailers. Direct to women. Shoes designed for women, by women, and made by generations-old Italian factories.  We are dead serious about disrupting the fashion world and being taken seriously about doing it. Tamara Mellon is a Series B funded company, backed by NEA (the world’s largest venture fund; portfolio includes Moda Operandi, Jet, Casper, Goop, Groupon, and Quidsi, among others). We’re one year in, and we’re not slowing down. This is luxury, without the bullshit, in a fast-paced, startup setting.  If this sounds like the opportunity (not the job) you’ve been waiting to tackle and you are ready to do things differently (and passionately), we’d love to hear from you. RequirementsObsess over channel dynamics, customer acquisition, and all parts of the ecommerce funnelDevelop, measure, analyze and report all key performance indicatorsUncover insights from exploratory analysis to turn data into actionable insightsSupport marketing and product through A/B testing and optimization initiativesCreate daily, weekly, and monthly dashboards including sourcing, vetting, and analyzing dataPartner with engineering to instrument data collection and tagging5+ years of experience in analytics or related workStrong quantitative and analytical skillsExperience with web analytics such as Google Analytics or MixPanelExperience in a growth stage company, extremely well-organized, methodical and efficient, able to bring initiative to a lean startup teamYou are curious, positive, and you have gritExperience with SQL a big plusBenefitsCompetitive salaryMedical, Dental and VisionFast-paced, energetic and entrepreneurial culture with long-term career development opportunitiesEmployee discount (you love shoes, right?)

Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: About Navigant Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant’s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant’s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com. Responsibilities This role can be based in any of the following locations: Lewisville, TX; Gardena, CA  The Senior Business Analyst leads the requirements gathering process and works as a liaison in order to understand the business issues and challenges of our customers. Than working with the teams to solution ideas that enable customers to achieve their goals. The Senior Business Analyst works closely with product owners, designers, web developers, engineers, scrum masters and quality assurance teams to understand, analyze, and document requirements and deliver functional specifications for project delivery.  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Lead the requirements gathering processQuickly understand the business issues and data challenges of our customers quickly organize solutions to resolve those pain pointsTranslate business needs to system solutionsRecommend new features or improvements to features that return value to our customersEnsure business, functional, and technical requirements are captured, organized. Incorporating feedback from customers, end users or key stakeholders, to continually increase value for our customersDynamically facilitate working sessions as well as stakeholder interviews, focus groups and a/b testingIdentify functional gaps and provide solutionsAuthor user stories and define acceptance criteriaCreate user scenarios, process flow diagrams, and wireframesCollaborate with multiple team members to ensure a standard level of requirement understandingQualifications Must Have Skills: Developing and writing user stories that directly support the primary objective of the project and are appropriate size for iterative development.Active participation in Agile teams developing software solutions (5+ years experience)Requirement documentation and detail analysisRally, JIRA or any other advanced tool for Agile teamsParticipating in meetings regarding requirement specificationIdentifying business needs, requirements, constraints and business problems of current systems along with the stakeholdersConsistently meeting with business customers to receive business requirementsEffectively communicating to all stakeholders to solidify needs and identifying issues in a timely mannerWriting and maintains defects and user stories and reviewing them with stakeholders Preferred Skills: Previous experience in Business Analyst roles/Scrum Master roles: A minimum of 5 years3+ years working in agile environments. SCM is a big plusIdentify major stakeholders and requirement sourcesHealthcare Revenue Cycle Management experience (great plus)Experience with offshore delivery modelBasic knowledge of SQLBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience Professional Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work with staff through executive level employeesStrong presentation skillsAbility to negotiateMental/Physical RequirementsCommunicate frequently with co-workers as well as with managers to discern their needs, and be able to express themselvesWork as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independentlyConstantly operates a computer and other office equipment to coordinate workUsually remains stationary for the majority of the dayFrequently communicates with clients and coworkers and must be able to share information effectivelyGenerally works in an office environmentEEO/C&B StatementThe company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans.Navigant does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Navigant and Navigant will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.Navigant is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: At First Entertainment Credit Union, we believe that every story matters - that includes our members, employees, community, and those interested in joining our growing team. The Credit Union has served its members since 1967 and has grown to manage over $1.5 Billion in assets. Today, First Entertainment is the financial partner for the creators of entertainment and those who support them.  We are looking for talented individuals who are passionate about member service and teamwork, have a deep sense of respect and integrity for their co-workers and our members and are also driven to pursue excellence in all that they do. We are constantly aiming for higher goals that depend upon growth-minded individuals who share our core values and vision.  If you are looking for a workplace where you can make a positive impact for our members and opportunities for advancement, read on!  As a Financial Analyst, this position will provide broad based financial and analytical support to the Finance team. This individual will create and enhance analytical reports to ensure accurate reporting of data and its effective presentation.  Responsibilities: Responsible for daily and monthly tasks such as updating files, maintaining management reports, and submitting data files to vendor.Interpret qualitative and quantitative data into business impacts and recommendations.Focus on the details of a project deliverable, while still keeping the organization's strategic priorities top-of-mind.Work with large files of qualitative and quantitative data; combine, maneuver, and manipulate large data sets.Work on several projects simultaneously within the Finance and Accounting departments.Work collaboratively with other departments to achieve common goals.Create charts, graphs, and other dashboarding tools that highlight and share portfolio insights (i.e. trends, KPI metrics, margins, etc.). Qualifications: Four (4) year college degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or related field or equivalent experience or trainingMinimum of three to five (3-5) years' experience.Experience in the financial services industry preferred but not required.Strong knowledge of GAAP and accounting methodsStrong overall computer skills including strong Excel skillsAbility to proactively research issues, suggested improvements, and new related analysesKnowledge of basic finance, accounting, and analytical concepts, and how they are applied to real-life situations.Excellent problem-solving and analytical skillsJob Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Financial Analyst - Consultant
Description: Intermedia Group has an opening for the following Consultant: TITLE: Financial Analyst LOCATION: Los Angeles, CA or Woodland Hills, CA TYPE: ContractCLIENT: Fortune 100 Bank SUMMARY: Will assist the ALM Modeling team as it generates and socializes the CCAR forecast. Duties will include: Generation of reporting and presentations detailing the forecasts for lines of business / portfolio owners requiring interaction and collaboration with Subject Matter Experts (SME) and Senior Management. Meeting coordination including meeting minutes and takeaways. Prepares, supervises, and provides quality control in the preparation of forecasts, associated analyses and presentations. Name: Expense Management Analyst
Description: KORE1, a nationwide provider of staffing and recruiting solutions, has an immediate opening for an Expense Management in Southeast Los Angeles.  Summary:  This position supports the accounts payable operations for the organization and subsidiaries, including 13 community practices. This includes procure to pay business process improvements, performing month and year end close and ERP reconciliation, creating insightful AP metrics reporting, ensuring compliance and control through driving policy compliance and working with internal audit, as well as developing and providing necessary training to end users. Including strategically managing internal expense transactions for the enterprise.  This position will design and monitor department metrics and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) with our key customers across the enterprise. The key services this position will provide includes handling enterprise departments accounts payable inquiries and research accounts payable issues, assisting with system upgrades, replacements, and troubleshooting, as well as recommending key policies and procedures for daily activities, demonstrating a solid understanding of GAAP, SOX and regulatory guidelines. Assist with preparation for audits and special projects as assigned such as enterprise training or system implementations.  This Expense Management analyst will play a crucial key user role in large Procure to Pay optimization projects. This role will provide insights on current process flow, provide recommendations on future state. This position will participate through all stages of project implementation including design, testing, go live and post go live training.  The Expense Management analyst must demonstrate key AP knowledge and understanding of relevant business processes at various levels across the organization. This position also requires excellent communication skills, presentation and facilitation skills, as well as superior customer service. Must also be able to present the analytical findings and metrics to identify inefficiencies and propose recommendations. Lastly, this position must demonstrate independent thinking and requires minimal supervision.  Essential Functions: Develop and publish AP analysis to identify issues with internal transactions related to Procurement card expenditures and Travel and Expense. Reviews and approves Travel and Expense reports for accuracy and compliance to policies. Publish monthly metrics for T&E (SLAs) for the enterprise. Conducts regular audit of procurement card transactions throughout the enterprise to ensure compliance with policies. Reviews and analyzes card user data and prepares usage reports to review trends, year over year changes and unusual transactions. Ensures internal controls related to Procurement card transactions and Travel Expense related expenses are executed. Co-lead with AP manager on presentations/inputs to identify opportunities to optimize business and IT processes. Provides training to new and existing users on business expense module to ensure business expense reimbursements are processed accurately and most efficient means. Prepare month end accruals for Procurement card to ensure we close on time to meet the financial close timeline. Maintain and assist in revisions to business expense policy and procedures by working with AP manager. Research and analyze processes, collaborate with General Accounting and PeopleSoft FIN system business analyst team. Thus recommending process improvements as well as internal controls. Play a vital role with AP manager in assisting interim and year end external audit related to Procurement card and Travel and Expense transactions. Act as the key user for Procure to Pay improvement initiatives, aiming to deliver efficiencies within in operations. Act as the AP lead in working with ERP Fin System Business Analyst in providing service desk support related to Travel and Expense. Assists in additional AP projects as assigned. Requires minimal supervisor to manage daily activities and is able to meet deadlines. With extensive industry expertise and unmatched opportunities, our goal is to provide a unique experience for our contractors and consultants as they prepare for their next role. Name: Workday IT Business Analyst
Description: Requisition Number 18-0044 Post Date 7/3/2018 Title Workday IT Business Analyst City El Segundo State CA Description As an industry leader with an unsurpassed service record, growth and innovation are at the forefront of our strategic goals. Over the past five years we’ve doubled in size, pioneered new advances in laundry room technology, and modernized our systems.  We have a bold digital journey! We are excited about our mobile program. It is part of our digital platform and customer journey. We have a strong company culture that embraces exceptional customer service.  In being a people-centered company, we provide professional development, promotional opportunities, and a learning environment to continue to innovate. WASH’s mission is to provide best-in-class laundry room operations to our customers by delivering superior  quality service. If our spirit of innovation and excellent customer service speaks to you, we want to meet you! Position Summary: Looking for an IT Business Analyst and System Administrator to support HR Business with Workday HRIS implementations. Responsibilities: Analyze, design, evaluate, modify, test, and implement Workday functionality in coordination with the HR.  Lead system update process, including making appropriate recommendations to process owners, leading configuration and testing, and training end users, when appropriate.  Conduct research and analysis regarding trends, patterns, and issues to identify opportunities and solve problems.  Work closely with department leadership to fully maximize and enhance the system.  Ensure consistent delivery of established service level agreements through active, ongoing management.  Ensure that system is configured accurately to support end user business needs.  Configures and troubleshoots integrations with third parties.  Partner with stakeholders to implement process modifications that support changing business and compliance requirements.  Manage the ongoing maintenance and data integrity of existing systems, including all integrations and reports. Requirements Requirements:  3-5 years experience with HRIS systems (core HR, payroll and tax, time and attendance, recruiting, on-boarding, benefits, compensation, performance management, talent management, workforce management)  Workday Business Analyst experience - requirements elicitation, use case documentation, process flows etc  Workday Systems Administrator experience - configuration, reporting, and maintenance  Workday Systems Integration experience - Workday Integration Cloud Connect Package experience with out of the box connectors such as Salesforce, Kronos, SSN Verification, Background Check, Payroll, etc. Experience with web service based APIs and the Workday  Integration Cloud platform.  Experience migrating a company from a legacy on-premise and/or cloud based HRIS solution to a Workday solution.  We offer an excellent benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, paid vacation, educational reimbursement, and a superior 401K/profit-sharing plan. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Drug Testing employer and do not discriminate against  any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, or basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class. We will consider for  employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable federal, state, and local laws

Name: Financial Analyst

Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.  Snapchat is the camera used by millions of people every day to Snap with family, watch Stories from friends, see events from around the world, and explore expertly curated content from top publishers. In short, we are a passionate team working hard to build the best platform in the world for communication and storytelling.  We’re looking for a Financial Analyst to join Team Snapchat! Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. Name: Analyst
Description: Are you interested in working for the music industry? Would you like to help develop unique and clever ways to drive the music industry into the future using data driven strategies and insights?  Universal Music Group is looking for an Analyst to help brainstorm, create, and implement critical business solutions for a wide variety of stakeholders throughout the organization. These stakeholders would include Senior Executives, as well as individuals within our Global Digital Strategy, Global Streaming Marketing, Business Development, Global Communications, Commercial Partnership, and Finance units.  The ideal candidate should be well-versed in data analysis and financial modelling, with a solid understanding (or an eagerness to learn) the business models that are currently revolutionizing digital and subscription-based media. Candidates should be complete wizards in Excel (including VBA / Macros), PowerPoint, SQL, Tableau, DOMO, or other data manipulation / visualization platforms.  This candidate should also have a demonstrated ability to manage client or audience requests in a professional manner, communicate findings to a variety of different audience types (from Senior Executives down to fellow Analysts), and work in project teams to solve interesting problems in a consultative fashion.  Job Functions: Deliver data-driven solutions and recommendations to executives and necessary parties that incorporate rigorous research and analysisDevelop dynamic / automated models to help key stakeholders with partner negotiations, executive presentations, label meetings, global communications, etc.Create SQL scripts in order to extract necessary data from files that could be greater than 100 TB in size within Google BigQuery or other SQL platformsIdentify user / partner trends, including but not limited to user engagement, listening habits, conversion, retention, monetization per stream / user, genre insights, among many othersPresent overall findings to executives throughout the company in a clear and concise manner Job Requirements: Skills/Abilities:Passion and curiosity for music and the data that is used within the industryAbility to query our databases (using platforms such as BigQuery) accurately and efficiently using SQLAdvanced level Excel skills, with the ability to develop dynamic models using named ranges / formulaic referencesFamiliarity with statistical concepts and tools, along with the ability to use them effectively in analysesAbility to visualize data within Tableau, DOMO, or other data visualization platformsExperience:2 – 3 years of work experience in management consulting, investment banking, or similar roleExperience managing and engaging with clients in a consultative or analytical capacityExperience working with analytical tools including, but not limited to Excel, VBA, Tableau, DOMO, BigQuery, etc.Education:BS required in Business Administration, Accounting, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a similarly quantitative degree Universal Music Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Disclaimer This job description only provides an overview of job responsibilities that are subject to change.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionDAILYLOOK is looking for a Data Analyst to join our rapidly expanding team. This individual will provide quantitative analytical support and insights by supporting the Finance and Marketing team while reporting to the VP of Finance. As a Data Analyst at DAILYLOOK, you will be responsible for turning data into insights, and insights into key business decisions that drive strategic decision making. What we’re looking forAnalyze large data sets, identify insights, make recommendations, and effectively communicating findings to cross-functional groupsBuild data visualizations that conveys key performance metrics, significant trends, and relationships across multiple data sourcesResponsible for providing data tools and analysis-based insight that drive the efficacy of the businessProvide internal stakeholders with data-driven stories of customer behavior to drive strategic decision makingCreate data solutions that uncover actionable business insight and contribute a quantitative data points in assistance of our marketing and customer acquisition effortsOptimize marketing campaign performances based on ROI analysis and measuring conversion funnel efficiencies and goalsCollaborate across multiple teams to understand business needs, analyze complex data, and clearly communicate recommendationsEducation & ExperienceBA/BS in Math or Finance related fieldMinimum 2-3 years of experience in a data analytical roleProficiency in SQL / query language skills with large-scale, complex data setsFamiliarity with database and data warehouse conceptsAbility to multitask and independently make decisions Company DescriptionWhat is DAILYLOOK?  DAILYLOOK is the premium personal styling experience that provides on-trend looks tailored to your lifestyle - saving you time and effort. We make shopping simple, by curating looks you love based on your body shape and lifestyle. Our experienced Stylists mix/match our collection to style beautiful outfits for you to try on in the convenience of your own home. You buy what you love and return the rest. Free shipping both ways. It's that easy.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: About Us: PlayQ is a rapidly growing mobile gaming studio based in the heart of sunny Santa Monica. Our titles have been downloaded over 60 million times worldwide, with millions of users playing our games every day!  Our goal is to deliver tomorrow's nostalgic game experiences to a global audience and we rely on our dedicated team to craft these unforgettable games that our users love. We believe that the best games come from diverse teams with a shared desire to create something amazing. From our beachfront headquarters to our innovative tech stack, it's no surprise that PlayQ was named as one of the 2018 Best Places to Work in Los Angeles by the Los Angeles Business Journal.  We're looking for people who have a genuine love for their craft and we invite you to join us in this exciting endeavor. The Data Analyst will leverage billions of data points from our games to build dashboards, answer key business questions, and tell compelling stories. This person will conduct in-depth analyses of our data, report on key game metrics, and provide recommendations that will have a direct impact in shaping future game development and company initiatives. The ideal candidate is intelligent,sharp, detail-oriented, and highly quantitative individual who loves working with and analyzing data. Responsibilities:Create thoughtful and compelling dashboards to monitor KPIs and performance for our current and future game titlesPerform in-depth analyses to provide answers to specific business questions and acquire a deep understanding of user behaviorReport and present findings and actionable recommendations to respective teams and key stakeholdersMonitor, identify and investigate changes in KPIs and provide insights into the underlying cause of such changesConduct a variety of ad hoc data analyses and fulfill data requests for new product/version releases, design documentation, marketing material, and user acquisition campaignsDesign and document tracking specifications for core KPIs, feature additions, experimentation, and user acquisition campaignsCheck and debug any data-related issues to ensure accurate tracking and data integrityAssist with the development of new tools and processes for data analysis across the companyRequirements:BA/BS degree in Math, Statistics, or other quantitative field2-3 years of post-graduate experience as a data analyst or similar analytical role, preferably for a technology or gaming companyExpertise with ExcelExperienced with Tableau, Spotfire, STATA, SAS, or similar analytics softwareExperienced with SQL and querying large, complex data setsExcellent communication, presentation, and visual reporting skillsStrong analytical skills with the ability to apply business strategy to data analysis and recommendationsLoves problem-solving, has an innate ability to investigate issues and find the optimal solutionsDesire to work independently on analyses and projects from inception to completionBonus Points:Working knowledge of basic statisticsWorking knowledge of R, Python, or similarPerks:Competitive compensation and equity optionsComprehensive medical, dental, vision insuranceFlexible time off401K plan with company matchStocked kitchen with free snacks and beverages of your choiceCatered weekly Name: Healthcare Data Analyst
Description: KORE1, a nationwide provider of healthcare and technical recruiting, has an immediate contract opening for a Market Intelligence Analyst with one of our clients in Los Angeles, CA.  SUMMARY:  This position is responsible for managing customer and marketing analysis projects that support organization’s strategic initiatives. The primary responsibility is the production of high-level analytical reports on patient quality, utilization and outcome, healthcare costs or market research data that supports the organization’s Integration, Growth and Maximizing Value initiatives.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Responsible for data mining, analysis and reporting and clinical quality, patient utilization and outcome, and financial data, comparative analysis of performance against benchmarked health industry data, and analysis of market research or financial data for business development and growth initiatives.  Lead the cultivation and maintenance of relationship with external partners and data sources and delivering customer focused work product in internal business partners.  Gathers and manages patient demographic, diagnosis and utilization, clinical quality and financial performance healthcare data from external partners for analysis.  Accesses proprietary patient, clinical quality and financial performance data from Data Warehouse and enterprise Data Systems for us in analysis projects.  Leads and manages data analysis projects, including use of quantitative or predictive analytics that support the company’s integration, growth and maximizing value strategy.  Reviews health policy and healthcare industry information sources to stay current and inform key stakeholders on emerging healthcare industry issues.  Creates summary and detailed informational reports and presentations for leadership and management to support business decisions that enable the organization to achieve its strategic goals and objectives.  Cultivates and maintains partnerships and collaborations with internal and external business partners.  Assists members of the Business Intelligence community and other departmental team members in accessing and analyzing health care data  and information.  Perform all other related duties as assigned.REQUIREMENTS:Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Health Administration, Business or Public Administration or a related field.5 years of experience in analysis of healthcare operations, patient, clinical quality, financial data, and additional industry information.Excellent analytical reporting and understating of patient quality, utilization and outcome-based data.Excellent problem-solving skills and knowledge of best health care practices.Strong organizational, analytical, multi-tasking, documentation, and presentation skills.Strong business acumen, interpersonal, and communication skills.Proven oral and written communication skills to a wide diverse audience.ABOUT KORE1:Specializing in professional services and technical recruiting, KORE1 is committed to supporting top IT and Healthcare professionals in their career paths. We build deep relationships with leading companies, connecting them to exceptional talent every day. With extensive industry expertise and unmatched opportunities, our goal is to provide a unique experience for our contractors and consultants as they prepare for their next role. We are passionate about matching the right people with the right companies.Kore1 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Kore1 complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Kore1 expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Kore1's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.#REH

Name: Business Analyst - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity

With the guidance from a business relationship manager, the Business Analyst will assist the development teams and vendors in understanding the business processes, workflows, and information requirements of the users. Issue Resolution  # Issue tracking skills, documenting and communicating issues/defects to the appropriate level of detail for business users and technical teams.  Documentation  # Strong documentation experience in creating detailed use case documents, functional documents, reporting and interface specifications.  Additional  Four or more years of relevant working experience  Bachelors degree in a related field  Ability to adapt to and work in an Agile Methodology environment; experience working in an agile environment is a preferred  Is curious and takes on the challenge of unfamiliar tasks  Collaborative, positive attitude and open to giving and receiving feedback  Optimizes work processes  Core Competencies  Trusted Partner  Consistently demonstrates ethics and integrity  Shows respect to all colleagues regardless of position  Fulfills commitments  Values diversity in thought and background  Builds trust and productive relationships across SPE  Effective Communicator  Articulates views in a concise and clear manner  Comfortable adjusting style according to audience  Solid written and presentation skills  Leverages data and insights to influence others  Strategic Thinker  Recognizes the factors critical to the organizations long-term success  Understands how his/her work impacts the bottom line  Sees the big picture, able to connect the dots  Applies analytics to business data to describe, predict, and improve business performance  Problem-solver  Asks the right questions to analyze situations, able to carefully define the problem, does not rush to conclusions  Simplifies and makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information  Uncovers root causes to difficult problems  Change Agent  Flexible and open to change  Learns quickly when facing new situations Sony Pictures Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer.
