Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Financial Analyst ServiceTitan is looking for a Financial Analyst to join our growing FP&A team. Partnering closely with our HR, Sales and Payroll departments, the Analyst will manage sales compensation plan administration, commission system administration, and reporting. The financial analyst will be responsible for calculating commissions and ensuring commission payouts are accurate and timely. The ideal candidate is detail and process oriented, ethical, analytical, proactive, collaborative and self-motivated.  This position is based at our headquarters in Glendale, CA. We are looking for someone to join our team immediately. What you'll do:Maintain our new commission management system (Performio), including setting up new participants, new plans, amending plans, confirming compensation plans are built and transactions are mapped correctlyChallenge the status-quo and think outside the box to design better, more efficient processes and build scale into our monthly commission process.Ensure that monthly commission calculations are prepared accurately, on time, and in line with the different commission plansSubmit commission payments to payroll in a timely mannerCalculate monthly commission accruals and submit to AccountingAssist with ASC 606 implementation with respect to capitalization of commissionsSupport the development, implementation, communication and administration of new commission or incentive programs, plans, policies, and quotas.Provide superior customer service to the sales organization when resolving difficult and sensitive issuesAd-hoc reporting, analysis, and special projectsHold weekly office hours for the global sales team to provide guidance and insight into commission plans, calculations, statements, and any other ad hoc questions.Perform audits to ensure accurate data entry/file imports by the processing team.What we're looking for:Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or business preferred3-5 years in a Finance, Accounting, or Sales Operations Analyst roleHands on experience with Salesforce Hands on experience administering Performio/Xactly on any other commission software is preferredExperience with administering and analyzing complex commission plans is preferredAbility to organize and summarize large volumes of data in ExcelResults-driven and comfortable handling multiple deadlinesExtreme attention to detail and accuracyPersonable and able to effectively communicate and work with all levels and across functional departmentsProficient with financial software applications including strong Excel skillsAbility to effectively multi-task in time sensitive situationsTeam player who also works well independentlyAbout ServiceTitan ServiceTitan is a mobile, cloud-based software platform that helps home services companies streamline operations, improve customer service, and grow their business. ServiceTitan's end-to-end solution for the multi-billion dollar residential home services industry includes CRM, intelligent dispatch, custom reporting, marketing automation, mobile solution for field techs, and accounting integration with Intacct and QuickBooks. ServiceTitan brings a fully operational modern SaaS infrastructure to an industry traditionally underserved by software. ServiceTitan is the preferred software for hundreds of the world's most successful plumbing, HVAC, and electrical companies. For more information about ServiceTitan, visit www.ServiceTitan.com. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: If you want to work for a fast-growing company, Accountemps is hiring dedicated candidates for a Financial Analyst position. Some of your responsibilities in this role include running financial modeling on a number of financial products and measuring, analyzing, and forecasting performance in conjunction with operating plans. We will give you the responsibilities to advise management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives and prepare reports for management. Name: Business Systems Analyst

Other Must Have's: • Must be able to work as a W2 hourly consultant (H1 Transfer's available) • Must reside LOCALLY (S. California) area  • MUST be available for a face to face interview • Must have a stable work history, working in a similar role • Must have EXCELLENT oral communication skills • Education: Bachelors Degree  DESIRED: •• Experience building set standards for a governance model/OEM. •• Experience with American Disability Act (ADA) - Website Accessibility standards and/or testing desirable  • Experience authoring and executing basic SQL statements  Calance Benefits Offerings: • H1 Transfers/Green Card processing is available  • Medical/Dental/Vision benefits (HMO/PPO) • 401K Retirement program • Paid Bi-Weekly/Direct Deposit • Flex Spending Plan • Voluntary Life, AD&D, STD or LTD plans Send To Email / Remind Me WEB-DOM01-NEW

Name: Finance Business Analyst/Dynamics Functional SME
Description: Job ID: 10770  Our large entertainment client in West Los Angeles has a fulltime permanent opportunity for a Finance Business Analyst/Dynamics Functional SME. The Business Technology Solutions (BTS) Business Analyst is a member of a highly-motivated BTS team responsible for partnering with multiple tech and business divisions to evaluate, understand and deliver solutions for complex business problems. The team works as the strategic interface with assigned business divisions for the purpose of business-tech strategy development, solutions delivery, service management, risk management and relationship management. The BTS team provides highly-valued strategic consulting level support and guidance throughout key business technology initiatives.  The Finance Business Analyst is a full-time position responsible for analyzing finance business problems and implementing solutions in our ERP platform. The business analyst supports the user community, elicit, manage requirements and specifications as well as execute a variety of testing disciplines (test plans, scripts, unit testing and user acceptance) to drive development and validate results.  The Finance Business Analyst will report to the BTS Enterprise Services Manager within the Business Technology Solutions Global Operations group and act as a business relationship management function as described below. ResponsibilitiesElicit, analyze, and document business requirements, from user groups and project stakeholders.Create and manage backlog of items by documenting business requirements and translating into technical specifications for solution implementation.Manage requirements prioritization, implementation estimation and dependencies; traceability from business capability to test case.Process/Workflow analysis; work with project teams to gather, analyze and compile business process needs.Create process, models, specifications, diagrams and charts on current business processes and workflows.Support prioritization of Tech initiatives based on the division’s needs/strategy, Tech workload and budget.Promote business knowledge of Tech process, roles, and procedures to ensure the best possible outcomes.Support on solution options analysis, risks evaluation and impacts on end-user solutions and services, business processes/workflows and system priorities.Participates in planning sessions with BTS team members.Support the development of business cases and contribute to the “project greenlight” process, including cost benefit analyses.Build a trusted relationship with multiple roles.Partner with BTS and Service Mangers to deliver Tech solutions to further company goals, all while managing customer expectations around what Tech can deliver.Analyze technology trends to determine impact to the achievement of BTS goals.Support the development of project plans and project charters.Support the project management process, reporting on status, accomplishments and risks.Develop test plans and test case scenarios based on project requirements.Assist and conduct user acceptance testing.Research and document issues / bugs before reporting these to the developers.Supports change management activities; training and user support.Supports the BTS manager in monitoring and reporting on escalated issues.Works collaboratively with service managers to develop clear and concise communications with respects to incidents, problems, and change management as needed.Required CapabilitiesExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills.Experience implementing ERP applications with specific knowledge of finance and accounting modules.Experience using Dynamics AX 2012 or Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations.Advanced Excel skills, in particular around data validation, pivot tables and reporting financial data.Expert in business workflow modeling.Exceptional oral and written communications skills.Demonstrate initiative and ownership of tasks and projects.Ability to prioritize, coordinate and complete tasks to meet deadlines.Ability to work effectively both independently and in team environments.Ability to present complex problems in simple terms with great presentation skills.Experience extracting insights from data.Experience in Agile or waterfall SDLC.Experience using requirements management tools and test management tools.Thorough understanding of GAAP accounting.Thorough understanding of source control, unit testing, and continuous integration practices.Possess the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high growth environment.Attention to detail to be vigilant in analysis to come to correct conclusions.Be a team player who is approachable and supportive; able to contribute ideas and recommendations.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Senior Business Systems Analyst Location  Pasadena, CA Department  Development Requisition ID 2808Apply NowGreen Dot Corporation, along with its wholly owned subsidiary bank, Green Dot Bank, is a pro-consumer financial technology innovator with a mission to reinvent personal banking for the masses. Green Dot invented the prepaid debit card industry and is the largest provider of reloadable prepaid debit cards and cash reload processing services in the United States. Green Dot is also a leader in mobile technology and mobile banking with its award-winning GoBank mobile checking account. Through its wholly owned subsidiary, TPG, Green Dot is additionally the largest processor of tax refund disbursements in the U.S. Green Dot's products and services are available to consumers through a large-scale "branchless bank" distribution network of more than 100,000 U.S. locations, including retailers, neighborhood financial service center locations, and tax preparation offices, as well as online, in the leading app stores and through leading online tax preparation providers. Green Dot Corporation is headquartered in Pasadena, Calif., with additional facilities throughout the United States and in Shanghai, China. requirements.Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing with technical, business, and management staffExcellent interpersonal skills with the ability to develop cohesive working relationships with internal and external clientsMaintain a high degree of business functional knowledge and current automated technologies and toolsFollow outlined project plans and task lists to ensure that all research is completed prior to implementation of developmentFacilitate the resolution of known issues to expedite solutionsPerform analysis and trouble shoot data scenariosLearn the existing business model and related architectureParticipate in user acceptance testing of data warehouse projectRequirementsBachelor’s degree in a business or technical fieldMinimum of 7 years of experience in requirements gathering and analysis in an IT environmentAbility to write clear requirements and specification documentationBanking and financial services background is preferredExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExperience with multiple SQL Server technology platformsUnderstanding and experience within various project management frameworks (i.e., Agile, SDLC)Ability to Name: Financial Analyst - Consultant
Description: Intermedia Group has an opening for the following Consultant: TITLE: Financial Analyst LOCATION: Los Angeles, CA or Woodland Hills, CA TYPE: ContractCLIENT: Fortune 100 Bank SUMMARY: Will assist the ALM Modeling team as it generates and socializes the CCAR forecast. Duties will include: Generation of reporting and presentations detailing the forecasts for lines of business / portfolio owners requiring interaction and collaboration with Subject Matter Experts (SME) and Senior Management. Meeting coordination including meeting minutes and takeaways. Prepares, supervises, and provides quality control in the preparation of forecasts, associated analyses and presentations. Take ownership of forecast questions and feedback to ensure proper resolution in terms of performing financial analysis with proper documentation. QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree with 5-7 years of experience. Understanding of banking products & financial statements (including income statement, balance sheet, cash flow analysis, and performance measurement). Advanced skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) gained through extensive hands-on experience in prior jobs. Specific knowledge of pivot tables, large data preferred. Ability to model and create complex spreadsheets, look up tables, pivot tables. Intermediate to advanced skills in data analysis and design, and data mapping. Detail oriented with the ability to work efficiently and independently with little supervision. Excellent time management skills working under time pressure and handling multiple tasks/projects at the same time. Problem resolution experience requiring strong financial analytical skills, sound judgment and ability to work effectively with clients and technical staff. Experience with financial database/software (knowledge of Hyperion or SQL is a plus, but not a requirement). ALM is a plusIRR (Interest Rate Risk) is a plusExperience with the Quantitative Risk Management (QRM) Enterprise Risk Framework is preferred but not a requirement. If you are interested in pursuing this opportunity, please respond back and include the following Full MS WORD ResumeCurrent and required compensationCurrent contact informationAvailability Upon receipt, one of our managers will contact you to discuss in fullSteve Fleischner Intermedia Group, Inc. 212 248-0100 steve@intermediagroup.com www.intermediagroup.com

Name: Sr Business Analyst (ediscovery data migration)
Description: Sr Business Analyst (ediscovery data migration) Immediate need for a Business Analyst to assist in an ediscovery data migration project. Prefer someone with an ediscovery or legal background. This project requires working with existing IT tools that export data as well as communicate, coordinate, and troubleshoot with outside vendors when issues arise. The Analyst will provide actionable insights to both the business and IT project manager of the progress of the exports. RESPONSIBILITIES: Ability to track the status of large amount of tasks Work with departmental managers and senior executives to access data and generate reports based on specific needs of the business segment. Locate and define new process improvement opportunities. Work with management to prioritize business and information needs. Coordinate tasks that involve other teams REQUIREMENTS: Strong analytical skills exhibiting the ability to collect, understand, organize and analyze large datasets. Creative ability to work around system constraints Effective communication skills with the capability of translating reports and findings to non-technical terms. Ability to work under multiple teams, coordinate with multiple stakeholders, understand requirements and provide stakeholder-specific recommendations. Willingness to learn rapidly, use collaboration to gain perspectives and flexibility to adapt to changing business situations. Experience with Microsoft Excel formulas - provided by DiceBSA, Data Analyst, Excel, ediscovery or legal background; data migration

Name: Analyst, Business Data (E) - Transplant Administration - FT 8 Hour Days - Exempt
Description: The Transplant Business Analyst is responsible for timely processing of invoices, posting charges, reviewing claims for possible errors, confirming diagnosis codes relating to transplant evaluations. This individual insures that appropriate charges are transferred to organ acquisition for the Medicare Cost Report. Manages the accounting and payment of organ acquisition expenses. Conducts monthly review of all transplant department cost center accounts to assure appropriate allocation of pre transplant, post transplant and non-transplant expenses. Tracks the number of and type of organs donated and provided to the organ procurement organization. Keeps and provides records to cost accounting for annual filing of Medicare report. Completes monthly variance analysis on continuous financial planning reports. Reconciles month end financial reports and clinic charges daily. Provides continuous oversight of billing and collections for process improvement opportunities. Participates in quality initiatives. Minimum Education:Bachelor's degree requiredMinimum Experience/Knowledge:3-5 years of experience in healthcareAbility to prioritize multiple projects at the same timeExcellent communication skills to interface with internal and external customersAbility to work independently. Name: Business Analyst - Business Intelligence / Big Data
Description: Major entertainment company in Culver City has a long term contract position for a Senior Business Analyst who preferably has Business Intelligence and/or Big Data experience.Position Summary:  The Business Analyst will be a key member of a team building a consolidated consumer marketing data platform. The Business Analyst will be responsible for working directly with business users, Data Scientists, and technical team members to understand and document business requirements, data structures, data flows and data processes. Finally, the Business Analyst will interact with stakeholders at all levels from various business units including IT, Corporate, Motion Pictures, Television, and Mobile Games.  This role will be expected to perform data and functional requirement analysis and to create documentation ranging from functional designs to complex process flows to ensure business requirements are understood by the team and completed successfully. This will include an ability to understand, document and explain the logical and physical architecture of a data warehouse/data lake and complex ETL processes. The ideal candidate must also have a proven track record of supporting highly visible initiatives where multiple business units are involved and are critical to the projectâ€™s success. Responsibilities include: â€¢ Initiate and facilitate communications between stakeholders, acting as a primary point of contact.  â€¢ Capture and disseminate technical and business information.  â€¢ Work with the business and technical team members to document detailed functional and data requirements, process flows, use cases, and test scenarios.  â€¢ Manage the UAT process by performing test case and data validations and obtaining business approvals on UAT for scheduled deployments.  â€¢ Serve as a liaison to other teams in planning, coordination, development and deployment of project deliverables.  â€¢ Ensure delivery of project deliverables meet the requirements defined by the business customer. Job Requirements: â€¢ Solicit and elaborate requirements from business and IT stakeholders.  â€¢ Create business and functional requirement documents  â€¢ Build complex workflow diagrams to depict business processes, system processes and data flows.  â€¢ Lead data definition and mapping exercises.  â€¢ Build and execute acceptance criteria, test scenarios, and test cases.  â€¢ Validate large data sets and data processing logic.  â€¢ Plan and conduct testing processes.  â€¢ Create user guides and training documentation as needed. Experience Required: â€¢ Minimum 3-5 years of experience in IT or related technical professions  â€¢ Minimum 3-5 years of experience using Microsoft Office suite of products including Excel, Word and PowerPoint  â€¢ Business Intelligence and/or Big Data Experience Preferred Skills: â€¢ Strong analytical skills for problem solving  â€¢ Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx or other data analysis tools  â€¢ Agile/Scrum experience  â€¢ JIRA/Confluence experience  â€¢ Entertainment Industry Work Experience Education â€¢ Bachelor Degree required

Name: Enterprise Data Quality Technical Analyst
Description: Enterprise Data Quality Technical Analyst Start Date: Immediate Duration: 6 month Location: Los Angeles, CA Overview: The Enterprise Data Quality Technical Analyst is a key role responsible for developing and supporting an Enterprise data quality solution. This role will support the business in the ability to analyze and assess the data quality in the various data environments (Transactional, MDM etc.). This is critical in supporting the Data Governance organization with actionable information to improve the quality and value of information assets. The client is consolidating its data management platform on Informatica including Informatica MDM, Power Center, Data Quality (IDQ), EDC and Axon. Responsibilities: Data Quality Development Responsible for full cycle development (designing, testing, deploying, and documenting the data quality procedures and their outputs). Document at a functional level how the procedures work within the data quality applications. Perform data load and mappings from source. Responsible for migrating objects. Responsible for deploying and validating objects to different environments for Scheduled, Batch or real time environment. Responsible for development of scheduling of Batch jobs and invoking of the jobs. Responsible for standards across all the SDLC phases. Business and Technical Rules Management Partner with the Data Governance Office and business data stewards to provide summary results of data quality analysis, which will be used to make decisions regarding how to measure business rules and quality of the data. Translate the business data quality rules into technical rules which are implemented on the platform. Execute and analyze Data profiling Develop and implement additional data quality monitoring based on requirements gathered from business units. Provide Data Quality Scorecards, Dash-Boards and Ad-Hoc reporting Provide recommendations for modification or creation of business rules based on data results Implement on-going monitoring jobs Aptitude to understand business challenges and offer advice on how to solve them with Data Quality. Data Quality as a Service Develop and implement additional data quality monitoring based on requirements gathered from business units. Manage and prioritize a request queue for new data quality monitoring requests over new data elements, new data quality rules, and maintenance to existing rules. Provide reports to provide insight to data quality errors. Qualifications: · 3-5 years of data analyst experience performing data profiling, data mapping, data validation, data manipulation, data analysis, use case, test cases, etc. preferably in a data-intensive financial company. · 3-5 years' experience in defining and deploying data quality programs and tools on enterprise data quality projects. · 3-5 years' experience in Information technology development across all phases of the SDLC process. · Experience in data profiling & data quality rules development. · Experience with Data Quality tools like Atacama, Experian, and Informatica IDQ etc. · Proven experience translating business problems into actionable data quality initiatives. · Familiarity with current trends in Data Quality technologies. · Good knowledge on Data mapping experience - mapping data sources to and from multiple applications · Possess good oral and written communication and presentations skills with the ability to lead meetings effectively · Experience in SDLC Process · Good understanding of data governance principals · Strong experience on data quality development process, issue management, and data remediation · 3-5 years of hands-on experience with Informatica Data Quality (IDQ) standards toolset preferred. · 3-5 years of experience in Banking or Financial sectors especially in terms of regulatory and strategic needs for data quality management preferred. - provided by DiceEnterprise Data Quality Technical Analyst

Name: Junior Investment Analyst
Description: Who We Are:Be part of a rapidly-expanding advertising agency with a global reach!Hylink is the largest, independently owned digital advertising and media agency in China.At Hylink, we believe that smart thinking equals endless possibilities. Over the past two decades, we have grown to a team of 2,400 digitally minded-professionals worldwide, earning our reputation as the number one media buyer in China. Our objective is simple: to leverage our decades of experience to help brands navigate the intricate spectrum of Chinese advertising. Hylink is called upon by industry leaders across tech, beauty, travel, and FMCG to provide an insiders perspective into digital China, consistently staying ahead of industry trends to deploy innovative strategies within a crowded market. We pride ourselves on pooling together the talents of a highly diverse workforce; our team is comprised of professionals from every corner of the earth, with experience within dozens of sectors.As China's largest digital media buyer, Hylink utilizes its institutional knowledge to advise companies looking to enter China on a myriad of business transactions including capital raise, licensing, investment, and strategic partnerships. Hylink works directly with the largest media platforms in China on behalf of its clients to drive the highest media efficiencies in the market. Hylink sits on some of the largest data pools in the China market and uses first-look insights to advise both consumer and B-to-B companies on maximizing their returns in the market.Hylink Ventures focuses on connecting ad tech companies and American properties with relevant Chinese platforms, investors, and media conglomerates The Junior Investment Analyst will play a vital role to the inner workings of Hylink Ventures. You will focus on connecting ad tech companies and American properties with relevant Chinese platforms, investors, and media conglomerates. Hylink sits on some of the largest data pools in the China market and you will learn first hand how to use first-look insights to advise both consumer and B-to-B companies on maximizing their returns in the market.Reporting directly to senior agency staff, you will be involved in a fast-paced, multitasking oriented team. You will be responsible for evaluating potential investments, providing reports, daily data entry, script improvement, writing reports, and forecasting. The Junior Investment Analyst must be knowledgeable, meticulous, analytical, and confident while communicating with senior staff or with clients in an informative and articulate manner.You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the organizational needs of Hylink's key partners and objectives. Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Responsibilities:Conduct and document due-diligence meetingsPrepare, present, and defend investment recommendationsAnalyze investment opportunities globally across various equity marketsMonitor existing investments and report on resultsPrepare reports for management and trustee reviewMaintain all legal, financial, and regulatory documentsGenerate ad-hoc reports and presentations Qualifications:BA or MBA in Finance, Economics, Actuarial Science, or data science field of study1-2 years of professional experience, in finance or investment banking settingExcellent communication and presentations skills, both written and verbalMethodical and efficient in a timely manner in tasks with a quick reaction due to market violation Well organized with high-proficiency in R Studio, SAAS, Matlab.Ability to present results to team with informative and visualized insights.Basic computer language is a plusDemonstrated ability to work calmly and maintain good judgment in a fast-paced and high-stress environment.

Name: Project Analyst
Description: At Kantar Added Value, we help world-famous brands champion issues and deliver experiences that customers genuinely want to engage with. A creative marketing consultancy based in 9 countries, our strategic insight adds value to different businesses and inspires new thinking to transform brands and shape the world we live in. Join us and you'll be part of 30,000 colleagues and 12 world leading research, data and insight brands at Kantar. At the heart of WPP, our unique consumer insight inspires clients to flourish in an extraordinary world. additional_description: We are looking for someone interested in uncovering marketing insights to help support us in our growing and innovative consumer insights business. This is a key role in helping to manage projects and clients from some of the world's most iconic brands, as well as a great opportunity to build a career with a leading global marketing and consumer insights consultancy.  You will work closely with people at all levels on multiple studies across a variety of categories including Automotive, Telecommunications, Beverages, among others. Your primary responsibility will be helping us get projects from start to finish. candidate_requirements:KEY OUTCOMES Project Management  Able to execute the project process independently, thoughtfully, accurately, thoroughly and on-schedule  Demonstrate high attention to detail - this is a must  Juggle multiple projects at one time and maintain full ownership of their responsibilities  Help set up projects and coordinate/communicate with fieldwork operations and flagging issues and contributing to resolving them.  Understand the value of getting the job done well and delivering AV's best  Accommodate different working styles and needs  Analytical  Draft basic questionnaires  Do data checks such as checking questionnaire programs for logic, accuracy and completeness, edit/proof data tables, review/approve codes  Perform basic analysis  Execute subgroup analyses  Prepare presentation charts and reports in PPT  Begin contributing analytically to client deliverables and ensure that they tell a logical story  Client Service  Handle client and internal requests with a positive attitude  Demonstrate ability to work in a fast-paced deadline-driven environment

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Welcome to Pabst! We may be 174 years old but we will never stop exploring with energy and excitement.We have some of America’s most iconic brands and are on a quest to realize their future potential. We want you to join the team if you are….A DOER WHO DARES TO DREAMYou love freedom, relish challenge, realize potential, have a thirst for knowledge; you are innovative, confident yet humble, open to possibilities, courageous, true to your values, and passionate about making people’s lives better.You have spirit and grit; are restless and determined. You take action…because it represents opportunity, not fear.When you see progress, it gives you hope and inspires you.Right now we need a Financial Analyst. Someone with a natural curiosity to enable and inspire execs and peers. We are a group of courageous pioneers and want to add a like-minded person to assist us in realizing the potential of Pabst. You will develop informative, data-driven conclusions and analysis, with the goal of optimizing performance across the portfolio. Your role is to ensure the quality and integrity of information driving key business drivers to empower the organization. An important component to this position is the development of tools that underscore the importance of timely, accurate and consistent reporting.  You enjoy using Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook email, and are great at financial modeling. More importantly, you will love being part of a finance team ensuring everyone is on the same page and moving forward.  Preferred requirements are Bachelor’s degree.  If this is you please apply now!PBC takes pride in developing and promoting talent as an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. By fostering a diverse business environment, PBC welcomes opportunities to learn from each other, our customers, and business partners.

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: About Navigant Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant’s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant’s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com. Responsibilities This role can be based in any of the following locations: Lewisville, TX; Gardena, CA  The Business Analyst leads the requirements gathering process and works as a liaison in order to understand the business issues and challenges of our customers. Than working with the teams to solution ideas that enable customers to achieve their goals. The Business Analyst works closely with product owners, designers, web developers, engineers, scrum masters and quality assurance teams to understand, analyze, and document requirements and deliver functional specifications for project delivery.  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Support and co-lead the requirements gathering processQuickly understand the business issues and data challenges of our customers quickly organize solutions to resolve those pain pointsTranslate business needs to system solutionsRecommend new features or improvements to features that return value to our customersEnsure business, functional, and technical requirements are captured, organized. Incorporating feedback from customers, end users or key stakeholders, to continually increase value for our customersDynamically facilitate working sessions as well as stakeholder interviews, focus groups and a/b testingIdentify functional gaps and provide solutionsSuport authoring user stories and define acceptance criteriaCreate user scenarios, process flow diagrams, and wireframesCollaborate with multiple team members to ensure a standard level of requirement understandingQualifications Must Have Skills: Developing and writing user stories that directly support the primary objective of the project and are appropriate size for iterative development.Active participation in Agile teams developing software solutions (5+ years experience)Requirement documentation and detail analysisRally, JIRA or any other advanced tool for Agile teamsParticipating in meetings regarding requirement specificationIdentifying business needs, requirements, constraints and business problems of current systems along with the stakeholdersConsistently meeting with business customers to receive business requirementsEffectively communicating to all stakeholders to solidify needs and identifying issues in a timely mannerWriting and maintains defects and user stories and reviewing them with stakeholders Preferred Skills: Previous experience in Business Analyst roles/Scrum Master roles: A minimum of 3 years2+ years working in agile environments. SCM is a big plusIdentify major stakeholders and requirement sourcesHealthcare Revenue Cycle Management experience (great plus)Experience with offshore delivery modelBasic knowledge of SQLBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience Professional Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work with staff through executive level employeesStrong presentation skillsAbility to negotiateMental/Physical RequirementsCommunicate frequently with co-workers as well as with managers to discern their needs, and be able to express themselvesWork as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independentlyConstantly operates a computer and other office equipment to coordinate workUsually remains stationary for the majority of the dayFrequently communicates with clients and coworkers and must be able to share information effectivelyGenerally works in an office environmentEEO/C&B StatementThe company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans.Navigant does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Navigant and Navigant will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.Navigant is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.Navigant will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

Name: Data Analyst - Risk Adjustment
Description: Company Overview Health Data Vision, Inc., is a fast-growing tech company that provides a SaaS-based healthcare workflow and analytics platform (MRCS) for medical records analysis  and targeted solutions for HEDIS® Hybrid, Medicare, and Exchange Risk Adjustment and comprehensive, year-round clinical data analysis efforts as well as RADV Audits. The platform provides flexible scalable workflows and automation for medical records-intensive project needs of health plans in the United States. Job Responsibilities:Act as the primary data analyst for risk adjustment data-related efforts including but not limited to data integration operations for new and existing clients, coding result extracts, ad hoc reporting.Partner with internal risk adjustment subject matter experts (SMEs) to help coordinate data reporting workflows based on the information they help provide in addition to aiding with research to help enhance our current data extract interfaces as well as adding industry-standard output extracts used for CMS submissions.Coordinate and organize the periodic updates of the diagnosis and HCC tables utilized by the companys application suite as well as for ad hoc report needs.Work directly with the Clinical Operations Team to help support the design and deployment of report sets such as those, which would give read-outs on coding quality and additional HCC gains obtained through the coding process.Required Experience/Education:3-5 years of experience in healthcare data analysis/analytics space with a focus on risk adjustment and IVA related data including but not limited to ICD9 and ICD10 codes and CMS-HCC risk adjustment model data.3-5 years of experience using Microsoft SQL Server T-SQL language for the development of SQL tables, queries, stored procedures, views, and user-defined functions. (Candidates will have SQL skills evaluated in the interview process.)1-2 years of experience using SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) for ETL development and SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) for online report development strongly preferred.Proficiency with converting XML documents into relational database structures and creating XML from data queried from the database used with our coding platform.1-2 years of experience a program language such as .Net (VB or C#) or Powershell for program control and file I/O operations.Competency with the Microsoft Office suite of products including but not limited to  Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.Demonstrates good communication skills that will be effective in working with  teammates internally as well as with technical staff for external partners and clients.M.S., M.A., B.S or B.A. degree in computer science, data science, computer information  systems, business administration, or the engineering and sciences preferred. Other  degree programs strongly considered when accompanied by associated industry  experience.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Our client, a marketing agency has an immediate need for a Data Analyst (Manager, Analytics) to deliver data-driven, actionable insights on behalf of our clients. This is a freelance position onsite that starts as soon as next week.  Ideal candidates will be fluent in the various technologies, platforms and best practices that define the online space and are passionate about understanding their impact on consumer behavior. Are you interested in developing solutions based on data-driven findings? Do you obsessively track social and digital trends? In this role, you will be a key contributor to the analytics team, driving innovative measurement strategies, leading business intelligence efforts, execution of analysis and overall market awareness and understanding. RESPONSIBILITIES: Leverages a variety of statistical methods to compile and analyze data from online and offline sources Derives insights from data to create a compelling narrative that moves clients to act on our recommendations Creates visually compelling presentations of reporting and insights that allows a client to easily evaluate performance relative to their business objectives Creates measurement framework to evaluate program performance across paid, earned and owned channels Guides clients and account teams through the process of establishing KPIs and targets based a program’s goals and channel strategy BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 3+ years of experience in Data Science, Marketing Analytics, Digital Marketing, or a business related fields. Experience with relational databases and statistical analysis tools such as SAS and SQL Able to leverage scripting to complete analysis, data cleansing or data integration tasks. Proficient in at least one programming language such as R, Python or Javascript Highly proficient with data visualization tools including: Excel, Google Data Studio, Tableau or Domo Additional Qualifications: Experience leading and producing work for a marketing analytics program – Bonus: experience with analytics for a communications program with earned media as a tactic Expertise with site analytics and social platforms including: Adobe, Google, Facebook, Twitter Experience using media intelligence, marketing intelligence, social listening or other research tools such as: Sysomos, Critical Mention, Quid, Brandwatch, Affinio, Buzzsumo, Comscore or Mintel Experience with A/B/MVT testing and optimization for site and social media content (paid and organic) Highly proficient in working with behavioral data from digital channels including SEO, paid media platforms, site analytics and organic social  Send your resume today! Name: Business Intelligence Developer I
Description: Loot Crate was founded in 2012 around a simple idea: put the awesomeness of Comic-Con in a box. Today, we ship some of the coolest geek, gaming, and pop-culture collectibles and accessories to a subscriber base in the hundreds of thousands of fans around the world. Loot Crate is one of the top subscription box services in the world spanning pop culture, gaming, anime and sports. Weve assembled an amazing team of passionate, ambitious people who cultivate our ever-growing global community of fans and provide support of the highest caliber. Were always on the lookout for fun, hard-working new people to join our team and make Loot Crate even better.  As a Business Intelligence Developer, you will specialize in Data Warehousing, ETL, and the development of Data Marts supporting business insights. You will be a member of the Data Science & Engineering team, which is a center of excellence for Data Science, Data Transport and Cluster Computing at Loot Crate. The role requires close collaboration with teammates and squad members in feature design, sprint planning, task execution, code review and feature deployment. You will uphold best engineering practices and collaborate closely with teammates. To thrive in this position, you need to have a strong understanding of our Data Architecture and the tools we use. You will also need to consistently capture business requirements and translate them into technical specifications. RESPONSIBILITIES:Implement ETL pipelines on our data platformsIntegrate with our vendors to collect and ingest second-party data into our Data LakeImplement Data Marts for downstream consumptionCollaborate with Data Scientists on data wrangling and exploratory analysisCollaborate with Data Engineers to ensure that best practices are applied on our data platformsCollaborate with Data Analysts to ensure the integrity and cleanliness of data sources, and to support the requirements of downstream data consumersCollaborate in a cross-functional squad with Business Stakeholders, Product Managers and Engineers to create data productsSUCCESS FACTORS:Flexibility to work with different platforms and pipelines.Guaranteed data cleanliness and integrityCommitment to lifelong learning. Taking online courses, attending conferences, and experimenting with the latest software and platforms are critical to successSKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors degree in a technical field, or equivalent work experience1+ years holding similar responsibilitiesGood knowledge of relevant data sources, query languages and ETL design patternsGood communication skills and ability to work in a team

Name: Supply Chain Coordinator/Analyst
Description: ** NO 3rd PARTY RECRUITERSYoobi, an awesome company with giving at its core, is looking for a strong Supply Chain Coordinator/Analyst with wholesale and direct to consumer CPG experience to join their hardworking team of results driven, creative, fun and collaborative people. Reporting to the Supply Chain Manager, the Supply Chain Coordinator will work cross functionally to manage the purchasing and movement of inventory throughout the supply chain from purchase order to delivery.RESPONSIBILITIES:Organize and process purchase orders for finished goods.Interface with sourcing team in Asia to manage production schedules.Ensure product safety & quality assurance standards are upheld.Ensure supplier social compliance standards are upheld.Manage transportation logistics for all inbound and outbound goods.Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends pertaining to key operational functions.NetSuite ERP transactional responsibilities.Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to support ongoing or one-time operational needs.Support additional projects as assigned by Supply Chain Manager.WEEKLY TASKS:Receive and Bill Purchase Orders for shipped goods in NetSuite.Manage import violations and chargebacks.Enter and/or approve B2B, Wholesale, and Marketing sales orders in NetSuite ensuring inventory is appropriately allocated prior to submitting to 3PL.Generate freight quotes for B2B, Wholesale, and Marketing non-parcel shipments.Track outbound freight shipments and communicate delivery status to Sales Manager.Manage FarApp integrations between NetSuite, Shopify, and 3PL to ensure timely and accurate flow of data relating to order fulfillment.Review ecommerce transactions in NetSuite to ensure completion.Run weekly report of open purchase orders by item and distribute to BHG & MKL teams.Manage program production tracking grids to ensure timelines are upheld.MONTLY TASKS:Review customer orders submitted via EDI and email, and create relating purchase orders to suppliers in NetSuite.Generate ocean freight rate quotes for, and manage the booking, clearance, and delivery of shipments.THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE4+ years of direct experience in operations and supply chain (retail/CPG experience a plus)Strong analytical and forecasting skills with experience in forecasting and production modeling.Experience with EDI operations and supply chain management.Knowledge of supply chain processes (order management, manufacturing, and logistics a plus)Excellent verbal and written communication skillsProficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Strong Excel Skills a must!)Ability to exercise excellent judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining the best outcome and results.Great attention to detail and managing execution.Proven track record of taking ownership and driving resultsABOUT YOOBIYoobi is based on a bright yet simple idea: colorful, vibrant supplies for school, home or the office that give back. For every Yoobi item purchased, Yoobi donates an item to a classroom in need right here in the U.S. Together with the Kids In Need Foundation, Yoobi has impacted more than 2 million kids nationwide. In June 2015, Yoobi opened its first retail store at the Westfield Santa Anita Mall in Los Angeles, CA. The store features a hyper-localized giveback: for every Yoobi item purchased in the store, one will be donated to a local classroom with the greatest need within a 10-mile radius. In July 2015, Yoobi released the limited-edition Yoobi X Usher collection, curated by Usher and featuring 20 new products and five prints designed by artist Jonni Cheatwood. In July 2016, Yoobi launched a collaboration with Pharrell William’s creative collective, i am OTHER, designed to inspire kids to embrace their uniqueness and what makes them different. Yoobi X I am OTHER features over 50 items available exclusively for Back to School 2016. Yoobi currently offers more than 500 different items, from pens and journals to lunchboxes and headphones, available at Yoobi.com and Target stores nationwide. Yoobi is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Sales Analyst
Description: Sales Analyst, North America, Professional Beauty  COTY, Calabasas, CA PURPOSE Our purpose is to celebrate and liberate the diversity of beauty. We challenge convention through invention, expanding our horizons to enrich your reality with possibility. We build brands to inspire and enable our consumers to experience the confidence and joy of expressing their beauty, their way. MISSION AND RESPONSIBILITIES This position is responsible for monitoring and coordinating statistical information to support sales functions, tracking sales achievements against forecast and prior years, developing analytical reports based on market intelligence and providing information to the sales planning process based on knowledge of market data. This position also prepares reports for and works with sales and marketing during the planning process, monitors sales, and analyzes performance trends to identify issues and opportunities. Essential Functions:Analyzes and compiles reports in compliance with daily, weekly, and monthly sales reporting requirementsProvides support for the sales team to include coordination or analysis of sales planning and administration events and activitiesGenerate standardized reports on sales information to monitor progress towards growth objectives, e.g., sales results, historical growth, market growth trends, sales exceptions and product useDevelop monthly inventory flows plans to include to track sales and inventoryIntegrates information from multiple sources and develops actionable insights and recommendations in support of sales initiativesAnalyzes and monitors trade spend, works closely with Sales team to gain understanding of risk and opportunitiesAnalyzes sales forecasts to plan product procurement and inventory needs, verifying risks of backorders and shortages, with particular attention to top accountsMonitors and reports on various projects to sales leadersCollaborates with cross-functional departments on the development and execution of products and cost savings initiativesAssists in coordinating meetings, meals, and other special eventsMaintains up to date rosters and regular sales mailings for assigned groupsCompletes ad hoc requests and projects as assigned by leadershipQUALIFICATIONSBachelor's Degree3 years minimum experience in similar capacityProficient in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and related software skillsExcellent problem-solving and analytical skillsAbility to adapt in a constantly changing environmentHighly organized, detail-oriented and excellent customer service skillsStrong management skills with ability to manage multiple projects in fast paced & highly demanding environmentPrior experience in the Beauty or Cosmetics industries preferred We are Coty and our people make us who we are. It's important that we find individuals who are a great fit for our business, not just for us but for you too. We want people to thrive here and, if you are the right culture fit with us and we with you, you'll be able to shine and achieve beyond your own expectations. For us, beauty is and beauty does. We are very focused because we all want the same thing: to help our consumers celebrate and liberate the diversity of their beauty and that takes creativity, excellence and radical thinking we are here to disrupt the beauty industry on behalf of consumers and you need to want to join that mission to succeed here.We have an energetic intensity about us. We're quite relentless in our determination to deliver, always accountable for our actions and tenacious. We will not be beaten by obstacles.Responding quickly with agile thinking to business challenges and opportunities is second nature to us. We like it that way as it means we can be creative and find new ways to make things happen fast. Colleagues will expect it of you and you'll expect it of them we're a team and we help each other. We're all in it together irrespective of level or part of the business.We always go the extra mile, pushing the boundaries to be that best partner we can be to our customers and to excite and delight our consumers.When you join Coty, you become part of a vibrantly diverse and energetic group who have fun in an intense sort of way. Because we're not just here for the ride, we want to change things.ABOUT US Coty's purpose is to celebrate and liberate the diversity of our consumers' beauty. Aligned to this is our mission to strive over time to become the global industry leader by being the clear challenger in beauty, delighting consumers and creating long term shareholder value.  We are one of the world's largest beauty companies with approximately $9 billion in revenue, and our strong entrepreneurial heritage has created an iconic portfolio of leading beauty brands.  As the global leader in fragrance, a strong number two in professional salon hair color & styling, and number three in color cosmetics, we operate across three divisions: Coty Consumer Beauty: focused on color cosmetics, retail hair coloring and styling products, body care and mass fragrances sold primarily in the mass retail channels with brands such as COVERGIRL, Max Factor and RimmelCoty Luxury: focused on prestige fragrances and skincare with brands such as Calvin Klein, Marc Jacobs, Hugo Boss, Gucci and philosophyCoty Professional Beauty: focused on servicing salon owners and professionals in both hair and nail with brands such as Wella Professionals, Sebastian Professional, OPI and ghd Coty is a truly global player with over 20,000 employees, operations in more than 40 countries in Asia, Latin America, Australia, Middle East and Africa, as well as Europe and North America and products sold in over 130 countries and territories. Our headquarters are in London, New York, Geneva and Paris.  Want to know more?  For additional information about Coty Inc., please visit www.coty.com.  At Coty, we embrace Diversity. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability.  Equal Employment Opportunities  We offer equal employment opportunity to qualified individuals without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We strongly believe that cultivating a diverse workplace gives a company strength. The combination of unique skills, abilities,experiences and backgrounds creates an environment that produces extraordinary results.  EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled. Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Clutter is an on-demand, physical storage and moving, technology company based in Los Angeles that is disrupting the $50B/year self-storage and moving industries. We've built an end-to-end logistics and supply chain platform, enabling us to offer consumers a much more convenient solution at price parity with the incumbents. We've raised $100M from a number of VCs, including Sequoia Capital, Atomico and GV, formerly Google Ventures. We have 750+ team members and tens of thousands of customers in 7 major markets across the US with plans to be in 50+ markets, domestically and internationally, within the next 5 years!  At Clutter, we're fortunate to be providing a consumer value proposition that people love and one that makes economic sense - a true product/market fit that few startups ever find. To deliver on our promise to consumers, team members and investors, we're focused on hiring, training and retaining exceptional individuals. This means that we have a very thorough interview process and maintain high performance expectations, but we'll always be transparent with you and respectful of your time. The Opportunity: As a Senior Data Analyst you will play a critical role in analyzing data to identify key opportunities and drive strategic business initiatives. We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who is resourceful, passionate about improving data quality, and can communicate complex ideas with ease. You'll work closely with our Head of Product to help define the way that our data is collected, calibrated, and what questions should be asked in order to drive actionable insights. As a Senior Data Analyst - you will:Analyze business data to identify trends, draw conclusions, and develop recommendations and help drive data-driven decision-makingCollaborate with cross-functional teams to deeply understand business objectives and create meaningful narratives that drive efficiency and growthDevelop mechanisms to discover, monitor, and improve data quality and reportingWhat we're looking for:B.S. in economics, applied math, statistics or other quantitative field; M.S. preferredStrong experience analyzing data in SQL; proficiency in R or Python a plusExperience developing data-driven hypotheses and effectively communicating actionable insights to decision-makersPossesses extreme attention to detail but understands the big picture without getting stuck in paralysis by analysis

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionTitle: Data AnalystLocation: Los AngelesTeam: ModelingReports to: Vice President of Modeling☒ Full-time or ☐ Part-time☒ Exempt or ☐ Non-exempt Praedicat is a funded FinTech startup in Los Angeles that is delivering innovative new “foresight modeling” to commercial clients built on cutting-edge big data analytics and technologies. Our cloud-based SaaS products, CoMeta™ and Oortfolio™, are pushing the limits of scalable risk modeling and big data. Our team is blazing new trails in forward-looking, science-based risk analytics using advanced machine learning algorithms and related technologies.  We are looking for a strong candidate to join our growing team in Los Angeles as a Data Analyst. We need a creative thinker with expertise in data manipulation and analysis who can own data pipelines bringing data in-house from external sources through to its use in models. You will be expected to develop an understanding of Praedicat’s clients and proprietary analytics and think creatively about how Praedicat can solve their problems through data-driven solutions delivered through software and analytics. Team members in this position will have an opportunity to grow into a variety of different roles.  · Making a difference: Our products deliver data from peer-reviewed science into the workflow of business so that our clients can use it to make better decisions – cleaner technologies, safer products, a healthier environment.  · Multidisciplinary collaboration: We work in teams with smart people from multiple disciplines to develop creative solutions.  · Hard problems and cutting-edge technologies: Our data science, modeling and software engineering challenges are hard and innovative solutions are necessary. ResponsibilitiesPerform various tasks of data ingestion, data transformation, and data visualizationsConduct data analysis, data integration, data management and feature engineeringUnderstand and programmatically implement mathematical, statistical data, and computational solutionsCreate internal documentation for data sets and completed analysesRequirements · Bachelor of Science or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (bioinformatics, bioengineering, chemistry, engineering, mathematics, physics, economics, etc.) plus 2 years of experience or equivalent  · Ability to solve problems thoroughly, quickly, and creatively with an eye for detail  · Hands on experience in many aspects of data management activities involving large data sets (e.g. data gathering and profiling, data analysis, pipeline creation, data validation)  · Strong background in exploratory data analysis and visualization  · Experience using data analysis packages and ability to independently produce in-depth analyses of large data sets  · Proven track record of leveraging large amounts of data to solve real-world problems  · Strong written and verbal communication skills to support interactions with subject matter experts and create documentation as needed Preferred SkillsSubject matter knowledge in chemistry and/or medicine-related areasFacility with SQL, data manipulation, and data analysis for business intelligenceExperience with and mastery of high-level programming languages for data analysis, such as Python, C#, or MATLABExperience with modeling approaches such as regression analysis, principal component analysis, clustering, etc. To apply, send your cover letter and resume as one .pdf via ZipRecruiter. Incentive Compensation and Benefits Praedicat believes in a work-life balance that is supported by a competitive compensation and benefits package. All full-time regular employees are eligible for benefits such as: Participation in Praedicat’s Stock Incentive Plan offering equity-based incentives for employees, including annual equity bonuses tied to individual and company performanceThe ability to contribute to a Praedicat-sponsored 401(k) planMedical insurance coverage, with both HMO and PPO options, as well as dental and vision coverageGenerous allotment of PTO (paid time off) and official holidays each yearAbout Praedicat® Praedicat, Inc. is dedicated to improving the underwriting and management of liability catastrophe risk. Our multidisciplinary team leverages cutting-edge analytics to solve problems for clients. Our patent-pending technology delivers information extracted from scientific literatures on emerging risk. We analyze the risk with a structured approach incorporating applied legal reasoning and economics. Our analysis is focused to directly inform core business functions of liability insurers and reinsurers. Praedicat is developing a comprehensive system of software products, Litagion® Risk Management, designed to bring 21st Century science-based risk analytics to liability insurance. Praedicat was created by the RAND Corporation and Risk Management Solutions, Inc. after the two companies collaborated on research and development to improve the identification and prioritization of emerging risks using modeling and cutting-edge computer science. Praedicat is an independent corporation launched in March 2012.  Praedicat is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment with Praedicat is determined on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.Company DescriptionPraedicat, Inc. is dedicated to improving the underwriting and management of liability catastrophe risk. Our multidisciplinary team leverages cutting-edge analytics to solve problems for clients. Our patent-pending technology delivers information extracted from scientific literatures on emerging risk. We analyze the risk with a structured approach incorporating applied legal reasoning and economics. Our analysis is focused to directly inform core business functions of liability insurers and reinsurers. Praedicat is developing a comprehensive system of software products, Litagion® Risk Management, designed to bring 21st Century science-based risk analytics to liability insurance. Praedicat was created by the RAND Corporation and Risk Management Solutions, Inc. after the two companies collaborated on research and development to improve the identification and prioritization of emerging risks using modeling and cutting-edge computer science. Praedicat is an independent corporation launched in March 2012.  Praedicat is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment with Praedicat is determined on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

Name: Business Insurance- Actuarial Analyst Internship
Description: We are looking for a diverse group of curious, passionate, and hard-working students to join our summer internship program for 2019!We are Farmers!Farmers Insurance is proudly certified as a Great Place to Work and listed in Forbes’ Best Employers for New Grads in 2018. At Farmers Insurance, our employees set the tone, drive our strategy, dream of the future, and create world class customer experiences. Our employees help make Farmers one of the largest insurers of vehicles, homes and small businesses in the United States.What you’ll get to do as an internThis is an opportunity to work alongside accomplished Insurance professionals and gain valuable skills for your future. You will learn how we use innovation and technology to drive our business forward. Through project work, job shadowing, hands on work experience, and exposure to Farmers leadership teams you will expand your knowledge and experience.What we’re looking for10 to 12 week summer internship, 40-hour work weekRising seniors working toward Bachelors (BS/BA) degree or entering final year of Master’s program (MS/MA)Excellent verbal and written communication skillsSelf-motivated individuals with attention to detail and effective time-management skillsEligible to work in the United StatesInternship SummaryThe program will be highly collaborative and immersive, with interns working on real Business Insurance Group (BIG) business problems that can span multiple business units within the complex commercial insurance landscape: Product, Actuarial, R&D, Underwriting, Finance, Operations, Distribution, IT.Here at Farmers, we are embracing this change by taking a customer-centric approach, backed by data-driven insight. One example of how BIG has adapted to the ever-changing insurance market is an innovative partnership with Uber to insure all rides in Pennsylvania and Georgia.So whether your passion lies in big data analytics (data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, predictive modeling), formulating pricing and marketing plans to hit profit and loss targets, or strategic product development to differentiate Farmers in the marketplace and provide a better customer experience, it’s an exciting time to be in BIG!Actuarial analysts should have proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and exposure to at least one programming language (e.g., VBA, SQL, Python, R, Tableau)Excellent verbal and written communicationAbility to manipulate and analyze data to address and solve business problemsWillingness to independently learn and make an impact within a team environmentAmenitiesState-of-the-art facility with cafeteria, fitness center/shower, walking trails nearby, etc.Walking distance to the Village in Woodland Hills, an open air shopping/dining centerFarmers is an equal opportunity employer, committed to the strength of a diverse workforce.Schedule: Full-time Job Posting: 11/01/2018

Name: Salesforce Techno-Functional Consultant
Description: Salesforce Techno-Functional ConsultantOnly seeking FTE candidates. Boingo, one of the Best Places to Work in Los Angeles, is looking for a Salesforce Techno-Functional Consultant to customize Salesforce for Boingo, the nation's leading provider of Wireless Networks. Customize and enhance Salesforce so that our Sales, Marketing, Business Development & Customer Care teams get all of the benefits that you know Salesforce can offer, when well-implemented. You'll be the Boingo Salesforce Expert! Great visibility throughout the company. Work with an amazing manager, and some smart, hard-working engineers! ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop and configure the Salesforce.com platform with best practices in mind to fulfill business needs.Develop and maintain Lightning Components, Visualforce, Force.com pages and integration to other third party solutions.Develop integration processes using Salesforce.com's Web Services API and third-party integration tools.Develop and apply advanced Salesforce functionality to solve business problems and create customized solutions on the Force.com platform.Create technical requirements and specifications as needed to support full project lifecycle.Provide support and help troubleshoot system issues.Collaborate with business and project stakeholders to successfully articulate needs, identify project objectives, drive implementation, and communicate challenges and measurements of success.RequirementsBachelors of Science in Computer Science or Degree in Technology related fields.Develop and maintain third-party app integrations such as Pardot, MarketingCloud, Skuid, Salesforce Inbox, Social Studio, or LiveMessage.Perform administrative work with best practices in mind.5+ years of experience with one or more of the following skill sets:Salesforce.com developer toolkit including Apex ClassesControllers and TriggersVisualforceForce.com migration toolWeb ServicesExperience in building Lightning ComponentsExperience in APEX and Javascript developmentMeet Boingo Boingo Wireless, Inc. (NASDAQ: WIFI) helps the world stay connected. Our vast footprint of Wi-Fi and cellular networks reaches more than a billion consumers annually. From airports and stadiums to universities and military bases, Boingo helps folks stay connected to the people and things they love.  Our team is creative, collaborative, and on the cutting edge of technology. (You can check out some of the awards we've won here. #humblebrag). But there's no doubt the "secret sauce" to Boingo's success is our incredible team and culture. We take pride in having fun and staying healthy think summer picnics, bowling nights, in-house yoga classes, costume contests, massages and food trucks. There's also a kitchen stocked with yummy snacks and drinks, and an incredible benefits package including equity, health, dental, vision, 401(k) match, unlimited vacation, 12 weeks paid parental leave, and more! Plus our award-winning headquarters in Westwood boasts 360-degree views of LA, from Catalina to the Hollywood Sign. It's no wonder we've been named among the Best Places to Work in LA four years in a row!  Boingo is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Name: Sr Business Info Analyst
Description: If youre passionate about becoming a Nationwide associate and believe you have the potential to be something great, lets talk.  Number 54 on the Fortune Magazine 100 Best Places to Work.  This Sr Business Info Analyst will be part of the Sales Support Team working in the Western Regional Operations in Sacramento, CA. This position can also be filled at the Business Information Analyst level depending on the skills and qualifications of the selected candidate.  JOB SUMMARY: Partners with internal customers in determining data and information needs, and in determining the use of information to aid them in business decisions. Analyzes information needs, creates and maintains ad hoc and ongoing reports, and maintains internal databases for related functional information. Performs statistical and other data analysis, and interprets analysis results. Job Description Reports To: Manager Key Responsibilities:Partners with internal customers in determining data and information needs that will aid them in business decisions. Develops, produces and maintains ad hoc and custom reports for functional area information needs and analysis. Analyzes information contained in reports as requested or needed. Uses various data access tools to pull information for reports and analysis.Plans and supports information project needs, special reporting and new technology. Maintains the integrity of information in internal databases.Retrieves data from internal and external sources and data files in order to keep internal databases current and usable. Exports information to external sources.Determines appropriate information to be shared with customers. Shares reports and information with appropriate area of the company as assigned.Supports the research, analysis and presentation of information by: producing reports, compiling and summarizing information, producing supporting documentation and exhibits, and verifying information received from external sources.May maintain personal computer hardware and software.Assists other associates with preparation of reports and use of information systems, software and related sources of information. Trains other users on report preparation and data base access.Participates in special projects and teams .Presents actionable recommendations, presentations, reports, and documents to help with the use of the information.Performs other duties as assigned.MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS: Education: Undergraduate studies in business, insurance, mathematics or related field. Prefer degree or professional insurance coursework.  Experience: Four years experience in a business information analysis or similar business related position that involves analysis, problem solving, planning, coordinating and organizing.  Knowledge: Knowledge of business and/or insurance policies and procedures, customer service concepts and practices. Familiarity with product terminology, processes, regulatory and compliance issues is desired.  Skills: Verbal and written communication skills for interaction within the functional area, information documentation and report formulation. Ability to understand business information needs and to analyze data requests. Ability to work under tight time constraints. Ability to effectively operate a personal computer with business software applications for data retrieval, manipulation, reporting and analysis.  Staffing Exceptions to the above Minimum Job Requirements must be approved by the: Business Unit Director/Officer and the HR Representative. JOB CONDITIONS: Overtime Eligibility: Not Eligible (exempt)  Working Conditions: Normal office environment. Extended periods of personal computer usage and report/information verification. Occasional extended and non-standard hours based on business information needs.  ADA: The above statements cover what are generally believed to the principal and essential function of this job. Specific circumstances may allow or require some associated assigned to the job to perform a somewhat different combination of duties  Job Evaluation Activity: Evaluated 05/07/2004 SMP  Additional Job Description  Compensation Grade: E2  Job ID: 53505  #nationwide

Name: Temp IT Analyst
Description: Paul Hastings is a leading international law firm providing innovative legal solutions to many of the world's top financial institutions and Fortune Global 500 companies. With offices across the U.S. and world, we have the global reach and extensive capabilities to provide personalized service wherever our clients' needs take us.  We have an immediate opening in our Los Angeles office for a Temp IT Analyst.  The Temp IT Analyst leverages technology to provide business solutions and support to drive organizational effectiveness and continuous system improvement. Qualifications: Advanced to expert proficiency in Microsoft Operating Systems;Advanced to expert proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite;Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Operating System application installation and configuration processes;Advanced proficiency with data security and security applications;Advanced proficiency with project management;Advanced proficiency in remote access architectures, applications and technologies (Citrix, VPN);Advanced proficiency with Smartphone and personal wireless technologies (iOS, iPhone, iPad, BlackBerry);Advanced proficiency in networking technologies, cabling topologies and related applications;Advanced proficiency in installation and configuration of modems, routers, data communication devices, networking devices and cabling;Advanced proficiency in practice support/litigation support applications (Ringtail, LiveNote, Concordance, CaseMap);Advanced proficiency in Inter/Intra/Extranet technologies;Advanced proficiency in Document Management Systems (WorkSite/FileSite);Fundamental to Advanced knowledge of customer service principles and practices.Associate’s degree (preferred); Bachelor’s degree (preferred);At least 4 years of experience providing direct support to customers in the areas of business solutions, software, hardware and networking technologies;At least 4 years of experience in LAN, WAN and network systems support and management;At least 4 years of experience configuring, installing and maintaining client PC operating systems and related devices; andAt least 2 years of professional services or law firm experience (preferred). Paul Hastings LLP is an equal employment and affirmative action employer F/M/Disability/Vet. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.
