Name: Financial Analyst
Description: At First Entertainment Credit Union, we believe that every story matters - that includes our members, employees, community, and those interested in joining our growing team. The Credit Union has served its members since 1967 and has grown to manage over $1.5 Billion in assets. Today, First Entertainment is the financial partner for the creators of entertainment and those who support them.  We are looking for talented individuals who are passionate about member service and teamwork, have a deep sense of respect and integrity for their co-workers and our members and are also driven to pursue excellence in all that they do. As a Financial Analyst, this position will provide broad based financial and analytical support to the Finance team. Responsibilities: Responsible for daily and monthly tasks such as updating files, maintaining management reports, and submitting data files to vendor.Interpret qualitative and quantitative data into business impacts and recommendations.Focus on the details of a project deliverable, while still keeping the organization's strategic priorities top-of-mind.Work with large files of qualitative and quantitative data; combine, maneuver, and manipulate large data sets.Work on several projects simultaneously within the Finance and Accounting departments.Work collaboratively with other departments to achieve common goals.Create charts, graphs, and other dashboarding tools that highlight and share portfolio insights (i.e. trends, KPI metrics, margins, etc.). Name: Expense Management Analyst
Description: KORE1, a nationwide provider of staffing and recruiting solutions, has an immediate opening for an Expense Management in Southeast Los Angeles.  Summary:  This position supports the accounts payable operations for the organization and subsidiaries, including 13 community practices. This includes procure to pay business process improvements, performing month and year end close and ERP reconciliation, creating insightful AP metrics reporting, ensuring compliance and control through driving policy compliance and working with internal audit, as well as developing and providing necessary training to end users. Including strategically managing internal expense transactions for the enterprise.  This position will design and monitor department metrics and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) with our key customers across the enterprise. The key services this position will provide includes handling enterprise departments accounts payable inquiries and research accounts payable issues, assisting with system upgrades, replacements, and troubleshooting, as well as recommending key policies and procedures for daily activities, demonstrating a solid understanding of GAAP, SOX and regulatory guidelines. Assist with preparation for audits and special projects as assigned such as enterprise training or system implementations.  This Expense Management analyst will play a crucial key user role in large Procure to Pay optimization projects. This role will provide insights on current process flow, provide recommendations on future state. This position will participate through all stages of project implementation including design, testing, go live and post go live training.  The Expense Management analyst must demonstrate key AP knowledge and understanding of relevant business processes at various levels across the organization. This position also requires excellent communication skills, presentation and facilitation skills, as well as superior customer service. Must also be able to present the analytical findings and metrics to identify inefficiencies and propose recommendations. Lastly, this position must demonstrate independent thinking and requires minimal supervision.  Essential Functions: Develop and publish AP analysis to identify issues with internal transactions related to Procurement card expenditures and Travel and Expense. Reviews and approves Travel and Expense reports for accuracy and compliance to policies. Publish monthly metrics for T&E (SLAs) for the enterprise. Conducts regular audit of procurement card transactions throughout the enterprise to ensure compliance with policies. Reviews and analyzes card user data and prepares usage reports to review trends, year over year changes and unusual transactions. Ensures internal controls related to Procurement card transactions and Travel Expense related expenses are executed. Co-lead with AP manager on presentations/inputs to identify opportunities to optimize business and IT processes. Provides training to new and existing users on business expense module to ensure business expense reimbursements are processed accurately and most efficient means. Prepare month end accruals for Procurement card to ensure we close on time to meet the financial close timeline. Maintain and assist in revisions to business expense policy and procedures by working with AP manager. Research and analyze processes, collaborate with General Accounting and PeopleSoft FIN system business analyst team. Thus recommending process improvements as well as internal controls. Play a vital role with AP manager in assisting interim and year end external audit related to Procurement card and Travel and Expense transactions. Act as the key user for Procure to Pay improvement initiatives, aiming to deliver efficiencies within in operations. Act as the AP lead in working with ERP Fin System Business Analyst in providing service desk support related to Travel and Expense. Assists in additional AP projects as assigned. Requires minimal supervisor to manage daily activities and is able to meet deadlines. Skills Required:Bachelor's degree (minimum of 6 years of current experience with AP department can substitute for minimum education requirements2-5 years in Accounts Payable or Accounting operation experienceProficient in Microsoft Office applicationsDemonstrated experience with account reconciliation’s and general knowledge of accounting principlesHistory of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously with the ability to adapt to the changing needs of the business while meeting deadlinesExcellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with all internal and external stakeholdersTrack record of working independently with little directionStrong attention to detail and organizational skills with the ability to creatively problem solveBasis system navigation skills, People SoftDetail-oriented and ability to maintain high levels of accuracy for high volume of transactionsAbility to adjust priorities to meet deliverables and deadlinesStrong verbal and written communication skills and presentation skillsStrong customer service skillsAnalytical skills / problem solving skillsAbility to handle confidential and proprietary informationABOUT KORE1 Specializing in creative and technical recruiting, KORE1 is committed to supporting top IT and Creative professionals in their career paths. We build deep relationships with leading companies, connecting them to exceptional talent every day. With extensive industry expertise and unmatched opportunities, our goal is to provide a unique experience for our contractors and consultants as they prepare for their next role. We are passionate about matching the right people with the right companies. Kore1 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Kore1 complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Name: Senior Financial Analyst (Strategy)
Description: A global Top Industry firm is currently seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to join their dynamic team! We are looking for great candidates with solid experience with at least 5 years of Analysis experience in Valuation, Strategy, Pricing, Revenue, and M&A.  Responsibilities include the following: Summarizing large volumes of data in executive summary schedules and dashboard reports.Producing reports on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis.Preparing professional presentations for a wide array of audiences.Completing ad-hoc analysis, reports, and special projects related to client statistics and firm financial metrics.Collaborating with leadership team to create analysis and reports.Proactive recommendations to streamline organization processes. Utilizing new technologies to automate tasks and reporting.Presenting a professional image within the Finance and Accounting department and projecting the same image to those outside the department. A Bachelor’s degree in Business is required. The successful Analyst candidate should have five (5) or more years related analytical experience and experience at a management consulting firm, Big 4, or corporate strategy role. The ideal candidate should have experience regularly presenting to senior management as well as exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate colleagues and collaborate effectively across different teams. Occasional travel is required. Advanced Proficiency with Microsoft Excel is necessary, and PowerPoint, and Word, and knowledge of Microsoft Access is a plus.

Name: Lead Business Analyst, Vice President
Description: Discover your opportunity with Union  BankÂ® and become a part of one of the world's leading financial groups. Union  Bank is a member of Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest  financial group in the world with total assets of over $2.4 trillion (as ranked  by SNL Financial, April 2016) and 140,000 colleagues in nearly 50 countries. In  the U.S., we're 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every  customer, organization, and community we serve. Designs details of automatic systems; provides consultation to  users in the area of automated systems. Projects assigned impact enterprise wide systems.  This Position Reports to: Systems ManagerMajor Responsibilities:Develops and administers the project plan.Defines roles for team members.Serves as the principal coordinator on the project team  for ensuring the project's success.Resolves conflicts, priorities etc.Accountable for project status to management.Manages and coordinates the implementation of the  rollout.Acts as the senior level project manager for larger projects  Demonstrates expertise in strategic planning, tactical execution, project  management, process management and business systems requirements  definition.Consults with users and vendors for need assessment.Writes detailed analysis of users' needs.Presents research and recommendation to management.Identifies solutions to unusual and complex problems  requiring ingenuity, or innovative thinking.Monitors implementation and user satisfaction.Performs highly complex systems process analysis, design  and simulation.Understands technical problems and solutions in relation  to the current, as well as the future business environment.Suggests plans to integrate new and existing processes.Conducts studies of new technology and recommends  changes based on these findings.Leads, conducts and facilitates meetings.Leads in the development and implementation of strategic  technology plans.Produces project plans.Directs solutions to system/business problems.Manages and resolves complex projects.Expert/lead role. Demonstrates strong leadership and  consulting skills with advanced communications skills level for composing  and writing original business documentation and presentations for  management.Possesses knowledge and experience leveraging both IT  solutions and business process improvements. In-depth knowledge of all  processes/systems currently used within a specific business unit.Lead responsibilities include directing, monitoring and  assigning work to those on the team.Provides technical work guidance or mentoring. May  provide input to the managers/supervisor on staff performance.Coaches and mentors more junior staff.Typically requires 10+ years of in-depth business  knowledge and system design.In-depth knowledgeable of all processes /systems  currently used. Education Bachelor's or  Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or other directly  related field  The above statements are intended to describe the  general nature and level of the work being performed. They are not intended to  be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills  required of personnel so classified.  We are proud to be an Equal  Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the  diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experience of our workforce to create  opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in  employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.  A conviction is not an  absolute bar to employment. Factors such as the age of the offense, evidence of  rehabilitation, seriousness of violation, and job relatedness are considered in  all employment decisions. Additionally, it's the bank's policy to only inquire  into a candidate's criminal history after an offer has been made. Federal law  prohibits banks from employing individuals who have been convicted of, or  received a pretrial diversion for, certain offenses

Name: Senior Transportation Analyst and Planner
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Responsibilities:Reporting to the Domestic Transportation Manager for a world leader in growing, sourcing, distributing, and marketing fruit and healthy snacks - from packaged shelf stable fruit and frozen fruit, to dried fruit and fruit juices. The key focus is the domestic outbound to customer flows of 20,000 TL shipments/year and 10,000 LTL shipments/year.  Responsible for supporting the negotiating then managing LTL agreements, process, and demand. Duties include (a) assisting with negotiations of TL, LTL, and intermodal pricing agreements, (b) analysis of supply chain costs including assessorial charges by carrier, type, and by customer, (c) reviewing options with group management, (d) maintaining tariffs and routing guides, (e) carrier selection, (f) estimating shipping costs, and (g) freight payment. The challenge is to optimize the network ensuring customer service while minimizing supply-chain costs. Background Required:Supply-chain transportation and physical distribution (4 years)Supporting the negotiating and managing of LTL agreements (2 years)In depth understanding of tariffs and routing guides -TL, LTL, Intermodal (2 years)Financial analysis and cost estimationKnowledge of LTL pricing agreementsFreight paymentAbility to integrate IT transportation systems with the corporate ERPRFP process for TL, LTL, and intermodalTransportation demand planningCarrier selectionDelivery trackingAssessorial analysis and controlUse of vendor web portals and Business Intelligence toolsRecord of continuous improvement and application of state-of-the-art transportation technologyTravel: Occasional domesticEducation: Bachelors degreeResidence: Southern California (relocation assistance provided)Background Preferred (but not required):Food or CPG industry including reeferUsing and maintaining Czarlite (SMC) tariffs and base ratesUse of key performance indicators such as OTIF, carrier and customer score-cardsThird-Party freight paymentSAP experienceNetwork routing, including 3PLCustomer pick-up allowancesTechnical development such as APICS, CSCMPTransportation regulations (CFR49, DOT, Hazmat, FMCSA, ELD)Advanced Degree MBAOther Essential Abilities and Skills:Strong computer literacy: Microsoft (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)Excellent written and verbal communicationResults driven - team player (operates through consensus) If you are interested in this opportunity but youre not ready to apply, please email the Practice Leader provided below with your questions. Contact: Practice Leader: Robert Munro  Supply Chain (Food) Management  rmunro@GlobalESG.com 664.9400, ext.124 Click here to apply online

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.  Snapchat is the camera used by millions of people every day to Snap with family, watch Stories from friends, see events from around the world, and explore expertly curated content from top publishers. In short, we are a passionate team working hard to build the best platform in the world for communication and storytelling.  We’re looking for a Financial Analyst to join Team Snapchat! Working closely with the Corporate Finance team, you will help execute projects that impact multiple areas of the business. Working from our Los Angeles, CA headquarters, you’ll collaborate with various teams across the company to help accomplish our strategic goals. We find creative solutions to complex problems in an environment where our actions are guided by our key values of kind, smart, and creative. What you’ll do:Work cross-functionally with different teams at Snapchat on various business projects and strategic initiativesCollaborate with finance and business teams to provide analytical rigor and evaluate strategic initiatives and key decision processesBe responsible for scenario models and in-depth analyses, and be a key contributor to decision-making in investment and operational strategiesDevelop and monitor critical success metrics, and communicate actionable insights to relevant stakeholdersBuild mechanisms to monitor and evaluate strategic capital deploymentMinimum qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in economics, finance, or related fieldPreferred qualifications:Demonstrated experience working in a professional environment (e.g., internship)Proven ability to excel in a fast-paced environment with minimal guidanceExceptional analytical skills with the ability to communicate results clearly and effectivelyExpert skills with Microsoft Excel/Powerpoint and Google Docs/SheetsFlexibility to work in an agile environment with changing prioritiesAbility to dive-deep and take complete ownership of complex projects and handle competing priorities while doing soAbility to parse complex financial analysis into meaningful communications for business leadersA passion for Snapchat and creativity!At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don’t be shy and contact us ataccommodations-ext@snap.com.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: About Us: PlayQ is a rapidly growing mobile gaming studio based in the heart of sunny Santa Monica. Our titles have been downloaded over 60 million times worldwide, with millions of users playing our games every day!  Our goal is to deliver tomorrow's nostalgic game experiences to a global audience and we rely on our dedicated team to craft these unforgettable games that our users love. We believe that the best games come from diverse teams with a shared desire to create something amazing. From our beachfront headquarters to our innovative tech stack, it's no surprise that PlayQ was named as one of the 2018 Best Places to Work in Los Angeles by the Los Angeles Business Journal.  We're looking for people who have a genuine love for their craft and we invite you to join us in this exciting endeavor. Job Overview: PlayQ is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to spearhead analyses and provide meaningful insights into player behavior and engagement. The Data Analyst will leverage billions of data points from our games to build dashboards, answer key business questions, and tell compelling stories. This person will conduct in-depth analyses of our data, report on key game metrics, and provide recommendations that will have a direct impact in shaping future game development and company initiatives. The ideal candidate is intelligent,sharp, detail-oriented, and highly quantitative individual who loves working with and analyzing data. Responsibilities:Create thoughtful and compelling dashboards to monitor KPIs and performance for our current and future game titlesPerform in-depth analyses to provide answers to specific business questions and acquire a deep understanding of user behaviorReport and present findings and actionable recommendations to respective teams and key stakeholdersMonitor, identify and investigate changes in KPIs and provide insights into the underlying cause of such changesConduct a variety of ad hoc data analyses and fulfill data requests for new product/version releases, design documentation, marketing material, and user acquisition campaignsDesign and document tracking specifications for core KPIs, feature additions, experimentation, and user acquisition campaignsCheck and debug any data-related issues to ensure accurate tracking and data integrityAssist with the development of new tools and processes for data analysis across the companyRequirements:BA/BS degree in Math, Statistics, or other quantitative field2-3 years of post-graduate experience as a data analyst or similar analytical role, preferably for a technology or gaming companyExpertise with ExcelExperienced with Tableau, Spotfire, STATA, SAS, or similar analytics softwareExperienced with SQL and querying large, complex data setsExcellent communication, presentation, and visual reporting skillsStrong analytical skills with the ability to apply business strategy to data analysis and recommendationsLoves problem-solving, has an innate ability to investigate issues and find the optimal solutionsDesire to work independently on analyses and projects from inception to completionBonus Points:Working knowledge of basic statisticsWorking knowledge of R, Python, or similarPerks:Competitive compensation and equity optionsComprehensive medical, dental, vision insuranceFlexible time off401K plan with company matchStocked kitchen with free snacks and beverages of your choiceCatered weekly team lunchesBrand new penthouse office space equipped with outdoor patios offering beachfront viewsMonthly team outings and volunteer opportunitiesHelp build and support awesome GAMES. For a living! Who doesn't love games? Interested? Please get in touch!

Name: Business Analyst - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Business Analyst, Studio Systems GroupWe are looking for a Business Analyst in the Studio Systems Group to serve as a primary interface to the business users. With the guidance from a business relationship manager, the Business Analyst will assist the development teams and vendors in understanding the business processes, workflows, and information requirements of the users.  In this role, the Business Analyst will be expected to successfully carry out multiple responsibilities including requirements gathering, process analysis, technology solution development, system configuration and project management. Responsibilities: Project Execution  Requirements, Documentation, and Design (functional, technical, interface, use cases)  Collect, review, analyze, manage, system and user requirements from business  Develop functional requirements & testing scenarios that can be used to develop internal design specifications for systems or services  Determine interface requirements  Document detailed functional & data business requirements, process flows, use cases, project plans & information needs  Analyze/understand business challenges  Map current business processes to the new system or service  Testing  Create test scenarios that match the functional specifications developed  Perform QA testing, coordinate UAT testing  Analyze test results and document defects to resolve with technical team  Project Delivery (Go-Live)  Develop cutover plan to implement in environment  Ensures business requirements meet those defined by the business  Hyper-care for business unit  Training (Users, Team Members, etc.)  Ensure training needs are met for new or existing applications Qualifications Skills/Knowledge  Technical SDLC/ITIL # Understanding and execution of SDLC and ITIL processes.  # Experience gathering requirements for business application development efforts, enhancements or projects  Primary and Related Technology (Software/Hardware)  # Create process business flow diagrams (Visio)  # Knowledge of basic accounting and GL principles  # Understanding of File Transfer Interfaces and APIs  Financial  GL Knowledge  # Basic understanding of chart of accounts classifications and usage  # Basic understanding of standard billing flow  # Basic understanding of profit/loss  Process  Management  # Project management skills involving small to mid-size projects.  Issue Resolution  # Issue tracking skills, documenting and communicating issues/defects to the appropriate level of detail for business users and technical teams.  Documentation  # Strong documentation experience in creating detailed use case documents, functional documents, reporting and interface specifications.  Additional  Four or more years of relevant working experience  Bachelors degree in a related field  Ability to adapt to and work in an Agile Methodology environment; experience working in an agile environment is a preferred  Is curious and takes on the challenge of unfamiliar tasks  Collaborative, positive attitude and open to giving and receiving feedback  Optimizes work processes  Core Competencies  Trusted Partner  Consistently demonstrates ethics and integrity  Shows respect to all colleagues regardless of position  Fulfills commitments  Values diversity in thought and background  Builds trust and productive relationships across SPE  Effective Communicator  Articulates views in a concise and clear manner  Comfortable adjusting style according to audience  Solid written and presentation skills  Leverages data and insights to influence others  Strategic Thinker  Recognizes the factors critical to the organizations long-term success  Understands how his/her work impacts the bottom line  Sees the big picture, able to connect the dots  Applies analytics to business data to describe, predict, and improve business performance  Problem-solver  Asks the right questions to analyze situations, able to carefully define the problem, does not rush to conclusions  Simplifies and makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information  Uncovers root causes to difficult problems  Change Agent  Flexible and open to change  Learns quickly when facing new situations Sony Pictures Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics. Sony Pictures - CA - Culver City Area & Studios

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Tradesy may look like a fashion company, but under the surface we're a micro-economy that runs on data. From product, to marketing, to finance, to trust, every department at Tradesy relies on data to make business decisions. As a business intelligence analyst at Tradesy you'll work with teams across the organization to understand data needs, develop robust business intelligence data sources, build reports and visualizations to answer key business questions, and contribute to our strategy for data collection.You'll partner with marketing, product managers, and executives to tackle challenging problems such as analyzing listing metadata to understand supply and demand, monitoring user behavior to understand the impact of product features, measuring responses to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, and tracking inventory to understand the efficiency of our returns operation. In addition, you'll work closely with our data pipeline team to ensure that our data sources are complete, consistent, and reliable.As a key member of our decision making process, you’ll be solving problems and enabling our organization through data visualization, to figure out tomorrow’s puzzle. As we evolve, so will your responsibility. You’ll never answer the same question twice. You will dig into the data, driving insight that will directly help us win our market. You will work with an amazing group of people who believe in solidarity, honesty, autonomy, results, and excellence.You Will:Troubleshoot and reconcile data issues and potential impacts, educate people on definitions and structures, work to resolve and communicate issuesAudit, modify, and document existing reports to provide consistent and reliable metrics across various sourcesConsult with people to gather needs, objectives, feature requirements and deliver reportsDrive, design, and create innovative visual analytics to help aid in the identification of patterns, trends, and anomalies (i.e. interactive dashboards)Assist with data mining and analysis on team project initiativesInnovate new ways to improve existing reports and daily functionsGet into the action right away, take ownership of your projects and deliver on timeYou Have:4-6 years of experience working on SQL (Redshift or BigQuery preferred)3+ years of experience in TableauExperience in Google Analytics and Google Data Studio a plusThe ability to communicate stories/ findings from data clearlyStrong understanding of data and how it relates to the businessFlexible and able to switch between tasks depending on changing prioritiesAbility to audit and reconcile data across various systemsAudit and mine datasets for data anomalies, and develop data governance strategies and dashboardsData modeling and warehouse experience to transform user data (preferred, not required)Bonus Points:Ecommerce or retail experience.Knowledge of or interest in designer fashion.Experience with data analysis using programming languages like R or Python.Experience working with large volumes of event data to analyze user behavior.Compensation:Competitive base salary plus meaningful equityComprehensive benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k)Flexible Paid Time OffAdditional Perks:Daily catered lunchesDog friendly officeCollaborative, fun team

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: OpenX Technologies, Inc. is looking for a Financial Analyst (FA) to join our fun, dynamic and high-performing Finance team. Our team's mission is to steer the financial growth of OpenX through the delivery of world-class financial intelligence, guidance and services. In this mission we value reliability, integrity and fearless stewardship of OpenX's business. We strive to operate with objectivity, rigor and strategic insight.  The ideal candidate will be a highly engaged financial professional with one to three years of finance, accounting or analytical experience. You will be responsible for developing actionable insights and partnering with business teams to drive company performance. You will focus on a specific area of revenue and will gain exposure to the entire business through frequent collaboration within finance and with other teams.  This is an extraordinary opportunity for an early-career financial professional to accelerate their personal development by learning the dynamic ad tech industry from within one of its leading companies. Key ResponsibilitiesForecasting and Budgeting Engage in preparing revenue forecasts, annual budgets, and long-range plansDrive scenario and sensitivity analyses to support the development of strategy and key initiativesReporting Produce and improve revenue dashboards and ad-hoc management reports which show health and trends of OpenX revenue KPIsSanitize and synthesize large datasets to generate reporting and analysisProvide Accounting support to ensure accuracy in Financial Statements and drive process improvementsAd-Hoc Projects Develop financial models to evaluate new business opportunities and potential dealsIndependently identify and pursue analytical opportunities that will yield actionable insightsBecome a subject matter expert for businesses and assist manager in representing Finance for those business segmentsWork cross functionally with other internal teams to support high-impact projectsPresent to senior management with analysis and recommendationsRequired Qualifications1-3 years of finance, accounting or analytical experienceBachelor's degree required, with a major in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Math (Statistics) preferredExcellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact at all levels of the organizationComfortable collaborating with and presenting to cross-functional teamsStrong problem solving skills with the ability to think creatively and independentlySuperior analytical abilities and the ability to form key, succinct insights and recommendations from a comprehensive analyses involving large amounts of dataHigh level of curiosity and self-motivationProficient in Microsoft Excel and Power PointStrong work ethic and ability to work extended hours when neededDetail-oriented and exceptional organizational skillsEasily adapt to changing environment and responsibilities based on organizational needsStrongly preferred: SQL experienceCompany at a Glance OpenX is focused on unleashing the full economic potential of digital media companies. We do this by making digital advertising markets and technologies that are designed to deliver optimal value to publishers and advertisers on every ad served across all screens.  At OpenX, we have built a team that is uniquely experienced in designing and operating high-scale ad marketplaces, and we are constantly on the lookout for thoughtful, creative executors who are as fascinated as we are about finding new ways to apply a blend of market design, technical innovation, operational excellence, and empathetic partner service to the frontiers of digital advertising. OpenX Values Our five company values form a solid bedrock serving to define us as a group and guide the company. Our values remind us that how we do things often matters as much as what we do. We are one One team. No exceptions. We are a group of strong and diverse individuals unified by a clear common purpose. Our customers define us We know our business flourishes or dies because of our customers. OpenX is mine We are all owners of OpenX. We stake our personal and professional reputations on the excellence of our work. We are an open book We are eager to teach and share what we know with others. We evolve fast We take risks and confront failure openly. We recognize and repeat success aggressively. We actively seek out and provide constructive criticism. Defensiveness is for weaklings!

Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: Old Pal is looking for a Analyst who is interested in helping our business development team with state expansion. Ideally someone who has worked in a research and analysis capacity.What you can expect:To be the first line of offense in state expansion, you want to always want to askWhats next and use data to come to your conclusions.Assist the business development team in learning about new geographies and market players through deck development (e.g. Market size, regulatory product restrictions, key players, available channels, primary cultivation and manufacturing models).Discover new leads through our collective network and through outbound sales tactics.Attend events and conferences core to new business.Independent problem solver - You've had stand-alone experience where you managed projects from start to finish with limited oversight.Excel modeling aficionado.Acute attention to detail - Misaligned boxes on a ppt page or stated totals that don't add up to the correct sum stick out to you like flashing neon lights.Someone who would fit this role would be:You will need to see through data and analyze it to find conclusions.Present their findings, or translate the data into an understandable document. You will need to write and speak clearly, easily communicating complex ideas.+3 years experience in finance / consulting position or comparably intense experience.Experience with sales team coverage models and Go to Market strategy.Advanced understanding of P&L statements.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Why Work at Grindr? Since 2009, Grindr has built the world's largest social network for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. Now more than just an app, we're a family of lifestyle brands with the shared mission to connect LGBTQ people with the world around them: Grindr The location-based social app that started it all. Over 3 million people use Grindr daily, from every country on the planet.INTO A digital magazine dedicated to queer perspectives: news, culture, commentary, video, and more.Grindr for Equality (G4E) Our social mission to promote justice, health, and safety for LGBTQ individuals around the globe.Gaymoji A one-of-a-kind collection of over 500+ stickers available on iOS, Android, and in the Grindr app.Slumbr An event series for the high-minded partygoer, combining fashion, music, and art. Behind the brands, Grindr is an inclusive and passionate family of thinkers, innovators, leaders, and most importantly, doers. We're fueled by endless curiosity, constant collaboration, and a knack for crossing every finish line all within an agile growth environment. We also enjoy tons of perks, great social events, and stunning views from our HQ in West Hollywood. Summary Grindr is looking for a Financial Analyst to join our Finance team. The Financial Analyst will be responsible for providing key financial insights to drive the company's strategic decisions. Strong analytical and communication skills are necessary to be successful in this role. You will report to the Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Manager  The core functions of the role include providing monthly expense forecasts and guidance, weekly pacing, creating and managing the annual operating plan, including independent analysis as well as consolidation of business unit inputs, supporting Accounting in the month-end close process, as well ad-hoc analysis as a means for decision support.  Key outputs include preparation of forecasts and reporting packages, coordinating data-gathering across the organization, and assessing risk and opportunity ranges for initiatives and trends. The role will also assist in streamlining and standardizing processes across the organization. ResponsibilitiesBuild out and manage short-term and long-term operational and expense forecasts in line with Grindr's business strategyPerform financial analyses to help executives and department leaders make critical decisionsStreamline and standardize reports and processes to mitigate risks and identify opportunities within the businessPartner with the accounting team to update forecasts and perform variance analysis reporting during month-end closeWork with data source providers and technology teams to ensure that the key data for decision making is accurate and automatedSupport the FP&A Manager with special projects and workflow process improvementsSupport all budget and forecasting activities as neededCreate, evolve, and standardize company reporting to align cross-business unit communication ExperienceBA or BS in Finance or related experience2+ years' experience in full P&L or corporate level planningAdvanced Excel and experience in modeling and analyticsExcellent interpersonal skills to work with various stakeholders across the organizationA passion for problem-solving and comfort with ambiguityStrong attention to detail and organizational skillsBasic understanding of accountingExperience with Oracle and/or SmartView a plusExperience in tech or digital media industries preferred but not requiredBenefits & PerksFull coverage medical and dental insuranceUnlimited sick policyCompetitive Salaries and Options401(k)Catered lunch, every dayStocked kitchenFree on-site parkingCasual dress environment

Name: Financial Analyst Level I
Description: Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world with total assets of over $2.4 trillion (as ranked by SNL Financial, April 2016) and 140,000 colleagues in nearly 50 countries. In the U.S., we're 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. We achieve this by delivering on our values, putting people first, fostering long-term relationships built on honesty and mutual understanding, and inspiring the best in each other. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Join a team that's working to fulfill its vision to be the world's most trusted financial group. Job Summary: Within the Analysis group of FP&A, the Financial Analyst produces and delivers meaningful, accurate, actionable, and timely financial analysis to Managers at all levels of the organization. The adaptability of this team is key, as team members must understand our business partners' strategies, and operations, and proactively anticipate and respond to environmental shifts. Major Responsibilities:Provides basic to moderate complexity financial analysis.Aptitude for preparing less complex analytical and financial reports and presentations.Comfortable interacting with the Analyst team, making presentations, and recommendations.Familiarity with the various financial applications within FP&A and has an understanding of the data relations and interdependencies.Coordinates the resolution of financial questions and issues.Able to work collaboratively across all FP&A teams, identifying best practices and process efficiencies.Produce monthly, quarterly, annually and ad hoc, financial reports regarding trends, variances, profitability and performance measurement.Basic Financial modeling, graphing and reporting.Reconciliations and Adjustments.Assist in analyzing forecast results.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.  A conviction is not an absolute bar to employment. Factors such as the age of the offense, evidence of rehabilitation, seriousness of violation, and job relatedness are considered in all employment decisions. Additionally, it's the bank's policy to only inquire into a candidate's criminal history after an offer has been made. Federal law prohibits banks from employing individuals who have been convicted of, or received a pretrial diversion for, certain offenses.  Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree with 1-2 years related experience.  Some Management Accounting knowledge.  Basic understanding of Performance Measurement.  Basic knowledge of Bank products.  Moderate Financial analytical skills.  Some modeling and project experience.  Presentation & written communication skills.  Aptitude and experience in using and modeling Microsoft Office Suite of products (Excel, Access, PowerPoint).  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.  A conviction is not an absolute bar to employment. Factors such as the age of the offense, evidence of rehabilitation, seriousness of violation, and job relatedness are considered in all employment decisions. Additionally, it's the bank's policy to only inquire into a candidate's criminal history after an offer has been made. Federal law prohibits banks from employing individuals who have been convicted of, or received a pretrial diversion for, certain offenses.

Name: Service Desk Analyst II
Description: Give your career the best treatment. Ready to be part of the first and largest pediatric hospital in Southern California? This is Children's Hospital Los Angeles. A place where you can make a real difference in the lives of our patients and their families. A big responsibility? Absolutely. But if youre up for the challenge, were on the lookout for amazing professionals to join our elite teams talented individuals who can continue our high level of care.  The Help Desk Analyst II provides technical guidance, assistance, coordination and follow-up on customer questions, problems or malfunctions of all software/hardware installed or maintained by the hospital. This may include business specific application software and hardware. Qualifications: Bachelors Degree required. Related experience may be substituted for a Bachelors Degree. Approximately 3-6 years of experience in an Information Technology (IT) discipline and/or Customer Service Call center. 1-3 years experience in hardware provisioning, installation, configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting. Skills: Windows 95/98/XP, Microsoft Office 97/2000/XP/2003 troubleshooting experience. Knowledge of LAN/WAN networking, workstations, operating systems, and applications. Good problem solving, communication, results oriented, team oriented and customer service skills. Excellent multi-tasking skills. Prioritizes and performs a variety of concurrent tasks with minimal direction or supervision. Excellent verbal and written communication skills a must.

Name: Business Analyst Sr - HCI
Description: Business Analyst Sr. - HCILong Beach, CAFull-timeAbout SCAN Our mission is simple: Keeping Seniors Healthy and Independent–that’s been our mission for almost 40 years. Rated as one of the top Medicare Advantage plans in California, SCAN Health Plan employees are passionate about what they do. Understanding that success is based on achieving the mission, SCAN employees are afforded with the training and tools necessary to do their jobs and they are rewarded for their efforts and recognized as experts in their fields. Ask anyone who works here and we’ll proudly tell you that SCAN’s commitment has never wavered. We are as steadfast in our pledge to help our members live healthy and independent lives. The job Act as liaison among 5 STAR Member Satisfaction Workgroup and internal business/IT stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems. Understands business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and performs root cause analysis to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. You willCreate informative process flows to demonstrate current state of process and recommended future state of the process. Perform process analysis using data and six sigma training and utilize process redesign concepts to implement recommendations.Performs root cause analysis using relevant techniques and create recommendations for addressing the root causes. Pushes creative thinking beyond the boundaries of existing industry practices and client mindsets with the ability to separate what is important from the noise.Gather and create business and functional specifications/requirements by facilitating cross functional meetings and workshops of business and IT stakeholders. Create user stories and use cases to define user specifications and functional requirements.Creates informative, well-organized presentations to the Senior Leadership with compelling story line and utilize data to inform decision making.Ability to understand and analyze data with strong skills in excel and SQL is preferred. Must be able to find and translate insights from the data.Work with the Project Manager to create an action plan for implementing recommendations.Quickly understands the business issues and data challenges of client's organization and industry. Ability to understand member experience and issues using outside in thinking and ability to relate to human behavior driving specific experiences.Develops relationships with internal and external stakeholders to enable seamless implementations.Communicates effectively with stakeholders to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions with support from project management. Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.Assists in the facilitation of team and client meetings.Functions as an expert in process redesign and process expert to the team, providing guidance as needed.Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.Actively supports the achievement of SCAN’s Vision and Goals.Other duties as assigned.RequirementsYour qualificationsBachelor's Degree required (Computer Information Systems or equivalent work experience preferred).7+ years of professional experience.5+ years of healthcare experience.Green Belt Certification required with Black belt preferredExcellent Presentation skills with ability to communicate a visual story.Strong experience in writing business and functional requirements and facilitating workshop sessions to gather requirements.Perform root cause analysis using different methodologiesAbility to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully.Ability to facilitate effective cross functional team interaction.Background in Psychology, Behavioral Science, Cognitive Science is highly preferred.Conditions of WorkOffice Hours: Monday-Friday, 8am to 5pm. Extended work hours, as needed.What's in it for you? Qualified employees will receiveA competitive compensation and benefits programAn annual employee bonus programGenerous paid-time-off (PTO)Ten paid holidays per yearExcellent 403(b) Saving Plan, providing up to 4% match and vesting after three yearsCasual attireA work-life balance and much more! We're always looking for talented people to join our team! Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply now!

Name: Sr Analyst - Business Development & Strategy
Description: At Disney ABC/Television Group, you?ll help us tell stories that touch millions of people around the globe and new ways for us to connect with the world. Now is your opportunity to unleash your skills?.  At Disney ABC Television Group (DATG), you will work alongside the best, chart your own career course and help create the next generation of media and entertainment. It?s an exciting time as we work across multiple platforms and on multiple continents, all while changing the face of media. And, you could be a part of the next evolution.  We are seeking a Senior Analyst, Business Development & Strategy that will serve as a key member of the Strategy and Finance group for Disney Channels Worldwide. This role will work with our teams across departments to provide objective decision support to evaluate new business opportunities and manage strategic and operational initiatives for the networks. Working closely with VP and Director, you will take a prominent role in identifying, analyzing, and implementing strategic and operational opportunities across the business. *Responsibilities :** + Support growth initiatives and identify new opportunities with project management, modeling and data analysis, post mortems business cases, and presentations  + Constantly scan market trends and consumer insights to identify opportunities to further monetize DCWW IP  + Partner with Director in proactively developing and executing new internal and external business arrangements to drive incremental value to DCWW (financial, marketing, engagement, capacity-building)  + Support Director on deal assessment, negotiation and execution  + Partner with VP and Director on assigned Corporate & senior executive requests and communications *Basic Qualifications :** + 3+ years of related experience  + Strong analytical ability including modeling skills  + Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively summarize and communicate complex ideas  + Strength in collaborating cross-functionally and across multiple levels  + Able to maintain both a rigorous attention to detail and a big-picture, strategic mindset  + Command of Excel, Power Point and Keynote  + Project management experience preferred  + Experience in business development and digital media preferred  + Passion for kids and family media and entertainment and the Disney brand a plus *Required Education :** + Bachelor?s degree *Preferred Education :** + MBA preferred *Job ID:** 614223BR*Location:** Burbank,California*Job Posting Company:** Media Networks

Name: Senior Analyst, Group International Leasing
Description: Senior Analyst, Group International Leasing-LEA000FPDescriptionUnibail-Rodamco-Westfield (URW) is the premier global developer and operator of flagship shopping destinations. With a portfolio valued at $75B as of December 31, 2017, 88% being in retail, 7% in offices and 6% in convention & exhibition venues, we own and operate 102 shopping centers; 56 are flagships in the most dynamic cities in Europe and the United States. Our centers welcome 1.2B visits per year. The Group has the largest development pipeline in the industry, worth $15B. Present in 2 continents and in 13 countries, URW provides a unique platform for retailers and brand events and offers an exceptional and constantly renewed experience for customers.  URW distinguishes itself by its Better Places 2030 agenda that sets its ambition to create better places that respect the highest environmental standards and contribute to better cities.  At the forefront of innovation, our 3,700 talented professionals are preparing for future generations of customers. Our skills, engagement and team work are key to driving performance and generating superior value.  The Group International Leasing Senior Analyst is responsible for the management of the International Leasing activities carried out at Group level, closely liaising with the Group Director of International Leasing. He/she is the guardian of the Leasing methodology and processes, monitors cross-continental activity and facilitates communication between continents.  The Senior Analyst provides high-level leasing intel and insights across the international leasing team, and assists in articulation of strategy for Cross-Border accounts and ensures execution and cooperation of continental terms.  The Group International Leasing, Senior Analyst reports to the Group Director of International Leasing.  Responsibilities  The main areas of responsibility of the Group International Group International Leasing, Senior Analyst include:  Governance  • Setting up the governance of the International Leasing function at Group level  • Establishing the appropriate coordination mechanisms with International Leasing Europe  • Monitoring retailer portfolio, International Leasing meetings / discussions  • Contributing to the gathering of high-level, senior executive-related information relevant to URW’s participation in retailer and industry events  • Define and own the global leasing calendar of industry events, meetings and priorities  • Identify the needs of the international leasing team and determine the tools to be implemented  • Leasing tools and processes  • Contributing to the definition of the Group’s Leasing guidelines and processes  • Manage the new roll-out of guidelines and processes and monitoring implementation  • Act as the owner for the roll-out of new Leasing tools (e.g. CRM tool)  • Reporting and performance management: create global reports and identify opportunities for global collaboration  • Key account management and cross-continental activity  • Defining process to regularly update list of International Premium Retailers (IPR), Cross-Border Retailers, and major ongoing international deals  • Monitoring and keeping a consolidated view of relevant meetings / discussions with key accounts across continents, ensuring there is effective coordination between teams  Required background and skills  • Academic background in business or sales (or similar fields)  • 3 to 5 years' experience  • MBA preferred  • Experience in project management, or positions requiring a high level of team coordination  • Experience in leasing / sales is a plus  • Strong organization / project management skills  • Rigorous, highly structured and analytical  • Strong system skills and proven ability to handle data from multiple sources  • Design and create new tools for senior level management  • Report and efficiently communicate the leasing activity and analysis  • Provide leasing intel and insights to the international leasing team  • Fluent in English  URW is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity of backgrounds, perspectives, experience and skills. We offer a collaborative, innovative, achievement focused culture with unique opportunities for growth in a global company and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.#LI-JH1Job : LeasingPrimary Location : United States-California-Los Angeles County

Name: Customer Development Business Analyst
Description: Company Summary  Bonduelle Fresh Americas is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Bonduelle, and home of the Ready Pac Foods brand. With four processing facilities throughout the U.S., the business unit focuses on fresh vegetables, salads and fresh meal solutions for the Americas. Acquired by Bonduelle in 2017 as Ready Pac Foods, the renamed Bonduelle Fresh Americas is the largest of the company's five business units. Ready Pac Foods brand manufactures a complete range of products featuring fresh produce and protein under the company's Bistro®, Ready Snax®, Cool Cuts®, elevĀte™ and Fresh Prep'd™ sub-brands. Offerings include fresh-cut salads, fruits, vegetables, snacking and fresh prepared meals, including wrap kits, available where consumers buy groceries and in restaurant chains across North America. Visit www.readypac.com or follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.  Position Overview  The Customer Development Business Analyst will serve as a key player on the Customer Development Team within the BFA Sales Department. This person will work closely with Customer Development, Field Sales, and Finance to drive profitable revenue and financial discipline within the organization. The Customer Development Business Analyst position will be responsible for providing analytical support and project management for Sales with a primary focus on the Foodservice Channel.  Position Responsibilities  Customer Contract Reporting and Accountability Work closely with Field Sales in gathering contract details and developing ways to track obligations and ensure accountability.Responsible for reviewing customer contracts and compiling measures to be monitored monthly. Provide data needed to hold the customer accountable to contractual obligations. Work with Account Teams and Accounts Payable to ensure timely resolution.Complete internal and external customer reporting requirements and update monthlyUpdate Scorecards/Reports to new formats as requested by Management.Conduct monthly calls with each of the sales team members to provide updates on pricing analysis.Drive continuous improvement by developing and implementing actions that improve contract price compliance.Monitor and communicate Market Pricing trends of assigned commodities. Keep informed of all new developments and price trends, and make recommendations designed to reduce costs and gain more profitable business. Customer Development Analytics Directly assist the Customer Development Team in the execution of objectives and strategic initiatives.Develop scorecards for objectives and KPIs, and provide ongoing weekly/monthly updates on progress along with key observations.Perform analytics on P&Ls to facilitate decision making in support of the Business Planning Process.Send formal Sales Communication Announcements by packaging all pertinent information and communicating the message clearly and concisely for flawless Field Sales execution.Ensure all product information resources are updated and all information is consistent (Sales Portfolio, Price Lists, online assets/tools and internal product management tools)Consolidate Raw Reporting updates from Ag Team and Procurement Team, and post for Field Sales Team to access and share with Customers.Assist other cross-functional groups on reporting CSR results to meet customer requirements.Contribute in completion of RFIs and RFPs as needed.Maintain Price List on an ongoing basis as changes occur.Track Freight trends and report opportunities to CDT and Sales Leadership.Assist in the development of a BFA Foodservice Website for customers to access and interact with.Participate in any and all relevant internal meetings, to include the bi-weekly calls with the Field Sales team.Communicate weekly and monthly updates to CD and Field Sales.Assist in building selling-tools by updating existing presentations and developing new templates as needed for Account Leads to utilize with customers.Assist Sales Team as needed to further BFA sales in each of our accounts.Develop strong, trusted relationships with external partners and internal teams to enhance visibility of successes, learnings, and best practices.Other related duties as assigned.Minimum QualificationsBA/BS Degree (required)2-3 years Sales, Finance, or equivalent experienceMust be competent in Microsoft Office Suite and must be at expert level in Excel.Candidate must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.Desired QualificationsAdvanced Analytical Skills -- Detail oriented with advanced analytical and problem solving skills.Strong Organizational Skills -- Highly organized, self-motivated, hard worker with the ability to manage projects with limited oversight and proactively drive strategic priorities.Integrity -- Consistently acts with integrity and with the best interest of the organization in mind.Communication Skills -- Ability to clearly and concisely compose and relay information (both verbal and written) throughout the team and keep other key stakeholders informed.Relationship Skills -- Ability to develop strong internal/external relationships and work well in a collaborative team environment.Superior Execution -- Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously while preserving attention to detail, adapt well to change, and able to prioritize multiple work assignments.Process Management -- Accurate and timely reporting with drive to improve and streamline processes. Technology savvy, especially in Excel and PowerPoint.Office environment (sitting at desk eighty percent (80%) of the day.A passion for learning and a craving to work in a fun culture. This description should not be construed to contain every responsibility that may be required to be performed by an incumbent in this job. Incumbents are required to perform other related functions assigned. Name: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: About City of Hope City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6,000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.  Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nation's 20 leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment. Position Summary: The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, reporting to the Vice President of Enterprise Business Intelligence, is an experienced professional with a passion for preparing and presenting information in a visually appealing and easily understood manner, making it relevant and actionable for key stakeholders.  Requires the ability to collect and synthesize complex data from multiple sources, provide intellectual rigor to analysis and interpretation processes, and derive meaningful insights that support the achievement of strategic and operational goals. Essential Functions:Analyze large datasets to discover trends, patterns and actionable insights.Apply research and evaluation standards, descriptive statistics and data management principles to translate complex data into meaningful content.Present findings using verbal, written, and graphic communication techniques. Offer recommendations to support organizationalperformance improvement.Work closely with multiple internal stakeholders to analyze business needs and deliver relevant information in appropriate formats.Design, create, test and maintain a portfolio of reports, scorecards and dashboards.Participate in enterprise-level metadata, master data management and data governance initiatives.Stay informed about Business Intelligence industry trends, technologies and best practices that can be applied to achieve business goals.Develop and implement business logic and the ETL mechanism to populate the EDW and Programming ETL tool with business rules to be applied to data from source input to target data repository, automating data extraction/load programs to run on regular schedule.Utilizes understanding of dimensional data modeling techniques, data warehousing, design and concepts to produce balanced scorecard design, and design of dashboards and KPI's (Key Performance Indicators).Gather and analyze business requirements to perform data modeling and mapping across multiple platforms for enterprise wide BI initiatives.Identify data quality issues and support the data governance initiative by participating in necessary activities including data profiling. Follows established City of Hope and department policies, procedures, objectives, performance improvement, attendance, safety, environmental, and infection control guidelines, includingadherence to theworkplaceCode of Conduct and Compliance Plan. Practices a high level of integrity and honesty in maintaining confidentiality.  Performs other related duties as assigned or requested. Position Qualifications:Minimum Education:Undergraduate degree or equivalent requiredMinimum Experience:5+ years of experience in business intelligence, systems analysis, informatics or a related discipline, including requirements gathering, solution implementation, testing and validation.Experience in a health care, biomedical research and / or academic medical setting is preferred.Skills/Abilities:Demonstrated proficiency in analyzing data to derive business insights and support performance improvement initiativesDemonstrated proficiency in the collection, classification, dissemination, integration and visualization of complex informationDemonstrated proficiency, formal training and / or certifications in one or more Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Spotfire, QlikView) required. Tableau experience strongly preferred.Present complex information in a logical and understandable format to a wide variety of audiences.Translate business requirements into technical and functional specifications. Design, develop and test deliverables based on specifications.Strong analytical skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skillsAn innovative thinker that can turn ideas in to solutions.Ability to work with minimal supervision and lead small project / performance improvement teams if necessary.Ability to collaborate effectively in a matrix environment. City of Hope is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Name: Financial Management Analyst- General Accounting
Description: Assist with the monthly GL close process.  Prepare, enter or upload standard and non-standard journal entries to record transactions  Investigate and book the need for any monthly accruals  Investigate budget to actual account balance fluctuations on a monthly basis  Prepare general ledger account analysis and reconciliations on a monthly basis  Assist with the preparation of annual audit schedules  Advise management about issues in complying with US GAAP or organization policy  Perform other related duties as assigned or required  Must have strong computer skills, primarily in MicroSoft Office (i.e. Excel, Word, Powerpoint, Outlook)  Must be flexible and possess the ability to adapt quickly to changing business needs and/or prioities  Must be detail oriented Experience:  2-5 years accounting experience in healthcare Educational Requirements: Bachelor degree in Finance/Accounting or equivalent experience License/Certification/Registration Requirements: CPA preferred but not requiredPhysical Demands:sitting, computer work#LI-Corp
