Name: Sr. Digital Analyst / Data Analyst / Optimization Specialist
Description: Sr. Digital Analyst / Data Analyst / Optimization Specialist Los Angeles The Data Science and Analytics team at Tillster is looking for a highly motivated Senior Digital / Optimization Analyst with an emphasis on website & mobile app optimization. You will be exploring data from multiple tools & sources to find actionable insights and prioritize, recommend & execute strategies working with cross-functional teams & clients to improve and optimize consumer experience and profitability for global restaurant brands in the quick service and casual dining space. General Profile You are a rock star digital analyst who is a jack/jill of all trades related to analytics & optimization and a master of a few. You are comfortable with pulling data from multiple data sources, able to analyze data using variety of tools and find interesting actionable insights from the data. You focus on uncovering profitable sources of traffic, increasing conversion rates, improving average order value and finding loyal segments of customers to encourage repeat purchases. You are able to form hypotheses to test based on data and working with cross-functional teams, execute and analyze experiment results. You are able to effectively communicate analyses, visualizations & insights to a broad audience with different levels of data sophistication. You have great presentation skills and have significant client interaction experience. You have a high attention to details and have quick thinking & problem solving skills. ResponsibilitiesExplore data to find actionable insights through funnel analysis, user segmentation & cohort analysis.Build a backlog of measurable and actionable hypotheses based on customer behavior data and prioritize & execute AB & Multivariate tests for mobile apps and responsive websites.Collaborate with clients, product managers, engineers & UX/UI designers to implement tests & experiments and to present your analyses & recommendations.Develop and present analyses, actionable insights & recommendations to key stakeholders including senior executives & clients in forums and periodic business review meetings.Other duties as required or directed.Requirements5+ years of experience in site and app analytics providing customer behavior insights in a data-driven fast growing mobile/web company. Experience in ecommerce analytics is required.3+ years of managing and executing AB & multivariate tests in optimizing customer experience and behavior using tools such as Optimize, Optimizely, Test & Target etc.Expertise in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager required.Proficiency with at least one visualization tool and/or library e.g. D3, Microsoft Excel, Tableau, R is required.Expertise in writing SQL and understanding of databases & data structures is required.Understanding of digital marketing concepts such as SEO, SEM, social media, email, push notifications strongly preferred.Understanding of Data Mining & Machine Learning principles strongly preferred.Knowledge of statistics, probability, controlled experiments & the underlying mathematical concepts strongly preferred.Basic knowledge of JavaScript, CSS & HTML strongly preferred.Experience in product management and/or user experience a big plus.Experience in collecting data from/exposing data to various data sources and services (API, JSON, XML) using Python a big plus.Candidates should be highly analytical with great problem solving skills.Candidates should have exceptional communication & presentation skills and the ability to explain data and analysis to a variety of audience.Candidate should be self motivated & thrive in a fast-paced environment.Candidate should have a bachelor's degree or higher in quantitative or related field.About Tillster Tillster is the global leader in digital ordering and customer engagement solutions. For over a decade we've developed revolutionary self-service, ordering and payments solutions for mobile, tablet, online, kiosk, call center, and more creating personalized interactions based on consumer preferences, language, and currency. Our platform is compatible with 15+ unique POS systems, representing over 90% coverage in multi-unit restaurants. We offer one platform; one scalable, enterprise class solution to create world-class digital engagement solutions. Tillster is proudly an Equal Opportunity EmployerLocal Candidates Strongly PreferredRelocation Assistance ConsideredNo visa sponsorshipPrincipals only no Agencies or calls please

Name: Senior Analyst, Business Analytics
Description: DINE Brands Global, is looking for a highly motivated individual with demonstrated strength in analytics, problem solving, intellectual curiosity, and relationship management to serve as a Senior Analyst. Reporting to the Dine Research Institute, this individual will conduct timely and accurate business analysis and reporting to assist with strategic decision making in the organization. Provide quantitative and technical expertise to assigned business units/leaders to ensure that all relevant financial, marketing, and operational data are available to support business decisions. Key deliverables will include:  • Assist the DRI team in mining for insight across all data platforms. Insights will include focusing on sales drivers and identifying new opportunities.  • Working with the team to create trackers for national programs and business units internationally.  • Assist the team in diving deep into DINE Brand’s vast collection of data and weaving together an impactful story to drive business results.  • Influence Marketing to assist in designing best-possible campaigns  • Prepare presentations for International team and Executive Teams  • Proactively monitor business results and preemptively bring forth analysis explaining“why” and root causes behind shifts in performance.  • Critically analyze information, clearly articulate findings, and concisely present recommendations to management team.• Perform industry/category/market analysis to identify drivers of growth  • Provide summaries of earnings release transcripts for Dine Brand’s competitive set to the organization Requirements • BA required; analytical degree preferred (e.g., Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, or related discipline)  • Working knowledge of basic statistical concepts• 2-4+ years analytically oriented business leadership / Job level will be commensurate with experience  • Strong internal motivation, intellectual curiosity, logical thinking and desire to have a large impact on our organization  • Superb interpersonal and communication skills, with ability to partner well with other team members  • Strong organizational skills, with ability to work independently and multi-task in a complex, fast-paced, and deadline-driven environment•  Resourceful nature, with strong problem-solving and customer-service orientation  • Highly versed in applications software including advanced Excel and particularly strong understanding of PowerPoint.  • Familiarity with business intelligence software (e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, SQL) and/or statistical software (e.g. R, SAS).  • Experience building dashboards using a business intelligence tool.  • Ability to communicate complex analysis to non-technical audience.  • Ability to think holistically, leveraging several sources of data and bringing them together to tell a story

Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Project Description  Our Data Strategy and Operations team is focused on implementing and evolving client's investment data strategy to enable the full range of business objectives; data for minimizing risk, data for efficient processes, and data for growth and innovation. It also delivers a set of capabilities to source, automate, and curate data assets to enable and enrich core investment and distribution processes, quantitative analytics, reporting and analysis, and advanced analytic efforts such as artificial intelligence.  As a Senior Data Solutions Analyst based in Krakow, you will serve as an investment management data expert and cooperate with Los Angeles based part of the team. Name: Cost Engineer / Budget Analyst (Transit)
Description: Kal Krishnan Consulting Services, Inc. (KKCS), a California Corporation, is a full-service engineering & design, construction management, and program management organization. The firm has grown steadily in size and capability since its founding in 1987, and today employs more than 85 professionals in our regional offices. KKCS has attracted to its staff a full complement of highly experienced, talented, and dedicated professionals who bring a collaborative, integrated team approach to our clients’ projects.  KKCS experience includes work on rail, airports, ports, freeways, schools, universities, facilities, water, wastewater, bridges, and roadways. Our client list includes federal agencies, state agencies, regional agencies, and private clients. KKCS has broad experience and expertise in engineering design, project management and project controls services.  The KKCS culture is rooted in the ideals of integrity, safety, diversity, and ethical business practices, which is a commitment shared by all KKCS employees throughout our offices and project sites around the country. We have a positive impact on the communities we serve by not only improving infrastructure but also providing service at a relatively low cost to the taxpayer. This allows for more money to be available to the agencies we serve, that inevitably will be reinvested in the community. At KKCS, we value the individual employee and the importance of their contributions toward quality improvement. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITSCompany-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees401K retirement plan with company matching contributionPaid holidaysPaid time offCompany-paid life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) benefitsCompany-paid long-term (LTD) insuranceAnnual tuition assistance allowance for employeesEmployee Assistance ProgramRelocation allowancePOSITION DESCRIPTION SUMMARY KKCS is seeking a construction project cost engineer for a full-time opportunity in Los Angeles, CA. The Cost Engineer is responsible for monitoring and analyzing project cost information through all capital project lifecycle phases on transit-related capital projects. The position is anticipated to start as soon as possible. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESCoordinates maintenance of the cost reports including plan, forecast, and actual information along with associated funding and authorization for expenditure levels.Controls and monitors project total expenditures including verifying and checking of contractor progress payments.Coordinates the development of forecast updates and variance analysis compared to baseline cost plans.Coordinates development of cost recovery plans to mitigate variances.Prepares routine progress reporting and cost status narratives for monthly/quarterly reports with earned value perspectives.Coordinates and works with the Project Management Team (PMT) to resolve project issues to ensure the delivery/completion of the project work within budget.Attends project meetings and discussions with the PMT.Provides cost control and planning advice to the internal PMT team as and when required.Undertakes ad-hoc duties as required. When duties and responsibilities change and develop, the job description will be reviewed and subject to changes of business necessity. QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSRequired ExperienceBachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Engineering, Construction Management or another related fieldFour (4) years of experience in cost engineering for capital projectsWorking knowledge of widely accepted cost engineering methodologies required by owners, consultants and/or contractorsDemonstrated ability to approach technical issues, identify alternative solutions and solve complex problemsAbility to communicate effectively, orally and in writingDemonstrated proficiency utilizing standard MS Office applications including Word, Excel and PowerPointAbility to manage the workload including setting priorities and meeting schedules effectively Preferred Experience Experience on rail transit projects strongly preferred***PLEASE APPLY WITH RESUME***

Name: Collateral Analyst
Description: This colleague is responsible for a designated group of ABL client portfolio, performing quantitative and qualitative analyses of accounts receivable, inventory and payables. Based on analytical data, the colleague is responsible for identifying and addressing any areas of concerns that can impair the integrity of Bank's collateral position as well as any collateral default and reporting requirement, either through written or verbal communication. The colleague must have the ability to provide excellent customer service to external and internal clients. The colleague is responsible for understanding and maintaining the loan documents and records related to his/her designated portfolio. *Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, related field or equivalent experience*Minimum of 2 years of experience with Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, Word, Asset Reader, Monarch, Stucky and AFS Software systems.*Minimum of 2 years of experience with accounts receivable financing, accounting or internal auditing.Comprehensive understanding and knowledge of the legal terms, conditions and requirements pursuant to the loan agreement, credit approval and bank credit policy preferred.Ability to prepare the Collateral Instruction Sheet and Client filing system for new and existing clients.Efficient in managing the record keeping of legal documentations and various reports.Experience in ensuring the client compliance with collateral reporting requirements preferred.Ability to maintain excellent internal and external customer relation and services relating to collateral monitoring, issues, problems, system and other related functionality. *Represents basic qualifications for the position. To be considered for this position you must at least meet the basic qualifications.  City National Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer -- Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Business Intelligence Team aims to empower and support Ring’s leadership and business units with analytics and reporting to help drive strategic growth initiatives. As an Analyst, you’ll be working with a variety of disciplines ranging from Marketing and Pricing to Logistics and Engineering, identifying the underlying drivers of the data, using that knowledge to make predictions, and provide reports from which strategic recommendations are made. This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing recommendations. You will develop advanced models and tools, conduct statistical analyses, evaluate large data sets, and create tailored models and dashboards. Additionally, you will be instrumental in the creation of a reliable and scalable infrastructure for ongoing reporting and analytics. Your responsibilities can vary from task definition to implementation and interpretation of results. ResponsibilitiesAnalyze large data sets using a variety of database query and visualization toolsProvide technical expertise in extracting, integrating, and analyzing critical dataTackle short/long term quantitative/qualitative problems and questions with technical analysisArchitect data flows for new and existing reporting processes based on needs from various stakeholdersPerform ongoing monitoring, automation and refinement of reports and data solutionsPerform analysis to identify and understand issues or events. Reconcile and validate data from multiple sources and drive resolutionAssist with data integration projects by creating requirement documentation, data mapping, version control and release planningRequirementsBA/BS in Data Science, Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics or similarHighly proficient in SQL development and database toolsA solid grasp of common statistical methods and applications (A/B testing, probability, regression)Knowledge of fundamental relational database technology and terminologyExperience with transforming complex datasets into relevant visualizationsComfortable analyzing complex data sets, business processes, and able to quickly adapt to the use of new technologiesAbility to analyze current work processes and systems and clearly articulate potential improvement opportunitiesNice to HaveBig Data (Presto) and NoSQL experienceFamiliarity with Looker or related BI visualization tools such as TableauSoftware development experience in creating and or using 3rd party APIsExperience working with very large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)Programming Experience with analytical software (Python, R) and with manipulating json files Company DescriptionRing's mission is to reduce crime in neighborhoods and empower consumers by creating a Ring of Security around homes and communities with its suite of smart home security products: Ring Video Doorbell, Ring Video Doorbell Pro, Ring Stick Up Cam and the new Ring Floodlight Cam. With these security devices, Ring has created the neighborhood watch for the digital age and continues to keep homes around the world safe. For more information, visit www.ring.com. With Ring, you're always home. Name: Operations Analyst
Description: OPERATIONS ANALYSTLOS ANGELES, CAWINC has grown to be one of the leading wineries in the world. We are changing how wine is made, bought, and delivered. We make decisions as a company based on hard consumer data while also obsess over the quality of our wine.  This role is located in Los Angeles and will be reporting directly to the Operations Insights Manager. They will a chance to work with multiple teams throughout their time here: Product, Accounting, other members of Operations, Analytics, and Engineering.  We are looking for someone who is excited to join a team that is disrupting an old and traditional industry. Our company is committed to achieving our vision of having a great bottle of wine in every table and a great story on every bottle even if we have to break the rules.This role willTHINK BIG PICTUREWhether youre solving an inventory problem or planning ahead for future projects, youll have to tap into your creative side and think about how each event affect the business as a whole.Ensure inventory is perfectly balanced and aligned with company needs.Track how were doing on a day-to-day basis and suggest how that affects our future. Make data work for us.Collaborate with vendors to ensure WINC packaging is world class.KEEP IT AUTHENTICThere are a lot of moving parts in this business that require sharp systems upkeep. Be the brain who makes sure that what were doing in real life matches what our systems show.Reconciling inventory and be able to provide monthly reports.Work with other members of the team to implement, record, and polish processes so the next person doesnt have to start over from square one.MAKE IT BETTERSome of the questions that this role will have to continually answer is: Is the data that were looking at relevant to our goals? Do we have the right information flowing to the right people in order to grow as a company? If not, how do we set that up?Challenge the status quo by looking into our database and suggesting new metrics that we need to start tracking.Dig into our database and discover new data that can be used to our advantage.A perfect candidateSweats the details.Ability and confidence to dive into tasks, overcome obstacles under pressure in a constantly changing environment with little guidance.Has an undying curiosity to learn why things work.Prioritizes tasks that put company objectives first.Has a great sense of humor.Excited to grow as the company grows.Skills NeededProficient at Microsoft Excel (Fluent at vlookups, SumIfs, Ifs). An Excel test will be given out.Ability to quickly mock up models on the fly to make data-based decisions.Ability to learn multiple systems and extract the needed information out of them for your projects.Nice-to-haves but not necessarySQL knowledge writing a basic query

Name: Corporate Banking Analyst (Entertainment Finance)
Description: Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world (as ranked by S&P Global, April 2018) with total assets of over $2.9 trillion (106.2 (JPY) as of March 30, 2018) and 150,000 colleagues in more than 50 countries. In the U.S., we're 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. We achieve this by delivering on our values, putting people first, fostering long-term relationships built on honesty and mutual understanding, and inspiring the best in each other. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Join a team that's working to fulfill its vision to be the world's most trusted financial group.Major Responsibilities: Assist senior officers in the preparation of credit recommendation requests, spread historical financial statements, prepare financial projection models and general assistance of portfolio maintenance. Proactively assist and complete underwriting processes for single picture and other lending opportunities responsibilities include modelling, drafting term sheets, deal screening, updating salesforce, risk rating modelling, credit package preparation actively participating in internal approval process and in legal closing processes, work closing with portfolio maintenance group as applicable.Active role in deal execution with other responsibilities including: monitoring agent deadlines for commitments, leading effort with necessary amendments to internal approvals as deal closing approaches, back office closing coordination, and coordination of document signaturesSupport in identifying cross-sell opportunities including executionMaintaining a focus on providing superior customer service Support officers in call preparation on corporations within an assigned industry to solicit the Bank's credit and non-credit services to potential customers and to cross-sell additional services to existing customers. Identify customer needs and level of servicing required through discussions with corporate officers and analysis of financial status and/or operations. Support officers in examining the depository services needed by the organization and call in specialists from various areas of the bank (i.e., Cash Management, Deposit Relationship Management, Trust, etc.) to explain and eventually implement the desired services. Evaluate the organization's credit needs, analyze the financial statements, and structure loan packages Respond to operational problems experienced by assigned customers and work through other departments of the Bank for research and final resolution. Ongoing detailed and accurate monitoring of assigned portfolio to assess credit quality and trends.Collaborate with officers and portfolio maintenance group to ensure timely and accurate completion of reviews and credit actions.Assisting officers in daily customer service responsibilities for lead arranger credits including diligence to ensure borrowing base reporting is timely and accurate.Maintain accurate and detailed monitoring of collateral worksheets and disbursement histories, and ensure risk ratings are appropriate during quarterly reviews.Accurately identify and mitigate exceptions to credit policy and underwriting guidelines.Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree (preferably in a business related major, including Accounting, Economics).1year or more of work experience in a Corporate Banking setting.Credit experience, ideally from a training program with a money center bank/regional formal credit training or equivalent.Must have had historical accounting and finance classes/experience.Exceptional interpersonal, analytical and writing skills.Excellent organization, time management, and attention to details.Skilled at using computer applications, including MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word.Experience with spreadsheets and modeling desirable.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities duties and skills required of personnel so classified.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.  A conviction is not an absolute bar to employment. Factors such as the age of the offense, evidence of rehabilitation, seriousness of violation, and job relatedness are considered in all employment decisions. Description: Requisition Number: 29102 Job Title: ADMINISTRATIVE ANALYST I, PRINCIPAL Working Title: Financial Analyst Salary: $5,325 - $10,533 monhly Job Type: Career Department Name: 0300-ANDERSON GRAD SCH OF MANAGEMENT Department Website URL: Job Summary Statement: The Anderson School is a complex Academic and Business unit with an annual operating budget of approximately $145 million that includes state funding, self-supporting degree programs, contracts and grants, endowment and gift income as well as multiple sales and service enterprises.  Perform comprehensive complex analysis of the school's financial activities and systems. Include sensitivity and feasibility studies examining revenues, expenses and enrollments to assist senior management with high level decision making. Develop seasonal financial state-of-the-school reports. Develop on-line reporting systems to facilitate the units within the school with budget development and monitoring. Perform commodity and vendor analyses. Perform ad hoc analyses as required.  Work with Anderson Computing & Information Services programmers to evaluate available tools and will assess potential of available campus systems for development of long term financial reporting environment. Conduct assessments of the business needs of each unit within the school under the direction of the Sr. Associate Dean of Finance and CFO will establish project plans and timelines for development of reporting and budgeting resources. Percentage of Time: 100 Shift Start: 8:00 am Shift End: 5:00 pm Qualifications for Position  17 Records Qualifications Required/Preferred Demonstrated detailed working knowledge of accounting principles, policies and procedures. Required Detailed knowledge of university financial systems. Required Demonstrated experience in designing and developing sensitivity analyses and feasibility studies. Required Demonstrated experience in the development and implementation of analytical models. Required Demonstrated skill in analyzing statistical financial data and reports. Required Demonstrated skill in developing automated spreadsheets to perform analytical analyses. Required Experience explaining technical concepts to a variety of clients with varying levels of understanding of University accounting and programming. Required Experience researching complex administrative issues as they relate to accounting, purchasing and payroll policies. Required Demonstrated ability to write instructions on how to access and use reports using appropriate illustration tools, and in clear and consistent standard English. Required Demonstrated ability to make presentations of new reporting and budgeting tools to large groups. Required Experience drafting correspondence in standard English using appropriate grammar and spelling. Required Detailed knowledge of software applications such as Excel, and Access. Required Strong customer service orientation, demonstrated ability to establish and maintain good relations with faculty and staff, maintaining an air of approachability and commitment to service. Required Knowledge of COGNOS, Essbase and other campus reporting tools. Preferred Knowledge of University purchasing systems including Bruinbuy, Travel Express, DACSS and the reports available through them. Preferred Working knowledge of University purchasing policies. Preferred Working knowledge of University payroll policies. Name: Student Accounting and Financial Analyst
Description: CSU Job Listing Details  Printable version  E-Mail this listing Campus: Northridge  Job ID: 7839 Job Title: Student Accounting and Financial Analyst Appointment Type: Probationary Time Base: Full-Time Date Posted: October 9, 2018 Closing Date: Open until filled Link to Apply Online: https://cmshr.csun.edu/psc/HNRPRD/EMPLOYEE/HRMS/c/HRS_HRAM.HRS_CE.GBL Campus Employment Homepage: http://www-admn.csun.edu/ohrs/ Description: Student Accounting and Financial Analyst (JID 7839)  Accountant I  Extended Learning  Full Time / $3664 - $4625/mo.  CSUN's Commitment to You  CSUN is committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, learning and inclusion. Our values include a respect for all people, building partnerships with the community and the encouragement of innovation, experimentation and creativity. CSUN strives to cultivate a community in which a diverse population can learn and work in an atmosphere of civility and respect. CSUN is especially interested in candidates who make contributions to equity and inclusion in the pursuit of excellence for all members of the university community.  About the University  One of the largest universities in the country, California State University, Northridge (CSUN) is an urban, comprehensive university that delivers award-winning undergraduate and graduate programs to nearly 40,000 students annually and counts more than 330,000 alumni who elevate Southern California and beyond. Since its founding in 1958, CSUN has made a significant and long-term economic impact on California, generating nearly $1.9 billion in economic impact and more than 11,700 jobs each year. The LAEDC recognized CSUN as its 2015 Eddy Award winner for its positive economic impact. Serving more students on Pell Grants than any other institution in California, CSUN is also a social elevator and one of the most diverse universities in the country. CSUN ranks 13th in awarding bachelor's degrees to underrepresented minority students and seventh in bachelor's degrees to Latino students, serves the 13th largest Jewish student population, and enrolls the largest number of students who are Deaf and hard-of-hearing of any U.S. state university. The journal Nature recently named CSUN a Rising Star for scientific research, and the NSF ranks CSUN in the top five nationally among similar institutions for graduates who go on to earn doctorates in the sciences. CSUN is where individuals rise. And through them, so does Greater Los Angeles and beyond.  About the College  CSUN's Tseng College provides advanced professional education to undergraduate, graduate, international and midcareer students. With more than $39 million in revenue and over 36,000 registrations per year, the College is a leading provider of professional degrees, certificates and custom-designed programs. Known for its premier support services, the College employs an administrative staff of more than 75 people, leading to exceptionally high on-time graduation rates - 70-80 percent for most programs, with some, like the M.S. in Communicative Disorders, achieving above 90. The college is nationally recognized for providing programs with formats, delivery modes and locations that address the needs and constraints facing working professionals and their organizations. It works closely with businesses, communities, agencies and international partners to design and deliver programs that meet unique organizational needs and goals.  Major Duties  Under the supervision of the Director of Finance, the Student Accounting and Financial Analyst provides timely, efficient, and accurate management of the Tseng College student accounts; solves client/student account problems; ensures complete and accurate accounts management; and develops timely and clear financial reports. The incumbent assumes full responsibility for the assigned student accounts within particular degree or certificate cohorts and/or non-credit programs such as the Intensive English program (IEP), Semester at CSUN program (SAC), and short-term training programs; ensures accurate billing and timely payment; works with other members of the Student Accounting team of the College, reviewing and/or providing account reconciliations on all student accounts on a regular basis; serves as the internal auditor for all the student/client accounts for the College; performs general student accounting duties, including refund requests, withdrawals, and appeals for specific programs; reviews accounts for accuracy and prepares audits for student and sponsorship accounts; responds to student inquiries, and questions from the College's Admissions, Registration, and Client Services Unit, and Financial Aid Unit about student accounts; prepares, reviews, and analyzes enrollment audits and recommends and implements corrective actions to prevent reoccurrences; reviews and analyzes third-party sponsorship forms; maintains financial guarantee letters file; performs sponsorship accounts receivable reconciliation; reviews sponsor checks and prepares invoices to the sponsoring agencies; performs all student accounting tasks for international students; generates queries and prepares reports from Oracle PeopleSoft to analyze student accounts and to participate in and support the collection effort; prepares manual charges and account adjustments as needed; assists in the preparation of the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) agreements between the College and the academic colleges; prepares Profit and Loss (P&L) statements and all transfers linked to the P&L; prepares all faculty release time transfer to the academic colleges; assists in the preparation of quarterly variance analysis; assists in the preparation of the College's budget and additional material for the budget meetings; serves as the backup person to the College's Human Resources office and the e-Travel initial approver; performs special high priority projects; assists and provides administrative support as needed; and performs other duties as assigned. Qualifications Equivalent to a Bachelor's degree with a major in accounting, business administration, finance or a closely related field. Master's degree in the related field is a plus. Two or more years of experience in a financial management, professional accounting and/or data management role preferred.  Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities  Thorough and in-depth knowledge of all areas of financial accounting including Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and practices. Excellent skills in financial record-keeping, mathematical skills and knowledge of general office procedures and practices. Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office word and Excel spreadsheet (use of pivot tables) software programs, web browsers, query tools, integrated financial systems and/or other types of records management systems, such as student accounting. Experience with Oracle PeopleSoft, or large data bases is a plus. Ability and specialized skills to: interpret and apply written policies, rules and regulations; review documents for accuracy, completeness, validity and adherence to standards; maintain files and accounting records; analyze financial and statistical data and draw conclusions; utilize problem solving techniques and develop new procedures as needed; use initiative and resourcefulness in planning work assignments and in implementing long-range program improvements; communicate and work with a diverse campus community; communicate effectively, both orally and in writing. Knowledge of the Account/Fund structure and Chart-fields within the University's financial data system (CFS) and is proficiency in exporting data from Oracle PeopleSoft for analysis and management reporting preferred.  Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule  The university offers an excellent benefits package.  The salary range for this classification is: $3664 - $6867 per month.  The anticipated HIRING RANGE: $3664 - $4625, dependent upon qualifications and experience.  HOURS: Full Time; 40 hours per week; 8:00am - 5:00pm, Monday through Friday; may include some evenings and weekends.  REG: This is a Regular position with a one-year probationary period.  General Information  This position is a sensitive position as designated by the CSU.  A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for the position.  The person holding this position may be considered a 'mandated reporter' under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.  How To Apply  Candidates should apply by completing the CSUN on-line application utilizing: http://bit.ly/HRCSUN link. NOTE: Internal candidates should apply through the portal by accessing the View Job Openings/Apply link on the Human Resources/Employee pagelet.  Applications received through October 22, 2018 will be considered in the initial review and review of applications will continue until position is filled.  In order to be considered in the initial review, applications must be submitted prior to the date listed above. Application submissions received after the initial review date will be reviewed at the discretion of the University.  For more detailed information on the application and hiring process, please visit the link below:  www.csun.edu/careers  Equal Employment Opportunity  CSUN is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, and disability. Our nondiscrimination policy is set forth in CSU Executive Order 1096. Reasonable accommodations will be provided for applicants with disabilities who self-disclose by contacting Recruitment Services at ext. 2101.SDL2017

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Job ID 612469BR Location Burbank, California, United States Business Direct-to-Consumer and International Date posted Nov. 12, 2018  Job Summary: We have created one of the most powerful brands by bringing memorable, life-changing storytelling to the world. The foundation of this creativity starts with The Walt Disney Studios where we produce, acquire, and distribute live-action and animated motion pictures, video experiences, music, and live performances. Our brands include Marvel, LucasFilm, Pixar, Disney Animation, Disney Nature and Hollywood Records. No other Media & Entertainment company can rival the brands we have the honor of working with every day.As part of the Studio’s Technology team you’ll be joining a group of seasoned, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting and dynamic industry.We are looking for a self-starting Sr Business Analyst who is dedicated to shaping the future of digital media distribution. We’re a casual shop that values passion, community involvement and exceptional software. If this is you, we want you to join our team.You will be a part of a team dedicated to innovating digital media distribution across the company. You should be comfortable working within cross-functional teams as well as diverse group of business stakeholders and technologists. We expect you to have a deep understanding of business analysis methodologies and product life cycle management as well as technological savviness and ability to quickly ramp up on new technologies, keep up with the latest trends, and identify improvement opportunities. Through your analysis and vision for continuous improvement, you will help expose new opportunities and communicate trade-offs and risks to your business partners. You will work in service of an overall company initiative to reimagine digital media distribution as an integrated, automated, efficient and effective machine that can scale and flex in line with rapid, technology-driven business dynamics. Responsibilities:Analysis and recommendationsYou will analyze and evaluate existing work processes and technology solutions to identify improvement opportunities and produce recommendations for new solutions including tradeoffs and risks.You will develop business analysis deliverables, including but not limited to workflows and process models, business requirements, use cases, and business rules.You will perform evaluations for in-house and 3rd party technological solution alternatives to identify gaps and consolidation opportunities.You will create and/or support the development of work and test plans and develop testing specifications for evaluating alternative technological solutions.Leadership and collaborationYou will collaborate with Product and Project Management to ensure recommendations for process/ technology improvements and effectively translated to actionable work plans and are aligned with budget, timelines and resources constraints.You will act as a liaison between business and the engineering teams, translating business requirements to technical design and producing detailed system documentations. You will help communicate relevant feedback around technological complexity, resources and timelines evaluations to the Project Management team. You will provide presentations to key stakeholders to inform on projects progress, risks/ issues and new opportunities.Your passion for digital transformation and value creation through technology is visible to your team and stakeholders in every product you and your team delivers. You take ownership on projects you manage and effectively communicate your vision and solution approach to gain results through collaboration.A master problem solver. You take deep pride in your work and view each new problem as an opportunity for success; you approach challenges creatively, but methodically, and are biased toward delivering high-value results quickly and within budget constraints considering all available options.A seasoned team player. You have learned from experience and are continuously striving to identify improvement opportunities; you’re focused on value and drive the right solution in spite of resistance or obstacles.Comfortable with ambiguity. You face change with a cool head and persevere even if you don’t have all the details; you’re comfortable moving between projects and facing the uncertain because risk and change motivates you to evolve and innovate.Technically astute. You rapidly learn new skills, grasping complicated technical information that often leaves others lost whether its product, industry, or hard tech knowledge, you absorb it quickly and are ready for more.Goal oriented. You enable informative decision making for the business most strategic initiatives thought deep analysis and unrelenting focus on process improvement; you connect business and technology strategies to the software you deliver and can easily articulate the value created. Basic Qualifications:5+ years in business systems analysis with at least 1 year of experience with large scale and complex systemsAbility to communicate and present technology concepts and solutions to business stakeholders at varying levelsAbility to identify risks and mitigation strategies throughout the projectExcellent communication and teamwork skills are essential with both internal and external resourcesProven track record of business acumen with product developmentExperience with multi-tiered architectures, including UI design, business rules layer, and basic data architectureProficient in SQL in order to research data and build analysis reportsProficient use of UML including one or more modeling tools in the business and information technology domains (e.g. Sparx Enterprise Architect, Modelio, and/or IBM Rational, or any other tool)Highly motivated individual to improve the skills and capabilities of the organizationAbility to learn about, understand and apply new technologies Preferred Qualifications:3-5 years of progressive experience in an IT related field2+ years of Project Management experience on small to moderate complex level projects is desirable2+ year experience supporting complex IT projects and/or IT Support Departments2+ year experience in project management of large IT initiativesExperience working in the digital media distribution space is preferred About Direct-to-Consumer and International:Comprised of Disney’s international media businesses and the Company’s various streaming services, the Direct-to-Consumer and International segment aligns technology, content and distribution platforms to expand the Company’s global footprint and deliver world-class, personalized entertainment experiences to consumers around the world. This segment is responsible for The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer businesses globally, including the ESPN+ sports streaming service, programmed in partnership with ESPN; the upcoming Disney-branded direct-to-consumer streaming service; and the Company’s ownership stake in Hulu. As part of the Direct-to-Consumer and International segment, Disney Streaming Services, developer of the ESPN+ and Disney-branded streaming platforms, oversees all consumer-facing digital technology and products across the Company.  About The Walt Disney Company: The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.  This position is with Disney Streaming Technology, LLC, which is part of a business segment we call Direct-to-Consumer and International.Disney Streaming Technology, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

Description: COMPANY OVERVIEW:Herbalife is a global nutrition company that has helped people pursue a healthy, active life since 1980. Our nutrition, weight-management and personal care products are available exclusively through dedicated independent Members in more than 80 countries. The Applications Analyst reviews, analyzes, develops, and modifies functional documentation for business applications. Name: Analyst, Health Care Consulting
Description: COPE Health Solutions is a national mission-driven consulting firm that partners with health system and payer clients and provides them with the tools, services and advice they need to be leaders in the health care industry. We are passionate about health care, with roots as a non-profit organization dedicated to providing health education to the underprivileged and underinsured. Today, as one of largest health care business advisory firms in the country, we continue to focus on improving the health of communities by helping clients with all aspects of strategy, population health management, CMS demonstrations, Medicaid redesign, and workforce development to transform health systems into coordinated, financially sustainable population health management systems.  The Analyst, Health Care Consulting is responsible for participating in internal and external consulting projects. This will involve hands-on work with clinic staff, providers, executives, vendors and other stakeholders to successfully implement innovative care models and improve health outcomes. The Analyst, Health Care Consulting will have the opportunity to gain practical experience and technical skills in health care management and clinical redesign. Position Description:Conduct strategic policy analysis directly related to CMS, Medicare, Medicaid, CMMI and related programsPerform financial and data analytics to support strategic planning in a wide variety of health care settingsPerform community data assessments to support the development of business plansSupport advanced financial analysis in the areas of hospital revenue cycles and predictive modelling for capitated models in managed carePlan, manage, and execute business analysis for consulting projects, company-wide activities, and business developmentConduct quantitative and qualitative analyses of business intelligence dataAssist in the development of proposals, project deliverables, white papers, and other business materialsMeet with assigned supervisor, executive members, and clients to maintain good communication regarding project work, goals, challenges, and expected outcomesAdditional responsibilities to be determined based on final candidate experience and interestsQualifications:B.A. or B.S. degree requiredHealth care policy background preferred and experience in the areas of CMS, Medicare, Medicaid, CMMI and related programsAbility to understand government payer systems preferredAbility to work effectively on multiple projects in a fast-paced environmentAbility to work well independently and in a team settingExcellent organization, interpersonal, oral and written communication skillsExcellent customer service skillsFlexibility to work on evenings and weekends as necessaryAbility to travel up to 80%Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Project Management)Benefits: As a firm passionate about health care, we’re deeply committed to the health and wellness of our own team members. We offer comprehensive, affordable insurance plans for our team and their families, and a host of other unique benefits, such as a yearly stipend for wellness-related activities, no cost gym memberships and a paid parental leave program. You can learn more about our benefits offerings here: https://copehealthsolutions.com/careers/why-cope-health-solutions/ To Apply: To apply for this position or for more information about COPE Health Solutions, visit us at https://copehealthsolutions.com/careers/open-positions/

Name: Quntitative Modeling & Analytics Analyst, Associate
Description: Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world (as ranked by S&P Global, April 2018) with total assets of over $2.9 trillion (106.2 (JPY) as of March 30, 2018) and 150,000 colleagues in more than 50 countries. In the U.S., we’re 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. We achieve this by delivering on our values, putting people first, fostering long-term relationships built on honesty and mutual understanding, and inspiring the best in each other. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Join a team that’s working to fulfill its vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group.Job Summary:The Quantitative Modeling & Analytics Analyst will be primarily focused on developing econometric models for balance and income forecasting. These models attempt to illuminate the relationship between macro-economic factors and interest rates with changes to assets or liabilities on the Bank’s balance sheet. Such models are used for Interest Rate Risk (IRR), scenario forecasting such as CCAR, and also for business planning and strategy. Post model development and validation, the analyst will own the implementation of models and analytical tools and be responsible for performance monitoring. The analyst will provide expertise and support to various lines of business and be responsible for ad hoc analysis as needed.The position requires work that is complex and varied by nature and includes a significant amount of attention to detail and flexibility to support management and regulatory reporting.Major Responsibilities:Own, manage and develop econometric modelsSupport processes associated with periodic Stress Testing (CCAR and DFAST)Contribute to the increased usage of Stress Test processes (increased frequency and usage for other purposes)Own, manage and develop regular monthly Interest Rate Risk (IRR) processes associated with Economic Value of Equity (EVE) and Earnings at Risk (EAR)Implement models and analytical tools Develop a deep understanding of the Bank's balance sheet, individual products and associated risksWork with management to craft strategies in the mitigation of Interest Rate Risk and other riskDemonstrate outstanding quantitative, communication and presentation skillsMaster’s degree in Financial Engineering or Financial Mathematics. A candidate with a Ph.D. in Statistics or Economics with appropriate experience in finance will also be considered.Familiarity with SAS, R or other statistical analysis software is required. SAS experience is highly preferred1-3 year’s work experience in modeling or financial analysis is preferredKnowledge and understanding of a bank’s balance sheet and individual financial instruments and regulatory requirementsCFA / FRM a plusKnowledge of MS Office Suite (emphasis on Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Visio) requiredExperience with Financial Database Systems such as Hyperion is preferred. Experience using SQL is required.QRM Enterprise Risk Framework experience highly desiredThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities duties and skills required of personnel so classified.We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.A conviction is not an absolute bar to employment. Factors such as the age of the offense, evidence of rehabilitation, seriousness of violation, and job relatedness are considered in all employment decisions. Additionally, it's the bank's policy to only inquire into a candidate's criminal history after an offer has been made. Federal law prohibits banks from employing individuals who have been convicted of, or received a pretrial diversion for, certain offenses.

Name: IRB/IACUC Analyst
Description: CSU Job Listing Details  Printable version  E-Mail this listing Campus: Northridge  Job ID: 7892 Job Title: IRB/IACUC Analyst Appointment Type: Probationary Time Base: Full-Time Date Posted: October 3, 2018 Closing Date: Open until filled Link to Apply Online: https://cmshr.csun.edu/psc/HNRPRD/EMPLOYEE/HRMS/c/HRS_HRAM.HRS_CE.GBL Campus Employment Homepage: http://www-admn.csun.edu/ohrs/ Description: IRB/IACUC Analyst (JID 7892)  Administrative Analyst/Specialist  Research and Graduate Studies  Full Time / $3288-$6162/mo.  CSUN's Commitment to You  CSUN is committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, learning and inclusion. Our values include a respect for all people, building partnerships with the community and the encouragement of innovation, experimentation and creativity. CSUN strives to cultivate a community in which a diverse population can learn and work in an atmosphere of civility and respect. CSUN is especially interested in candidates who make contributions to equity and inclusion in the pursuit of excellence for all members of the university community.  About the University  One of the largest universities in the country, California State University, Northridge (CSUN) is an urban, comprehensive university that delivers award-winning undergraduate and graduate programs to nearly 40,000 students annually and counts more than 330,000 alumni who elevate Southern California and beyond. Since its founding in 1958, CSUN has made a significant and long-term economic impact on California, generating nearly $1.9 billion in economic impact and more than 11,700 jobs each year. The LAEDC recognized CSUN as its 2015 Eddy Award winner for its positive economic impact. Serving more students on Pell Grants than any other institution in California, CSUN is also a social elevator and one of the most diverse universities in the country. CSUN ranks 13th in awarding bachelor's degrees to underrepresented minority students and seventh in bachelor's degrees to Latino students, serves the 13th largest Jewish student population, and enrolls the largest number of students who are Deaf and hard-of-hearing students of any U.S. state university. The journal Nature recently named CSUN a Rising Star for scientific research, and the NSF ranks CSUN in the top five nationally among similar institutions for graduates who go on to earn doctorates in the sciences. CSUN is where individuals rise. And through them, so does Greater Los Angeles and beyond.  Major Duties  Under general supervision, the Institutional Review Board/Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IRB/IACUC) Analyst reviews applications and protocols for the use of humans and/or animals in research. The incumbent conducts regulatory determinations of protocols, and monitors investigator compliance with IRB recommendations and contingent approvals; reviews grant, contract, and internal award materials for congruence and/or compliance; coordinates and meets with the institute's IRB and lACUC; conducts semi-annual inspections of campus animal research facilities; manages post-approval monitoring and compliance; maintains documents and records consistent with regulatory requirements and campus policies; is responsible for registrations and reports to governing agencies of !RB and IACUC; provides training, guidance and outreach on human subjects research and use of animals in research lo faculty, staff and students; maintains current knowledge of Federal, State and local governmental agency compliance regulations and requirements related to use of human subjects and animals in research and effectively communicates relevant information to IRB and IACUC members and the campus community; is responsible for developing and implementing guidelines and application processes for the university research community; and performs other duties as assigned. Qualifications Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university in a job-related field. Equivalent to two years of full-time, technical, analytical, or administrative experience. Additional experience in job-related field may be substituted for required education, on a year for year basis.  Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities  Working knowledge of general practices, program, and/or administrative specialty. Working knowledge of IRB and IACUC protocols. Ability and specialized skills to: interpret, and apply a wide variety of policies and procedures; perform basic research and statistical analysis; analyze data and make accurate projections using business mathematics and basic statistics; compile, write and present reports related to program or administrative specialty; communicate effectively both orally and in writing. Proficient in using standard office and financial software (Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)  Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule  The university offers an excellent benefits package.  The salary range for this classification is: $3288 - $6162 per month.  The anticipated HIRING RANGE: $3288 - $6162, dependent upon qualifications and experience.  HOURS: Full Time; 40 hours per week; 8:00am - 5:00pm, Monday through Friday.  REG: This is a Regular position with a one-year probationary period.  General Information  This position is a sensitive position as designated by the CSU.  A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for the position.  The person holding this position may be considered a 'mandated reporter' under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.  How To Apply  Candidates should apply by completing the CSUN on-line application utilizing: http://bit.ly/HRCSUN link. NOTE: Internal candidates should apply through the portal by accessing the View Job Openings/Apply link on the Human Resources/Employee pagelet.  Applications received through October 15, 2018, will be considered in the initial review and review of applications will continue until position is filled.  In order to be considered in the initial review, applications must be submitted prior to the date listed above. Application submissions received after the initial review date will be reviewed at the discretion of the University.  For more detailed information on the application and hiring process, please visit the link below:  www.csun.edu/careers  Equal Employment Opportunity  CSUN is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, and disability. Our nondiscrimination policy is set forth in CSU Executive Order 1096. Reasonable accommodations will be provided for applicants with disabilities who self-disclose by contacting Recruitment Services at ext. 2101.SDL2017

Name: Financial Systems Project Analyst
Description: Tracking Code  3423  Job DescriptionLatham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Financial Systems Project Analyst to join our winning team, located in our Global Services Office in downtown Los Angeles. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.  The Financial Systems Project Analyst will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.  As a Financial Systems Project Analyst at Latham, you will coordinate new and existing project efforts for various accounting and finance systems and business processes. You will assist the Financial Project Manager in managing day-to-day operational aspects of finance-related projects while accomplishing these and other critical functions: Coordinating projects and helping to manage the system development life cycle; reviewing, clarifying, and/or testing deliverables prepared by the financial team before providing the final product to stakeholdersReviewing, documents, and coordinating across departments to develop efficient procedures and methods to increase productivity by streamlining processesWorking with functional managers and supervisors to create, implement, and document project specifications, project plans, and business processes and proceduresUpdating, modifying, testing, and/or repairing existing software systems and proposing innovative solutions to problemsProviding functional and technical analysis and documentation related to the design, development, and implementation of software systems and reportsParticipating in the development of test strategies, tools, and systemsMaintaining and supporting existing Finance and Accounting applications, including but not limited to; Chrome River Expense & Invoice, Clarity Financial Planning and Reporting System, and Elite - 3E Financial SystemActing as project lead for Finance & Accounting sponsored projects ranging in scope and complexityActing as liaison between the Accounting and Finance and Technology departmentsAssisting with projects on various issues when neededPromoting effective work practices, working as a team member, and showing respect for co-workers As a Financial Systems Project Analyst, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Financial Systems Project Analyst must be highly proficient in Microsoft applications, such as Excel, Word and PowerPoint. The Analyst must also display solid working knowledge of MS Project or Visio. Strong knowledge of developing and supporting Microsoft Excel VBA is preferred. The ability to lead and drive complex operational projects is desired, as well as the ability to manage multiple competing priorities in a time-sensitive and high-pressure environment.  A Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Accounting, Engineering, Management or a related field is required. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus. At least six (6) years of related experience leading projects is required.  Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.  Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.  Latham & Watkins LLP will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance.  For information regarding family care and medical leave (CFRA), click here.Job Location  Los Angeles, California, United States  Department  Office Accounting  Position Type  Full-Time/Regular

Name: Analyst, Business Data (E) - Transplant Administration - FT 8 Hour Days - Exempt
Description: The Transplant Business Analyst is responsible for timely processing of invoices, posting charges, reviewing claims for possible errors, confirming diagnosis codes relating to transplant evaluations. This individual insures that appropriate charges are transferred to organ acquisition for the Medicare Cost Report. Manages the accounting and payment of organ acquisition expenses. Conducts monthly review of all transplant department cost center accounts to assure appropriate allocation of pre transplant, post transplant and non-transplant expenses. Tracks the number of and type of organs donated and provided to the organ procurement organization. Keeps and provides records to cost accounting for annual filing of Medicare report.Completes monthly variance analysis on continuous financial planning reports. Reconciles month end financial reports and clinic charges daily. Provides continuous oversight of billing and collections for process improvement opportunities. Participates in quality initiatives. Minimum Education: -Bachelor's degree requiredMinimum Experience/Knowledge: -3-5 years of experience in healthcare-Ability to prioritize multiple projects at the same time-Excellent communication skills to interface with internal and external customers-Ability to work independently.

Name: Hospital Technical Analyst - Procurement
Description: The University of Southern California (USC) has established a Workday Financials deployment program covering our academic enterprise as well as our hospitals. This program is critical to USC's overall goals to improve administrative efficiency. Workday Financials will be paired with the existing Workday HR and Payroll solutions implemented in 2013.  We are currently seeking a Hospital Technical Analyst Procurement (IT Business Analyst) to join our Workday Financials deployment program team. The Hospital Technical Analyst of Procurement will be responsible for ensuring that the overall Workday solutions meet the business requirements. This includes requirements gathering, solution design, build, test, and deployment. Design will involve extrapolating from requirements the fundamental needs of the business while leveraging the most efficient solution provided by Workday. In some cases, we expect to challenge and optimize current business process.  The ideal candidate must possess 2 years of business analyst experience with a sound understanding of project management methodologies, business process flow, and documentation procedures. Experience with large enterprise software projects, Workday or other Financial ERP solutions and within Higher Education/Healthcare are strongly preferred.  This is a fixed-term position with an anticipated end date of December 31, 2021 Please note that this is a full-time role eligible for benefits, including medical, dental, and vision plans. What You'll Do:Facilitate design workshops and work closely with business owners to gather and document user stories within USC's tracking softwareTranslate user stories into detailed requirements and Workday use casesWork with project leadership and business owners to adapt requirements with an eye for business process optimizationDevelop subject matter expertise for assigned business and associated system functionalityWork collaboratively in an iterative agile 'style' environmentWork with project team members and consultants to configure the applicationHelp manage execution of the testing strategyAssist project team members in the design of new (or redesign of existing) integrationsDraft project documentation including configuration manuals and business cases (e.g., white paper, policy challenges) supporting the escalation of business decisionsMeet with customer groups to determine IT business requirements specifically supporting health careElicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.Provide information to developers and subject matter experts for the establishment of the technical vision and performance needsServe as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development or business process re-engineering team through which requirements flowParticipate in project meetings to review project deliverables and timelines.Work with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of projectParticipate in testing developed software or new process flowWork with the health system IT personnel to map conversion data, capture integration requirements, and help manage the integration design and development processPerform other duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any timeThe Must Haves:Bachelor's degree in business administration, organization development, communication or related discipline2 years of business analysis experienceStrong knowledge and understanding of project management methodologies, business process flow, and documentation procedures Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and toolsStrong oral and written communication skillsAbility to multitask, interact with multiple stakeholders and navigate changing priorities.Ability to work on moderately complex programming activities under supervision of senior IT Business AnalystExperience supporting procurement administrative business processesThe Nice to Haves:3-5 years of business analyst experience focused on large enterprise software projects or supportSome experience working within a Higher Education and/or Health Care industryExperience with Workday or other Financial ERP solutions through on-going support or deploymentBenefits: USC benefits include a choice of retirement programs, 12 paid vacation days per year, 12 paid sick days per year, university holidays, a choice of medical and dental plans, and discounts to football games, basketball games, and other campus events.  Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree, Combined experience/education as substitute for minimum education  Minimum Experience: 2 years, Combined education/experience as substitute for minimum experience  Minimum Field of Expertise: Sound knowledge of documentation procedures, project management methodologies, program flow charts and operator instructions. Competent to work on moderately complex programming activities under supervision of senior IT Business Analyst.  USC is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law or USC policy. USC will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring ordinance. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Applicants with questions about access or requiring a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should contact USC Human Resources by phone at (213) 821-8100, or by email at uschr@usc.edu. Inquiries will be treated as confidential to the extent permitted by law.  Read USC's Clery Act Annual Security Report  Required Legal Notices  Certain positions are subject to background screening  If you are a current USC employee, please apply to this USC job posting in Workday by copying and pasting this link into your browser:  https://wd5.myworkday.com/usc/d/inst/1$9925/9925$24968.htmldSDL2017

Name: Data Analyst Manager
Description: OUR CLIENT Headquartered in Los Angeles, our client has more than 30 years of history serving multi-ethnic customers across the United States. It has over $13 billion in total assets. It operates more than 60 full-service branches in California, Washington, Texas, Illinois, New York, New Jersey, Virginia, Georgia and Alabama. They specialize in business banking products for small and medium-sized businesses, with an emphasis in commercial real estate and commercial lending, SBA lending and international trade financing.
