Name: Data/Business Analyst
Description: Do you enjoy working with numbers? Want to drive smarter business decisions using quantitative and qualitative analysis? Do you excel at working collaboratively with all parts of a company to accelerate the growth of a fast-moving company? If so, Commercial Real Estate Exchange, Inc. (CREXi) is looking for a Business Analyst to be part of the Data/Analytics team. This position will touch all parts of the business with the objective of scaling the use of analytics to drive CREXi forward.  CREXi is a forward-looking marketplace in the CRE space that brings brokers, buyers and principals together to transact online. Through collaboration with brokers and principals, CREXi blends technology with the fundamentals of CRE transactions, addressing the shifting needs of industry professionals to maximize revenue and minimize time spent on administrative tasks. RESPONSIBILITIES: - Use data to drive actionable insights across all parts of the business  - Work cross-functionality across multiple departments including: Sales, Marketing, Product, Engineering, Operations, and Finance  - Identify and analyze key metrics for the business  - Build dashboards that effectively articulate your analysis  - Use data to build out future CREXis revenue plan  - Conduct ad hoc analysis to support product and company decisions  - Work both independently and collaboratively to deliver creative solutions to complex problems REQUIREMENTS: - Bachelors degree in an analytical field (e.g. Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science)  - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience using data and providing business insights  - Three to five years of experience in a data-focused role  - Experience with SQL, Python, R, SPSS, SAS, Matlab, etc. preferred  - Flexibility in working in a constantly changing and fast-paced culture  - Experience with Tableau or Looker, preferred ABOUT CREXi CREXi brokers have access to a suite of innovative, easy-to-use tools to manage the entire sales process from listing to close within the platform. With an extensive network of buyers and principals who visit the platform, CREXi gives brokers the ability to find, manage and qualify leads, market their properties with customizable emails, and communicate with interested parties through in-app messaging. CREXi buyers can browse through thousands of properties with smart search filters, view due diligence documents, schedule in-person tours, submit digital LOIs, offers and much more.  A team of 47 and growing rapidly, CREXi was founded in January 2015 and launched its online platform 10 months later in October 2015. The CREXi team brings of a diverse set of backgrounds including commercial real estate, technology, social media, data and analytics to the CRE industry. The company prides itself on its transparent culture and encourages its employees to think bold, take risks, work hard and embrace ownership. CREXi is headquartered in Marina Del Rey, California.

Name: Business Product Analyst
Description: Job Title Business Product Analyst Department MMNA Parts Pricing & Admin - 240 Job DescriptionMitsubishi Motors North America, the fastest growing  non-luxury brand in the United States, is seeking an experienced Parts Planning  Senior Specialist. As the Sr. Specialist, you will be responsible for  coordinating Parts and Accessory sales planning activities with Mitsubishi  Motors Corporation (Japan corporate office), including analyzing information to  determine risks and opportunities to increase Sales and profit. Major tasks  include coordination of new Alliance reporting for KPI management, dealer dispersion,  USFT, and GMS & GAS month-end sales reporting.  ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:  Coordinate Parts & Accessory Sales planning activities  with MMC and Alliance.  Analyze business information and determine risks and  opportunities to improve business results and increase Fixed Operations Sales  and Profit.  Assist in the preparation of strategic and competitive  planning, including building financial business cases to target  investment in new localization products. Proposals to include product research,  product specification, product packaging, financial business plan and  development schedule.  Prepare monthly strategic reports and presentation for Fixed  Operations management, MMC Global Aftersales dept, and Alliance  Coordinate new Alliance reporting for KPI management, dealer  dispersion, USFT (Upstream Strategic Functional Task), and GMS & GAS  month-end sales reporting.  Develop Fiscal Year Dealer Parts & Accessory Financial  Objectives and Field Sales performance reporting for management. QUALIFICATIONS: 5-7 years of progressive professional level experience  including financial, sales analysis, and forecasting background.  BA/BS in Business Administration, Accounting, economics,  Statistics, Quantitative Analysis, or equivalent combination of education  and/or work experience.  Strong verbal / written / presentation communication skills.  Moderate knowledge of mathematical, statistical, and  quantitative models.  Advance Microsoft Office skills (Excel, word, PowerPoint and  Access DB)  Moderate knowledge of automotive technical information  Possibility of some travel to dealers, vendors, field  offices, up to 10%  Mitsubishi Motors North America is responsible for the  manufacturing, distributing and marketing of Mitsubishi brand sedans and  crossover utility vehicles through a network of hundreds of dealers throughout  the United States. When you join Mitsubishi Motors North America, you’ll be  part of a team that is committed to continuous investment in innovative new  technologies, attractive design and product development, bringing exciting and  authentic new vehicles to customers around the world.

Name: Consultant/Senior Consultant, Life Sciences
Description: KEY RESPONSIBILITIESPromidian is a life sciences strategy consultancy. We are actively looking for Consultants and Senior Consultants to help support the rapid growth and expansion of the firm. Primary responsibilities for the positions include:Work closely within engagement teams and with clients to: lead primary and secondary research; develop logical and insightful qualitative and quantitative analyses; create innovative and effective recommendations; and develop well-structured, high-quality deliverablesOwn work streams for and present significant portions of client deliverablesTake increasing responsibility in the development and management of external relationships (e.g., client, vendor, external experts)Coach junior team members and serve as a thought partner to colleaguesRealize high levels of client satisfactionAssist in developing intellectual capitalPlay an active role in practice developmentHelp in pursuing new business development opportunitiesQUALIFICATIONSQualifications for the position include:Demonstrated track record of success in executing and delivering strategy consulting engagements to life sciences companies—or in the healthcare industry (required)Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint (required)Undergraduate degree from a top-tier institution with a relevant concentration (e.g., business, economics, life sciences) and strong academic record (required)Advanced degree(s) (e.g., MBA, PhD, MD) (preferred)A strong passion for and understanding of dynamics and issues in the biopharma industry (required)WHAT MAKES PROMIDIAN UNIQUEThe WorkWork on intriguing and challenging projects with executives from a wide range of leading pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies The OpportunityBe part of building something special—an up-and-coming consulting firm that aspires to develop a reputation for being the best in its fieldRealize the opportunity for earlier exposure to—and involvement in—a wide array of areas that isn’t typically possible at other firmsWork in a true meritocracy—where you are recognized and rewarded for your contributionsBe given the chance for rapid advancement in a fast-growing, entrepreneurial firm The CultureBe part of a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environmentBe surrounded by—and work with—bright and highly motivated professionals who are focused on and committed to the overall success of the firmWork with colleagues who are committed to—and invested in—your professional development and successBe part of an environment where there’s a mutual sense of responsibility and obligation to support each otherWork in an environment where people don’t take themselves too seriously, and successes are regularly celebrated

Name: Security Policy Analyst
Description: Security Policy Analyst El Segundo, CA*US Citizenship Required** Do you thrive on scouring and scrutinizing documents? Is attention to detail important to your work? Are you motivated by the thought of supporting our nation's security? If you want to take the next step in your career by joining a team of talented security engineers and analysts working for a company that is making a difference in the world, Parsons has the opportunity for you! We are currently seeking communications and documents security specialists to help us deliver best-in-class services to our federal government client.  You will join a team that ensures appropriate security principles, concepts, methods, and practices are applied during the system life cycle to achieve stakeholder objectives for the protection of assets-across all forms of adversity characterized as disruptions, hazards, and threats. The communications and policy specialist provides review and basis of evidence to support decision makers for system and system security engineering acquisition activities.  Responsibilities : Review, research, verify, and validate official government documents, including acquisition documents , for thoroughness and completeness ; resolve conflicts within government documents for full compliance with applicable standards; Coordinate and communicate between internal and external government agencies to complete projects; Provide full administrativeand security support services to executive DoD staff ; Schedule executive-level appointments and meetings ; Type reports and routine correspondence from dictation or written sources ; Attend meetings and arrange for the distribution of the minutes . Experience and Education Requirements : A minimum of 2 years of experience in compliance research and documentation (i.e. federal contracts administration, accounting, paralegal services, acquisition security, etc.) ; A minimum of a BA/BS degree (security studies, public policy, legal studies, or business degree preferred); Paralegal experience is highly preferred ; Familiarity with querying and training an artificial intelligence tool for research purposes ; Knowledge of Systems Security Engineering (SSE) documentation (e.g. Program Protection Plans (PPPs) ) ; Federal g overnment acquisition experience desired ; Active security clearance is required. Applicants selected for employment will be subject to a federal background investigation and must meet additional eligibility requirements for access to classified information or materials.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.  We’re looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to join Snap Inc! You’ll drive financial planning, analysis, and reporting as well as partner with business leaders to grow Snapchat. Working from our Los Angeles, CA headquarters, you’ll be responsible for building out and managing financial planning and analysis processes. We’re looking for someone with the highest performance standards who can execute well and flourish in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment while adhering to our company values. We find creative solutions to complex problems in an environment where our actions are guided by our key values of kind, smart, and creative. What you’ll do:Drive internal discussions around near-term and long-term financial planning. Your work will help our executives make critical decisionsPartner with Snap Inc.'s various business divisions to create near and long-term forecasts, identify key performance drivers, and present analysis to our division leaders to drive meaningful actionBuild and maintain a consolidated financial model to be used for monthly forecast and annual budget cyclesAnalyze variances between actuals and forecasts, and use insights to drive meaningful action and communicate complex issues in a clear and concise wayBuild, and help to evaluate, business cases and strategies to drive long term growth, optimize cost structures, and deliver new product experiences to customersWork on building/expanding financial and operational reporting capabilities that provide Snap Inc.’s executive leadership key insights about the business and help drive the right business decisionsPartner with Accounting and other teams to complete projects efficiently and effectivelyTackle complex financial projects to drive growth within our business divisionsOur finance team members are expected to be active contributors to the leadership and management of our business for the betterment of our customers and long run business successMinimum qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in economics, finance, or related field3+ years of experiencePreferred qualifications:MBAAdvanced Excel modeling & analytical skillsStrong track-record of business partnership, financial planning, and analytical experienceExperience implementing systems and processesA detail-oriented personality with business acumen and the ability to influenceAbility to dive-deep and take complete ownership of complex projects and handle competing priorities while doing soExperience with complex financial planning processes and financial statement consolidationAbility to parse complex financial analysis into meaningful communications for business leadersStrong communication skills including the ability to effectively convey financial analysis in both written format and verballyA team player who’s willing to get their hands dirty and help where neededA passion for Snapchat and creativity!At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don’t be shy and contact us ataccommodations-ext@snap.com.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description Esterline Technologies Corporation  Job Summary - Business Systems / Database Analyst  The Business Systems / Database Analyst role is to develop new technology solutions to enable business growth and innovation, enhance efficiencies in current ERP (Infor Syteline), PLM, SharePoint and other business critical software systems, and also support integration, reporting, and data integrity.  What You Will Do Serves as a MS SQL database analyst and developer.Develops SSRS and Crystal reports as business required.Develops, updates, and maintains Syteline and other business systems.Troubleshoots Syteline errors and performance issues as they arise.Performs daily maintenance and monitoring of Syteline to ensure data integrity and uptime including backup, restore, and user access managementUpdates, documents and maintains all internal procedures related to the use of Syteline and other business systems.Tests and installs new releases or modules as required.Maintains all business unit databases.Identifies areas for improvement within the existing business processes.Supports the organizational vision and mission.Promotes the use of change management and configuration control to maintain the data integrity.Ensures that governance and legislative controls are applied correctly and properly within the business unit. Meets IT general controls requirements for SOX.Performs other duties, as IT management and services deem necessary. Strategy & Planning Assists or develops long-term strategic goals for development databases and production databases in conjunction with data owners and business managers. Acquisition & Deployment Conducts research and makes recommendations on databases, services, protocols, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts. Operational Management Responds to and resolves business systems support issues.Monitors business systems performances, including stored procedures and execution time, and implement efficiency improvements.Creates, or supports creation of, required reports in response to business user needs.Establishes appropriate end-user business systems access control levels.Performs business systems security audits.Performs business process analysis and implements streamline plans. What You Will Bring BA or BS in Computer Science or related field.Three years of experience in MS SQL management and development is required.One to three years of experience in Syteline or any ERP management is preferred.One to three years of experience in Business Intelligence, or Data warehouse is preferred.Good knowledge of the following disciplines: MS SQL Server, Reporting tools including Crystal Reports and SSRS, ERP, SharePoint, .NET, XML, System Integration.Good understanding of business processes. Aerospace or Manufacturing industry experience is preferred.Experience using development tools such as Visual Studio, SSMS.Must have intermediate skill level using Microsoft Office.Knowledge of IT General Controls as it relates to SOX audits.Troubleshooting experience.Good understanding of the organization's goals and objectivesProject management experience is a plus.Excellent communication skills required.Ideal candidate will be a self-starter who can work without direct supervisionDexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, power tools, and to handle other computer components.SDL2017

Name: Sr. Business Data Analyst, Data Analytics & Insights
Description: Job Title Sr. Business Data Analyst, Data Analytics & Insights  27-Sep-2018 Business Segment Operations & Technology Responsibilities As a Sr. Business Data Analyst for the Data Analytics & Insights team, you will support and help drive educated decisions and operational excellence for West Coast Studio Operations (production services, post production, lighting & grip, property, wardrobe/costume, transportation, finance, and IT). You will be responsible for creating, maintaining and automating operational metrics and reports used in translating data into actionable insights, provide recommendations and support implementation and ROI assessment of cross functional projects / initiatives and operational processes targeted to reduce cost, raise OCF margins, and optimize the client experience. In collaboration with more senior members of the team, you will participate in and support internal client engagements to identify analytical requirements and assist in implementing systems to capture business operation information for ongoing operations and strategic initiatives. Performs business analysis using various techniques, including statistical analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling, data mining.Collect business requirements and define operating metrics / KPIs. Provide timely and accurate reports, dashboards, KPIs, operational scorecards, and other leading indicators that report historical performance, as well as provide insight into future trends.Create data requirements, dictionaries and ensure that data coming into the system is clean and accurate, and maintain ongoing data hygiene.Consolidate large amounts of data from multiple source systems and design tools to aid in the analysis and consumption of this data, as well as continually work to optimize internal reporting tools.Perform ad hoc data research, put discovered data together, and organize it so that it’s ready to analyze.Support the creation of presentations for operational reviews and strategic initiatives across organizational teams from diverse backgrounds and levels of responsibility.Job Number43835BRPosting Category Studio Technical Operations Country United States Sub-Business West Coast Studio Ops About Us At NBCUniversal, we believe in the talent of our people. It’s our passion and commitment to excellence that drives NBCU’s vast portfolio of brands to succeed. From broadcast and cable networks, news and sports platforms, to film, world-renowned theme parks and a diverse suite of digital properties, we take pride in all that we do and all that we represent. It’s what makes us uniquely NBCU. Here you can create the extraordinary. Join us. State/Province California Career Level Experienced Qualifications/RequirementsMinimum 2-4 years of experience in business analytics, business planning or operations, solving operational/data problems, building business requirements and standardizing business reporting and processes.Bachelor's degree or higher in Business, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics is preferred.High proficiency in data analysis, modeling and reporting. Ability to define problem, collect data, and provide creative solutions.Methodical and process oriented with superior attention to detail and strong organization skills.Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities, projects, ad hoc assignments, and deadlines.Proficient in MS Office with advanced expertise in Microsoft Excel, SQL and Tableau. Skilled in developing PowerPoint presentations that effectively communicate ideas using graphs, charts, and other data visualization techniques.Knowledgeable in SQL and/or Business Objects tools and technical aptitude to advance skillset for ad-hoc queries.Desired CharacteristicsPrior experience working with JIRA and Confluence, QlikView and NPrinting technologies.Knowledge of Studio departments, workflows, functions, and technologies.Experience in Supply Chain, Operations Management, Film & Broadcast Technology, Engineering or related field.Experience working with information technology systems, specifically databases and enterprise reporting tools.City Universal City Notices NBCUniversal’s policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, where applicable.

Name: IRB Analyst I
Description: Summary of Essential Job Duties:  The IRB Analyst performs a detailed analysis of all applications submitted for IRB review. The IRB Analyst reviews each submission, verifying that all institutional requirements have been met, and determining whether applicable regulations and policies are appropriately addressed. The IRB Analyst must consider the nature of the proposed research, make a determination regarding the necessary review process, and share this recommendation with the IRB reviewers. The IRB Analyst attends IRB meetings to provide technical support and guidance on regulatory matters. The IRB Analyst documents the Board’s determinations in the drafting of comprehensive meeting minutes and correspondence to investigators that effectively outline the concerns, rationale, and technical questions of the IRB. The IRB Analyst is also responsible for conducting evaluations of investigator’s response to identify potential issues for IRB reviewers and advise as to whether the requirements for IRB approval have been met. The IRB Analyst is responsible for documenting the review process thorough complete and timely entries in WEBRIDGE, the IRB online submission and protocol tracking system.     The IRB Analyst is the primary point of contact with the research community. Utilizing expertise in regulatory matters and IRB policies, the IRB Analyst assists investigators in the preparation of their IRB applications and informed consent forms.     The IRB Analyst participates in departmental quality improvement activities by identifying needs in department operations and making recommendations for their improvement.Educational Requirements:  A Bachelor’s degree, with a minimum of 2-3 years experience in a structured business office. A working knowledge of the federal regulations governing human subjects research is preferred. A certification of “Certified IRB Professional” is preferred.  License/Certification/Registration Requirements:  Experience:  Physical Demands: (e.g., lifting, standing, walking)  Physical ability and perceptive acuity to perform functions.

Name: Quantitative Portfolio Analyst
Description: The Quantitative Portfolio Analyst will support the development and implementation of quantitative models related to credit risk and stress testing in the commercial C&I and CRE portfolios. This position will develop and maintain the internal PD and LGD databases and will integrate external data relevant to the Bank's loan portfolio. Working with IT and Credit Administration this position will be responsible for improving data quality for regulatory and modeling purposes and will develop dual credit ratings models for obligors and facilities In addition, this position will conduct PD migration analyses and back testing of credit risk models and will participate in creating models to stress test credit portfolios.  These models will inform and support decisions for Credit, Finance, and Treasury related to Economic Capital, allowance for loan losses and stress testing. This position will assist in the quantification and analysis of credit risk using data driven statistical methodology, interpreting findings, identifying solutions to optimize risk/return equation and developing presentations to senior management. Responsibilities Database Management Maintain PD rating history for the commercial portfolio and ensuring its accuracyMaintain and update internal LGD databases, help with internal data validationWork with the IT group to improve data quality for regulatory and modeling purposesDevelop databases for future EAD modeling across various Commercial portfoliosDesign and maintain databases of obligor and facility specific attributesAutomate multiple data extractions and manipulations Quantitative Risk Modeling Develop and maintain Dual Rating System (PD, LGD, EAD)Develop credit stress testing modelsSupport portfolio models such as Credit Manager and PPR CompassPerform migration analyses, building transition matricesDevelop and implement stress scenarios for use in the economic capital and ALLL methodologies General Risk Management Improvements Keep abreast of industry best practice standards for credit risk measurement and stress testingAssist in benchmarking risk capital (economic and regulatory) to other institutionsAssist in developing and maintaining loan pricing modelsSupport ad-hoc Line of business requests for quantitative modelingBasic Qualifications*Bachelor's degree or minimum 5 years equivalent experience in a risk quantitative position required.*Knowledge of standard modeling techniques (cross sectional and time series)*Minimum 1 year technical experience obtaining information from disparate sources, including production and ad hoc systems, linking and analyzing the information, performing data integrity checks and exploratory data analysis required.*Minimum 1 year experience with SAS, R, Stata or other modeling software requiredAdvanced degree in statistics/finance/economics or other quantitative fieldExperience in statistical/econometric modeling and database managementDatabase experience, SQL. VBA experience highly desiredExperience in developing/validating risk rating models, evaluating financial ratios, and using default prediction tools for commercial portfoliosModeling in R, Stata, SAS, Eviews or StatisticaStrong background or practical experience in statistical or econometric modeling, model validation, Basel II requirements, economic capital and stress testing methodologiesExperience in macroeconomic forecasting, credit risk forecasting and incorporating macroeconomic variables in credit risk modelsAbility to build strong relationships with peers, line of business managers and colleagues across the BankTo be considered for this position you must at least meet the basic qualifications.City National Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer -- Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans.Note: This preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.Note: Candidates should be advised that City National Bank does not pay interviewee travel expenses or relocation expenses for candidates who are hired unless previously agreed. #LI-NK1 Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Name: CB Analyst I - Middle Market Banking & Specialized Industries
Description: Commercial Banking – Middle Market Banking & Specialized Industries Full-Time Analyst ProgramStart your career working alongside our seasoned professionals, building long-term relationships and providing clients with access to our world-class banking solutions.Who we areThe Middle Market Banking & Specialized Industries (MMBSI) group at J.P. Morgan focuses on companies with annual revenues of $20 million to $500 million, municipalities, and not-for-profit entities requiring both traditional banking services (lending and cash management) as well as investment banking products (including debt and equity capital markets, risk management derivatives, and corporate finance advisory). With over 100 locations, our local delivery model, coupled with the firm’s global resources, allows us to provide clients with customized, comprehensive solutions and exceptional service. How we’re organizedMMBSI is organized into 5 regional groups (Northeast, Midwest, South, Southeast and West) and a variety of industry segments, including, but not limited to, Agribusiness, Life Sciences, Government, Healthcare, Higher Education, Not-for-profit and Technology.Full-time Analysts supporting our regional groups will work with MMBSI Bankers and Product Partners (including Credit, Asset-Based Lending, Treasury Services and International Banking) who cover a variety of industries to provide a range of financing solutions and strategic advisory.Full-Time Analysts supporting our industry groups will work with MMBSI Bankers and Product Partners (Credit, Asset-Based Lending, Treasury Services and Investment Banking coverage) to provide industry-specific expertise, solutions and advisory.What you can expectOur Full-Time Analyst Program will provide you with an introduction to client management, credit structuring and product sales over the course of the program to ultimately position yourself to have a successful and rewarding career in Commercial Banking.You’ll begin with an intensive training program where you will learn about our products and services, clients and business practices. Under the leadership of our lending and training professionals, you will gain in-depth knowledge of accounting, commercial banking, underwriting, financial statement analysis, cash flow analysis and credit structuring. The program uses a full range of teaching methods such as lectures, team exercises, exams and case studies.After completing the initial training program, you will begin your first role in one of the following areas, where you will continue to receive periodic training and gain hands-on experience, working alongside senior professionals to support our clients.Placement areasBanking – You’ll work with relationship bankers to identify, develop and market solutions for corporates, municipalities and not-for-profit entities and build client management skills Credit Markets – You’ll gain firsthand knowledge of and exposure to product sales and work with product specialists to bring customized, comprehensive solutions to clients and prospects. Credit Market sub-groups include: Asset Based Lending, Equipment Finance, Employee Stock Ownership Plan Advisory Group and Syndicated Finance Treasury Services – You’ll work with Treasury Services executives to market and deliver cash management, trade, liquidity and commercial card solutions to our corporate clients International Banking – You’ll support local and overseas colleagues to help clients establish and manage their international operations by identifying the products and services that best meet their needs Risk – You’ll works alongside seasoned risk officers to analyze client performance and capital structure. You will assist in assessing the risks in our client portfolio, managing the portfolio (i.e. annual renewals, modifications, managing the credit metrics), and meeting deadlines associated with financing requests Analysts in MMBSI are placed in strategic markets throughout the country. Over the course of the program, analysts will reside in one office in roles that support the broader segment. Upon successful completion of the program, analysts will be eligible for associate level positions in Commercial Banking across the country. About YouWe are looking for candidates who have an interest in corporate banking and enjoy working with people, building relationships and providing the best customer experience.Key qualifications:Must have prior formal credit trainingMinimum GPA of 3.2Coursework in business, finance, or accounting a plusExceptional verbal and written communication skillsExcellent problem solving and critical thinking skillsStrong attention to detailAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative work environmentAuthorization to work permanently in the U.S.

with Oracle R12 Experience with development and delivery of system documentations, such as requirements documents, test plans, and design documents Look for opportunities and make recommendations for views, Cursors and Materialized views for processing data.Write simple to complex queries to support audit requests or business partners’ reporting requestsExperience utilizing tools such as Data loader, PLSQL, BI Publisher, OAF, SQL Developer, and TOADYour PlatformActivision Blizzard and Activision Publishing are headquartered in Santa Monica, California. Name: Budget Analyst
Description: Accountemps is looking for a temporary Financial Analyst to join a fast-growing company. In this position, you will conduct financial modeling on various financial products as well as measure, analyze and forecast performance in conjunction with operating plans. Additional duties include be responsible for advising management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives and preparing reports for management. You will be a part of a dynamic team being a key business partner in areas such as forecasting, performance reporting, and expense management.  ? Seeking a highly flexible individual comfortable with large amounts of information, and adept at managing expectations  ? Supporting weekly, quarterly and annual Area/Segment level Bookings and P L forecasting  ? Analyzing performance to date and assessing potential risks and opportunities  ? Understanding and explaining internal and external drivers impacting performance and trending  ? Learning and applying econometric and statistical methods to forecasting  ? Enabling effective Business Intelligence (BI) to provide forward-looking insight and decision support  ? Provide analytical support during New Year readiness/Year End planning cycle  ? Drive the strategy and business planning process  ? Become embedded within the Marketing and Customer Success organizations. Establish trust and quickly understand the key drivers of the business, economic trends and core metrics  ? Work with senior executives on strategic deep dives by developing financial models and insights on topics such as: Retention forecasts, Campaign Planning Tracking, return on investment of strategic investments, event tracking and execution, strategic resource allocation and prioritization  ? Work closely with cross-functional partners in Accounting, Recruiting, People and Operations to execute against plans  If you are interested in this position, please send your resume to Raymond.Teh@Accountemps.com

Name: Strategy Insights & Planning Associate Consultant
Description: ZS is the world’s largest consulting firm focused exclusively on helping companies improve overall performance and grow revenue and market share, through end-to-end sales and marketing solutions – from customer insights and strategy to analytics, operations and technology. From our worldwide offices, ZS experts draw on deep industry and domain expertise to help companies make smarter decisions quickly and cost effectively. We are particularly known for our strong presence in the pharmaceutical and health care sectors, yet work across a range of industries.ZS's Business Consulting group delivers solutions to a broad spectrum of marketing and sales challenges. We also help our clients transform their marketing and sales organizations to implement these solutions. Our solutions and recommendations are based in rigorous research and analysis underpinned by deep expertise and thought leadership.STRATEGY INSIGHTS & PLANNING ASSOCIATE CONSULTANTStrategy Insights & Planning Associate Consultants (SIPACs) create and deliver solutions for our clients and project teams. SIPACs leverage their analytic, synthesis and communication skills to derive insights and solve business problems. In particular, SIPAs apply problem-solving frameworks to client issues, support clients in change initiatives and employ standard analytic techniques to help guide client decisions.Responsibilities:• Leverage problem solving skills and frameworks to develop solutions to client business problems;• Structure and conduct market research and/or desk research to derive insights and inform client decision making;• Design custom analyses using tools like Excel, Access, Confirmit and ZS's proprietary software;• Synthesize and communicate results to clients and ZS teams through oral and written presentations;• Develop client relationships and serve as key point of contact on aspects of projects;• Provide client and ZS teams project status updates;• Create project deliverables and implement solutions;• Advance problem solving skills and improve ZS's capabilities;• Guide and mentor Associates on teams.Qualifications:• Bachelor's or master's degree required in any discipline with strong academic performance in analytic and quantitative coursework (business, economics, marketing, psychology, physical or life sciences, engineering, applied mathematics, statistics or relevant fields);• 2-4 years of relevant post-collegiate job experience. A PhD may substitute in lieu of work experience;• High motivation, good work ethic, maturity and personal initiative;• Strong oral and written communication skills;• Empathy, adaptability and high personal impact;• Close attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset;• Self-discipline for planning and organizing tasks;• Aptitude for, and enjoyment of, team leadership.ZS is a global consulting firm; fluency in English is required, additional fluency in at least one European or Asian language is desirable. Candidates must possess work authorization for their intended country of employment. An on-line application, including a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered.ZS Associates offers a competitive compensation package with salary and bonus incentives, complete medical/dental/life insurance programs and retirement benefits. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.Connect with ZS on social media:Like ZS Careers on FacebookFollow ZS Careers on Twitter and InstagramFollow ZS on LinkedIn for more job opportunitiesSubscribe to the ZS YouTube ChannelZS has been recognized globally for its expertise in consulting and its flexible work environment. View ZS’s accolades.

Name: Operations Analyst - Senior Associate
Description: What do you get when you bring together the brightest minds and place them into an exciting, fast-paced environment that fosters intellectual growth and rewards based on impact, not tenure?  You get one of the fastest growing consulting companies in the United States. While we may be a new name in consultancy, we were born from a storied one. Guidehouse was founded in 2018 as an evolution of PwC Public Sector with a mission to help our clients deliver on their mission; providing bold new strategies that catalyze transformative results across all ends of the enterprise. We embrace brilliance. We embrace independence. Join us.  Our Finance consultants help clients optimize all elements of their finance organization, including operating model design, sustainable cost reduction, financial planning and analysis, management reporting, financial systems architecture, and full scale finance transformation. This high performing team helps CFOs identify, design and implement programs that transform their finance function to meet today’s demanding requirements while continuing to provide value added insights to the business.  Minimum Years of Experience: 6  Minimum Degree Required: Bachelor's degree  Degree(s) Preferred: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, Master's degree in Accounting  Certification(s) Preferred: CPA  Knowledge Preferred:  Demonstrates some proven knowledge and success in advising global organizations on improving efficiency and effectiveness in transaction processing, close and consolidation, budgeting and forecasting, and internal and external reporting, which includes the following:  - Process improvement in, industry knowledge, and applications of at least one of the following focus areas: shared service and outsourcing, finance transformation, performance management, financial systems optimization, and talent management Business intelligence and performance management software tools.  Skills Preferred: Demonstrates proven extensive abilities and success with developing strategy; as well as leveraging PC applications including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Project to write, communicate, facilitate, and present cogently; to and/or for all levels of industry audiences, clients and internal staff and management, including development and delivery of business proposals, conferences and whitepapers.  Demonstrated proven intimate levels of knowledge and success with identifying, obtaining and processing critical data (e.g. benchmarks) to challenge the status quo through innovative thought leadership in the application of standard industry practice solutions for high performing finance functions, including the following: Internal and external reporting;People and organization structures;Performance management, budgeting and forecasting capabilities;Cash flow optimization and the use of capital; and,Maintenance and building of cost-effective controls Demonstrated proven extensive ability and success to contribute to the development of a business vision and manage implementation efforts with complex project management capabilities.  Demonstrates proven extensive ability and/or success with identifying and addressing client needs: building, maintaining, and utilizing networks of client relationships and community involvement; communicating value propositions; managing resource requirements, project workflow, budgets, billing and collections; and preparing and/or coordinating complex written and verbal materials.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Ria's mission is to be the most progressive money transfer company in the world, offering service excellence and the most competitive and reliable remittance payment services to its customers. Our vision is a service that is "always on" and available whenever, wherever and however people need it, serving customers, anywhere around the globe. Ria has store and agent locations conveniently located around the world, in addition to online money transfer, both of which offer competitive rates and fast, friendly and reliable service.  Job purpose  Finance Operations Department is seeking a Project Manager/Senior Business Analyst, who will be joining our global PMO team. The position is located in the Buena Park Ria headquarters office. The Project Manager/Senior Business Analyst possesses excellent people management skills and has strong knowledge in business process technical analysis, and software development lifecycle. We are on the lookout for a goal-oriented project manager with a business analyst profile capable of managing our efforts to continue delivering effective solutions to our organization.  Duties and Responsibilities Apply Project Management Methodologies and tools in Software Development Life-cycles (SDLC) to effectively reflect business models' and requirements' goals.Develop detailed project plans that can be effectively tracked and reported.Manage changes to projects' scope, timelines, and budget while keeping business objectives in mind.Analyze reports and serve as a liaison between management and technical teams.Gather and elicit Business Requirements by interviewing customers, stakeholders, reviewing existing business documentation, and documenting existing processes and systems.Measure project performance and perform risk management using appropriate tools and techniques.Influence/manage technical teams.Report on projects' status and escalate to management as needed. Job Requirements QualificationsMinimum 5 years of experience in software implementation project management and business analysis in a cross-functional environment.Bachelor's degree in technical/business fields, preferred.Ability to manage multiple projects/teams simultaneously.Experience with dealing directly with Business Stakeholders.Experience with managing projects following both Waterfall and Agile methodologies.Experience with leading and managing teams developing large-scale backend systems that support a variety of customer facing applications.Proficiency in SQL and Database design considerations.Familiarity with MS Project, Smartsheet, or other Project Management tools.PMP/PMI-ACP certification - Required.Must be a team player with a positive attitude.Flexibility and mindset to operate in a unique and fast-paced environment.People management and negotiation skills.Strong verbal and written communication skills. To the Technical Project Manager/Senior Business Analyst we offer: Growth opportunities within the companyPaid vacation, sick leave and holidaysBenefits packages including medical, dental, vision and life insurance401K with company contributionEmployee stock purchase program About Ria Financial  Ria Financial Services ("Ria") is the money transfer division of Euronet Worldwide, Inc. ("Euronet") (NASDAQ: EEFT). Ria is one of the largest global money transfer companies in the world. Our mission is to be the most progressive money transfer company by offering service excellence and the most competitive and reliable remittance payment services to our customers. Since we began in New York in 1987, we have been successfully providing a cost effective, secure and fast alternative to send money to the families and loved ones of customers worldwide. Now serving 150 countries we are a recognized brand in both quality and service.  Euronet Worldwide, Inc. (NASDAQ: EEFT) facilitates the movement of payments around the world and serves as a critical link between our partners Financial Institutions, Retailers, Service Providers and their end Consumers, both locally and globally. Founded in 1994, Euronet has established itself as a leading electronic payments provider. Euronet's customers are served from three core business segments: Electronic Financial Transactions (EFT including Payments Software), Prepaid (epay) and Money Transfer (Ria).  Do you want to work with one of the industry leaders in the Money Transfer business? Then Ria Financial is the right place for you!  Apply online today!  Ria Financial is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. policy with business development needs.Work on structured credit transactions (including Financial Solution opportunities, securitizations, specialized leasing transactions, and up-tier proposals).Understand and maintain base industry knowledge of industries represented in portfolio, including technical aspects, regulatory issues and unique credit product activity.Participate in establish appropriate ratings for transactions and correlate appropriate exposure level with regard to exposure on both a transaction and group level.Ensure compliance with policy and regulatory requirements (i.e. CEA, AOA, FSA, and FRB).Ensure compliance with internal policy and procedural requirements (i.e. CEA, AOA, LOA and CODA) by understanding and adhering to USCB Operating Procedures, Name: Workday Technical Analyst- Data Conversions
Description: The University of Southern California (USC) has established a Workday Financials deployment program covering our academic enterprise as well as our hospitals. This program is critical to USC's overall goals to improve administrative efficiency. Workday Financials will be paired with the existing Workday HR and Payroll solutions implemented in 2013.  We are currently seeking two Workday Technical Analysts Data Conversions (Programmer Analyst III) to join our Workday Financials deployment program team. The Technical Analysts will be responsible for converting the data from legacy Financial applications to Workday. They will need to use their technical aptitude to convert and map data sources into data conversion templates to be loaded into Workday. The successful candidates will need to perform data extract, data cleansing, mapping of data, transformations of data as well as loading data to Workday though ETL scripts. In addition, they will need to lead the validation of data loaded into Workday. Regularly engage and support the business through all phases of the project, ensuring a smooth transfer of data from legacy systems to the Workday Financials solution. Finally, the Technical Analysts will need to perform multiple tasks under limited direction, while regularly keeping the client, the project team abreast of changes or progress related to the project  The ideal candidate must possess 3 years of experience with Workday or any ERP data conversion. Experience with data conversions, data mining and data loading are required as is experience with some ETL tools. Experience with Workday ERP and Workday Financials deployment are strongly preferred.  ITS is committed to providing information technology services and support to the university. ITS provides essential, university-wide services such as: Enterprise information systemsUniversity wired and wireless networksEducational TechnologyResearch ComputingIT Security There are two vacancies for this role.  These are a fixed-term position with an anticipated end date of December 31, 2021. Please note that these are full-time role eligible for benefits, including medical, dental, and vision plans. Produce design specification documentsTranslate design specifications into programming languagesDevelop test data and routines required to test and revise application(s).Ensures application(s) is thoroughly tested before release. Write reports of test results.Detect, define and debug programs whenever problems are reported or encounteredPerform other duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any timeThe Must Haves:Bachelor's degree in business administration, organization development, communication or related discipline3 years of experience with data conversions, data mining and data loadingExperience with Workday or any ERP data conversionExperience with some ETL toolsSound knowledge of programming and documentation procedures, programming methods, program flow charts and operator instructionsExceptional written and verbal communication capabilities; able to communicate effectively with diverse people and individuals at various levels within the organizationWillingness to take charge and the ability to simplify a complex problemAbility to manage multiple initiatives at a time and operate in a group or confidence to lead that group through a challenge and to a solutionSuperior detail orientation, organization, and analytical skillsAbility to operate effectively in a dynamic environment with minimal supervisionThe Nice to Haves:Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or other engineering discipline3-5 years or Workday or any ERP data conversion experienceExperience with Workday Financials deploymentExperience within the Higher Education and/or Health Care industryBenefits: USC benefits include a choice of retirement programs, 12 paid vacation days per year, 12 paid sick days per year, university holidays, a choice of medical and dental plans, and discounts to football games, basketball games, and other campus events. Name: Workforce Insights Analyst
Description: Summary of Essential Job Duties: Provides broad analytics, metrics, analysis, support and coordination to HR Data Management (HRIS) and its client base. Position is also responsible for providing day-to-day analytics/metrics support to end-users, including data systems integrity, troubleshooting, and analyzing errors in reports/data. Works with EIS (Information Technology) in implementing/delivering new analytics tools, such as Oracle's OBIEE Analytics packages.  This position is responsible for data analysis (may include advanced Statistical Analysis), and producing a wide variety of reports to support department and management decisions. Assists in the evaluation and development of department systems. Produces data/reports annually/semi-annually for various surveys such as HASC, AHA, Magnet, benchmarking, etc. This position is also extremely instrumental in supporting the Employee Engagement Survey reporting and graphical representation of the results.  Candidate must have experience with analytical tools, such as Tableau, Business Objects, Lawson and/or Peoplesoft, Oracle Cloud HCM table structures, Crystal report writing tool, and have worked in the Healthcare arena. Must also have experience with HR Analytics and be able to provide graphical representation of the data and show trends, in addition to translation of the meaning of the charts (tell the story). Data Auditing is also required of this position. Candidate must be able to work in a fast paced enviroment with changing priorities. Educational Requirements:• Bachelor’s degree in relevant discipline (such as statistical analysis); with some course work in data management. • Strongly prefer Master’s degree in business, human resources, communication or other relevant discipline preferred.• At least four (4) years of related experienceLicense/Certification/Registration Requirements:NoneExperience:• Experience in designing and producing both simple and complex business analytics for use by management in decision support.• Experience in designing, creating, and publishing Human Resources-related dashboards.• Subject matter expertise and experience in both statistical analysis and trend analysis summarizing the data and the trends.• Ability to identify issues, and trends, synthesize information, propose methodical solutions and highlight implications of findings.• Ability to conduct and interpret quantitative and qualitative analysis.• Experience in Workforce Administration, Talent Acquisition, Human Resources, Payroll or other Human Capital Management discipline preferred.• Experience in multiple report writing platforms, such as Crystal.• Experience in analytical presentation tools, such as Tableau.• Experience with OBIEE (Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition) preferred.• Expert knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Visio and Projects required. Proficiency will be tested.• Expert knowledge of HR Information Systems, preferably PeopleSoft, Taleo, Lawson and/or Oracle Cloud.• Experience with hospital-based administrative database applications and data warehousing technology highly desired.• Project Management experience is desireable.• Experience with SQL and relational databases and of query/report writing• Excellent organizational skills. Experience with hospital-based administrative database applications and data warehousing technology highly desired.• Project Management experience is desireable.• Experience with SQL and relational databases and of query/report writing• Excellent organizational skills• Ability to work and effectively communicate with peers and clients at all levels across the organization.• Highly organized with proven ability to meet deadlines, prioritize workload, and manage own time effectively.• Executes all job responsibilities and assignments promptly, reliably, honestly, and ethically.• Demonstrated strong verbal, written and presentation skills Physical Demands: (e.g., lifting, standing, walking)None

Name: Senior Financial Analyst - Pricing & Rate Analysis
Description: Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to join our winning Rate Analysis team, located in our Global Services Office in downtown Los Angeles. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.  The Senior Financial Analyst will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.  As a Senior Financial Analyst at Latham, you will contribute your expertise to providing financial and project management support to attorneys for pricing and scoping engagements. You will assist firm management with financial modeling of rate alternatives, supporting analysis related to requests for proposals (RFPs), and tracking engagement budgets, while accomplishing these and other critical functions: Modelling matter profitability and providing scenario analysis to support pricing decisions for firm management.Providing project management support to attorneys for pricing and scoping engagements. This includes defining project scope, goals, and deliverables and in collaboration with senior global and local management, identifying resources needed to achieve project objectives that support business goals.Researching and identifying existing/historical firm matters that may provide a baseline for billing attorneys in developing budgets for new matters.Designing templates to assist attorneys with establishing budgets. Monitoring engagements on a regular basis and provides reports to management.Overseeing maintenance of Rate Approval Tracking database by inputting key rate approval information. Creating analysis and designing reports/presentations to display pricing trends.Liaising with Finance & Accounting Department staff and other administrative departments to ensure that the correct data is being captured and that the appropriate tools are available to provide accurate and timely reporting.Staying abreast of current and new technologies and market trends providing benefit to the firm. Working with and making recommendations to senior management regarding all functions of the financial modeling platform and current projects.Working with senior management to refine current work processes, develop new tools, and implement new ideas.Providing outreach, promoting the availability of revenue analysis and project management support to the partnership. Working with senior management to formalize the service offering throughout the firm.Monitoring progress against economic targets and goals and initiating follow-up, as needed.Analyzing client performance data to identify client opportunities.Performing ad hoc analyses using the firm's various data stores and tools.Coordinating with other areas/ departments of the firm where overlap exists to develop efficient procedures/communications to streamline processes and satisfy various department needs.Completing special projects on various issues as needed or when requested by manager. As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Senior Financial Analyst must have advanced financial modeling and project management skills; the ability to perceive and analyze problems and develop alternative strategies to solve them; organizational skills/project management skills to manage time well, prioritize effectively, and handle multiple deadlines; the ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines; the ability to work in a team environment with a customer service focus; and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.  A Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or related field is required. A Master's degree or equivalent in a related field is preferred. A Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus. Six (6) years of financial analysis and/or project management experience is required, preferably in a professional services environment. Experience developing financial analysis/modeling and project tracking/reporting is preferred.  Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the 'Apply Now' link.  Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.  Latham & Watkins LLP will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance.  For information regarding family care and medical leave (CFRA), click here.SDL2017

Name: Sr. Credit Analyst
Description: Overview This position will sit within City National Bank's Food & Beverage Group ("F&B") within the Specialty Banking division. F&B originates, closes and monitors direct and private-equity-backed transactions nationally by providing cash flow, asset-backed, and asset-based loans >$25.0 million to support companies that operate in the food and beverage sector. This role is within F&B's Credit function, whose primary mandate is to underwrite new transactions and manage existing exposure. At this level, employees are developing credit analysis skills, acquiring fundamental principles of corporate finance, learning bank policies and practices, and becoming familiar with relevant banking laws and regulations. Responsibilities New Transactions: Support due diligence efforts, including analyzing confidential information memoranda, lender presentations, complex raw data and financial statements provided by private equity firms, investment banks and/or prospective borrowers.Run dynamic 3-statement financial models with 2-3 sensitization cases and detailed, supporting assumptions.Facilitate the preparation of approval documents, including specific qualitative and quantitative content around the company, industry and transaction.Spread historical financial statements and analyze and explain the pertinent trends/drivers.Liaise with Loan Administration to satisfy pertinent compliance-related requirements pertaining to entities, owners and/or management.Gain exposure to external constituents (e.g. legal counsel, appraisers, field examiners, accounting firms, etc.) as well as all aspects of the new deal process (e.g. indicative term sheet, proposal letter, due diligence, lender meetings, commitment letter, credit agreement, loan closing, etc.) Existing Exposure: Prepare approval documents for amendments, consents, and waivers, including clearly articulating the background, request, and rationale. Shadow legal documentation.Spread historical financial statements, reconcile compliance certificates, and identify abnormalities for follow-up.Prepare quarterly trend cards and annual reviews, each focused on exposure levels, risk ratings, financial trends, and post-close modifications for each portfolio account.Satisfy ongoing Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review deliverables for each portfolio account.Communicate with the Agent, private equity firms and/or management from time-to-time as portfolio-related deliverables dictate.Basic Requirements*Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or Business*Minimum 5 year of credit or financial analysis experience required*Minimum 5 year of experience in a banking or financial services environment required *Represents the basic qualifications for the position. To be considered for this position you must at least meet the basic qualifications.  City National Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer -- Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans.  Note: The Preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Note: Candidates should be advised that City National Bank does not pay interviewee travel expenses or relocation expenses for candidates who are hired unless previously agreed.Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Name: Sr. Database Analyst
Description: We are committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.Job SummaryOMNIGON is looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. The team member will join us in delivering custom solutions for our clients; leaders in the sports, media and entertainment industries. As a member of Data Services Management team, the Sr. Data Analyst will create and maintain source to target designs and mappings, provide detailed data analysis, and manage metadata in support of the development and/or implementation of new or enhanced systems projects or programs.At OMNIGON, we are fortunate to work with the world’s leading sports, media and entertainment companies, many of whom operate 24/7. Because we work tirelessly to support our clients, there are times when we put in late night and weekend hours.Job RequirementsAs a member of Data Services Management team, this person will create and maintain source to target designs and mappings, provide detailed data analysis, and manage metadata in support of the development and/or implementation of new or enhanced systems projects or programs. Participates in development of strategic and tactical planning activities, and works with IT PMO, business users, and technical peers to provide solution estimates. Reviews business requirements and leads source to target design efforts including system technical flows, use case analysis for a complex portfolio set of applications, leading a team of data analysts. Leads joint application design requirements and solution sessions across IT and business teams. Implements improvements to the quality of processes, standards and metrics. The Data Analyst works with subject matter experts from the project team to determine data requirements for analytical systems, develop these requirements into functional specifications and detailed data flow design documents, and participates in the full development process life-cycle from concept, through testing, to implementation. This includes identifying necessary data, reconciling with the new application and the legacy data sources and ensuring a successful implementation. This will include communicating business term definitions, establishing data quality rules, researching and analyzing data in support of business functions, process and workflow knowledge, and user acceptance testing. Leads the data and system impact analysis incorporating system designs and system architecture. Participate in problem management process. Performs data profiling and detailed data analysis of source systems and target analytic solutions.Responsibilities:• Own the design, development, validation, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions• Develop and maintain the Core Data Dictionary and MDM• Conduct hands-on modeling/analytics retrieving, compiling, and analyzing large volumes of data from disparate databases into distilled, actionable information and insights• Develop and own business intelligence dashboards for operational aspects of the business• Analyze data, including utilization, turns, lifetime value and profitability• Supports data engineering team to help define business metrics and to close data gaps in our data warehouse• Collaborate with data scientists to help build advanced analytical models• Find ways to use data to empower team members across the business to take action in real timeQualifications/Requirements:• 3-5 years of experience as a data analyst, preferably with an entertainment or digital media company• Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills with ability to interpret and summarize complex data that drive actionable plans that add value to the business• Expert in MS Excel• 3-5 years of professional experience using advanced SQL in a cloud data warehouse environment (such as Redshift, Snowflake or Hive), including window functions and CTEs• Experience with AWS Stack (S3, RedShift, Spectrum, Glue, etc)• 2-3 years of experience with BI tools such as Looker, Tableau or AWS QuickSight• Bachelor’s degree with a major in Math, Statistics, Finance, Economics, etc. is strongly preferred• Knowledge of various software development processes, including SDLC, Agile methodologies, tools and technologies• Detail-oriented and exceptional organizational skills• Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact at all levels of the organization• Experience with Python or R is a plus, but not required• Experience with Big Data (Hadoop, Spark, EMR, Streams, etc.) is a plus but not requiredAre you ready to contribute to transforming and enhancing every aspect of the sports industry? Unite your passion for sports with a rewarding career by joining our ONE team of talented, highly-motivated and hard-working individuals. Please submit your online application now.Infront is an equal opportunities employer.

Name: Cerner PharmNet Support Analyst
Description: Title: Cerner PharmNet Support Analyst  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212770  CTG is seeking a Cerner Millennium Clinical support analyst with expertise in PharmNet Orders build. This resource will support Cerner Inpatient and PharmNet. Responsibilities include all support activities such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance.  This is a remote position but must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Support includes being be part of the 24/7 on call rotation.  Preferred candidates will have 5 years of Cerner experience, particularly around Cerner Core functionality ? including CareSet, Order Sentence Discern rules build and maintenance, positions, privileges, and user preferences.  Candidates should be prepared to be part of a multifunctional team and provide support where needed. **Please note that all positions are W2 salary! Hourly, 1099, and corp-to corp will not be considered.Requirements: Experience with the detailed design, configuration, build, testing, and troubleshooting experience in one or more of the following Cerner solutions: PowerChart Inpatient or Ambulatory CPOE (including, PowerPlans, PowerOrders, Order Sentences, Dynamic Documentation, PowerForms, MPages, Workflow, Task Completion, etc.)Cerner Practice ManagementScheduling ManagementCare ManagementCore Measures/QualityCareAware, CCL/Clinical RulesRegistrationPathNet and the Reference Lab NetworkPharmNetRadNetSurgiNetFirstNetSecurity Location: Remote after 3-6 weeks of knowledge transfer in Chicago, IL  Duration: 2 years Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.  Job: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations
