Assists with the execution of system changes (updates, integrations, new configurations) and participate in all aspects of system testing.Provide end-user troubleshooting, issue remediation, technology request assistance and escalation management. Monitors reoccurring issues, system/data or process gaps and proactively identify potential sources of increased efficiency and enhancements.Maintain accurate security role permissions, and create new roles as needed.Stay informed of current international data and system requirements and ensure compliance.Configuration LeadProject ManagementSecurity AdministrationIntegration AdministrationRequirement:Degree in HR, business or related field or equivalent experience.3-5 years HCM systems experienceIn-depth knowledge of HRIS and database systems management required experience with Workday highly preferredExperience working with confidential information and critical business processes requiredExperience working with global HR data preferredExperience with a Workday PartnerSkills:Excellent communication and collaboration skillsAdvance knowledge of Microsoft Excel and experience manipulating complex data setsTimely execution and decision makingAbility to manage competing prioritiesProactive approach to process improvement

Name: Delivery Implementation Analyst
Description: Overview  EXOS helps people perform at a high level so they can achieve what matters most to them. Since our founding in 1999, we've become a leader in proactive health and performance, trusted by more than 150 clients, including corporations, academic institutions, health systems, sports organizations, the U.S. military, community centers, and residential communities. With award-winning facilities and spaces, technology, equipment, and services, EXOS connects people to the solutions they need and provides individualized plans based on time-tested fundamentals and research in order to help people take control of their health and performance.  We know that athletes' careers evolve and their goals change, but the one constant is the demand for staying at the top of their game, and pushing it to new levels. That's why we develop personalized game plans for athletes around the world at any point in their career. We've helped individuals and teams in just about every sport on the elite level as well as college, youth, and high school. Wherever athletes are preparing to compete, EXOS specialists are helping them get there from club team tryouts and high school championships to renowned events like NFL combine, the Olympics, and the World Cup. Responsibilities As the Delivery Implementation Analyst, we will train you to be an expert in a wide range of EXOS software products. You will then be responsible for supporting that software by managing pre-launch deployment requirements, identifying installation and configuration issues, user error, environmental problems, and bugs. These problems can be quite complex and will reward those who love problem-solving. Your work will have you collaborating with multiple stakeholders, from corporate staff to our outstanding team of developers. Your work will contribute to helping our customers minimize disruptions to their operations. This position reports to the Senior Delivery Manager.  The Delivery Implementation Analyst is a tech-savvy professional who has a blended skill set including project management, user experience, and business analyst skills.  Primary Responsibilities Install and configure platform productsConfigure new customers' technical systems based on customer's individual business processesTest and troubleshoot final system setupsProblem solve technical issues using critical thinking skills and acquired knowledge of EXOS applicationsProvide technical end user support during and after the implementation processThroughout the implementation process, provide feedback, follow up and assistanceEscalate issues to Senior Delivery Manager as neededManage multiple implementations, while maintaining on-time deliverablesQualificationsBasic Qualifications:Bachelor's degree or min 4 years work experience in related fieldPreferred Qualifications:Excellent client services and technical support skillsMust be able to learn new technologies and communicate effectively with various teamsAbility to multi-task and work independentlyExceptional verbal and written communications skills; establishes rapport quicklyAbility to excel in a fast-paced, service oriented position We are an equal opportunity employer  EXOS is proud to be an affirmative action / equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, creed, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected under local, state, or federal laws. EXOS provides reasonable accommodation to employees and applicants for employment who have disabilities. You may request reasonable accommodation, in writing, by reaching out to our HR department at:  Attention : EXOS Human Resources, Accommodations  2629 E. Rose Garden Ln.  Phoenix, AZ 85050 Learn more here: EEO is the Law  EEO is the Law SupplementSDL2017

Name: Business / Data Analyst
Description: Responsible for conducting and documenting moderate to complex data analysis projects. Also responsible for planning and implementing projects that drive efficiency and quality within the Revenue Services department. Ideal candidate must be able to manipulate, analyze, and interpret data using Access, Excel, SQL, and VBA and then be able to provide answers to business questions and billing issues found through analyzing the data. Primary Responsibilities:Manipulate, analyze, and interpret large amounts of data using Access, Excel, SQL, and VBAAutomate processes and reportsRecognize inefficiencies in processes (operational or technical)Design solutions to address billing issuesPull ad hoc reports from various billing systemsPerform data validation to ensure accuracy and qualityData mining for advanced analysis of data presented in reports for managementAnalyze insurance medical billing denials to identify trendsRecommend solutions to decrease bad debt and increase cash for receivables from laboratory testsAssist Billing department in the resolution of billing issuesProvide feedback to Senior Management regarding contractual issues impacting Revenue ServicesCollaborate with other business units and departments on analysis projectsRequired Qualifications:BS / BA degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or Computer Science1 years of business or data analysis experiencePrevious experience implementing cross-functional initiativesPreferred Qualifications:Advanced Excel and Access skills with programming knowledge using VBA and SQLExperience with insurance health plans or HMOsAbility to work to a consistent high standard under pressureAbility to work in a fast paced environment and adapt to ever changing prioritiesHigh degree of accuracy and attention to detailDemonstrate problem-solving and strong analytical skillsAbility to multitask on multiple small to complex projects / tasks and meet deadlinesWillingness to undertake additional responsibilities as requiredSelf-motivated, able to work in a team, and demonstrates the ability to work independentlyDemonstrated ability to clearly communicate complex issues to all levels of managementExcellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication (written and verbal) skills Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world?s large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job keywords: Analyst, Analysis, Analytical, Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, VBA, Visual Basic for Applications, programming, Billing, Revenue Services, Data, Excel, Access, SQL, vlookup, Revenue, Business, Greenbelt, Green belt, Automation, Process Improvement, Healthcare, HMO, IPA, Insurance, Project Management, West Hills, Woodland Hills, Sherman Oaks, CA, California

Name: Data Analyst, Product
Description: About sweetgreen: sweetgreen is on a mission to build healthier communities by connecting people to real food. We passionately believe that real food should be convenient and accessible to everyone. Every day in each sweetgreen, our 4,000+ team members make food from scratch, using fresh ingredients and produce delivered that morning. And in our local communities, we're committed to leaving people better than we found them. We're in the business of feeding people, and we're out to change what that means.  We are building our data services team to deliver thoughtfully designed, data-driven customer experiences and first-class internal operations.  We are seeking a Data Analyst to provide critical strategic support to our Product Management, Engineering, and IT teams as we undergo a digital metamorphosis. The opportunity to facilitate a fast-growing company's consumption of internal and external data all for the mission of feeding more people better food should excite you. You will use your comprehensive analytical skill set to guide our technical teams in their consumption of quality data-driven insights, helping to deliver our strategic goals. Responsibilities: This Data Analyst is responsible for providing data tools and analysis-based insight that drive the success of our technology department. From simple topline reporting to thoughtful design of org-spanning A/B testing systems, you will create data solutions that uncover actionable business insight and shepherd the business through its data epoch. This role is for you if you love collaboration, excel at end-to-end analysis, and have the business acumen and technical skills to line up the two.  Wrangle data from disparate sources to develop in-depth understanding of our internal and external customers, identify areas of opportunity, and execute projects to produce increased customer fanaticism Provide internal stakeholders with data-driven stories that support strategic decision making Work collaboratively across the company to build data tools (aggregated views, automated reports, ad hoc analyses, etc) that provide actionable insight Help create a high-functioning and healthy data ecosystem Demonstrate database technical proficiency in the areas of performance, reliability, and functionality Develop data models for applications, metadata tables, views or related database structures Collaborate with product and program managers, data platform engineers, analysts, leadership, and cross-functional stakeholders to understand business requirementsDesired Experience: 3+ years in quantitative analysis roles; experience with predictive modeling a plus 3+ years conducting clickstream analyses, A/B testing, and segmentation 3+ years using statistical scripting languages software (Python or R preferred) 3+ years heavy use of SQL (Amazon Redshift a plus) 3+ years Tableau experience, or similar BI tool Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges Interest and dedication to the healthy food revolution a huge plusWhat you'll get:Competitive pay + bonus plan granted based on performanceHealth, dental + vision insuranceFlexible PTO, because we respect the need for work/life harmonyAn opportunity to make a real impact on the people around you, both by growing them and by connecting them to real foodTo live the sweetlife and celebrate your passion + purposeA collaborative family of people who live our core values and have your backA clear career path with opportunities for development, both personally and professionallyOur annual Impact Retreat offsiteFree sweetgreen swagComplimentary sweetgreenCome join the sweetlife! sweetgreen provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law. sweetgreen participates in the federal government's E-Verify program to determine employment eligibility. To learn more about the E-Verify program, please click here.

Name: Temp Financial Analyst
Description: JOB DESCRIPTION: We have an immediate opening for a Temporary Financial Analyst for the Los Angeles office. This position will assist in developing the Firm's reports and delivery systems, create ad hoc financial analyses and models, and support the planning and budgeting process. This role will contribute towards delivering useful and timely information to the Firm's leaders and decision makers.  Responsibilities: Assist with the Firm's annual operating capital and cash flow budgeting processSupport the preparation and analysis of quarterly forecasts and the operating planPrepare and distribute financial and KPI reportingAnalyze operating results and profitabilitySupport the month end close consolidation processDevelop ad hoc analyses utilizing financial modeling and data analysis skillsDesign complex worksheets and/or databases for tracking and reportingUpdate financial models as necessaryTest and validate changes in the data warehouseConsolidate and synthesize data from various sources JOB REQUIREMENTS:  Qualifications: Possess strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present findings and solutions to a diverse audienceHave the ability to develop complicated financial analyses; discern trends and communicate the meaning of financial data to executives and users; define problems, research data, draw conclusions, concisely present recommendations and be willing to ask questionsDemonstrate problem-solving and decision-making skillsPossess strong knowledge of Excel (including pivot tables). Knowledge of relationship database, SQL, and Business Object application is a plusA minimum of two years of work experience as a Financial or Business Analyst, in a multi-business line organization, is highly preferred. Law firm experience is a plus, but not necessaryA Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting or related field is highly preferred

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: Eaton’s Aerospace division is currently seeking a Supply Chain Analyst to join our team. This position is based at our Los Angeles, CA facility.In this role, you will perform diversified duties related to MRP planning, scheduling, and expediting finished goods and components in order to support strategic inventory goals and to ensure on time delivery of customer orders. Requires judgment in anticipating future requirements through analysis and interpretation of current production status. Manages the inventory and production plan for a given product group to optimize and meet plant goals. Essential functions include: Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.You will review customer orders, plant capacity and inventory to develop schedules that meet production requirementsYou will plan and release work orders as required to meet customer orders while maintaining optimum lead time and inventory levelYou will analyze and interpret pertinent inventory information and data to determine current production status. Work closely with production team to monitors work order progress. Anticipates future requirements and provides adjustments in scheduling as neededYou will print drawings and create job packs from MRP system output for use by the floor as required. Ensure job packs are handled and released to the floor according to standards and policyYou will provide the customer service representatives with manufacturing due dates and advanced notice of shipping delay informationYou will drive shortage meetings with a cross functional team and expedites material where required to meet shortfall between current plan and customer order requirementsYou will analyze data and system information to prepare reports as needed to facilitate and recommend actions to ensure optimal supply chain execution.You will maintain planning parameters in the MRP system to ensure proper order generationYou will support cost reduction projects and improvement initiatives to achieve overall business objectivesYou will compile with plan safety procedures to ensure a safe environmentWhen we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other statusRequired (Basic) Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institutionMinimum 1 year of experience in supply chain planning, inventory control, purchasing, logistics, stockroom operations, and/or shipping / receivingMust be eligible to work in the US without company sponsorshipThis position requires use of information or access to hardware which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or RefugeeRelocation is not offered for this role. Candidates must reside within a 50 mile radius of the Los Angeles, CA facility (zip code 90039) to be considered..Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of lean manufacturing and continuous improvement processesKnowledge of production work flow and work order generation logicGood PC skills, especially in MS ExcelGreat written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work with all functions of the organizationsAbility to multi-task

Name: Data Analytics Specialist, Analyst Relations
Description: Job Description IBM is looking for a Data Analytics Specialist in San Francisco, Boston or New York to work to handle an analytical workload which would primarily entail the management of a custom database that weighs influence as well as tracks interactions and mentions. This database gives the global analyst relations team a road map of the most important influencers globally. It is necessary to take raw data and transform it into creative graphs and PowerPoints with insights to help set strategic direction.  Analyst Relations is an old function inside of IBM. Some say IBM created the function in the 1960s. It has been an integral part of how we work and create success for our business units, clients and society.  IBM has been innovating for 107 years. In 2017, we broke the record as the top US patent generator for the 25th consecutive year. Our patent leadership has changed the way the world works with advancements critical to the modern era of computing. Nearly half of our patents are pioneering advancements in AI, cloud computing, cybersecurity, blockchain and quantum computing and all are aimed at helping the world and our clients.  Analyst Relations is at the nexus of IBM sales and strategy. It plays a critical, cross-functional role by working with experts at many different levels of the organization across product management, engineering, communications, sales and marketing teams, while leveraging important technology analysts and key global influencer community. Analyst Relations is considered a strategic function at IBM, as it drives revenue and influences strategy.  Candidate should have; Strong ability in data analytics, including database construction and analytics tools.Ability to develop and continuously measure Key Performance Metrics (KPIs) for different roles.Strong content and proficient story writing skills.Ability to take unstructured data, and crystalize them into poignant compelling visuals.Ability to glean insights from data, communicate it to peers, and create executive-level talking points.Ability to leverage data to craft unique solutions to elevate the Analyst Relations efforts.Ability to present orally and written to broad audiences (executive to functional).Effectively project manage such that you can handle multiple projects, from beginning to end.Ability to teach concepts to other teammates, such that they can replicate your analyses.An eagerness to work with highly influential individuals both in and outside of the company.Candidate must have the tenacity, determination and patience to be able to challenge conventional thinking and processes. Also, key to the role are the following traits; analytical, entrepreneurial, persistent, collaborative, open and expressive. Must like to laugh.Exceptional skills with: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and other analytics tools as well as, Tableau, SQL, Slack, Zoom, Box and Architect. Candidate will report to Manager of Strategy & Operations Team in Analyst Relations, based in Boston, MA.  This role requires the ability to work on multiple fast paced projects at the same time, strong analytical skills, and experience evaluating qualitative and quantitative research in the tech sector. This candidate must also enjoy building relationships with industry influencers and internal stakeholders. Candidate will be a delicate blend of technical and business.  The candidate will interact with colleagues across IBMs global offices. RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop, manage and create content for the Analyst Relations department.The content you generate educates IBM executives, the most influential technical analysts, hybrid analysts, bloggers, marketers, etc., who work with existing or prospective IBM customers, key global media and financial markets.Work closely with and for Vice President, department colleagues and BUs to influence strategy while improving analyst/influencer perceptions and relationships.Collaborate with colleagues in Analyst Relations, Marketing, Sales, Product Management, Communications, Finance and BU leadership to ensure that IBM is receiving the best representation with the analyst/influencer community.Develop and broaden Analyst Relations key performance metrics to elevate efforts to key BU leadership and stakeholders.Analyze analyst inputs, such as social media, blogs, reports, and other forms of influence. Leverage data to guide Analyst Relations leads to maximize amplification of IBM messages.Develop a keen understanding of how to build credible and impactful relationships with key influencers and leading industry analysts. Honesty, tenacity and consistency.Grow a deep technical interest in the spaces that IBM plays in.Be a person who thinks about bettering the world through your work in the technology sector. Applicants must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorship.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Bachelors Degree in Data Analytics, Data Science, Applied Math, EconomicsProven proficiency in analysis and visualization tools such as SQL, Tableau, and Excel.Expertise in writing and creating compelling data-based content and graphics, and presenting them in Word and PowerPoint.Experience with collaboration software tools such as Box, Zoom, Slack and Architect.Experience in social media analysis.Experience working in the tech sector and/or a passion for technology.Polish and presence to work with senior management.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Unwavering attention to detail and excellence.Compassion and respect for fellow colleagues and clients.Entrepreneurial mindset, being able to operate in a highly visible and accountable role. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Advanced Degree in the Engineering/Sciences, Math, Computer Science and/or MBA Strategy or JD.5+ years of work technology flavored experience in: Data Analytics, Market Research, Performance Marketing, Management Consulting, Strategy, Product Management, Communications, PR, or Graphic Design.Existing relationships with leading industry analysts/influencers in emerging technologies space. EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Revenue Analyst - InterContinental
Description: Description About usDo you see yourself as a Revenue Analyst? What's your passion? Whether you're into sports, shopping or spending time with your pet, at IHG we're interested in YOU. At IHG we employ people who apply the same amount of care and passion to their jobs as they do their hobbies - people who put our guests at the heart of everything they do. And we're looking for more people like this to join our friendly and professional team.Your day to dayThe Revenue Analyst is responsible to produce reporting that support and evaluate hotel business strategies to maximize overall hotel revenue. Provide guidance and support to reservations, sales and marketing initiatives that are targeted to meet the needs of the hotel. Duties and responsibilities• Assist with effectively managing and maintaining revenue management systems including Opera, Concerto and SBRP. • Accurate preparation and distribution of daily, weekly, monthly revenue reports. The reports include market segmentation analysis, production reports, source contribution analysis, daily pick-up reports, preferred guest program analysis, etc.• Assist with ensuring all rates are loaded and inventory maintenance is correct.• Perform audits and maintenance on all systems such as PMS, CRS, RMS, and Sales & Catering Systems to ensure content and information is correct.• Communicate strategies and procedures to other departments as required.• Must be knowledgeable of all rates, room types, and hotel product.• Participate in weekly revenue management meetings.• Prepare Revenue Management Report information for all related meetings.• Monitor and analyze the competition daily / weekly through shop reports and the Internet to identify selling strategies and market trends.• Assist in preparing short and long term forecasts.• Review and analyze reports such as STAR, Demand 360 and other measurement tools and present revenue opportunities.• Update MAR's in Delphi as required under the guidance of the Revenue Director to ensure optimal use by sales team.• Analyze local events and activities and project the effect of opportunities they create.• Prepare 14 Day Forecast for distribution to Management team so proper staffing levels are achieved. • Maintains and monitors a CRS/PMS interface, to insure all rates, inventory, and restrictions are flowing between both systems.• Creates and manages rate plans, room types, policies, promotions, packages, and restrictions• Assist the Director of Revenue and Sales team with Group/Transient rate analysis.• Update of rates and selling restrictions in all distribution channels.• Load and quality check Negotiated accounts and other rates in CRS and GDS. • Conduct audit checks to ensure inventory controls and rate parity across all distribution channels. • Manage and update ad-hoc reporting or tools to identify opportunities and serve as primary source for majority of reporting needs of the Revenue Management team. • Assist with training of new colleagues as necessary in reservations and Revenue Management tools.What we need from youQualifications and requirements• Bachelor’s Degree: Business Administration, Finance, or Economics• 1-2 years Analytical experience within the Hospitality Industry. Revenue Management, Front Office Operations• Bachelor’s Degree preferred.• Previous experience in Revenue Management will be an asset• Comprehensive knowledge of the Los Angeles market.• Strong mathematical and analytical skills.• Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office particularly Excel.• Ability to create and automate reports from all Systems extraction.• Knowledge of management strategies and techniques.• Knowledge of Delphi and GDS an asset.• Must be a creative and innovative thinker.• Analytical approach to problem solving.• Ability to manage time well and be flexible.What we offerIn return we'll give you a competitive financial and benefits package which can include healthcare and dental coverage, disability and life insurance, and a matched 401(k) program. Hotel discounts worldwide are available as well as the chance to work with a great team of people. Most importantly, we'll give you the room to be yourself.So what's your passion? Please click "Apply Online" and tell us how you could bring your individual skills to IHG.IHG is an equal opportunity employer Minorities / Females / Disabilities / Veterans

Name: Product Analyst
Description: Age of Learning is a leading education technology innovator based in Glendale, California, with a talented team of more than 600 individuals—from educators, developers, artists, writers, designers, and engineers, to producers, product managers, and marketing experts.  We are the creators of the award-winning ABCmouse.com® Early Learning Academy curriculum, experienced by more than 10 million children worldwide who have completed over 3 billion Learning Activities to date.  We are committed to helping every child learn. Our Education Access Initiatives reach millions of children by offering the full ABCmouse curriculum at no cost to teachers and community institutions such as libraries, Head Start programs, and community centers—including public housing authorities and after-school programs.  At Age of Learning, we areBringing Learning to Life®! Summary We are seeking a pro-active, intellectually curious and entrepreneurial Product Analyst to help deliver in-depth analyses to influence numerous aspects of business performance. This role will focus on pro-active identification of actionable optimization opportunities. Contribution will come in the form of data manipulation, business monitoring, data visualization, ad-hoc analyses, defining data capture requirements and verifying data integrity. ResponsibilitiesProvide product analyses to understand how user behavior impacts KPIs, such as retention and long-term value.Monitor and analyze business performance by providing regularly refreshed data visualizations and ad hoc analyses.Drive data capture and data integrity requirements. Partner with other teams so that the right data is captured.Partner closely with business teams to surface key insights and learnings to inform marketing initiatives and product increments.Work directly with stakeholders and other team members to formulate requirements for dashboards and ad-hoc analyses. Work with manager to prioritize projects.Maintain vigilant eye on data quality. Challenge and recommend solutions to solve problems.Perform complex data extractions, manipulations and validation from internal data warehouse to effectively analyze data.Support A/B and multivariate testing strategy and implementation across desktop and mobile platforms.Continue to improve and enhance automated/real-time dashboards and visualization of key metrics.Maintain knowledge of competitive and related products.Required QualificationsMust be able to understand and analyze data, synthesizing large volumes of data and complex questions into clear analyses and actionable findings.Intellectual curiosity in user behavior, UI/UX, mobile marketplaces, marketing. Experience in games or education a plus.Strong analytical and reporting skills. Fluent in complex SQL queries on big data sets. Fluent in Tableau and Excel. Additional data visualization capabilities a plus. Modeling experience in R or Python a plus.Comfort defining analytics architecture that meets product management requirements.Collaborative problem solving skills. Entrepreneurial and results-oriented. Strong work ethic. Does what it takes to get the job done and naturally goes the extra mile.Ability to identify edge cases and solve practical problems.Experience with testing and optimization a plus, ideally in a digital environmentAt least 2 years in an analytical/product focused role, preferably from a digital environmentBachelor's degree from four-year college or university; or two to four years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination.

Name: Corporate Banking Analyst
Description: Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world (as ranked by S&P Global, April 2018) with total assets of over $2.9 trillion (106.2 (JPY) as of March 30, 2018) and 150,000 colleagues in more than 50 countries. In the U.S., we're 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. We achieve this by delivering on our values, putting people first, fostering long-term relationships built on honesty and mutual understanding, and inspiring the best in each other. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Join a team that's working to fulfill its vision to be the world's most trusted financial group.The role is an integral part of the Power & Utilities team managing major client relationships on behalf of Wholesale Banking. Power & Utilities is consistently a top-5 lead arranger of syndicated loans with an uninterrupted 30+ year track record of banking the most active utilities and independent power producers across the U.S., Canada and Latin America. The Analyst will be responsible for providing marketing and operational support to Relationship Managers ("RM") heading a business development effort in the Power & Utilities Finance industry specialty group. This position will consistently provide relationship backup to the RM(s) and also interface with certain product areas within the bank to facilitate the further development of new business opportunities. The position will require frequent monitoring and updates of the Salesforce Database and management reporting. The Analyst will handle operational aspects of business origination such as analyzing portfolio profitability, performing all follow-through of any deal origination process, preparing economic capital analysis, and managing customer intensive processes (other than credit analytics).The Analyst will coordinate efforts for the RM(s) heading up a business development effort, providing support where needed including industry research, marketing material production, coordination with product areas, as well as other activities as identified by the RM(s). The Analyst will prioritize activities based on level of importance to the overall department and at the direction of the RM(s).Major Responsibilities:Assist marketing activity by providing customer and industry research when requested by RM(s).Assist RM(s) with:Due diligence related to prospective client deals.Actively maintaining the Sales force database through direction of RM(s).Development of client marketing presentations and materials under the direction of RM(s).New strategic area development.Follow relationship development activities with clients and act as liaison with product areas to facilitate opportunities.Assist in documenting transactions.Develop knowledge (through internal and external training) of the bank, industry, credit and marketing activities.Develop responsibility for global network correspondence, client deal due diligence, and assistance with business origination as RM(s) deems appropriate.Attend client meetings when they occur in New York, when appropriate, to observe the RM(s) and develop real world knowledge of relationship development and relationship management.Prepare call reports for review and comment by the RM(s) when attending client meetings.Relationship management related to BTMUS such as referring clients to BTMUSProduct Liaison:Liaise with various product areas on USCB transactions to help develop more extensive knowledge of BTM's product capabilities. Integrate developing product knowledge into draft presentations and transaction memos.We require:A college graduate, Bachelor's Degree (preferably with a BA degree in a business related major, including Accounting, Economics)One year or more of work experience in a Corporate Banking settingCredit experience ideally from a training program with a money center bank/regional formal credit training or equivalentMust have had historical accounting and finance classes/experienceExceptional interpersonal, analytical and writing skills.Excellent organization, time management, and attention to details.Skilled at using computer applications, including MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word.Experience with spreadsheets and modeling desirable.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: What is HITRECORD? Founded and led by actor and artist Joseph Gordon-Levitt, HITRECORD is an open online community for creative collaboration. Users dont just post about themselves and vie for attention; they work together on a variety of art and media projects that they couldnt have completed on their own. So far, HITRECORD has operated as a successful production company, winning an Emmy for its television show, partnering with numerous brands from Samsung and LG to the ACLU, paying contributing community members a total of nearly three million dollars. With over 700,000 registered users, our next step is to evolve from a PRODUCTION COMPANY into a PLATFORM. Our mission is to bring as many people as possible the experience of creativity through collaboration.About the Role: HITRECORD is looking for their first Data Analyst to help build the function from the ground up and be part of the process in setting up the best practices and tools in data collection and visualization. This role will report directly to the Head of Finance but work cross-functionally across Product, Finance, Engineering, and other departments and help each team collect, clean and analyze data - which will drive decision making and provide direction for future growth of the business. Were looking for someone whos a self-starter who has worked at a startup before and wants to be part of building the analytics function at HITRECORD!What youll do: Provide the insights to deploy tools and grow value around the creation and consumption of digital art and entertainment, as well as educate creators around the world Own and master the analytical understanding of user funnel, segmentation and behavior across all facets of the product to drive growth and engagement Identify opportunities emerging in user behavior to prioritize resource deployment and inform nascent business lines Partner with key stakeholders in Finance, Engineering, Product, Community, etc. to clearly communicate results in order to advise strategy and prioritize initiatives/launches Help choose and implement various scaleable BI and data visualization tools like Amplitude, Mixpanel, Tableau, Looker, etc. from the ground up to synthesize data for the people who need it Work with Finance, Product and Marketing to analyze the e-commerce platform and its intersection with the web and mobile products to optimize the reporting and grow the success of online retail Encourage other teams to self-serve when your interpretation of the data is not required, either through training or automation of tasks.What makes this different You will have the opportunity to create a role and impact the path of the company This role provides a high potential for growth with exposure across all aspects of the organization and significant interaction with key stakeholders in all departments. You will work with and be exposed to top talent in technology, entertainment and mediaWhat were looking for: A relentless passion for solving puzzles, understanding user behavior and hypothesizing answers where there were none Startup experience is a must - especially being part of the implementation of new processes or new systems 3+ years of experience in a Data Insights, Data Analytics, Data Science or Business Analytics role A self-starter who has built things from the ground up and is looking for autonomy The ability to tactfully engage with strong points of view at all levels of the organization Strong experience in SQL and product analytics packages; Python skills are a plus Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau) Expertise with statistical analyses and concepts (e.g. regressions, experiment design, etc.) Strategically-minded yet detail-oriented Excellent interpersonal communication and presentation skills MBA, CPA and working closely with finance analytics is a major plus BA/BS degree in a related field (Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering) Ability to work in a fun, creative team with a sense of humor

Name: Data Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Data Analyst in Monterey Park, California (CA).  Service Task 1:  Data and Impact Analysis: Fieldglass worker will support the company in the documentation and analysis of the data linkages from Systems of Records (SoRs) to downstream systems; The following features will be identified and documented for each Key Data Item (KDI) and associated items:  Analyze large datasets and perform impact analysis of identified issues Work with Impacted Systems to analyze ETL code and perform root cause analysis of issues Document findings and prepare analysis presentations for stakeholders Database schema and file specifications of SoRs and downstream systems Data mapping and ETL logic from SoRs to downstream systems, including any and all intermediary systems Filtering and transformation logic Record counts Scheduling jobs and configurations Service Task 2:  Fieldglass worker shall understand the requirements and approach for Risk & Compliance application projects and work with the customer on the design, development, and testing and deployment phases as defined by the ITPD process:  Planning Engage potentially impacted system/application managers based on the BRD Requirements, DRD and KDE candidates Drive to gather system/application attributes on each potentially impacted system with a custom Questionnaire/survey Drive to gather current state data mapping for each system Drive to gather data/file attributes for each system Drive collaboration with the Enterprise Architect for delivery of an approved Architecture Solution Document (ASD) Create a high-level dataflow or wireframe diagram for use during our initial engagement with all the system/application leads and Technology Stakeholders Create and merge DRD, file attribute and current state data-mapping into workbook Create ISA Work Breakdown Structure and merge with PM WBS when feasibleREQUIREMENTS: Must have some Engineering, Computer Science background This position is a blend of IT and PM skills; 1 person is needed for 2 projects Must understand the design and architecture (doesn't need to be an SME) Definite understanding of UI, dataflow, mapping, nuances of data, must have leadership skills, it's a matrix environment, very good communication skills, must be proactive, take this as your own business, keep people together Banking experience is a must BSA AML and Sanctions is preferred 70% of the work is data mapping and 30% is functional Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: THE COMPANY: TRADESY (https://www.tradesy.com/)Tradesy is a peer-to-peer marketplace for womens designer fashion thats pioneering a sustainable future for commerce. Backed by top tier venture capital firms, our mission is to make the resale of consumer goods as simple, safe, and stylish as retail, at scale. We have millions of passionate members, a product that people love, and an office with an ocean view in sunny Santa Monica, California.THE OPPORTUNITY: Tradesy may look like a fashion company, but under the surface we're a micro-economy that runs on data. From product, to marketing, to finance, to trust, every department at Tradesy relies on data to make business decisions. As a business intelligence analyst at Tradesy you'll work with teams across the organization to understand data needs, develop robust business intelligence data sources, build reports and visualizations to answer key business questions, and contribute to our strategy for data collection.You'll partner with marketing, product managers, and executives to tackle challenging problems such as analyzing listing metadata to understand supply and demand, monitoring user behavior to understand the impact of product features, measuring responses to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, and tracking inventory to understand the efficiency of our returns operation. In addition, you'll work closely with our data pipeline team to ensure that our data sources are complete, consistent, and reliable.As a key member of our decision making process, youll be solving problems and enabling our organization through data visualization, to figure out tomorrows puzzle. As we evolve, so will your responsibility. Youll never answer the same question twice. You will dig into the data, driving insight that will directly help us win our market. You will work with an amazing group of people who believe in solidarity, honesty, autonomy, results, and excellence.RESPONSIBILITIESTroubleshoot and reconcile data issues and potential impacts, educate people on definitions and structures, work to resolve and communicate issuesAudit, modify, and document existing reports to provide consistent and reliable metrics across various sourcesConsult with people to gather needs, objectives, feature requirements and deliver reportsDrive, design, and create innovative visual analytics to help aid in the identification of patterns, trends, and anomalies (i.e. interactive dashboards)Assist with data mining and analysis on team project initiativesInnovate new ways to improve existing reports and daily functionsGet into the action right away, take ownership of your projects and deliver on timeREQUIREMENTS4-6 years of experience working on SQL (Redshift or BigQuery preferred)3+ years of experience in TableauExperience in Google Analytics and Google Data Studio a plusThe ability to communicate stories/ findings from data clearly Strong understanding of data and how it relates to the businessFlexible and able to switch between tasks depending on changing prioritiesAbility to audit and reconcile data across various systemsAudit and mine datasets for data anomalies, and develop data governance strategies and dashboardsData modeling and warehouse experience to transform user data (preferred, not required)NICE TO HAVEEcommerce or retail experience.Knowledge of or interest in designer fashion.Experience with data analysis using programming languages like R or Python.Experience working with large volumes of event data to analyze user behavior.PERKS AT TRADESYCompetitive base salary plus meaningful equityComprehensive benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k)Flexible Paid Time OffDaily catered lunchesDog friendly officeCollaborative, fun team

Name: CLO Analyst
Description: About the Position The CLO Analyst will be responsible for leading and assisting in the review of the collateral, servicing, and structural aspects of CLO deals. The CLO Analyst will also be responsible for credit surveillance of existing positions, maintaining awareness of industry developments, and developing and producing credit risk surveillance reports for senior management. Specific Responsibilities IncludeResearch potential CLO debt and equity investments to include broadly syndicated, middle market, and bilateral loan deals, warehouse facilities, and combo note structures.Utilize GPIM underwriting guidelines, deal-specific cash flow modeling, and review of deal terms, as well as all available sources of information (e.g., offering/governing documents, roadshows, published research, news, financial reporting, rating agency reports, and market color) to create clear, comprehensive, and authoritative credit memoranda.Assist in and conduct presentations to Investment Committee. Review, explain and answer committee questions. Conduct timely, and accurate follow-up analysisReview deal term sheets and offering documents to understand key deal terms related to payment waterfall, collateral eligibility, deal performance triggers, and rights and authorities of key parties. Maintain knowledge of market terms and pricing to support efficient comparisons and negotiation of deal terms.Build cashflow models when necessary. Project impact of Investment Committee approved credit stresses on the cashflow, pricing, liquidity and rating of investments.Perform surveillance of investments and product areas, including reviewing performance reports and third party research, following news and developments, and interacting with internal/external subject matter experts.Research and recommend credit sells and other loss mitigation actions.Obtain and review investment reporting to support generation of ongoing monitoring reports. Create internal memos/emails to communicate developments to internal constituents (PMs, senior management, Investment Committee)Develop comprehensive understanding of GPIM models for risk and exposure reporting. Execute, maintain, and enhance those models.Participate in issuer, servicer, and manager meetings/calls to maintain knowledge of market developments and industry practices. Conduct high frequency monitoring of manager news and industry developments in the CLO and bank loan markets.Maintain updated cashflows and analytics for existing investments. Support CLO trading with timely refreshing of deal cashflows and key structural termsSkills & Experience Required3+ years of research, analysis, or structuring in CLOsMBA, CFA, or equivalent educational background.Strong credit, finance, economic, business and technical skills.Strong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to multi-task across analytical, administrative, and research activities in a detail oriented and timely manner.Strong commitment to performance and accuracy of work product.Experience in VB or Python programming, SQL, and technology systems development for structured finance applications is desirable.Team oriented individual with ability to work well with diverse groupsAbout Guggenheim Investments Guggenheim Investments is the global asset management and investment advisory division of Guggenheim Partners, with expertise in fixed income, equity, and alternative strategies. We focus on the return and risk needs of insurance companies, corporate and public pension funds, sovereign wealth funds, endowments and foundations, consultants, wealth managers, and high-net-worth investors. Our team of investment professionals performs rigorous research to understand market trends and identify undervalued opportunities in areas that are often complex and underfollowed. This approach to investment management has enabled us to deliver innovative strategies providing diversification opportunities and attractive long-term results.  To succeed in the Guggenheim culture, candidates must be self-starters and strive for results. We are looking for people, who operate as business owners, adhere to the highest standards and think creatively to realize opportunities, wherever they may be.  Guggenheim Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diversified and inclusive workforce.Associated topics: analyse, analyze, business analytic, financial analytic, financial reporting analyst, forecasting, refine, refinement, regulation, valuation analyst

Name: Operations Associate (Consultant)
Description: Job ID: 150959 Store Name/Number: CA-Studio City (1144) Address: 12036 Ventura Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 91604, United States (US) Hourly/Salaried: Hourly (Non-Exempt) Full Time/Part Time: Part Time Position Type: Regular Store Operations It takes a lot of behind-the-scenes effort to make sure our stores have the right products in the right place at the right time to fuel our clients' beauty obsessions. That’s where our operations team comes in, to keep our stores looking beautiful and running smoothly "backstage!" This team is the backbone of the store and essential in providing the best possible experience for every client who walks through our doors. Your role at Sephora: As an Operations Associate, you help keep the store running smoothly “backstage” in partnership with the entire operations team. In addition, you will: Complete daily processing and organization of damages, testers, and known theft productEnsure all shipping and receiving activities are completed and executed within the store in a timely mannerReview all visual elements in the store and communicate missing or damaged pieces to the Ops Manager or appropriate store leadershipMaintain and organize the backstage area as neededDemonstrate our Sephora values of Passion for Client Service, Innovation, Expertise, Work-Life Balance, Respect for All, Teamwork, & InitiativeWe think you’d be a great for this role if you have:Minimum 1-year work experience, preferably in an operations capacityFlexible availability to work during “peak” retail hours such as nights, overnights, weekends, and holidays. In the ops role, you will be required to work early mornings, late evenings, and overnight stock shifts as neededStrong communication skills, ability to multitask, and comfortability with computer/store systemsYou’ll love working here because:The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work withThe product. Employees enjoy a product discount and receive free product, often multiple times a month. (Think your friends and family love you now? Just wait until you work at Sephora!)The education. Sephora heavily invests in training for our store associates – not just product knowledge but building a personalized career plan with you so you can achieve your professional goals The perks. Sephora offers medical benefits, competitive 401k, gift matching, and a 'perks' program that includes various discounts at participating companies (hotels, rental cars, telecommunication, gyms, etc)The LVMH family. Sephora’s parent company, LVMH, is one of the largest luxury groups in the world, providing support to over 70 prestige brands such as Louis Vuitton, Celine, Moet Chandon, Marc Jacobs, Dior, and so many moreOur legal team wants you to know what’s required:Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds and bend/stretch to stock shelvesAdherence to Sephora’s dress code and other policies in the Sephora Employee Handbook

Name: BTS Analyst - Sports
Description: Job DescriptionThe RoleThe Business Technology Solutions (BTS) Business Analyst is a member of a highly-motivated BTS team responsible for partnering with multiple IT and business divisions to evaluate, understand and deliver solutions for complex business problems. The team works as the strategic interface with assigned business divisions for the purpose of business-IT strategy development, solutions delivery, service management, risk management and relationship management. The BTS team provides highly-valued strategic consulting level support and guidance throughout key business technology initiatives.The BTS Business Analyst serves as a key liaison between technology solutions and service delivery teams and business divisions to gather detailed requirements and specifications from stakeholders, assist in the design and development of technical solutions, and ensure the technical solutions meet the user’s needs. The Business Analyst assists in testing new application functionality. Coordinates and implements process flow and functional improvements to increase user efficiency within CAA applications. Assist in developing and managing project plans, risk communication and progress status. The role is very similar to a Business Relationship Manager (BRM) position.ResponsibilitiesTechnology Solutions Delivery:Acquire an in-depth knowledge of IT’s service catalog, and assigned business divisions areas to identify and communicate how IT solutions can support the achievement of short- and long-term business goals.Support prioritization of IT initiatives based on the assigned division’s needs/strategy, IT workload and budget.Promote business knowledge of IT process, roles, and procedures to ensure the best possible outcomes.Support on solution options analysis, risks evaluation and impacts on end-user solutions and services, business processes/workflows and system priorities.Participates in planning sessions with BTS team members.Support the development of business cases and contribute to the “project greenlight” process, including cost benefit analyses.Build a trusted relationship with multiple roles in the assigned business division.Partner with BTS and Service Mangers to deliver IT solutions to further CAA’s goals, all while managing customer expectations around what IT can deliver.Analyze technology trends to determine impact to the achievement of BTS goals.Support the development of project plans and project chartersSupport the project management process, reporting on status, accomplishments and risks.Business Process Modelling:Process/Workflow analysis; work with project teams to gather, analyze and compile business process needs.Create process, models, specifications, diagrams and charts on current business processes and workflows.Requirements Management:Elicit, analyze, and document business requirements, from user groups and project stakeholders.Create and manage backlog of items by documenting business requirements and translating into technical specifications for solution implementation.Manage requirements prioritization, implementation estimation and dependencies; traceability from business capability to test case.Quality Assurance:Develop test plans and test case scenarios based on project requirements.Assist and conduct user acceptance testing.Research and document issues / bugs before reporting these to the developers.Supports change management activities; training and user support.Supports the BTS manager in monitoring and reporting on escalated issues.Works collaboratively with service managers to develop clear and concise communications with respects to incidents, problems, and change management as needed.Required CapabilitiesMinimum 3 years working in a Business Analyst or Project Management role in an IT environment with significant client exposure.Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science of Business Management fields.Experience successfully implementing medium sized project and/or in IT lead roles.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.Exceptional oral and written communications skills.Demonstrate initiative and ownership of tasks and projects.Ability to prioritize, coordinate and complete tasks to meet deadlines.Ability to work effectively both independently and in team environments.Ability to present complex problems in simple terms with great presentation skills.Experience extracting insights from data.Agile, waterfall SDLC understanding and experience.Proficiency using excel for advanced data analysis and reporting, project management tools (MS project or equivalent), business process mapping tools (MS vision, CaseWise or equivalent), PowerPoint or equivalent.Experience using requirements management tools and test management tools.
