Name: Watson Health - Data Warehouse Analyst
Description: Job Description2nd shift resource in Ann Arbor, Sacramento or Denver Position Summary:The Data Warehouse Analyst is responsible for maintaining data warehouse solutions that deliver diverse reporting and analytic capabilities to health and human services in customers in the public and private sector. This role provides operational support, data profiling and audit and reconciliation services for the data integration platform in the data warehouse environment, additionally this role assures that operational processes follow data warehouse best practices. This individual works with data integration programmers, data architects, analytic consultants, and HW/SW engineers to ensure enterprise DW solutions are reliable, scalable, flexible and low maintenance. The candidate must demonstrate an understanding of data warehouse concepts, practices, and procedures, has technical hands on experience supporting data warehouse solutions, has strong communication skills and the ability to provide support to customers and collaborate internally on projects as a contributor/specialist. This candidate should also be able to find creative solutions to complex and diverse business requirements. This position typically reports to a Team Lead or an Operations Managers.Essential Responsibilities:Support data warehouse data loadsMaintain and support extract solutions for data warehousesMaintain, execute and document data warehouse tests and support UATExecute monitoring and measurement of data quality as defined by business rulesParticipates in analysis of data quality root cause issues and data investigationsContributes to ETL maintenance efforts for team utilizing ETL toolsOff hour and weekend support required to meet project milestonesRequired Technical and Professional ExpertiseREQUIRED Skills and Experience:• Up to 3 years of experience performing data analysis and profiling, and maintaining ETL systems/programs• Understanding of data warehouse best practices• Familiarity with Microsoft SQL and ETL tools• Experience reading/evaluating/interpreting code• Strong PC skills with experience using Microsoft Office applications• Strong problem-solving ability• High attention to detail• Strong communication skill• Self-starter with good ability to work in a team environment• Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and complete work within allocated time framesPreferred Tech and Prof ExperiencePREFERRED Skills and Experience:• Familiarity with Federal reporting requirements for Medicaid programs (e.g., MSIS, PERM, TMSIS) • 1-2 Years of State Medicaid experience • Applies extensive expertise and knowledge of specific area of healthcare practice or expertise• Demonstrates effective supervisory skillsEducation / Certifications:• Bachelors' degree OR up to 3 years of experience in a data processing, data warehouse maintenance OR healthcare knowledge OR equivalent experience preferred.EO StatementIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: INVENTORY AND DEMAND PLANNING ANALYST
Company: Seed Beauty, parent company to Colourpop Cosmetics
Description: Job DescriptionColourpop Cosmetics, a division of Seed Beauty disrupts the traditional cosmetics industry by tearing down incumbent distribution channels, rewriting how brands interface with their customers, and by changing the way products are developed, launched and marketed.  If you like to roll in an entrepreneurial work environment filled with hard working, passionate peeps and you clearly meet our job requirements, then we want to hear from you!! ***PLEASE ONLY APPLY if after you read the rest of our requirements you are convinced this job was written for you! While we love meeting new people, we are very serious about the expertise required to fill this job! Thanks in advance for evaluating your skill set before you consider a resume submission. We look forward to hearing from you! In addition, please note: *** we are located in Ventura County, just North of Los Angeles, near the coast! Only apply if (1) you 110% have what it takes to be successful with us given your proven track record, work experience and leadership; (2) you are a hands on do-er with a got what it takes attitude; and (3), you also love the smell of salt air and sand in your toes and are eager to work in Ventura County! Serious candidates only please!THE OPPORTUNITY: Sales and Inventory Forecasting Analyst We are looking for a dynamic, high energy, sales forecasting analyst to manage the revenue planning and inventory forecasting and reporting process for Colourpop. Specifically… · Manage the monthly sales forecast at both the category and SKU level across 1,000+ skus  · The monthly sales forecast is comprised of 3 parts (1) replenishment items, (2) promotions, (3) new launches  · Analyze daily sell thru to determine 3 month rolling forecast for replenishment items  · Work with marketing to create a 60 day locked promotional calendar and update the forecast accordingly  · Working with new launch team to create new launch forecast  · Release 90 day rolling sales forecast to marketing operations  · Report daily, weekly, and monthly plan versus actual  · Interact with sales, marketing and operations to gather information to understand demand forecast drivers. using historical trends plus future sales plan to develop a demand forecast plus monitor inventory levels to avoid shortages and avoid overstocks THE RIGHT CANDIDATE: Requirements/Qualifications/AttributesEDUCATION: BA/BS required. · EXPERIENCE: 3+ years of hands-on experience Demonstrated experience managing sales forecasting process for a Consumer Products related business with fast inventory turns (beauty and or fashion industry preferred, ecommerce experience a plus)Proven experience managing 1000+ skusExcel wizardHave strong understanding of Google Analytics a plusExperience working cross-functionally to achieve resultsStrong quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skillsA strong communicator (verbal, written, interpersonal) who can effectively communicate with a broad spectrum of colleagues and external partners.Must be highly organized, able to pick up things quickly, and create processes that scale in a highly dynamic, rapidly evolving environment.Desire to roll up sleeves and execute while also seeing the broader vision for the brandA self-directed entrepreneurial professional who knows what needs to be done and operates with a sense of urgency, focus and discipline.Must be hands on and detailed oriented and is attentive to all of the small details Company DescriptionSEED Beauty is a fast-growing beauty ecommerce company and the parent company for direct to consumer brands ColourPop Cosmetics launched in 2014, Kylie Cosmetics launched in 2016, KKW Beauty launched in 2017 and multiple future brands currently in the incubation stage. SEED Beauty brands are disrupting the traditional cosmetics industry by tearing down incumbent distribution channels, rewriting how brands interface with their customers, and changing the way products are developed, launched and marketed.

Name: Sr. FP&A Analyst - Corporate
Description: POSITION SUMMARY The Corporate FP&A Analyst will be responsible for the financial planning and reporting of Inspire. This role will be responsible for driving the budgeting and forecasting processes as well as developing and maintaining reporting packages for the company, board, and investors. You'll need to be incredibly detail oriented as well as be able think high level in order to build reporting packages that meet the needs of the various stakeholders. Successful candidates will demonstrate an ability to leverage systems and tools to report on trends in the business and provide recommendations to leaders. RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIESDrive the overall financial reporting structure and cadence for the companyCompile and review financial results as it relates to operational and strategic plansDesign and update materials for board meetings and investor presentationsCoordinate with finance team on reporting needs to drive accountability within the businessDevelop templates for rolling up submissions and consolidating financial dataManage the monthly financial forecasting and annual budgeting processesIdentify opportunities to standardize, centralize, and automate financial reporting within the organizationPartner with internal finance and accounting teams to improve processesWork with corporate leaders to track budget variances and identify savings initiativesSKILLS & QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting3-5 years hands-on Corporate FP&A experienceExperience with Adaptive Insights required; Competency in NetSuite or similar ERP system preferredExceptional analytical abilities and strong skills across various software tools (Excel, PowerPoint, GSuite, etc.)Ability to utilize communication skills (written and verbal) to articulate recommendations and influence decision makersDetail-oriented and strong organizational skills, with a high level of curiosity and self-motivationMust possess a strong work ethic along with a sense of urgency to drive projects to conclusionExperience with BI tools and SQL preferredAbility to multi-task and manage competing deadlines in a fast-paced environmentUnderstanding of Subscription-based revenue modelsABOUT US Disrupting the one-size-fits-all utility model, Inspire's groundbreaking smart home subscription seamlessly combines personalized clean energy plans with best-in-class smart devices. Using the Inspire app, members can self drive their smart homes from anywhere, and select automated settings to use less energy while earning rewards. Inspire strives to make every home a smart home, powered by clean energy. Inspire's mission is to drive forward a brighter energy future by simplifying consumer adoption of clean energy and smart home technologies.  Through continual innovation and scaling of connected device interoperability; clean energy supply, generation and storage; and intelligent, decentralized grid services, Inspire is building the world's first fully-integrated clean energy company.  Launched in January 2014, Inspire homes have used the clean power production equivalent of 121 wind turbines since inception. Driven by a team of mission-driven Avengers in Philadelphia and Santa Monica,, Inspire prides itself on a culture of ownership, teamwork and stalwart obsession with "crushing it!" CULTURE & PERKSInspire's culture balances the serious nature and tone of a professional company with the move-fast-and-execute tone of a rapidly growing emerging tech company. We believe in working hard and producing, but doing it in a positive and friendly environment where collaboration is rampant.Inspire calls its employees Avengers. It's a team out to even the score on behalf of the common man, to challenge the status quo and confront apathy and old-world bureaucracy.Every Avenger lives for the mission: To build the world's most customer-focused clean power platform and inspire a connected moment towards a brighter energy future. Avengers are scrappy, restless, humble and committed to balancing passion with purpose and profit.Inspire offers competitive compensation and equity packages, plus benefits such as health, vision, life, and dental insurance - Not to mention, unlimited vacation, 401(k) plan, and LOTS of cupcakes!

Name: Site Infrastructure Support Analyst
Description: Join Eaton’s Information Technology team and help positively impact our business through leading technologies, exciting and challenging enterprise projects and new platforms. We are currently seeking a Site Infrastructure Support Analyst to join our team. This position is based at our Los Angeles, CA facility. No relocation is being offered for this position. The SIS Analyst is responsible for providing end user support, supporting device lifecycle management, and ensuring compliance with all of Eaton's policies and procedures with minimal supervision. Our customers include all of Eaton’s users (local and remote). This includes: Working on tickets and meeting defined service level agreements for the resolution of: incidents, requests, changes, and problems, as well as tasks assigned as part of one of those ticket types.PC/device lifecycle management - replacing outdated end user and infrastructure hardware when needed and planned for. This includes provisioning, asset management, and disposal. Ensure compliance with defined policies and procedures around end user client security and infrastructure, site IT disaster recovery planning, as well as participation in IT projects that require coordination, communication and/or implementation.Provides assistance to remote technical resources who administer network switches, servers and other IT infrastructure.Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. In this role:You will deploy, configure, and support hardware (PC, laptop, mobile, printing, etc.), client operating systems, and productivity software for end users. You will follow standard ITSM processes of Asset Management, Change Management, Incident Management, Request Management, Problem Management and Project Management to serve end users and maintain high levels of performance in achieving service level agreements.You will be responsible for the annual refresh of IT disaster recovery plan, as well as walkthrough of plan with stakeholders if required.You will participate in application, infrastructure, security, operational excellence initiatives, and support activities as needed.You will Assist with support of site-based IT systems.You will participate in trouble-shooting and resolution of larger IT issues. Participate in efforts related to root cause analysis and problem management as needed.You will act as the liaison between IT and users to drive IT standards. Advocate, influence, and assure compliance to IT standards and policies. Share information about best practices with end users to increase user satisfaction and productivity.You will participate in internal audits related to IT processes, procedures, software, and systems. Influence budgeting, forecasting, and spending for IT infrastructure as required.When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.Basic Qualifications:High School Diploma or GED from an accredited institution.Minimum 2 years of IT experience.Relocation is not being offered. Candidate must be located within a 50 mile radius of the Eaton Los Angeles, CA facility.Preferred Qualifications:Associate Degree in business or technology.ITIL, MCSA, or comparable certification.CompTIA A certification.5 plus years of IT experience supporting Windows operating systems and PCs.Position Criteria:MS Windows Operating Systems experience. MS Office Suites experience. Hardware - PC’s, laptops, mobile devices, PC peripheralsWorking knowledge of other IT infrastructure – network, servers, storage, phone systems.Knowledge of miscellaneous equipment used in manufacturing locations such as bar code scanners, specialized printers, industrial PCs, RF Scanners, etc.Ability to adapt and learn; to support complex IT environments that may contain various operating systems, desktop, network, phone, and mobile technology.IT Service Management (ITIL) - Asset Management, Incident Management, Request Fulfilment, Problem Management, and Change Management

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Los Angeles based Internet Brands is currently seeking a Financial Analyst with a strong background in financial analysis to join our corporate finance team. Responsibilities:Work with operation managers within the organization to develop comprehensive evaluation of financial results, focusing on key metrics.Review and interpret monthly profit and loss statements.Partner with operations to develop modeling for strategic initiatives.Prepare monthly forecasts and annual budgets along with variance analysis.Develop financial and operational presentations for our executive team and investors.Manage and develop sales performance and compensation plans.Track acquisition-related metrics, post-acquisition integration, and financial modeling.Spearhead special projects: perform analyses to drive revenue opportunities, cost rationalization analyses, streamline operations. Qualifications:3 or more years relevant experience.Undergraduate degree in accounting, finance, or economic.Highest degree of proficiency in financial modeling and analysis; skills should include not only Excel expertise, but also abilities to design, communicate, and adjust models to fit business needs and changes.Strong problem-solving and organizational skills, as well as attention to detail.Ability to work across various functional areas and to interact with individuals across all levels throughout organization.Experience working within internet, software, and/or publishing ideal.  Success starts with having the right people. At Internet Brands, we value and mentor each member of our growing team. We seek out talented, goal-oriented professionals who live and breathe the Internet and thrive in a flexible but challenging work environment. Our team of innovators has enabled Internet Brands to sustain high levels of profitability and success while evolving along with the Internet for over 20 years. At IB, we promote an entrepreneurial, friendly culture that applauds innovation and results while embracing change and independence. Our employees are intensely driven and constantly encouraged to reach higher and use creativity to achieve success – all the while enjoying high levels of collaboration and the luxury of coming to work in jeans and sneakers. We are proud to offer a unique blend of the innovation of a start-up with the history, stability, and benefits of an established corporation.  Internet Brands and its wholly owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.  Keywords: Financial Analysis, Finance, Accounting, P&L, Los Angeles

Name: Acquisition and Finance Analyst - Senior Associate
Description: What do you get when you bring together the brightest minds and place them into an exciting, fast-paced environment that fosters intellectual growth and rewards based on impact, not tenure?  You get one of the fastest growing consulting companies in the United States. While we may be a new name in consultancy, we were born from a storied one. Guidehouse was founded in 2018 as an evolution of PwC Public Sector with a mission to help our clients deliver on their mission; providing bold new strategies that catalyze transformative results across all ends of the enterprise. We embrace brilliance. We embrace independence. Join us.  Our Finance consultants help clients optimize all elements of their finance organization, including operating model design, sustainable cost reduction, financial planning and analysis, management reporting, financial systems architecture, and full scale finance transformation. This high performing team helps CFOs identify, design and implement programs that transform their finance function to meet today’s demanding requirements while continuing to provide value added insights to the business.  Over 7 years of experience managing cost, schedule, and performance for Department of Defense acquisitions from the commercial, industrial, and/or military perspective, of which the last three years shall include duties/assignments specifically in support of space programs.  PMP Certifications or APDP Level II in one or more of the following disciplines: Program Management, Contracting, Cost Estimating, Financial Management, or Engineering.  Bachelor’s degree relevant to their area of expertise limited to the following: Management, Business, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Science, Technology, Engineering, or Statistics (a Master’s certificate [or any other similar certificate] or equivalent will not suffice). Experience performing the following kinds of functions to include but not limited to: collecting, normalizing, and inputting data, cost modeling, performing in-depth research, reconciling complex data/information across multiple systems and reports, utilizing complex software in the development of analytical models, interpreting results to generate multiple recommended courses of action, building staffing packages, comprehending and applying concepts/guidance, effectively implementing instructions/policies into routine performance, and developing tools/applications to foster efficiency in day-to-day activities. Preffered experience with DoD and/or Air Force Acquisition Program Offices supporting: Life Cycle Acquisition FacilitationPortfolio IntegrationAcquisition PlanningProgram MonitoringMilestone Review PreparationStrategic PlanningResearch, Analysis, and ReportingStrategic Communications

Name: Account Analyst
Description: Good people, working with good people, for our common good. Sound good? KeHE-a natural, organic, specialty and fresh food distributor-is all about "good" and is growing, so there's never been a more exciting time to join our team. If you're enthusiastic about working in an environment with a people-first culture and an organization committed to good living, good food and good service, we'd love to talk to you!  The Account Analyst assists both the KeHE Account Manager and Customer’s personnel with the compilation, processing and analysis of data as related to the sales and marketing of products for the Customer’s account. Accountabilities are accomplished through working cooperatively to foster an environment consistent with the KeHE Mission and Values. Assist KeHE Account Manager in the development and execution of company sales and marketing programs for the Customer chain. This includes: assuring accurate and timely development, release, and execution of planograms and category responsibilities; assuring that planograms are designed to achieve customer satisfaction by market area; maximizing profitable sales; utilizing space efficiently; providing adequate inventory allocation to meet normal volume.Assist KeHE Account Manager in coordinating activities and communications among vendors and company functional groups to assure Customer account satisfaction. This includes: providing expert knowledge of category trends; communicating findings to all individuals involved, including Category Managers, Shelf Merchandising Specialists, Manager Shelf Merchandising, Planogram Specialist, etc; assisting KeHE Account Manager in identifying opportunities to increase customer sales through improvement of product mix; identifying and following up on new business development opportunities; advising Category Managers as to what will and will not work to meet their philosophies and objectives while maintaining planogram standards.Providing technical and analytical support to the Category Managers. Analyzing store data to effectively place items in the planogram.Coordinate implementation of merchandising activities, including but not limited to planograms, new items, ads, grand openings, and customer requests.Monitor competitor activities, recommend paths forward to address these activities, and implement approved plans.Assist in monitoring all accounts and receivables.Establish and maintain databases for promotions, price changes, cost changes, item maintenance, and other information regarding sales and marketing activities.High School diploma required; Bachelor's Degree preferred.Minimum two (2) years’ experience in sales of grocery products to chain accounts.Understanding of category management with strong quantitative, analytical and computer skills. Working knowledge of and literacy in computer software, including but not limited to word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation applications. Ability to quickly become acclimated to shelf merchandising tools.Qualifications / Additional Skills / Aptitude:Ability and willingness to work flexible hours.Demonstrated ability to recognize and pursue business opportunities without being directed to, acting quickly and decisively when appropriate. Ability to coordinate and prioritize a high volume of work and meet pressing time requirements. Ability to work independently. Demonstrated willingness to take responsibility for personal actions, decisions, and results.Demonstrated strength in oral and written communications with people at all organizational levels. Demonstrated proficiency in conducting effective meetings and making clear and concise presentations. Strong negotiating, communication and organizational skills as well as interpersonal skills.Ability to interact with a diverse group of individuals and contribute to a collaborative work environment - must be a team player.Demonstrated ability to effectively manage a variety of tasks simultaneously, focusing on those with the highest business impact, including anticipating problems and taking appropriate preventive action to avoid crises whenever possible.Demonstrated ability to effectively identify long-term issues, develop and implement strategies to address these issues, and link shorter-term activities to these strategies.2018-3273

Name: Instructional Resources Project Analyst (IRPA)
Description: Requisition Number: 29109 Job Title: ADMINISTRATIVE ANALYST Working Title: Instructional Resources Project Analyst (IRPA) Salary: $23.04 - $45.54 hourly Job Type: Contract Department Name: 5465-COLLEGE LIBRARY INSTRUCTNL CMPTNG COMMON Department Website URL: http://www.library.ucla.edu/about/jobs-ucla-library Job Summary Statement: Reporting to the Manager, Learning & Research Technology Support Services (LRTSS), and part of Digital Initiatives and IT Operations and Services (DIITOS) the Instructional Resources Project Analyst (IRPA) advances critical Instructional Resources Management (IRM) projects for the College Library Instructional Computing Commons (CLICC) and for Library Instructional Technology Services (LITS). The IRPA configures and oversees projects related to the use of resource reservation systems and service desk workflows and inquiries concerning instructional technology services. The IRPA writes proposals and project charters related to new initiatives in CLICC's instructional services (eg. Overnight lending, targeted lending, room and equipment reservation workflows and systems, etc.). The IRPA develops training for these new project-driven initiatives and systems and produces supporting documentation and content for training student staff delivering CLICC's instructional resources. The IRPA assists in supervising 5-8 student employees working on CLICC and instructional-technology projects in UCLA Library. The IRPA provides annual and on-demand data-driven analyses of services. The IRPA works closely alongside the LRTSS team to provide support for requests and inquiries for CLICC instructional resources.  The Learning & Research Technology Services and Support (LRTSS) team supports technology for staff, faculty and students within the UCLA Library. LRTSS provides instructional technology space management, audio/visual systems support, technology resources scheduling, desktop and laptop image building and training for the UCLA Library. The team also helps manage the College Library Instructional Computing Commons (CLICC) services such as laptop lending and computer classrooms support. The LRTSS team is part of the Digital Initiatives and Information Technology Operations group (DIITOS) that is part of a larger information technology group within the Library called DIIT.  Digital Initiatives and Information Technology (DIIT), a unit of approximately 40 people, is responsible for the systems development and operations for all of the Libraries at UCLA. Systems include both custom and licensed applications for both web and client server systems. The infrastructure includes approximately 1000 workstations, 65 servers with over 500 terabytes of storage supporting applications used worldwide via the Internet. DIIT supports library staff and users by providing access to library technologies via the campus network infrastructure backbone. Supported technology resources include the integrated library system and online catalog; network connectivity including servers, storage, operating system and application server delivery; and programming and application development in support of digital and web based initiatives. Through collaborative efforts with all areas of UCLA's libraries, DIIT assists in the development and delivery of technologies for all types of electronic resources. DIIT is comprised of four teams: Operations and Services (including Core Operations, Development Support, Logistics, and Learning & Research Technology Services), Library Web Services, the Digital Library Program, and Data Services. DIIT's staff members also work as collaborative partners with units in other areas of the library, and provide technology support for the major business systems used by the libraries. Percentage of Time: 60 Shift Start: 8:00 am Shift End: 3:00 pm Qualifications for Position  24 Records Qualifications Required/Preferred Strong evidence of success in project management. Demonstrated ability to bring projects to successful conclusion on time. Required Demonstrated ability to complete quantitative and qualitative assessments of complex projects. Required Minimum of 3 years of demonstrated project planning and management experience. Required Demonstrated experience in project management of process improvement projects using a formal project management methodology. Demonstrated ability to monitor project progress and identify schedule problems. Required Skill in recognizing, defining, and analyzing problems, situations, or procedures to define objectives and implement action plans and recommendations. Required Demonstrated ability in completing efficiency analyses and tasks which includes but is not limited to process mapping, analyzing inter-related processes, operational impact analysis, compiling completed process analysis documentation and presentations. Required Ability to write and produce technical user documentation. Required Excellent workflow management and organizational skills including the ability to use a task tracking system to organize, prioritize, delegate and manage tasks. Required Ability to effectively use productivity software such as Microsoft Office, including Outlook for email and calendar management. Required Excellent communication skills, ability to write concise and informative emails and communicate with customers and staff effectively in person and on the phone. Excellent communication skills in relaying technical information to full-time and student-staff. Required Excellent customer service skills, and knowledge of good service practices including ability to communicate effectively during a technical crisis, and ability to convey priorities to technical staff. Required Ability to work independently, follow through on assignments with minimal direction, set priorities which accurately reflect the relative importance of job responsibilities and to perform with many deadlines plus the ability to work with frequent interruptions or to shift from one task to another under fluctuating workloads and were a wide variety of duties may be assigned without loss of efficiency. Required Outstanding organization skills to manage multiple projects and perform efficiently and courteously in a fast-paced environment with conflicting priorities and frequent distractions and interruptions. Independently prioritize assignments and complete work successfully in a timely manner. Required Ability to initiate and maintain cooperative working relationships with co-workers, supervisors, and managers. Ability to work harmoniously and as a team player, thrive in a team-based environment, and skill in fostering teamwork among others. Required Ability to follow directions from supervisors (and to provide clear directions to staff and student employees). Required Ability to get to work reliably and on time and to be present in the workplace during scheduled working hours. Required Experience with collaboration tools, including wiki software (e.g. Confluence) and task tracking software (e.g. JIRA) Required Experience and demonstrated skill in supervision, including hiring, orienting, training, organizing workflow, delegating responsibility, monitoring and evaluating performance, and coaching and counseling student employees. Required Working knowledge of PC hardware and demonstrated ability to work in a networked Window environment. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office software including Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook. Required Demonstrated skill and ability to establish and maintain professional and effective working relationships with management, project champions, subject matter experts, and process owners to align process improvement initiatives with business objectives. Required Working competency with Drupal and writing/editing web content. Preferred Experience with instructional technology services and systems in an academic research library. Preferred Experience designing systems and workflows in ticketing and reporting systems like Atlassian products. Preferred Experience working in higher education or libraries. Please have ALL FILES ready to upload when applying.  This contract is an 18-month contract appointment. Name: Software SaaS Security Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job descriptionMortgage Cadence, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Accenture, has been partnering with mortgage lenders since 1999, offering the industry’s only true one-stop shop mortgage technology solutions designed for point-of-sale through post-closing. In a time when efficiency, speed and the customer experience are paramount to the success of lenders, Mortgage Cadence offers the most reliable software and dedicated people, supporting lenders every step of the way. Each of our products has revolutionized the mortgage lending process in some way, changing the way lenders lend and borrowers finance.  As a software company, we think like a start-up, with every employee empowered and encouraged to be visionary. Teamwork and innovation define what we do as we take our customers into the future by providing the last lending solution they will ever need.Role description: Work with the business to  define technical and functional requirements. Participate in the security architecture analysis, design, and  implementation, and ensure that the product fulfills the requirements. When  applicable, work with the solution integration architect on these tasks. Work  with the support unit to determine how the application is supported in  production, including back ups, disaster recovery, system performance, and  project management. Obtain stakeholder buy in for designs. Validate the design  with the stakeholders to ensure that the design satisfies the requirements.  Review security architecture deliverables throughout development to ensure  quality and requirement traceability. Identify and communicate any cross area  or cross release issues that affect other project areas. Ensure adherence to  all quality management plans and standards by participating in quality  management reviews. Make sure that the security components interact to fulfill  the requirements and meet performance goals. Participate in confirming the  completeness and consistency of the design deliverables. Assist with Resolution of any  inconsistencies discovered. + Basic qualificationsMinimum of 5 years of experience with enterprise, infrastructure, or application security architectureMinimum of 5 years of experience with cloud architectures and API web-services delivery, risks, and controls.Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)Preferred Skill Requirements:Information Systems Security Architect Professional (ISSAP) or Information - Systems Security Engineering Professional (ISSEP) or similar certification preferredApplication Development background preferredAbility to identify and define security architecture components as new requirements ariseAbility to define the complete security infrastructure environmentAbility to interact communicate with business effectivelyAbility to maintain current knowledge of all relevant security technology, operations, management developments and seek opportunities to deploy new technologies that benefit the businessAbility to assemble and test security componentsAbility to provide technical leadership on client engagement, including serving as a resource to the project team and the client by evaluating and proposing technical alternatives for resolving business and technology issuesAbility to create security architecture scope, definition, construction, and executionAbility to design and develop plans, taking corrective action as necessaryApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment Name: Senior EUC Analyst
Description: Responsible for business monitoring and testing of City National Bank's (CNB's) End-User Computing (EUC) controls program as prescribed by CNB's Management Risk Committee. Responsibilities include the development and maintenance of an end-user computing program to identify and maintain a bank-wide inventory of critical use spreadsheets and desktop EUC management tools essential to financial reporting, model use, bank stress testing, etc. Individual should be well versed and have expertise in EUC standards, risk management, information technology risk, standards for banking and data compensating controls, and a strong understanding of risk monitoring and controls. The role is not limited to only EUC, and responsibilities will include assistance and/or leading programs within Enterprise Risk Management. Basic Qualifications:Minimum 5 years of experience in finance, banking or related industry with specific emphasis on EUC control assessment, risk management, internal controls and audit, or data management.Minimum 5 years of experience with banking systems and processes, risk management methodologies, risk-based auditing techniques, and/or internal controlsMinimum 3 years of experience with various reporting and analysis tools including ClusterSeven, MS Excel and MS Access.Responsibilities:Development and maintenance of CNB's EUC program to include EUC identification and inventory management, EUC controls testing, change management, control monitoring, and EUC use validation. EUC is an enterprise wide initiative at CNB.Conduct periodic assessments on bank-wide EUC controls compliance as required by EUC policy and standard.Acts as an internal advisor/partner to CNB business units regarding EUC risk and management matters (e.g. controls, best practices, and industry developments.).Assist business units in understanding regulatory responsibilities and best practices.Develops and provides effective communication, training and support materials to educate CNB business units on CNB EUC Policy and Standard Controls over EUCs, and EUC risk management requirements prescribed by management committees and regulators.Regularly prepares status reports, performance metrics, presentations and Enterprise-wide guidance in accordance with the EUC program and financial industry regulations, ad-hoc reports, and as requested by management.Ensures EUC compliance for regulations within the second line of defense -- CCAR, Basel, Heightened Standards, etc.Complies fully with all bank policies and procedures as well as all regulatory requirements (e.g. Bank Secrecy Act, Know Your Client, Community Reinvestment Act, Code of Conduct, etc.).Successfully completes all required training and special projects as requested.Skills and Knowledge:Knowledge of banking systems and processes, risk management methodologies, risk-based auditing techniques, and/or internal controls required.Strong technology and data management experience desired, CISA preferred.Must possess demonstrated ability to think critically and facilitate change through collaborative effort.Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.Extensive knowledge and experience with various reporting and analysis tools including MS Excel, MS Access and MS SharePoint are required. Specific knowledge of EUC management tools including ClusterSeven preferred. GRC platform experience is a plus. *Represents basic qualifications for the position. To be considered for this position you must at least meet the basic qualifications.  Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans  Note: This preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Note: Candidates should be advised that City National Bank does not pay interviewee travel expenses or relocation expenses for candidates who are hired unless previously agreed.  #gd-nk  #LI-NK1 Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Name: Analyst
Description: Are you interested in working for the music industry? Would you like to help develop unique and clever ways to drive the music industry into the future using data driven strategies and insights?  Universal Music Group is looking for an Analyst to help brainstorm, create, and implement critical business solutions for a wide variety of stakeholders throughout the organization. These stakeholders would include Senior Executives, as well as individuals within our Global Digital Strategy, Global Streaming Marketing, Business Development, Global Communications, Commercial Partnership, and Finance units.  The ideal candidate should be well-versed in data analysis and financial modelling, with a solid understanding (or an eagerness to learn) the business models that are currently revolutionizing digital and subscription-based media. Candidates should be complete wizards in Excel (including VBA / Macros), PowerPoint, SQL, Tableau, DOMO, or other data manipulation / visualization platforms.  This candidate should also have a demonstrated ability to manage client or audience requests in a professional manner, communicate findings to a variety of different audience types (from Senior Executives down to fellow Analysts), and work in project teams to solve interesting problems in a consultative fashion. Job Functions:Deliver data-driven solutions and recommendations to executives and necessary parties that incorporate rigorous research and analysisDevelop dynamic / automated models to help key stakeholders with partner negotiations, executive presentations, label meetings, global communications, etc.Create SQL scripts in order to extract necessary data from files that could be greater than 100 TB in size within Google BigQuery or other SQL platformsIdentify user / partner trends, including but not limited to user engagement, listening habits, conversion, retention, monetization per stream / user, genre insights, among many othersPresent overall findings to executives throughout the company in a clear and concise mannerJob Requirements:Skills/Abilities:Passion and curiosity for music and the data that is used within the industryAbility to query our databases (using platforms such as BigQuery) accurately and efficiently using SQLAdvanced level Excel skills, with the ability to develop dynamic models using named ranges / formulaic referencesFamiliarity with statistical concepts and tools, along with the ability to use them effectively in analysesAbility to visualize data within Tableau, DOMO, or other data visualization platformsExperience:2 3 years of work experience in management consulting, investment banking, or similar roleExperience managing and engaging with clients in a consultative or analytical capacityExperience working with analytical tools including, but not limited to Excel, VBA, Tableau, DOMO, BigQuery, etc.Education:BS required in Business Administration, Accounting, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a similarly quantitative degree Universal Music Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Disclaimer  This job description only provides an overview of job responsibilities that are subject to change.SDL2017

Name: Data Scientist/Analyst
Description: Data ScientistThe Company: Our digital invitation platform brings people together for their big life moments! Whether a seasonal celebration, birthday, or engagement party, we connect you with all the people you love! The Role: We're beginning to translate our organizational needs towards data science, but aren't quite there yet. This role is open to both Data Analysts as well as Data Scientists, the more Data Science skills you have, the better! About You:BA/BS with quantitative emphasis (Business, Marketing, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or similar). Master’s Degree a HUGE plus!1+ Years previous data analytics experience in a high data volume environment1+ Years of expertise in Tableau, PowerBI, or similar Business Intelligent tools.1+ Years of experience with SQL – (SQL Server and Redshift experience preferred)1+ Years of experience with Analytical Tools (Google Analytics [preferred], comScore, Salesforce Analytics, or other)Strong experience with Ad tech platforms (DoubleClick preferred), with SSP/DSP data and reporting a plus.Great Communication & Collaboration skills with nontechnical teamsData Science Favorables:Data Science Background (Text Analysis, Machine Learning [Random Forest or Bayesian Algorithms], Cluster Analysis, Logistic Regression, etc)Experience with R, SAS, or other statistical softwareExperience with A/B Testing – Optimizely a huge plus! Looking forward to hearing from you!- provided by Dice  Data Science, Data Analytics, Tableau, SQL, Google Analytics, R, Google Analytics, ComScore, DoubleClick
